properties.title: Solitary Mountain
properties.landing_comments: Easy, on low gradient beach of gravel, cobble, some boulders. NW aspect. Some weather protection. East bank of creek.
properties.camp_comments: Upland sheltered cleared sites in open forest. Potential for many tents. Hammock opportunities. Other options along same shore.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round creek. View. Staging for tidal rapids.

properties.title: South Curme Island
properties.landing_comments: Moderate on rock ledges or rough beaches in N or S coves which join at high water, splitting island.
properties.camp_comments: 8 wooden tent platforms. Vault toilet. Picnic area. No fires permitted. Camping fees apply 1 June to 15 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at Lund or Okeover launch sites, but no reservable sites. Camp only at designated sites. Numerous drought-killed trees reported 2023.
properties.other_comments: Views. In Spring avoid bird nesting area on SW end. See Desolation Sound Marine Provincial ParkPark Operator: 1312768 BC Ltd email DesolationSound.Camping@outlook.com

properties.title: Grandmother Grove
properties.landing_comments: Head of lagoon at end of Carrington Bay where creek enters. Sand, gravel beach.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping.
properties.other_comments: Big spruce trees hang over secluded, sandy beach. Extensive hiking trail access via Jimmy Smith Road past Cortes Pit. Carrington Bay Park, Strathcona Regional District. See: Carrington Bay Park. . See also :Grandmother Grove.

properties.title: Fishermans Wharf
properties.landing_comments: Low purpose-built paddlecraft dock on Fishermans Wharf in front of Harbour Master's Office. Access via narrow ramp from parking lot. Expect congestion during summer.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Many park facilities directly across road including toilets.
properties.other_comments: Lies on David Foster Parkway walking path. Day street parking limit 2 hrs. Pay parking lot by dock $8.00 for 12 hr (2017). Launch site for Victoria Waterway Loop Trail, a 8.4 NM paddling route with a 950 m portage. Loop is in 4 sections with multiple launch points. May be completed in a day. See: Loop.

properties.title: Bricky Bay
properties.landing_comments: Sand, pebble beach. NE aspect. Steep stair to beach reduces value as Launch Site.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Ridiculous parking restrictions in adjacent Armadale Road. Steps to beach. Public beach access sign.

properties.title: Kent Island 2
properties.landing_comments:
Easy on lage clam bed beach of muddy sand, scattered boulders. Protected from most directions. SE aspect.
.
properties.camp_comments: Small stream crosses SW part of beach. Directly to NE of stream,10 m path leads to tent flat behind big cedar. May need salal re-brushed. Reported brushed 2004. Alternate camp on protected beach not seen 2024. 1 semi-flat rock might yield small site. Visible grass floods.
properties.other_comments: Additional upland potential sites could be brushed, but will re-grow quickly. See Mahpahkum-Ahkwuna/Deserters-Walker Conservancy.

properties.title: Kent Island 1
properties.landing_comments: Easy on low gradient sand, gravel, scattered boulder beach protected at all tides. End of the lagoon muddy, difficult at moderate or low tides. High water has more boulders. Very protected but long carry at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Sheltered. Sites for 3-4 tents at top of beach between bushes or under alders, above all but highest tides on level pebble, gravel. Additional potential 2-3 sites upland if salal brushed. Old site reported 15 m into woods at inlet corner but not seen 2024.
properties.other_comments: Charted streams not seen 2024. First Nation 'sea garden'. Use might be restricted. See Mahpahkum-Ahkwuna/Deserters-Walker Conservancy.

properties.title: Kent Island 3
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, cobble beach.
properties.camp_comments: Sheltered, undeveloped. Little beach at high water.
properties.other_comments: Not a good site, but useful shelter if crossing QC Strait. Might instead be 50Deg 54.063'N 127Deg 32.094'W. See Mahpahkum-Ahkwuna/Deserters-Walker Conservancy.

properties.title: Raynor Islands Central Cove
properties.landing_comments: High water landing awkward over stacked drift logs at head of protected narrow cove. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: 3-4 tent sites on damp lumpy grass. Easy upland access for further sites if brushed. Likely potential for 2 or more sites. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Marginal site.

properties.title: Howcraft Point north
properties.landing_comments: Beach of white sand below mid height, cobble, scattered boulders. Drift logs above. Exposed to NW. Surf likely in W wind. Outer cove to SE of Point is mostly boulders.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Upper beach lacks tidal clearance so no beach sites. Access dense low slope upland vegetation on small animal trails to yield potential brushable tent sites, hammock opportunities. 2 sites reported but none found.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Seasonal stream reported but not seen. Other sites offer better shelter.

properties.title: Peel Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy, on shell, pebble, sand beach. At tides less than 2m, landing is rocky.
properties.camp_comments: Sheltered, undeveloped. Dense salal. No upland forest sites found 2023. Beach floods. Gentle upland slope suggests brushing might reveal tent sites.
properties.other_comments: N Frazer (2000) noted nearby area with rough beach for possible day use. Used by First Nation for cedar bark harvesting, but no suitable campsites. Pipe debris on site 2023. Site viewed 2023 might be different from (to W of) main site.

properties.title: Cluxewe
properties.landing_comments: Easy on exposed gravel beach. N aspect. Protected optional landing in estuary near boat launch might require mid or higher water levels.
properties.camp_comments: Developed commercial resort, RV site. Picnic tables. Toilets.
properties.other_comments: Water at tap. Boat launch in protected estuary. View. For details, see Cluxewe Resort.

properties.title: Pig Ranch central
properties.landing_comments: Easy on cobble, pebble beach. Second bay from N. Drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: Tent sites in open sloped second growth forest. In 2023 only 1-2 tent sites seen. Possibly 6-8 sites if brushed lightly. Former commercial site, but platforms, structures decayed. Drift logs prevent beach camping,
properties.other_comments: Views. Log debris. See Qwiquallaaq/Boat Bay Conservancy.

properties.title: Lee Islands
properties.landing_comments: Moderate, cobble, boulders, bedrock.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Small rocky bluff areas. No clearing exists.
properties.other_comments: View. Faces across channel to Thurston Bay.

properties.title: Edith Point east
properties.landing_comments: Easy on low gradient beach of silt or firm mud, gravel, pebble, cobble, occasional boulders. Long but easy 50 m carry at low water. SE aspect. Protected from prevailing wind, swell. Currents.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Approx 50 m E of stream path leads into to forest clearing for 3 or more tents. Various other sites near centre bay among large conifers or alders without clearings. Another site lies by shore under large cedar just W of shoal projecting into bay. Inactive log dump nearby could yield additional sites.
properties.other_comments: Water at stream. Attractive. Staging area for Edith Pt.

properties.title: Hardinge Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy on pebble, gravel beach at high water, much cobble, some boulders at low water. SW side of island. Exposed W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Campsites in open forest behind the large rock at centre beach. Potential for several more sites. Hammock opportunities. ** Hazardous trees observed at here June 2020 - until situation has been remedied camping is recommended higher up slope where deadfall is less likely .**
properties.other_comments: Wild Coast Atlas shows site in incorrect location. Sheltered anchorages at various locations. Cetan Thurston Bay Conservancy. See: Cetan Thurston Bay Conservancy.

properties.title: Walkem Bay south
properties.landing_comments: Easy on low gradient gravel, pebble beach. sand patches. Rougher at sides, top with cobbles, occasional boulders. Exposed to W but outer bay moderately protected.
properties.camp_comments: Easy access to dark open forest with several level areas. Undeveloped. Some brushing, levelling needed.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. Aka East Thurlow Island south.

properties.title: Shoal Bay
properties.landing_comments: Large govt dock. Easy on low gradient mud, sand beach. N aspect. Long carry at most water levels.
properties.camp_comments: Camping by permission on grass - room for 4 tents. Little privacy.
properties.other_comments: Marina, laundry, showers, toilets. Water at tap. Cottage rental accommodation, seasonal pub. For details, see The Cottages at Shoal Bay.

properties.title: Sullivan Bay
properties.landing_comments: Float community.
properties.camp_comments: No comments.
properties.other_comments: Fuel, some provisions available year-round. Laundry, showers.

properties.title: Greenway Sound
properties.landing_comments: Moderately difficult on rough rock boulder beach with boat run for low, mid water levels. Well protected. Prominent sign. Float, dock in disrepair, hazardous but not close to camping area, so not recommended.
properties.camp_comments: Clear level grass areas upland. Pit toilet near dock. Picnic tables. Log book box needs repair, no book present 2023. Raised boardwalk hazardous due to rotting boards. Location also given as N50D 50.21M W126D 46.299M
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at year-round creek. Hiking trail leads to lake 45 min, further lake 30 min more.

properties.title: Mimkwamlis
properties.landing_comments: Easy, shell beach, reefs, midden. Some beach debris.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Site reported to be visited on summer evenings by Guardian Watchman to dissuade intending campers from staying overnight.
properties.other_comments: Visitors to this site who go ashore must obtain permission. Fee $20 each person. Call Band Office at 250-287-2955 or Toll Free: 1-888-287-2955. Etransfer at: viband@mamalilikulla.ca. For details and letter of permission, see Mamalilikulla First Nation.Water at creek. Known archaeological site. Mamalilikulla First Nation village on Village Island, occupied until 1972. Trail. Much of village site overgrown. The name Mimkwa̱mlis means village with rocks and island out front.

properties.title: Alert Road
properties.landing_comments: Easy, on sand, pebble, cobble beach. Exposed E aspect. Easy level access from parking area.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Alert Road off Highway 19A. Parking at street side in cul-de-sac. Beach access managed by Regional District of Nanaimo.

properties.title: Burdwood Group central
properties.landing_comments: This site is currently closed. Site closures may occur for a variety of reasons, including environmental protection, weather-related damage, safety concerns, or directives from First Nations. BC Marine Trails will update this site’s status as new information becomes available. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation in helping preserve these areas for future generations.
properties.camp_comments: nan
properties.other_comments: nan

properties.title: Sunnybeach Road
properties.landing_comments: Extensive low gradient sand beach. E aspect. Exposed. Short, easy carry from parking lot.
properties.camp_comments: Benches, picnic tables.
properties.other_comments: Gravel parking lot for about 15 vehicles. Located on Highway 19A. Sunnybeach Road Beach Access managed by Regional District of Nanaimo. Additional launch sites at Franksea Road 430 m to N and at Baywater Road 570 m to S.

properties.title: Care Island
properties.landing_comments: Rough beaches to N and S of rocky promontory.  Boulders, moderate gradient at high water, clam bed lower gradient with occasional boulders. S side steeper.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Rough tent sites in second growth forest or possible bluff sites. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Fisherman Bay
properties.landing_comments: Relatively easy landing on smooth pebble beach in partly protected cove. N aspect. Approach via centre bay through kelp. At very low water, W part of beach dries to boulders. Mostly sand bottom in centre of cove.
properties.camp_comments: Large area of level berm with beach grass 40 m E of centre beach. Also upland site under deciduous tree W of small peninsula i.e further E. Dispersed camping permitted. Fire pit, camp furniture. Camping fees apply 1 May to 30 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at San Josef Bay trailhead, but no reservable sites.
properties.other_comments: Rough hiking trail across peninsula to Nissen Bight. See: Cape Scott Provincial Park

properties.title: Lemon Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy on 20 m long mixed rock, gravel all-tide beach, cobbles below, scattered boulders in semi-protected cove, Open to W. W aspect. Moderately low gradient so dries far. Enter cove from W except at high water when passages between islands open. Beach mostly floods.
properties.camp_comments: Large site in open mossy woods for several tents 20 m along trail from beach on NW bank of creek. Hammock opportunities. Additional sites could be brushed.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. Logging relics, remains of cord road.

properties.title: Cranberry Islet
properties.landing_comments: Islet between Hull, Mistake Islands. Rocky beach or rock shelves at E end of islet. Strong winds can make landing difficult on SW side. Boat lining easy at either end of islet.
properties.camp_comments: Pine covered islet has flat top covered with low salal. Very small flat area half way along SW side above steep shore.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View.

properties.title: Boughey Bay entrance
properties.landing_comments: Steep angular cobble beach at bight on E shore N of entrance to bay. W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Right (S) of highest rivulet of creek entering beach up behind grove of cedars is small open flat area with easy access.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek, flowing during mid-July 2023 drought. Industrial road behind site.

properties.title: Patrician Cove
properties.landing_comments: Rock reef split cove with tombolo joining ashore. Broad beach of pebble, sand on either side of tombolo. E aspect. Well-protected from N, W.
properties.camp_comments: Beach camping on gravel or take trails 40 m into forest leading to upland camp area that will require brushing.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Water at seasonal creek at W end of cove. Rough Tex Lyon hiking trail runs by site. Anchorage. Site appears to be just outside S boundary of Hardy Bay Recreation Reserve.

properties.title: Masterman Islands
properties.landing_comments: Sand, pebble, shell beach with scattered boulders in protected cove on S side. Kelp. Landing easier at mid or high water. Landing at low water is difficult on seaweed-covered boulders. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: White shell berm may be levelled for small beach top site. Small upland bare patch for 2 tents approx 3 m above high water. Dense vegetation.
properties.other_comments: Attractive but rugged. Nature viewing. Bird colonies. Best avoided in Spring nesting season.

properties.title: Attwood Bay inner north
properties.landing_comments: 15% grade, 75 mm sharp rocks, gravel. Inner bay very sheltered. S aspect. Awkward boomsticks might be tethered on beach (2015). . Private float at shore (2022).
properties.camp_comments: One clear all-weather site. Several more potential sites at upland margin. Ground lumpy possibly due to logging debris. Because so sheltered, might be buggy, dark
properties.other_comments: No apparent foreshore tenure in this part of inner bay except private float likely related to saltwater recreational fishing commercial permit (2022). Anchorage.

properties.title: Toba Inlet Entrance
properties.landing_comments: 15%-20% grade, pea gravel up to 50-70 mm round gravel. Sheltered from inflow winds.
properties.camp_comments: Sites at upland margin behind drift logs. Open forest might yield more sites with minor brushing. 2022 party unable to find upland sites so used marginal gravel beach sites with little high water clearance at Neaps. Beach sites likely flood at Springs.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek to N. Shaded after mid-afternoon.

properties.title: Bend Island
properties.landing_comments: Smooth firm clam bed mud beach with scattered cobble, boulders. Suited to all water levels.
properties.camp_comments: Sites in forest. Lumpy terrain. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View.

properties.title: Village Bay Mayne Island
properties.landing_comments: Sand, gravel pebble beach in protected bay with scattered drift logs N of, adjacent to ferry dock. NW aspect. Use Public Beach Access gate in perimeter security fence, normally unlocked when terminal is staffed. Sloped, grassy access path with 1 step. Easy to wheel small boat from ferry to or from water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Services nearby. If locked, security fence gate may be unlocked on request by staff on duty approx 30 min before ferry arrives. Flush toilets, possible water available at terminal. 48 hr parking permitted on Dalton Drive.

properties.title: Tribune Bay Campground
properties.landing_comments: Easy on expansive sand beach 450 m to SE. S aspect. Campsite on beach access road - wheels useful. Off-beach to trail approx 50 m. Trail approx 70 m. Shields Road approx 300 m.
properties.camp_comments: Developed often crowded vehicle-accessible site. Minimum 2 nights stay. Reservations recommended. Open mid-May to September. See: http://www.tribunebay.com/rates.html#map Email: info@tribunebay.com Tel: +1 250.335.2359
properties.other_comments: On Shields Road adjacent to Tribune Bay Provincial Park - camping not permitted there. Provisions, restaurants, services nearby.

properties.title: Cevallos Campsite
properties.landing_comments: Land at village dock about 500m S or paddle up tidal river.
properties.camp_comments: Vehicle accessible campground with most services. Toilets, fire pits, picnic tables. Water at tap. Picnic shelter. Laundry facilities. Fee $10 per night (2023) Separate RV site has hookups at higher cost. Operated by Village of Zeballos, Reservations: (250) 761-4229 or e-mail adminzeb@recn.ca. Attractive riverside location.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Lyall Harbour
properties.landing_comments: High-sided float at public wharf, adjacent to ferry dock. Protected.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Direct but awkward access from BC Ferries to float managed by Capital Regional District as a Small Craft Harbour. Pub, restaurant, services.

properties.title: Weld Island Tombolo
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected sand, gravel beach, rougher at high water. Approach from NE or SW.
properties.camp_comments: Small site at top of isthmus. Suited to Neaps only, floods at Springs. Sides are rock walls that will funnel wind.
properties.other_comments: Attractive, view.

properties.title: Carrington Lagoon Entrance
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected pebble beaches E or W of reversing falls. Drift logs on E shore. W side bank slopes more gently to upland.
properties.camp_comments: Main camping area to E of tidal channel on grass or in forest clearings. Additional sites on W shore near picnic shelter. Pit toilet reported unusable 2021. Fire pits. Camp furniture. Site shared with hiking access users. Annual use in early August for large noisy 3 day /night gathering of approx. 100 visitors, Threats to remove public access resulting from poor visitor behaviour.
properties.other_comments: Water location unknown but 2 creeks mapped NW of narrows. Footbridge across narrows. Easy short portage to lagoon. Extensive hiking trails. Carrington Bay Park, Strathcona Regional District. No fees (2021). See Carrington Bay Park.

properties.title: Carrington Bay east
properties.landing_comments:
Gravel, rubble beach, some boulders. Behind island in sheltered bay.
Float home reported 300m W.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on open grassy upland benches. Fire pit. Camp furniture. Room for more tents.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek nearby but dry in Aug 2023 drought. Carrington Bay Park, Strathcona Regional District. Web site says informal camping. Park approx 200 ha waterfront lot with sheltered lagoon. Varied forested area includes old growth, second growth. Some accumulation of beach garbage reported 2022. Please remove if you can, as some kind paddlers are steadily doing.

properties.title: Stefans Islet
properties.landing_comments: Awkward landing in notch in bedrock with boulder substrate. S aspect. Protected except from S. Landing at mid or high water likely more difficult.
properties.camp_comments: Several level sites in open pine forest on upper parts of small islet. Fire ring, camp furniture.Avoid camping under or near dead trees in case of blowdown.
properties.other_comments: View. Secluded. Not listed as campsite because of potential landing difficulty, but regularly used. Name taken from SRD map. Aka Dunsterville Mini Islet.

properties.title: Secret Beach Campground
properties.landing_comments: See adjacent launch site
properties.camp_comments: 2 serviced campgrounds on either side of small creek. Gravel pads, fire pits, picnic tables. Drinking water not provided, no showers. Pit toilets. Open mid-May to mid-September. Gate locked at 11 pm nightly. Camping fee and launch fee - amount varies by season.To reserve email secretbeach@toquaht.ca or ph. 1-778-762-4433.
properties.other_comments: From Highway 4 turn onto gravel Toquaht Bay Road. Go straight 13 km. Campground on right. Marina, separate kayak launch nearby from same entry. Owned, operated by Toquaht Nation. See: Secret Beach Campground is open May 20 to September 15, 2022. Check with Toquaht Nation to ensure openings/closing of campground.

properties.title: Saturna Beach
properties.landing_comments: Smooth pebble, sand beach. Small boat dock. W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilets. Picnic shelter.
properties.other_comments: By road take East Point Road, Narvaez Bay Road, then Harris Road over ridge saddle to Trueworthy Road. Park at end. Swimming, Winery. Thomson Community Park, a Capital Regional District Park.

properties.title: Taylor Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy on long low to moderate gradient sand beach, occasional boulders, gravel. E aspect. Beach has some soft parts. Many drift logs under steep bank.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Huge meadow, old orchard in upland, many fine picnic locations.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Water at seasonal stream at centre beach. Ruins of farm, old quarry. Interpretive signs. Intact shoreline strip of Douglas Fir, Garry Oak, Arbutus from Taylor Point to vineyard. Rough hiking routes to Brown Ridge, vineyard but Parks Canada have not yet sanctioned or marked these. Wildlife viewing.

properties.title: Tumbo Island
properties.landing_comments: Sand beach in sheltered cove. W aspect. Another landing beach at E end of island. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Hiking trails. Pit toilets. Nature viewing. Tidal pools, freshwater marsh. Respect house owner's privacy. Gulf Islands National Park Reserve.

properties.title: Gordon River
properties.landing_comments: Concrete ramp at river. Many other options locally
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Parking available for fee. Might also be some free parking. Ramp believed to be part of Pacheedaht IR.

properties.title: Sooke
properties.landing_comments: Concrete ramp in sheltered harbour.
properties.camp_comments: No camping
properties.other_comments: District of Sooke public boat ramp. Located at 6933 West Coast Road. Parking. Fees charged. Many services nearby.

properties.title: Mannion Bay Boathouse
properties.landing_comments: Rough beach in sheltered bay. Steep 15-20% slope, rocks to 200 mm, slightly cleared in centre, Rocks to 300 mm at sides. SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Old boathouse, ramp, Road end Right of Way directly upland from boathouse, Flat bench on first small bluff to S. Bowen Island municipal park.

properties.title: Millers Landing
properties.landing_comments: Rough beach on cove 8% slope, 100 mm rounded rocks, rocks slightly larger to 200 mm at lower water levels, exposed somewhat to N but protected by small islet.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Overlooked by two houses, steep wooden public stairs to upland. Bowen Island municipal park.

properties.title: Fairweather Bay
properties.landing_comments: 10% slope, gravel to 50 mm at high water. At lower water some rocks to 300 mm. Drift logs. S aspect but some protection from S.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted, but 1-2 emergency sites possible at top of beach.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Overlooked by 2 houses (2015)

properties.title: Mannion Bay
properties.landing_comments: Wide beach of gravel to 75 mm at all water levels in protected bay.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Anchorage. Road access at Senator Place. Bowen Island municipal park.

properties.title: Cape Roger Curtis north
properties.landing_comments: Beach in cove with moderate 10% slope, gravel to 75mm, rocks to 400mm at mid water only, narrow entry but wide higher up, drift logs st top.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: 2 m rock bank to upland and seawalk. Shelter from N, E and some S. Just N of centre of the 3 long piers in this otherwise prime stretch of coastline. Developed private land above seawalk.

properties.title: Read Point east
properties.landing_comments: Moderate gradient pebble, gravel, small cobble beach in protected bay. SW aspect. Drift logs. Between the low and high the beach becomes barnacle encrusted rocks to boulders.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped user-maintained dispersed camping. Beach sites feasible. 2 sites to W of beach. Trail leads to many more upland sites to N some needing minor brushing, levelling. Rustic furniture. Some damp or flooded areas seasonally.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal stream which runs through site. Former homestead site. Evidence of old house, buildings, fencing. See Read Island Park. Additional bay 300 m to E also reported to have camping options.

properties.title: Union Cove
properties.landing_comments: Pebble beach in small well protected cove with moderate 10% slope, Drift logs. Sheltered from N, W, S. Appears to flood at Springs.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: No known public upland, but reported to be in part Bowen Island municipal class C park. Overlooked by residences on bench above 7 m bank. No known public road or trail access nor any found.

properties.title: Cape Roger Curtis
properties.landing_comments: Beach moderate 10-15% grade, gravel and rock to 200 mm. W aspect, shelter from N,E, S. Large dock (2014) and floats with marina to be added (2015).
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Bowen Island municipal park from high water to trail that joins to 2 other coves to N. Major residential development above. Road access nearby.

properties.title: Passage Island west
properties.landing_comments: Broad cobble beach, 10-15% slope, round rocks to 200 mm, smaller rocks at high water, larger toward low water.  Some boulders, drift logs.  SW aspect. Sheltered from N, E.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Overlooked by adjacent properties. Managed by Metro Vancouver Regional District.

properties.title: Passage Island south
properties.landing_comments: Broad cobble beach, steep 15-20% grade, rounded 150 mm rocks. S aspect. Sheltered from N, W, partly from E.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Slightly overlooked by adjacent residences, cabins. Managed by Metro Vancouver Regional District.

properties.title: Pasley South Islet
properties.landing_comments: Challenging bedrock shelf at SE corner of main islet. At low water, pebble tombolo beach joins to smaller islet. Landing exposed. Check weather for landing, leaving. Use in settled weather only.
properties.camp_comments: Flat bedrock, grassy areas on upper islet.
properties.other_comments: Some trees, swampy area. View.

properties.title: Winegarden Park
properties.landing_comments: Difficult on steep 25-30% small rip rap stone blocks. Easier landings nearby.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Paved pathways, grass, trees. Map shows toilets at extreme N end. Township of Gibsons park.

properties.title: Mount Gardner Dock
properties.landing_comments: Wharf with float or adjacent gravel beach, 15% slope. Well protected from S, E, W.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Road access on Mount Gardner Road. Bowen Island municipal park.

properties.title: Armours Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, pebble beach. SE aspect. Ramp, 9 stone steps to beach from road.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Flush toilets. Small wharf, float. 5 picnic tables, bench seats
properties.other_comments: N end of municipal smooth gravel seawalk, picnic area, small wharf, swimming area. Approx 8 parking spaces, no significant restrictions. Township of Gibsons park.

properties.title: Verdier Point north
properties.landing_comments: Easy roadside access down low bank to low gradient gravel beach, NE aspect. A few larger rocks, boulders.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: View. Large gravel parking area on Mill Bay Road with no posted restrictions. General 24 hr regional district parking time limit may apply. Adjacent land appears to be part of Malahat IR.

properties.title: Salmon Rock
properties.land_tenure: Public Foreshore, Road end Right of Way
properties.landing_comments: Land on W side in sheltered cove between west islet and Salmon Rock. 15% grade, mixed sand, gravel, small rocks to 100 mm, some rounded rocks to 300 mm.
properties.camp_comments: Exposed flat areas on grass, bedrock at point, some rock benches. Please respect 'no fires' notices.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Upland owned, managed by Keats Camps, Convention of Baptist Churches of BC Trails, ROW to camp buildings, also to Keats Island public wharf, road at Keats Landing. The only public land access is on the wide road right of way strip wide. Coordinates on BCMT map lie in the centre of strip. Home Island just to S is Crown and marked also as a Recreation Reserve, but lacks good landing.

properties.title: Crayola Beach
properties.landing_comments: Beach of gravel to 75 mm at all water levels.Some bedrock, boulders at high water. W aspect. Open bay sheltered from E, S with some protection from N.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Seasonal creek at S side of beach. Minimal overlook from local residences. Public stone stairs, trail to upland. Vertical painted log at stair base looks like huge upright crayon stub. Bowen Island municipal park.

properties.title: Mallard Road
properties.landing_comments: Extensive beach of sand pebble, cobble, scattered boulders.. Low gradient. Long carry at low water. Exposed E aspect. Short path to beach from parking.
properties.camp_comments: Picnic area.
properties.other_comments: Public beach access managed by Regional District of Nanaimo. Parking for numerous vehicles. Access from Johnstone Road. Alternate site 200 m SE at end of Johnstone Road.

properties.title: East Beach Keats Island
properties.landing_comments: Beach moderate 15% slope, rounded gravel to 50 mm. Sheltered from W, S.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Overlooked by houses. Several small boats stored at beach top,

properties.title: Clipper Place
properties.landing_comments: Beach in open bay moderate 10% slope, gravel and rocks to 75 mm, low water, 10 mm gravel at high water.  W aspect. Shelter from S, E.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Bowen Island municipal park.

properties.title: East Islets Keats south
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on small treeless rock islets. For both N and S landings 15% slope, shell & gravel to 75 mm, some 300 mm rocks. One side sheltered from E, W, S.  Other side sheltered from E, W, N.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Almost no shelter from wind.
properties.other_comments: View. Some flat areas for rest.

properties.title: Cates Bay
properties.landing_comments: Broad beach in bay. Moderate 15% slope, rounded gravel to 75 mm, at med/low water 200 mm rounded rocks. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Overlooked by many houses, mostly set far back. Bowen Island Municipal park. Public stairs give access from road. Aka Safety Cove on topo map.

properties.title: Seymour Landing
properties.landing_comments: S beach of sand, fine gravel. N beach of pebble, mixed rocks.  NE aspect. Mostly floods at high water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Public stair lead to/from road end. Major residential development in adjacent upland (2015). Bowen Island municipal park. Golf course above in higher upland

properties.title: Alder Cove Bowen Island
properties.landing_comments: Beach of fine sand in small sheltered cove. Protection from all directions. W aspect. Drift logs. Beach floods at high water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Public stairs lead to/from road end. Unserviced Bowen Island municipal park.

properties.title: September Morn Beach
properties.landing_comments: Long gravel beach of moderate to steep slope.  Narrow at high water. Many drift logs. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Access from road via public stairs. Steep bank enhances privacy. Bowen Island municipal park.

properties.title: Patricia Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy access on short unpaved track near large arbutus tree to normally sheltered broad sand, gravel beach. Low gradient, Moderate slope at top.. W aspect. Some drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: View. Off road parking for several vehicles on gravel roadside under trees that appears to be on municipal property alongside W Saanich Rd. General regulation bans parking over 24 hrs. but nothing posted. Popular launch site. Tseycum Reserve boundary appears to be immediately to N. ..

properties.title: Port Graves Camp Artaban
properties.landing_comments: Land on float.
properties.camp_comments: No known public camping.
properties.other_comments: Upland Camp Artaban is private, but roadways open to public use. Children's summer camp no longer in operation 2015. Substantial dock maintained by Sunshine Coast Regional District.

properties.title: Sunset Estates
properties.landing_comments: Steep paved or concrete ramp.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: 2 m high concrete breakwater around linear parking area for a few vehicles. Launch ramp continues directly down from steep approach road Errington Highway or onto floating dock with ramp up to parking area. 14 lot waterfront subdivision developed in 2006 Average 5 acre lots.

properties.title: Long Bay Head
properties.landing_comments: Gravel boat launch in sheltered bay.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping.
properties.other_comments: Very sheltered gravel launch close to residences. Gambier Island Sea Ranch is a private 334 acre strata community of at the head of Long Bay with resident manager operating a working farm. Marina on opposite shore, community pavilion, walking trails, swimming. Public access to trails unclear.

properties.title: Laurel Beach
properties.landing_comments: Unknown, but likely is bedrock shelving at some 15% slope, with gravel, rounded rocks to 150 mm. Drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Municipal park and marine conservation area.

properties.title: West Beach Keats Island
properties.landing_comments: Wide gravel beach, moderate 15% gradient, round pebbly rocks 25 mm to 75 mm. Exposed to SW.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Potential emergency use sites at beach top near stored small boats. Small beach fires permitted in winter, shoulder months only.
properties.other_comments: Steep upland bank partly shields overview from numerous cabins, giving some privacy. Sunshine Coast Regional District park. Trails lead to cross-island road. Frequently used for social gatherings,swimming by island residents, cottagers. Float in summer.

properties.title: Eastbourne
properties.landing_comments: Dock, float or adjacent gravel beach, moderate 15% slope, canoe runs at centre beach and beside dock. Rocks to 300 mm to E, rocks to 100 mm to W. Smaller stones at high water, larger rocks, bedrock at low water. E aspect. Exposed to N outflow winds.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Large cable sign, diagonal roadway to public dock across steep shore precludes upland usage, Aka Maple Beach. Dock operated by Sunshine Coast Regional District. Daily foot passenger ferry to Langdale. Frequent on-demand charter water taxi service. Adjacent to residential subdivision of holiday homes.

properties.title: Wreck Beach Keats Island
properties.landing_comments: Beach of moderate 10% slope, gravel, rounded rocks to 100 mm, wide canoe run at beach centre, rougher at sides.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not permitted. Possible emergency sites at foot of access road to SW.
properties.other_comments: Overlooked by houses. Many small boats stored just above beach. aka Sunrise Beach.

properties.title: Andys Beach
properties.landing_comments: Small beach of rounded gravel to 50 mm, moderate 15% slope. Bedrock outcrops. Private floats. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Steep bank upland shields overlook from residence giving some privacy. Seasonal stream cascades through steep rocks on W. Please respect private upland property.

properties.title: Underhill and Sole Beaches
properties.landing_comments: Beach moderate 15% slope, sand, gravel and rocks to 100 mm. NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Underhill Beach at the N end, Sole Beach at S. Overlooked by houses. 2 paths or narrow road accesses to beach. Aka Smugglers Cove on topo map.

properties.title: Poca Beach
properties.landing_comments: Wide gravel beach moderate 15% grade, SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Greatly overlooked by upland houses. Adjacent to Cates Bay beach to S. Bowen Island municipal park.

properties.title: Doctor Bay islet
properties.landing_comments: 20% grade, rocks to 200mm, some bedrock at foreshore, upland margin.
properties.camp_comments: 1 site on S summit, 2 sites on N summit which is in view of residence and industrial dock, work area. Paddlers have camped on islet and on point(s) on E side of Doctor Bay. Potential camp on W side of Bay beside islet.
properties.other_comments: Aquaculture, docks in bay. Bay, mainland to N under Crown tenure. Pictograph.

properties.title: Palm Beach kwekwenis
properties.landing_comments: Broad sand, pebble beach with drift logs. SE aspect. 250 m trail from parking lot to beach.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not permitted. Day use area. Flush toilets April - 15 September, playing field, playground, covered picnic area, parking.
properties.other_comments: View. Qathet Regional District park. Access from Hwy 101 turn S on Lang Bay Road then left on Palm Beach Road, half block to parking lot. Former name Palm Beach Lang Bay.

properties.title: Hof Regional Park
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected gravel beach. NE aspect. 150 m carry to beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Parking for 3 cars plus more along road. Grassy beach access trail. Picnic area. Hiking trails in separate section. Cees and Miep Hof Memorial Park operated by Cowichan Valley Regional District. Directions: E off Trans-Canada Highway onto Koksilah Rd. Bear right (S ) on Cherry Point Rd. Continue past Hof farm. Turn left (N) on Kingscote Rd to end.

properties.title: Gibsons Beach Park
properties.landing_comments: Occasional boulders on low gradient cobble, mixed sand beach. Paved boat ramp in some disrepair. Exposed. Better beach to N of ramp near picnic tables.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not permitted. 2 Picnic tables. Grassy meadow. Porta-toilet.
properties.other_comments: View. Large parking lot. Unrestricted except for no camping. Access from Hwy 101 12 km from Powell River then 1.5 km on unpaved Gibsons Beach Road. Boat ramp. City of Powell River park.

properties.title: Cherry Point Marina
properties.landing_comments: Launch from beach beside boat ramp.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Parking & launch fee $5.00 (2014). Pay at deposit box. Easy beach launch. Please keep clear of traffic using ramp. Overnight parking available. Privately owned and operated marina.

properties.title: Pulteney Point
properties.landing_comments: Cobble beach in lee of point in NW wind.
properties.camp_comments: Beach bivouac among drift logs. No room for tent. N Frazer says location 40 m SE of lighthouse. Owner of adjacent property to N does not encourage camping there.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Chatham Channel east
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient firm clam bed with moderately steep beach of pebble, small cobble above creek mouth. S aspect. Kelp.
properties.camp_comments: Path up midden bank near creek mouth to E. Camp in woods on top.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek, likely year-round. Flowing in drought mid-July 2023. Attractive, sunny.

properties.title: Bunsen Beach
properties.landing_comments: 20% slope, rough, rocks to 300 mm. Boulders at lower water levels. Oyster band at low water, Currents.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Would yield 2 further upland campsites with brushing of dense vegetation. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: View. Small trails through site.

properties.title: Potts Point north
properties.landing_comments: Beach 10% gradient of gravel, rounded rocks to 100 mm.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping.
properties.other_comments: Several roads or pathways upland.

properties.title: Scarborough Beach
properties.landing_comments: Wide gravel beach moderate 15% slope,  Rocks to 100 mm, Drift logs. NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Overlooked some by residences..Public access stairs to beach, road end. Possible access along old road at diagonal to property lines but N part appears private. Bowen Island municipal park.

properties.title: Scarborough Beach north
properties.landing_comments: 10 m wide beach, E aspect. Moderate 15% slope, broken rock to 100 mm at high water, larger rocks to 450 mm at low, medium water,  Sheltered from W, N, S.
properties.camp_comments: Overnight use not permitted. Potential sites to S on bluff, or directly upland. Further possibilities on upland to N.
properties.other_comments: Day use only permitted.

properties.title: Baker Beach Bowen Island
properties.landing_comments: Small steep beach 20% slope, in small bay. .Bedrock shelf to S. Gravel with some rocks to 200 mm. Beach floods so not usable at high water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Overlooked by one residence. Steep cliff bars upland access. Bowen Island municipal park.

properties.title: Williams Beach
properties.landing_comments: Rough beach, moderate 15% slope, gravel at high water, gravel and rocks to 300 mm at lower water levels. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Upland to N side of beach. Stairs, bluff appears to be Crown land and where the road end right of way intersects with beach.

properties.title: Eagle Cliff Beach
properties.landing_comments: Wide beach moderate 10-15% slope, gravel and rocks to 100 mm, Wide boat run N of centre. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Steep upland, but some access up steep bank at N end. Small boats stored on upland, Bowen Island municipal park.

properties.title: Langdale
properties.landing_comments: Easy on broad low gradient beach with 3% slope on sand, gravel, some small rocks. Protected E aspect. Prominent large boulder on shore. Some drift logs. Access on short  trail from parking lot. Former alternative launch off public float on N side within ferry dock, next to Gambier, Keats passenger ferry dock, inaccessible (2022) to long objects due to deliberately-placed barriers, fencing, also gated, locked at night.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilets at terminal, trailhead.
properties.other_comments: Terminal reconstruction planned. Public plaza planned next to beach to S of new building. Unknown if beach access, launch is to be included. Popular beach access location following removal of security fence from BC Ferries bordering property. Conditions of use of large parking lot unknown.

properties.title: Gibsons Marina Kwíl’aḵm
properties.landing_comments: Concrete boat ramp, float, dock, Beach 15% grade sand, silt inside fully protected harbour.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Kayak rentals available.
properties.other_comments: Operated by Gibsons Marina. Pay parking available. Unknown if paddlecraft are required to pay launch fees - using the adjacent beach is obvious alternative. Squamish (Coast Salish) name Kwíl’aḵm. Large Sea to Sky Marine Trail sign at top of ramp.

properties.title: Georgia Beach
properties.landing_comments: 15% grade, sand & gravel, wide beach, drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not permitted. Space at sides for emergency use. Picnic table.
properties.other_comments: Parking for 6 cars. Gates close at 9:00 pm. Township of Gibsons park. . No toilet.

properties.title: Cooper Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy at low water on protected clam bed beach at cove head to SW of Point. Rougher band with cobble, rubble, boulders at mid, high water levels. Near centre of Upper Okisollo Rapids so be aware of very strong currents.
properties.camp_comments: Treeless islet with cobble tombolo joins to Quadra Island. Camping or day use on W side of islet at grassy point. Cove head immediately W also has sites in protected forest clearing or at Neaps on upper beach, likely preferable to tombolo. Possible former cabin location.
properties.other_comments: Stream shown on topo map entering beach but not reported. Some private land to S. Beach fires are banned all year round.

properties.title: Waddington Bay
properties.landing_comments: Moderate gradient smooth shell beach in protected bay. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Large accessible but rough upland area. High bench just inside trees. Small tent sites in open forest, mostly uneven. Small trails link some sites. Many blowdowns. Some reporters used landing, sites approx. 100 m to NW. Hammock opportunities. Many additional tent sites with brushing.
properties.other_comments: Some parts used for cedar bark harvest. Anchorage, Provincial Boat Haven. Broughton Archipelago Conservancy.

properties.title: Retreat Passage south
properties.landing_comments: Clam bed in protected bay with NW aspect dries to smooth firm mud with scattered boulders. Beach smoother in centre.
properties.camp_comments: Old stump on beach has salal growing on top. Half way along beach SW of stump path leads 15 m to spacious flat site in old second growth forest. Other small tent sites. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Water at small seasonal creek at head of bay, dry in drought of mid-July 2023.

properties.title: Hanks Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, pebble beach. Moderate gradient. 50 m wide. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Open grass area behind beach. Signage says camping, fires not permitted. Access trail 10 min to/from road. Open style toilet 200m from beach in trees. Driftwood benches, shelter.
properties.other_comments: Hank’s Beach Forest Conservation Park. 62 ha mainly forested. Conservation Covenant (Land Conservancy of BC). Gifted by The Tides Foundation 2007 or 2011 from major donation by individual for preservation. Strathcona Regional District manages as public park, for respectful level of public use but primary management goal to maintaining ecological integrity, mature forest ecosystems. Ecologically significant inland, coastal bluffs wildlife habitat, rare species, plant communities.

properties.title: Tiber Bay Islet
properties.landing_comments: Rock shelf or boulder landing on small rocky promontory on E shore of N islet. SE aspect. Better landing on W side of islet at notch.
properties.camp_comments: Exposed mossy rock flat lacks trees. Potential treed or mossy rock bluff sites elsewhere on islet.
properties.other_comments: View. Sign nearby on S islet says Klahoose Oyster Lease. Islet dries on S shore.

properties.title: Mayne Passage
properties.landing_comments: Shore of prominent white bedrock. Rock shelf. Fisheries boundary marker triangle. Boat wash. No protection from S.
properties.camp_comments: Spacious bluffs, but tent sites marginal. Better for day use.
properties.other_comments: View.

properties.title: Gower Point east
properties.landing_comments: Exposed 5-10% slope beach, low water 300-200 mm cobble reducing to 75 mm rounded rocks to gravel at high water. Many drift logs. S, E aspect. Beach might flood at Springs.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted by Regional District. Dense vegetation but few mature trees. Some recent slide activity (2017). Small pebble beach sites except at Springs.
properties.other_comments: Trail access via trail, steps, off Gower Point Road. Beach access park Sunhsine Coast Regional District. 2 small streams. Area also called 'Secret Beach'. Walk along beach at most tides to access trail to Gower Point Road. Some other small trails appear to lead to residences. .

properties.title: Wharf Avenue Portage
properties.landing_comments: From beach at Trail Bay S node of portage, short 15% slope concrete ramp, slight slope down, and then 1.4 km level paved sidewalk to moderate gradient paved launch at Porpoise Bay Wharf on Sechelt, Inlet N node of portage.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Follow Wharf Avenue directly N, keeping to sidewalk except at first parking lot. Be aware of pedestrians, controlled highway crossing in the 2nd block through town. Remainder is level sidewalk. Simple, minimal physical exertion required compared to many other portages or ferry walk-offs. Enables extensive circle tour of Sechelt peninsula.

properties.title: Chaster Creek south
properties.landing_comments: Small bay immediately N, 3-5 % slope, gravel, round rocks to 100 mm. Some protection from S, W. Small estuary.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Residences nearby. Toilets.
properties.other_comments: Also known as Bonnybrook Beach. From Hwy 101 take Pratt Road, Gower Point Road to Ocean Beach Esplanade. 1577 Ocean Beach Esplanade. Roadside parking. Community Hall. Sunshine Coast Regional District park 2.1 ha.

properties.title: Paul Beach
properties.landing_comments: 5-10% slope, varied gravel to 75 mm, round rocks, some bedrock. Depending on water level, landing is sheltered from N, S or W behind bedrock outcrops.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Attractive, view. Limited parking. Beach access trail 130 m. Swimming. Some overview from nearby houses.

properties.title: Halfmoon Bay xwilkway
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient beach of cobble, gravel, some sand at creek mouth. Jetty nearby.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Toilet
properties.other_comments: Beach abuts Mintie Road near Halfmoon Bay General Store. Provisions. Coordinates given as N49 30.669 W123 54.727 Redrooffs Trail Park managed by Sunshine Coast Regional District. Very limited short term parking only. shishalh nae in Coast Salish language is xwilkway.

properties.title: Secret Beach west
properties.landing_comments: Beach of shingle, round cobble to 75 mm, 15% slope, many drift logs. Exposed SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Sunshine Coast Regional District beach access park. Level road access at Ocean Beach Esplanade junction with 6th St or Gower Point Road. Steeper access from 7th St (encroached?) or Mabel Road. Upper beach has several shacks, assumed to belong to residences above.

properties.title: tsukwum UREP
properties.landing_comments: From seaward enter narrow breakwater gap into small protected estuary or creek mouth,  S aspect. Dries to mud so might not be usable at low water. Likely easier access directly off the Strait on moderately steep beach of pebble, cobble with some drift logs. Beach lies adjacent to creek mouth  to E of gap. SE aspect. Exposed. Beach 10% gradient, sand, gravel, round smooth cobbles to 100 mm.
properties.camp_comments: Level upland with scrubby vegetation that would require minor brushing. Several small tent sites possible for emergency use or to break this long section of Salish Sea Marine Trail. No facilities. No fires.
properties.other_comments: New marina, multi-tenant housing and other land nearby owned by shíshálh First Nation who do not want recreational use here but cite environmental reasons relating to creek and estuary habitat. Site has water access only. Overlooked by residences. Sufficient privacy for sanitation purposes might be an issue. UREP 931505 (2021) site - emergency use only. Former name Wilson Creek UREP

properties.title: Mason Road
properties.landing_comments: Beach of cobble, small boulders with boat run on smaller cobbles. Drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: 5399 Mason Road - short cul de sac off Highway 101 in residential area. Parking for approx 3 vehicles. Easy access beach on gravel path 20 m. District of Sechelt beach access park. Walking trail to Wakefield along waterfront.

properties.title: Buccaneer Marina
properties.landing_comments: Narrow concrete boat ramp in fully protected cove surrounded by floats.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: 5535 Sans Souci Road Halfmoon Bay, V0N 1Y2 Ph 604 885-7888 or Toll Free 1-877-885-7888. 2016 fee charged for kayak launch $3, retrieve $3 incl day parking. Overnight parking available for additional fee.

properties.title: Walkem Bay north
properties.landing_comments: Easy on moderate gradient pebble, sand beach. Currents. W aspect. Bay is generally protected.
properties.camp_comments: Sites in sloped open cedar forest may require minor brushing, levelling. Access through dense salal vegetation band at beach top. No feasible beach camping at most tide levels.
properties.other_comments: Previously named East Thurlow Island west 2, Walkem Islands inside 2

properties.title: Penrose Bay
properties.landing_comments: No longer appropriate for landing/launching. Please use the government dock 1 Nautical Mile south at the Okeover government wharf.
properties.camp_comments: Closed for launching except with a rental from Powell River Sea Kayaking. Call for opening, closing dates 604 483 2160 or 1 (866) 617 4444 (toll-free). Email info@bcseakayak.com
properties.other_comments: Powell River Sea Kayaking base. No longer an appropriate launch/landing site

properties.title: Port Browning
properties.landing_comments: Sand beach in protected harbour. SE aspect. 2 adjacent locations - paved boat ramp  or beach near pub, public dock near broad lawn or grass field.
properties.camp_comments: See camping nearby at marina.
properties.other_comments: Ramp at at end of Hamilton Road next to sailing club compound, other beach at end of Oak Road. Kayak, canoe, SUP rentals, tours, outfitter. Pub. Marina. Dock, floats managed by Capital Regional District as a Small Craft Harbour. Parking available either on Hamilton Road or possibly through arrangement with local businesses.

properties.title: Mortimer Spit
properties.landing_comments: Moderately steep protected pebble, shell beaches depending on tide height. Drift logs. Various aspects to suit conditions. Unsurfaced boat ramp. Small lagoon. Short carry.
properties.camp_comments: no fires permitted.
properties.other_comments: Road access from Mortimer Spit Road, off Canal Road just S of bridge. Large gravel parking lot. No overnight parking permitted. Swimming. Capital Regional District Park. Nearby is Xelisen - aboriginal site bisected by construction of nearby canal. Outhouse on site near road.

properties.title: Sturdies Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on  is float at public dock adjacent to ferry dock. Alternate is protected sand beach. SE aspect. Some rock ledges. Immediately SW of ferry wharf. Vessel traffic, currents in Active Pass.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Toilets.
properties.other_comments: Public dock, float managed by Capital Regional District as a Small Craft Harbour. Easy 60 m access from ferry ramp. Wheels recommended. Beach access from ferry parking lot by unlocked gate through low perimeter fence, leading to paved sloped trail or drainage swale that runs to wall just above beach. Step off concrete wall to sandstone and beach approx 1 m high. Feasible to transport small narrow boats to, from beach. For ferry travellers without vehicles public float is more convenient

properties.title: Crofton Beach Park
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient sand beach, mud lower. At low water, long muddy carry likely. E aspect. Easy 50 m path to beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilet., picnic tables, benches. Grassed play area.
properties.other_comments: Off Adelaide Road, Berridge Street, Dyck Road. 2 small parking lots day use only. Park operated by Municipality of North Cowichan. Closed at night. S start point of Crofton Seawalk.

properties.title: Curlew Boat Ramp
properties.landing_comments: Steep concrete boat ramp, adjacent sand, gravel beach. Low gradient, dries far.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: View. Limited roadside parking at end of Curlew View Road off Steward Drive. Previously named Horton Bay.

properties.title: Little Espinosa Inlet east
properties.landing_comments: Gravel boat ramp in sheltered inlet. Exit from W end best timed for slack water to avoid strong rapids flowing under road bridge at mid-tides.
properties.camp_comments: Small site along short level gravel road, suited to drive-in camping or RVs. 2 fire pits. Additional sites for tents subject to brushing, mowing grass. Pit toilet.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. 9 km SW of Zeballos on gravel road. Past viewpoint overlooking Zeballos, Zeballos Inlet, road veers sharply right. Access road at sign on right.

properties.title: Mitlenatch Island
properties.landing_comments: Landing permitted only at Northwest Bay or Camp Bay. Camp Bay has protected beach in cove. SE aspect. Float. Northwest Bay has exposed beach, NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not permitted.
properties.other_comments: Access restricted to Northwest Bay or Camp Bay. Most of island is under visitor restriction. Bird sanctuary. Observation blind. Wildlife viewing. Volunteer naturalist in residence in summer months. Marine mammals. See Mitlenatch Island Nature Provincial Park

properties.title: East Redonda Boulder
properties.landing_comments: Exposed beach of small rocks, Land near creek mouth at prominent boulder, relatively few oysters. Minor boat run. W aspect. Easier at high or low water to minimize oyster contact at mid water.
properties.camp_comments: Forest opening at creek leads to level sites in small clearings in sloping forest near 2 creeks. Low salal, Tree hazards present.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek, believed year-round. Ecological Reserve: Open to the public for non-destructive pursuits like hiking.

properties.title: Hanna Point east
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on moderately steep beach of smooth pebble at high water with low sea state. Weed-covered smooth rocks below pebble beach at low water. SE aspect, Expect surf if swell is from S, Hanna Point protects beach from W.
properties.camp_comments: Roomy beach site on pebbles. Dispersed camping permitted. Camping fees apply 1 May to 30 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at San Josef Bay trailhead, but no reservable sites.
properties.other_comments: Water reported nearby but location unknown, See: Cape Scott Provincial Park

properties.title: Rough Islets
properties.landing_comments: Narrow boat run on cobble beach to E of  site, Larger boulders at alternate landing on W side.
properties.camp_comments: Trails on peninsula lead through salal to grass or forested sites. 4 large wooden tent platforms, some repaired by BC Parks. Usable. Other grassy areas appear damp. Kitchen structure in poor condition. Picnic table, fire pit.
properties.other_comments: Trail to Maggy Point site with composting toilet. Wildlife viewing. Adjacent to park but outside it. See Broughton Archipelago Provincial Park.

properties.title: Hudson Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy on moderate gradient firm pebble, gravel, sand beach in protected bay. 30cm boulders at low water. E aspect. Many drift logs, snags at high water. Summer 2024 large tree/log blocks most of upper beach at high water.
properties.camp_comments: Minor brushing required in upland forest for one tent site - others are normally clear. Beach camp possible on gravel. Good tree for bear hang.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Trail across isthmus. See Broughton Archipelago Provincial Park

properties.title: Bonner Islet west
properties.landing_comments: Possible surf landing above 2 - 2.5 m tides.  Can be exposed to inflow winds.
properties.camp_comments: Beach camping. Upper sites reported to not flood at springs. Tombolo 60 m to S might be used by some parties.
properties.other_comments: Water at E beach via trail. View of Brooks Peninsula, sea state.

properties.title: Kinsmen Park Departure Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on large beach of pebble, sand, some rock. E aspect. Low gradient beach dries far.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Picnic tables, benches, playground, toilets.
properties.other_comments: E end of Loat Street, off Departure Bay Road. BCMTNA sign. Day parking. Swimming, swim area, float. City of Nanaimo Kinsmen Park.

properties.title: Powell River ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off. Launch of municipal marina floats, boat ramp or rough beach adjacent to ferry.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to Blubber Bay Texada Island and to Little River Vancouver Island.

properties.title: Blubber Bay ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off. Extensive security fencing make shore access challenging. Rough beach in protected bay. Steep riprap banks at high water.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to Powell River.

properties.title: Little River ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off. Adjacent beaches offer good launches via gate in ferry terminal fence on S side. Semi-protected moderately steep sand, gravel beach. Many drift logs on upper beach. Approx 50 m from gate to water. Also possible to launch or land on N side in Little River estuary.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to/from Powell River. Private parking for ferry employees, short-stay visitors. Possible roadside parking off site. Official boat launch to N, possibly at Lancaster Road off Wilkinson Road.

properties.title: Shingle Spit ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off. Good beach adjacent to ferry. See Shingle Spit.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service from Hornby Island to Gravelly Bay, Denman Island.

properties.title: Saltery Bay ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off. Most feasible launch from government dock 100 m to E of ferry dock. Walk out of terminal around end of compound fence.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service between Saltery Bay and Earl's Cove - n.b. latter terminal has no feasible launch nearby.

properties.title: Gravelly Bay ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off. Good beach adjacent to ferry. See Gravelly Bay.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service from Denman Island to Shingle Spit, Horny Island.

properties.title: Denman Island
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off. Rough beach adjacent to ferry adequate, if not ideal..
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service from Buckley Bay Vancouver Island.

properties.title: Buckley Bay ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off. Beach adjacent to ferry. See Buckley Bay.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service from Vancouver Island to Denman Island.

properties.title: Swartz Bay
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off. Portage to Barnacle Road launch.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to Gulf Islands, Tsawwassen. Various circle tours feasible.

properties.title: Penelakut Island ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to Chemainus and Thetis Island.

properties.title: Snug Cove ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off. Good launch opportunities nearby. Closest are floats but gravel beach at cove head also feasible. Wheels recommended.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to Horseshoe Bay. Sea to Sky Marine Trail map sign in sheter near ferry dock.

properties.title: Fulford Harbour ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off.  Two short but awkward rough trails to small pebble, mud beach adjacent to ferry ramp on N side.  Paddlers with unloaded boats may opt instead to launch from high float at government dock S of ferry ramp, but ladder use likely required.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to Swartz Bay, Vancouver Island.

properties.title: Descanso Bay ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off is possible but difficult.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to Nanaimo, Vancouver Island.

properties.title: Sturdies Bay ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off.  See nearby Sturdies Bay for launch details.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to other Gulf Islands, Tsawwassen, Swartz Bay. Other kayakers have recommended that one use the wharf/dock next to the ferry. Get out of your kayak on the dock and wheel it up to the BC Ferry dock then leave it there until you board the ferry. That is where you will be instructed to wait for loading anyway (in the bicycle loading area).

properties.title: Thetis Island ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to Chemainus and Penelakut Island.

properties.title: Vesuvius ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off. Rough launch beach nearby or government float. Also feasible to walk 400 m to sand beach to S instead.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to Crofton, Vancouver Island. No known long-term parking nearby.

properties.title: Departure Bay ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off. Closest launch is at Brechin Boat Ramp.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to Horseshoe Bay, West Vancouver.

properties.title: Horseshoe Bay ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off. Good beach adjacent to ferry terminal - see Horseshoe Bay. Wheels recommended.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to Departure Bay (Vancouver Island), Langdale and Snug Cove (Bowen Island).

properties.title: Lyall Harbour ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off. Launch feasible from adjacent floats.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to other Gulf Islands, Tsawwassen, Swartz Bay.

properties.title: Zacharias Bay Harbour Island
properties.landing_comments: Sand beach. SW aspect. Protected by island, reefs, rocks at both narrow bay entrances, subject to swell, turbulence. Could be tough getting out in big swell and west wind
properties.camp_comments: One cleared upland forest site, one beach site. No other facilities. Sheltered.
properties.other_comments: Harbour Island Recreation Res REC6626 with active status is half of island. Area 15 Ha.

properties.title: Burgoyne Bay Wharf
properties.landing_comments: Easy on cleared boat run through rough beach, mostly of cobble. Vehicle loading near water, short carry at all water levels.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: BC Parks designated, signed canoe, kayak launch. Vehicles must be parked after unloading in 2 large gravel parking lots approx. 150 m to NW. Take signed driveway to private industrial property, not adjacent roadway leading to government dock. Swimming. Birding. Extensive hiking trails. No posted parking restrictions. See: Burgoyne Bay Provincial Park

properties.title: Kingfisher Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy on clam bed beach of silt, small rocks in very protected cove. S aspect. Local signage asks paddlers to not use beach at low water to avoid trampling clams, damaging eel grass. 40 m unpaved path from vehicles is smooth, steep, has no stairs.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. Vehicle access from Beaver Point Road by Bridgman Road then Fraser Road. Roadside parking on grassy shoulders for about 10 - 15 vehicles. No posted parking restrictions. Capital Regional District shore access. Many small boats stored at beach top.

properties.title: Churchill Road
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected moderately low gradient beach that largely floods at high water. Clam beds of silt, pebble. SE aspect. Short smooth unpaved trail ends with wide stairs, handrails that has awkward 90 degree turn.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: From Lower Ganges Road take Churchill Road to end. Roadside day parking for about 20 vehicles. No overnight parking permitted.

properties.title: Baders Beach
properties.landing_comments: Extensive low gradient pebble, silt beach. Long carry at low water. Clams, oysters. NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: At end of Collins Road, branching off Rainbow Road. Parking for several vehicles. Water at year-round creek. Very short near-level carry from vehicles at high water.

properties.title: Crofton ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off. Concrete boat ramp or cobble beach N of ferry terminal. Please respect other users of  busy ramp. If congested, please use adjacent beach instead - possibly awkward at high water due to scattered boulders.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to Vesuvius, Salt Spring Island. Overnight parking nearby but congested.

properties.title: Village Bay ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off. Excellent launch adjacent to ferry terminal - see Village Bay Mayne Island.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to other Gulf Islands, Tsawwassen, Swartz Bay.

properties.title: Nanaimo Gabriola ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off is possible but difficult.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to Gabriola Island

properties.title: Sidney ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: WA State Ferries summer service to San Juan Islands, Anacortes, WA.

properties.title: Duke Point ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off. Nearest feasible launch involves 1 km portage to Jack Point launch. Wheels required. Terminal has steep approach road, path to large gate that is unlocked on request.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to Tsawwassen. Enables circle tours around Gulf Islands from Tsawwassen.

properties.title: Long Harbour ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off.  See nearby Welbury Bay launch for launch details. No launch at terminal itself.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to other Gulf Islands, Tsawwassen.

properties.title: Mill Bay ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to Brentwood Bay.

properties.title: Brentwood Bay ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to other Crofton, Vancouver Island.

properties.title: Chemainus ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to Thetis and Penelakut Islands.

properties.title: Jack Point
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient rock shelf with small sand, gravel areas. In Nanaimo River estuary. E aspect. Access tide dependent as estuary dries far. Critical tide height not yet determined. Observed, used at depths over 3.1 m. Likely feasible down to 2.0 m. At some water levels a beach approx 100 m to N offers easier landing. Connection is by a relatively smooth trail with minor stair, feasible with unloaded boats.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: To reach Duke Point Ferry Terminal from landing, head E approx 40 m on good trail until short stair- unload boat here - leads to paved parking lot (40 m, re-load boat), opposite main entry to Canadian Forest Products mill. No barrier to Duke Pt Highway (2019). Walk N 750 m on south bound bicycle lane to passenger terminal for tickets. Access to bicycle etc ramp N of building but requires wide gate to be unlocked - regular man-gate too narrow. Steep ramp leads to vehicle ramp, ferry deck. Wheels required. City of Nanaimo park, heavily used by walkers.

properties.title: Gowlland Point Beach
properties.landing_comments: 100 m long gravel pebble beach. Many drift logs. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping, no fires permitted.
properties.other_comments: At end of Gowlland Point Road. No overnight parking permitted but can park up the road. Access to beach via stairs with 90 degree turn.

properties.title: Blind Bay north
properties.landing_comments: Rocky beach 10% - 15% gradient in protected cove.
properties.camp_comments: None known. Grass above foreshore. Lightly forested above.
properties.other_comments: Attractive S aspect. View.

properties.title: Kye Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, shingle, cobble in protected bay. Low gradient, so long carry at low water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Playground, picnic tables. Although a community park, no toilet seen.
properties.other_comments: 476 Windslow Road, Comox, BC V9M 3T8 Off Kye Bay Road, Town of Comox Elks and Royal Purple Park. Gravel parking lots. Signage prohibits overnight parking..

properties.title: Union Bay south
properties.landing_comments: Low pebble beach of moderate gradient. Some cobble, Scattered boulders. Shellifish lease. E aspect. Little elevation change from parking lot.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Picnic tables, toilets, benches.
properties.other_comments: Rest area parking lot alongside Hwy 19A.

properties.title: Pat Leslie Memorial Boat Launch
properties.landing_comments: Concrete ramp in protected  harbour with adjacent gravel beach. Part of the adjacent commercial Ucluelet Campground.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted at ramp. Bench.
properties.other_comments: 115 Seaplane Base Road. District of Ucluelet Floating dock. Signage. No charge for day parking, space for 10 vehicles. No overnight parking. Portable toilet. From Peninsula Rd, turn left on Seaplane Base Rd and follow to end.

properties.title: Mahaffey Road
properties.landing_comments: Similar to nearby Mountain View Road but more open. Very short carry from vehicle.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Limited parking in lane without a turn area. No overnight parking. Comox Valley Regional District beach access.

properties.title: Denman Road
properties.landing_comments: Similar to Fillongley. Exposed low gradient pebble, coarse sand beach. Dries 300 m at low water. Recommended for mid to high tides only. Short walk from vehicles. Access road short, steep, soft needing 4WD vehicle. Mabel Road to N might be better access.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Road access from Denman Road, keeping straight heading E where that road becomes East Road. To reach Mabel Road take Swan Road, Beadnell Road, Dalziel Road then to end of Mabel Road. Limited parking without posted restrictions.

properties.title: Gray Road
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient, near-level rock shelves in protected bay. E aspect. Vessel traffic. Strong currents in nearby Gabriola Passage. Long carry at low water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Road access from South Road, Cooper Road then immediately to Gray Road. Park At Murray Road. Very limited roadside parking. Used by locals as small boat launch.

properties.title: Taylor Bay Road
properties.landing_comments: Easy on low gradient sand beach with flat rock shelves above. W aspect. Moderately protected except from W. NW winds also enter bay. Long carry at low water. Gravel path 20 m to shore.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilets at Gabriola Sands Provincial Park nearby.
properties.other_comments: End of Taylor Bay Road. Residences nearby. Limited parking at gravel turn area. Closer parking to Taylor Bay than via the Park.

properties.title: Orlebar Point
properties.landing_comments: Rock shelves. Exposed. 60 m of rocky foreshore. NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Picnic table, bench.
properties.other_comments: View. Road access from Berry Point Road. Small parking areas for 5 or 6 vehicles.

properties.title: Descanso Bay Road
properties.landing_comments: Easy on pebble beach in moderately protected cove. NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Bench.
