properties.other_comments: From Easthom Road turn onto Descanso Bay Road. Limited parking near end on gravel.

properties.title: Miners Bay
properties.landing_comments: Sand, gravel beach mainly floods at high water. N aspect. Strong currents at edge of bay. Trail to road end approx. 50 m with 1 short stair. Public wharf nearby.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Picnic tables, benches, gazebo. Flush toilets at library building have outside doors.
properties.other_comments: Miners Bay Community Park at end of Naylor Road off Village Bay Road. Most services nearby including pub, restaurant, groceries. Limited day parking. Wharf, floats managed by Capital Regional District as a Small Craft Harbour.

properties.title: Oyster Bay Mayne Island
properties.landing_comments: Small cove N aspect. Gravel beach, drift logs. Protected by rock reefs especially at low water, but entrance can close at low water so use only at mid-tide or higher. Very easy access from vehicle.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Beach access sign. From Georgina Point Road take Bayview Road then Oyster Bay Road. Prominent cable sign. Parking restrictions unknown. Residences nearby.

properties.title: Cotton Community Park
properties.landing_comments: Stairs to rock shelf. Currents.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Vault toilet. Benches, picnic tables.
properties.other_comments: Water likely available. View. Short walking trails. Gardens. Road access via Georgina Point Road, Cotton Road. Commemorates Fred, Bette Cotton. Day parking only.

properties.title: Maude Bay
properties.landing_comments: Protected cove. W aspect. Bedrock, boulder, mixed rock shore at high water. Pebble at low water. Short carry to shore from vehicle. Use dubious wooden ramp or carry boats down bank over awkward rocks in creek bed.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Beach access sign. At end of Cherry Tree Bay Road. No posted parking restrictions. Room for a few vehicles.

properties.title: Anson Road
properties.landing_comments: Protected pebble, cobble beach. Short carry from vehicle but steep stairs up bank.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Picnic table
properties.other_comments: Beach access sign for canoe, kayak launch on Horton Bay Road. Shared driveway gives vehicle access to shore. Parking back up hill on Horton Bay Road.

properties.title: Steep Cove
properties.landing_comments: Small shallow cove SE aspect near tip of St John Point. Steep sides make shore access, boat storage challenging. Low water landings likely rougher, with boulders. Exposed to SE.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: View. Wildlife viewing. Extensive, moderately level walking trails in attractive douglas fir, arbutus, garry oak forest. St John Point Regional Park Reserve, Capital Regional District regional conservation area. See: St John Point Regional Park.

properties.title: Horton Bay Head
properties.landing_comments: Mud, pebble beach close to road access. Might be impractical at low water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Park on Horton Bay Road.

properties.title: St John Point northeast
properties.landing_comments: Rock shelf
properties.camp_comments: Camping not permitted
properties.other_comments: View. Wildlife viewing. Extensive, moderately level walking trails in attractive douglas fir, arbutus, garry oak forest. St John Point Regional Park Reserve, Capital Regional District regional conservation area. See: St John Point Regional Park.

properties.title: Campbell Bay
properties.landing_comments: Steep shore access. Some rocks, sand, gravel, shell. Extensive low gradient beach.
properties.camp_comments: Natural semi-level upland. Public swim float.
properties.other_comments: Campbell Bay Road/Waugh Road runs behind beach. Private land posted nearby.

properties.title: Gallagher Bay
properties.landing_comments: Sand, pebble beach, low to  moderate gradient with occasional boulders. Beach mostly floods at high water, but few drift logs. Protected from S, E. W aspect. Short sloping grassy path to beach. Use at low water not recommended.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Follow Gallagher Bay Road to end. Limited parking, logs dragged onto roadsides reduce lane width substantially. No posted restrictions. Large cable sign. Adjacent residences.

properties.title: Reef Bay
properties.landing_comments: Shallow bay. SE aspect. Exposed at high water, protected by extensive rock reefs at low water. Drift logs. Level access from road.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Bayview Road. Access on short gravel lane. Parking for several vehicles with no posted restrictions.

properties.title: Piggott Bay
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient sand beach, drift logs. Long carry at low water. SE aspect. Short, level access from road end at high water. Collects algae at times.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: E end of Piggott Road off Gallagher Bay Road. Float off beach presumably for swimming.

properties.title: David Cove
properties.landing_comments: Concrete boat ramp in protected cove or adjacent sand, shell beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Waughs Road leads to Porter Road, Petrus Crescent. No parking on Petrus Crescent. Limited nearby roadside parking.

properties.title: Village Bay Community Park
properties.landing_comments: Concrete boat ramp or adjacent low gradient sand, gravel, mud beach in protected bay. NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Vault toilet. Picnic tables.
properties.other_comments: Road access from Callaghan Crescent. Parking with unknown restrictions. Trail to Dalton Road with 48 hr parking.

properties.title: Dinner Bay
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient sand, gravel beach in protected bay. NW aspect. Stair or bank access to beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Flush toilets.
properties.other_comments: Dinner Bay Community Park. Road access from Dinner Bay Road, Williams Place. Tap water stated to be non-potable. Playground, ball field, disc golf. Japanese garden. Day parking only permitted.

properties.title: Conconi Reef
properties.landing_comments: Protected sand beach among rock reefs. Drift logs. S aspect. Easy trail access.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Road, 75 m trail access from Navy Channel Road. Beach access sign. Parking for about 10 vehicles on road with no posted restrictions.

properties.title: St John Point north
properties.landing_comments: Gravel beach among bedrock shelves. E aspect. Protected from S, W, N.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not permitted.
properties.other_comments: View. Wildlife viewing. Extensive, moderately level walking trails in attractive douglas fir, arbutus, garry oak forest. St John Point Regional Park Reserve, Capital Regional District regional conservation area See: St John Point Regional Park.

properties.title: Kadonaga Bay
properties.landing_comments: Pebble beach at bay head. S aspect. Mostly floods to drift log barrier at high water. Pebble berm approx 3 m with sloped trail shore access.
properties.camp_comments: Open field behind beach. Well-used trail leads to Park entrance 350 m to N. Toilet at park entrance. Camping not permitted.
properties.other_comments: St John Point Regional Park Reserve, Capital Regional District. Natural dry woodlands nearby. Extensive walking trails. Parking at Park entrance.

properties.title: Haynes Park
properties.landing_comments: Protected sand beach SE aspect. Short trail to beach from street.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Benches, picnic tables.
properties.other_comments: Water at drinking fountain. View. At corner of Beresford Street, Beach Drive. Small .04 ha park of District of Oak Bay. Street parking. Also close to Marina parking lot. Toilets, cafe at Marina.

properties.title: Heriot Island
properties.landing_comments: Land on exposed W shore.
properties.camp_comments: Overlooked by residences.
properties.other_comments: Busy anchorage to S in Heriot Bay. Beach fires are banned all year round.

properties.title: Judges Row Qualicum Beach
properties.landing_comments: Cobble upper beach with sand below, low to moderate gradient. NW aspect. Near-level beach access form vehicle wit 4 shallow steps.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted
properties.other_comments: In residential area. No overnight parking. Room for about 10 - 20 vehicles. Similar beach for 4 km. Beach Front Park in town centre 700 m to SW has toilets, change rooms, picnic tables, benches. Another similar beach with day parking 150 m away. Kayak rentals nearby. Other facilities, provisions nearby.

properties.title: Seacrest Place
properties.landing_comments: Sand, pebble low gradient beach, cobble at high water. Scattered boulders. Exposed NE aspect. Long carry at low water. 9 wide concrete steps lead from street to beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Small picnic area.
properties.other_comments: Street parking for approx. 6 vehicles in residential area. Overnight parking not permitted.

properties.title: Thieves Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on very protected sand beach or adjacent small public concrete boat ramp.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilet, picnic tables, bench.
properties.other_comments: Thieves Bay Park operated by Pender Island Parks - Capital Regional District. Swings. Gravel parking lot or roadway shoulder. Access by Anchor Way, Schooner Way. No reason to enter private marina at road end, unless for view of conditions in Swanson Channel.

properties.title: Welcome Bay east
properties.landing_comments: Rough, steep-backed cove.  Beach of boulder, cobble with gravel, drift logs at top. Appears  to flood or nearly so at Springs. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No obvious overnight sites. Marginal for day use. Steep behind, so no easy retreat available. At Neaps might offer dry upper beach sites.
properties.other_comments: qRD OCP notes as un-managed recreation area. Does not appear usable at high water.

properties.title: Grandmas Bay Ruckle Park
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected gravel beach, moderate gradient. SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. See Ruckle instead.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Swimming. Hiking trails. Historic farm.

properties.title: Kelly Point
properties.landing_comments: Protected moderate gradient sand, pebble beach at estuary entrance.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted although feasible.
properties.other_comments: qathet Regional District Beach Access. Park on roadway. No posted restrictions. Turn S off Hwy 101 at Brew Bay Road. Follow to end, trending left at fork.

properties.title: Southview Emmonds Road
properties.landing_comments: Sand, shingle beach. Exposed S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Emmonds Road. Beach access point signed by qathet Regional District. Very short trail to beach. Limited parking at road end.

properties.title: Divers Rock
properties.landing_comments: Moderately steep, rough beach with narrow cleared walkway between boulders.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. No services except picnic table. Unofficial fire pit.
properties.other_comments: From Finn Bay Road, turn W on Mead Road, S on Norlund Road. Divers Rock Regional Park. qathet Regional District. Attractive, natural. Picnicking, kayaking. Established 2014.

properties.title: Nicholas Point northeast
properties.landing_comments: Easy on crushed shell tombolo beach at high water Land on either side. Scattered boulders.SW or NE aspects.  Another small clam bed beach of sand, small rocks, cobble, scattered boulders lies 225 m to NE.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Steep forest with deadfalls. Beach top tent sites feasible at Neaps. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Hyashi Cove
properties.land_tenure: Crown Foreshore Lease, Private upland, public foreshore
properties.landing_comments: Very protected small sand, shell beach behind marina floats. Likely floods at Springs. Rockier at low water, with angular stones. Concrete trailer boat ramp adjacent. Low float nearby.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: 675 m walking distance from ferry ramp to beach at Otter Bay Marina via paved private driveway to MacKinnon Road on smooth pavement. Wheels recommended. Full service marina with washrooms, showers, laundry, restaurant, accommodation. Fees may apply. Paved parking lot, nearby street parking used heavily by ferry travellers. Paddlecraft rentals, guiding, tours.

properties.title: Quathiaski Cove
properties.landing_comments: Concrete boat ramp or adjacent low gradient mixed beach in protected cove. At S side of ferry dock, creek estuary might offer access at high water.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping. Showers, flush toilets, laundry.
properties.other_comments: Water at tap. Feasible to wheel on and off ferry. Pay parking available daily ($3/day 2018) or monthly. Provisions, services, accommodation, pub, restaurants, nearby. Managed by Quadra Island Harbour Authority; Wireless internet; 1.5 ton winch; Pay phones; Fresh water; Pay parking. Beach fires are banned all year round.

properties.title: Es-hw Sme-nts Community Park
properties.landing_comments: Pebble, cobble beaches NW, NE aspects. Might have to land on west side of beach in low tide. Recommend taking wheels to bring kayak or canoe to beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Vault toilet. Bear-proof garbage bin.
properties.other_comments: Regional District of Nanaimo Community :ark opened Oct 2017. North end of Oak Leaf Drive. Day parking in gravel lot at road end. Overnight parking on the road not parking lot.

properties.title: Peter Cove south
properties.landing_comments: Easy on gravel, pebble beach in protected rocky cove.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Easy path to beach from Plumper Way. 2 vehicle parking space at Beach Access sign. Very limited local parking on road shoulders. Signage at both ends of access trail. Beach overlooked by residences.

properties.title: Long Bay South Thormanby
properties.landing_comments: Moderate gradient beach of mixed angular small rocks at head of long, steep-walled cove. Good protection except from SE. Many drift logs. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Two sites - at centre bay on level rock platform or table - on grassy shelf near Farm Bay trail end in NE corner - each for 2-3 tents. Upland fire rings. Additional tent sites with minor brushing, approx 150 m up trail leading to Farm Bay. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Attractive, Trail leads inland, connecting to beaver pond, Farm Bay & Park trail network. Water at small seasonal stream or walk 7 min. to pond. Anchorage. Bay tends to collect marine debris. Also known as Table Bay. See Simson Provincial Park.

properties.title: Craddock Drive
properties.landing_comments: Pebble beach under cliffs. Currents.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted
properties.other_comments: View, attractive. Trail from road end on Craddock Drive to beach has 34 steps to beach.

properties.title: Drummond Bay
properties.landing_comments: 200 m long gravel, pebble beach. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: View. Wildlife viewing. Walking trail to Higgs Road with10 step stairway with bend in middle. Roadside parking for approx.10 vehicles but signed as no overnight parking.

properties.title: Medicine Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy on moderate to low gradient pebble, gravel, mud beach. Protected SE aspect at bay head. Level access from road.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Parking for about 6 vehicles with no posted restrictions by beach at end of Schooner Way (S segment). Wildlife sanctuary in adjacent marsh behind gates, fence. Hiking trail up bluffs.

properties.title: Egmont Point Recreation Site
properties.landing_comments: Easy on moderate gradient mixed, gravel, scattered boulder, cobble, pebble beach in small bay. Springs flood beach to tree line. Reasonable carry at low water.  Exposed to W, NW winds. Some vessel traffic. Larger beaches in bays to E lie outside area.
properties.camp_comments: On gravel upper beach at neaps only. Small sites in upland can be brushed. Deadfall logs abound.
properties.other_comments: Water at Killam Bay. View. Large site 124 Ha.

properties.title: Manley Creek
properties.landing_comments: Easy on firm low gradient beach. NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilet at Ratcliffe Road trailhead.
properties.other_comments: From Trans-Canada Highway go E onto Hutchinson Road then N on Ratcliffe Road. Picnic tables, view. Trails. Parking at road. Trail access, steep in places, from Aros Road, Granfield Way 500 m. Cowichan Regional District Park. 2.09 ha

properties.title: South Winchelsea Island
properties.landing_comments: Dock at NW side or rough beaches or rock shelves on NE.
properties.camp_comments: Request by owners for no camping, no fires. Sign posted near dock.
properties.other_comments: Day use welcomed. Pit toilet. Cabin has sometimes been rented for vacation use.

properties.title: Bligh Islet south cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy on pebble and clamshell low gradient beach either from small coves on SW or NE sides. Beach floods above 2.5m.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping.
properties.other_comments: Other nearby beaches might also offer easy low tide day use access.

properties.title: Kirby Point north
properties.landing_comments: Beach of mud, rock, boulders. NE aspect. Gradient: 5 - 15%. Easy on sand at high water. Poor access at low water when better landing is at Kirby Point southwest.  Unload boats on water. Launch loaded boats at mid-high tide level. Rock hazards, long reef at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Beautiful flat cleared forest between two beaches. Open Huu-ay-aht Treaty Settlement Land. This site appears to be fairly heavily used by the First Nation. Permit required. See: https://huuayaht.org/camping-permit-application. Two cabins, cook shelter, 2 toilets,
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Huu-at-aht cemetery located between the two beaches.At one time served as Huu-ay-aht youth camp.

properties.title: Edward King Island northeast
properties.landing_comments: Boulder, bedrock, sand beach of 5 - 15 % slope, N aspect. Access from N or S but channel dries at low water, when best approach is from NW. Boat run cleared through bigger rocks. Landing on SE has longer carry over cobbles.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on beach at most tides. Additional sites in.open, old growth forest.
properties.other_comments: CMTs. Blow hole accessible at low water. Rock ledge to Haines Island dries at low water. Two sources of water reported on SE shore of same island.

properties.title: Grappler Inlet
properties.landing_comments: Boat trailer ramp.  Kayak launch fee $2.50 (2016). Launch small craft next to ramp at no charge (2014).
properties.camp_comments: See adjacent site at Centennial Park.
properties.other_comments: Parking $3.00 day.

properties.title: Kontiki
properties.landing_comments: Protected gravel beach W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: District of Sechelt beach access park with easy car top launch 10 m from parking lot. Bench. Unrestricted parking at E end of Konitki Rd.

properties.title: Willow Point Sechelt
properties.landing_comments: Easy at sand spit. Overall W aspect but beaches of various aspects.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. No fires.
properties.other_comments: Launch at W end of Burnett Road off Sechelt Inlet Road. View. 10 m walk to beach. Picnic tables. Limited parking. Some dinghies parked. Swimming. District of Sechelt beach access park.

properties.title: Newton Cove north
properties.landing_comments: E side of bay with S aspect. Protected beach of grit, gravel, small rocks at low water, cobble band at high water.
properties.camp_comments: Upper beach sites under trees appear to be dry at most water levels. Small upland sites in level forest subject to brushing. Access from beach awkward due to deadfall, drift logs that could be cut. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Protected location with good potential in popular paddling area.

properties.title: St Pauls Dome
properties.landing_comments: W aspect sand, silt beach. Protected SE through SW. Surf likely in NW conditions. Likely to flood at Springs. Rock outcrops along beach at some water levels.
properties.camp_comments: Camp at Neaps on dead beach grass, dry weed or sand. Dense vegetation at forest margin with no obvious clearings. Small sites among drift logs.
properties.other_comments: Shaded at S end of beach. Trees for hanging food.

properties.title: Garden Point east
properties.landing_comments: Very low gradient sand, grit creek delta beach with some gravel, areas of rocks to 15 cm near creek mouth. Long carry at low water. N asepct. Good protection from W.
properties.camp_comments: Upland sites in small clearings. 3-4 beach sites E of creek. E site quieter so serves as overflow for main site at base of tombolo to W of creek. Gloomy N aspect.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round Brodick Creek alongside site. Attractive. E end of Esperanza Inlet funnels winds, while W Inlet has lower winds. This site is located within the Nuchatlaht Nation's Aboriginal Title Lands. See map of the Title area here. Look up term of Aboriginal Title lands in our glossary.

properties.title: Espinosa Inlet
properties.landing_comments: Beach of rough cobble W aspect. Somewhat exposed to winds entering from Esperanza Inlet. Beach appears to be dry at most normal water levels.
properties.camp_comments: Two or more level areas at top of beach on cobble. Dense vegetation at forest margin. Potential for upland sites with some brushing.
properties.other_comments: Old logging road may enter here, but not seen. Not as good as nearby Espinosa Inlet north.

properties.title: Cusheon Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy  in sheltered cove on beach of pebble, shell. Likely rougher at low water.Rock shelfs at cove entrance.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Extensive hiking trails connect with Ruckle trails. View, Attractive. Popular picinic site. Ruckle Provincial Park. No close vehicle access.

properties.title: Commerell Point
properties.landing_comments: Gravel, sand beach. N aspect. Easier landing than Paddler's Beach located 0.5 NM to N due to more protection from W, NW.
properties.camp_comments: Beach camping. Possible upland sites in forest. Camping fees apply 1 May to 30 September. May pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites. Fee $5.00 per person per night (2018) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System.
properties.other_comments: See: Raft Cove Provincial Park..

properties.title: Lawn Point Islet
properties.landing_comments: All-weather landing on sand beach in protected cove between islet, main Vancouver Island shore. ENE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: NE sand beach has several large rocks for wind shelter. Sand berm across centre has protective log. No upland forest sites found. Reported location is N50D 20.2758M,W12D 59.3622M
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Islet approx 500 x 100 m. Provincial Park excludes these islets.

properties.title: Ewin Inlet Head
properties.landing_comments: Sheltered low gradient shell, pebble, gravel beach in long bay. Scattered boulders. E aspect. 25 m N of creek mouth on W shore near bay head.
properties.camp_comments: Natural site with no development. 2 sheltered upland tent sites in open area with ferns, close to beach. 3 further sites possible with minor brushing, levelling. Hammock opportunities. Gloomy, damp.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round creek immediately to S, flowing from lake to WNW. Anchorage. See: Bligh Island Marine Provincial Park.

properties.title: Sandy Hook
properties.landing_comments: Sand, gravel low gradient beach at creek mouth. Paved ramp for small boats. Many dinghies stored on approach. N aspect, open to N, W. Optional trail to beach area has tight corners, awkward steps.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Portable toilet. Playground. Picnic area. No fires.
properties.other_comments: Sandy Hook Park at 6009 Ark Rd off Coracle Drive, Sandy Hook Road. 90 m walk to beach from parking lot for about 12 vehicles. Overnight parking discouraged. District of Sechelt beach access park. Swimming.

properties.title: Songhees Point
properties.landing_comments: Protected gravel, sand beach. Short 60 m carry on paved path. Vessel, aircraft traffic.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Limited day parking nearby. Popular public walkway. Launch site for Victoria Waterway Loop Trail, a 8.4 NM paddling route with a 950 m portage. Loop is in 4 sections with multiple launch points. May be completed in a day. See: Loop.

properties.title: Harbour Way
properties.landing_comments: Small beach of gravel, sand or on adjacent gravel trailer boat ramp.
properties.camp_comments: No camping
properties.other_comments: Approach by road via Gale Ave South, Harbour Way. Gated 200 m back from beach. Closed at night. Open 8:30 am to 8:00 pm only. Parking for about 12 Vehicles without trailers near ramp. District of Sechelt beach access park. Do not trespass onto fenced-off leased private /community marina.

properties.title: Lambs Brook
properties.landing_comments: Easy in small cove on low gradient beach of gravel, pebble, sand. Extensive at low water. W aspect. Protected except from W.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. No overnight parking. Portable toilet. Garbage bin.
properties.other_comments: 7500 block Sechelt Inlet Road. Lane leads to within 50 m of beach at head of Lamb Bay. Gravel parking lot for approx 10 vehicles. Restricted to day parking only. Heavy use. District of Sechelt beach access park.

properties.title: Seal Bay
properties.landing_comments: Cobble beach, some gravel, drift logs E aspect. Exposed.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Bates Beach Oceanfront Resort private campground lies 1 nm N.
properties.other_comments: Attractive on steep forest slope. Comox Valley Regional District nature park. Extensive forested walking, multi-use trails, some steep with stairs. Parking next to Bates Road access. Pit toilets near beach. Viewing benches.

properties.title: Eagle Harbour
properties.landing_comments: Easy on all tide protected sand beach in fully protected harbour. S aspect.  Easy road access. Smaller beach access near creek approx 100 m ESE of main beach preferred by some paddlers.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilets appear to be open only in summer. 2 picnic tables, bench. Outdoor shower.
properties.other_comments: Water. Sea water usually has higher E coli levels than at other local beaches so showering advised. Parking for 20 cars nearby. No posted restrictions. Avoid use of yacht club private parking.

properties.title: Tribune Bay
properties.landing_comments: Expansive low gradient beach of fine sand. SE aspect. Access from vehicle via 200 m gravel path.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilets. Benches. Adjacent private campsite acquired by BC Parks will be restored, reconfigured approx. 2024-25.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Large parking lot, closed at night. Anchorage for calm weather use.

properties.title: Gravelly Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected gravel beach. Moderate gradient. N aspect. At N side of disused boat ramp.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. BC Ferries toilets appear to be under repair (2019).
properties.other_comments: Close to ferry terminus. Parking nearby on roadsides.

properties.title: Whaling Station Bay
properties.landing_comments: Protected sand beach. Easy vehicle access.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilet at Carling Road.
properties.other_comments: Attractive, view. Easy vehicle access from ends of short roads off Anderson Drive e.g. Carling Road, Moya Road.

properties.title: Sandpiper Beach
properties.landing_comments: Sand beach SE aspect. Trail from parking lot to beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Benches. Toilet. Large mown grass area.
properties.other_comments: View. Sandpiper Beach Community Park. Parking lot for 12 vehicles. No overnight parking permitted.

properties.title: Welcome Beach Sunshine Coast
properties.landing_comments: Low to medium gradient [2-5%]. Pebble, cobble, sand beach. SW aspect. Drift logs at upper beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Launch along Merry Island Esplanade 200 m, runs along beach with residences on upland side only. Very limited parking for 2 vehicles by residences on other side of entry lane. Popular beach.

properties.title: Ucluelet Campground
properties.landing_comments: Protected adjacent lagoon/basin or Pat Leslie Memorial Boat Launch approx 200 m distant..
properties.camp_comments: Mix of treed tent and more cramped RV sites. Full facilities. Fees charged. Water, electric, sewer available. Showers, flush toilets. Phone 250-726-4355 Email camp@uclueletcampground.com http://www.uclueletcampground.com/
properties.other_comments: 260 Seaplane Base Rd, Close to boat launch.

properties.title: Koprino Harbour
properties.landing_comments: Easy on gravel ramp in protected cove. Close access for vehicles. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping. Spencer Cove nearby.
properties.other_comments: On Koprino Road. Topo map names cove as Robson Cove. Park on shoulder of adjacent spur road. Nearby float to S is private. Active log dump 200 m to S.

properties.title: Darrell Bay
properties.landing_comments: Rough beach in moderately protected bay. Large wharf, vehicle dock adjacent. Vehicles may approach close to beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Emergency ferry dock maintained in the event of Highway 99 closure, (as for dock at Porteau Cove), formerly used for Woodfibre ferry when mill was operational.

properties.title: Numas Islands Central Cove
properties.landing_comments: W facing rocky cove between 2 small central islands which join at low water, protected from NW by larger W island across channel. Appears suited to all water levels. Coarse gravel, scattered boulders, drift logs. Several other coves log-choked.
properties.camp_comments: No tent camping found. Poor upland access, rocky uneven terrain, dense brush.
properties.other_comments: Bird colonies. Avoid visits in Spring nesting season. Wildlife viewing. Evidence of previous logging or clearing.

properties.title: Nuyumbalees
properties.landing_comments: Long smooth gravel beach. Occasional boulders. W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: View. 34 Weway Rd, Quathiaski Cove, BC V0P 1N0. Cultural Centre, museum, totems in centre of Cape Mudge Village. Artifacts etc valued by the Kwakwaka’wakw people. Open May - Sept. Admission fee. Beach fires are banned all year round.

properties.title: Red Granite Road
properties.landing_comments: Easy on 75 m long smooth gravel, pebble beach exposed to SE. Drift logs. Short access to/from vehicles.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. No fires.
properties.other_comments: Seattle Yacht Club outstation, cottages close by. Parking unknown.

properties.title: Kilmorley Road
properties.landing_comments: Exposed beach moderate to low gradient. NE aspect. Small boulders, large cobble, other smaller broken rocks. Some sand at top. Access from road approx 5 m on short trail down low bank. Carrying boats across beach at low water could be awkward.  Use at high water suggested.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Comox Valley Regional District beach access recommended for launching small car-top boats. At end of Kilmorley Road off Little River Road. Last part of road is gravel. Parking with no posted restrictions for about 6 vehicles. Site has fenced RV park om one side, private residence on other.

properties.title: Bill Mee Park
properties.landing_comments: Protected concrete boat ramp with rip-rap breakwater on both sides or adjacent pebble beach. NNE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Picnic tables. Toilet
properties.other_comments: 6020 East Road. By road take East Road to Sole Road to its end. Gate locked at night. Ample parking, including for trailers but no overnight parking permitted. Launch fee for cartop boats $5 (2019). Wildlife viewing. Operated by Comox Valley Regional District under provincial licence, assisted by Denman Island Residents Association. Former gravel pit.

properties.title: Phipps Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy on beach of coarse sand, pebble, small cobble, some bedrock shelves. W aspect. Use either side of protecting disused jetty, Suited to all water levels. Easy shore access from vehicle.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Where Shingle Spit Road becomes Central Road turn W on Central Road to end in 200 m. Limited day parking.

properties.title: Hinton Road
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient beach mostly commercial oyster lease. Upper beach of pebbles, shell. 300 m of flats at low water so recommended only at high water. Short access from vehicle.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Hinton Road of Lacon Road. View. Limited parking. No overnight parking permitted.

properties.title: Mountain View Road
properties.landing_comments: Exposed low gradient cobble beach. Sand at low water. NE aspect. Level shore access from vehicle. Very short carry.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Limited parking in unpaved lane with turn area. No posted restrictions. In residential area. By road take Miracle Beach Drive to Seaview Road, Elma Bay Place. View. Swimming, wildlife viewing. Comox Valley Regional District official beach access. Beach walk to Miracle Beach Park.

properties.title: Sanborn Road
properties.landing_comments: Exposed cobble beach. E aspect. Grassy path gives easy shore access from vehicle.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Bench.
properties.other_comments: Comox Valley Regional District official beach access. Views, Wildlife viewing. Roadside parking. According to CVRD it is located just S of the Harby access, between Arran Road and Montrose Drive.

properties.title: Fillongley
properties.landing_comments: Gravel, sand, shingle beach. Open E aspect. Mostly low gradient, dries far at low water. Easy shore access from vehicles but 300 m carry at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Small sites adjacent to shore suited to vehicle access, all reservable. Vault toilets, picnic tables, fire rings.
properties.other_comments: Water at tap 50 m from campground. Parking. Extensive hiking trails. Parking lot does not permit overnight parking. See: Fillongley Provincial Park.

properties.title: Deep Bay Drive
properties.landing_comments: Pebble, cobble, sand beaches on both Inner or outer shores of spit. Low gradient exposed to NE on outer spit. Inside spit beach moderate gradient with protected shore of cobble, pebble. Access down grass bank.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Parking at roadside on grass or gravel. Overnight parking unknown. Public beach access managed by Regional District of Nanaimo. Another possible launch site 600 m to SE on Deep Bay Drive.

properties.title: Stories Beach
properties.landing_comments: Broad sand, pebble beach. E aspect. Moderate gradient.
properties.camp_comments: No campfires permitted.
properties.other_comments: Parking access from Highway 19A.

properties.title: Grassy Point Hornby Island
properties.landing_comments: Moderately steep crescent-shaped gravel beach between bands of bedrock. N aspect. Semi-protected. Short, easy shore access from vehicles.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Road access from Central Road, Carmichael Road, Harwood Road, Gunpowder Trail. Grassy Point Community Park. No facilities except picnic table, bench also toilet (summer only). Overnight parking not permitted. Accommodates about 10 vehicles.

properties.title: Bradsdadsland
properties.landing_comments: See nearby Phipps Point but low water use likely impractical due to low gradient rocky foreshore.
properties.camp_comments: RV & tent sites, some with electricity. Flush and pit toilets, showers, laundry. Playground, store. Family oriented. Reservations strongly recommended Ph (250) 335-0757. Email bradsdadsland@telus.net
properties.other_comments: 2105 Shingle Spit Road Hornby Island BC V0R 1Z0. 350 m waterfront.

properties.title: Sunset Boulevard
properties.landing_comments: Protected pebble beach at head of long bay. NW aspect. Easy level access from vehicle. Moderately low beach gradient with soft sand in some parts makes use easier at mid to high water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Picnic table.
properties.other_comments: By road, take East Point Road, turn NE on Sunset Boulevard. Residences nearby. Parking.

properties.title: Veruna Bay
properties.landing_comments: Protected sand beach. Gravel at low water. W aspect. Approx 100 m carry from vehicle on lane built for cable terminus access.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: East Point Road to Winter Cove Road then Church Bay Road to end. Beach access sign at turnaround. Parking for several vehicles.

properties.title: Heriot Bay Inn
properties.landing_comments: Protected small mixed stone beach or adjacent floats.
properties.camp_comments: Tent, RV sites some leased long term. In attractive grassed grounds of Inn with mature trees on bank overlooking harbour. Flush toilets, showers, laundry. picnic tables, fire pits.
properties.other_comments: Water at tap. View. Historic Heriot Bay Inn, pub, restaurant. Marina, fuel, public dock. Parking. Ferry terminal to Cortes Island nearby. For details, see Heriot Bay Inn. Beach fires are banned all year round.

properties.title: Boat Passage Trail
properties.landing_comments: Protected cobble, pebble mixed beach. SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilets along trail. Picnic tables near boat ramp.
properties.other_comments: View. Attractive. Hiking trail to Boat Passage, park entrance.

properties.title: Welcome Beach Pender Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy on pebble beach. E aspect. Beach will not completely flood on most tides.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: View, attractive. Park on road shoulder. Trail to/from Clam Bay Road 220 m. 10 stairs to beach. Generally secluded - few residences.

properties.title: Joe Walker Park
properties.landing_comments: Partly cleared boat run through low to moderate gradient beach of large cobble, scattered boulders.  Several steps to beach from trail. Alternate longer step-free gravel trail from S end of park.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Shelter with cooking oven, BBQ. Vault toilet. 4 picnic tables.
properties.other_comments: On Highway 19A. Walking trails. Comox Valley Regional District park. Parking for 20 vehicles. No overnight parking permitted.

properties.title: Reginald Drive
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient rock shelf beach suited to high water use only.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Trail leads to beach from road end cul de sac. No overnight parking permitted.

properties.title: Millard Road
properties.landing_comments: Moderate gradient shell, pebble, cobble beach at small point. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Millard Road descends steeply off Lacon Road. Very limited day parking for approx 3 vehicles.

properties.title: Breton Road
properties.landing_comments: Small rocky cove 20 m wide. S aspect. Drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: View. From Village Bay Road, turn S on Valdez Road then turn S on Breton Road to end. Parking on gravel or at roadside. Beach fires are banned all year round.

properties.title: Verdier Point
properties.landing_comments: Small gravel, bedrock beaches  Mostly flooded at very high tides.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted, presumably Rocky point with grass meadow. Fire pit upland in centre of site. Chairs.
properties.other_comments: On Malahat Nation Reserve No 11. Posted signs ask users to keep area clean. Public recreational use seems to be acknowledged. Evidence of some local use.

properties.title: Michigan Beach west
properties.landing_comments: Small sand beach S aspect E of Pachena Point, W of Michigan Beach,  Some shelter in rough conditions. . Beach mostly floods at high water but not completely. Favour N end staying 50 - 75 m from large rock shelf on starboard. SW end of beach is rock strewn. See image for route.
properties.camp_comments: Emergency pullout site. No known camping. Camping not permitted by Parks Canada nor are planned landings.
properties.other_comments: Not on West Coast (hiking) Trail. Landing or camping on the West Coast Trail is not permitted and could result in fines, except in emergency situations.

properties.title: Brickyard Beach Gabriola Island
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient gravel broken brick beach, W aspect. Bedrock shelves, reefs. Dries far at low water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Grassed picnic area. 2 picnic tables. No fires.
properties.other_comments: On South Road at junction with Ferne Road. Islands Trust administered community park. Large gravel parking lot adjacent to shore. At N entrance to False Narrows.

properties.title: Keeha Bay Islets
properties.landing_comments: Sand beach. E aspect. Easy, sheltered at mid to high water. Difficult at low water with  wave action due to boulders. See image for suggested route. Beach with W aspect appears to be more rocky.
properties.camp_comments: Not an established Parks Canada site. Camping occasionally occurs on exposed sand tombolo connecting islets. Suited to settled weather only. Camping fees apply.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View.

properties.title: Helby Island
properties.landing_comments: Directly W of northernmost point of island, All tide sand beach of moderate gradient in generally rock shelf shore. W or NW asoect. Land in front of cabin, huu au aht signage. Low water recommended for approach. Reefs offer protection. Another beach to E closer to the N point offers similar but rougher landing.
properties.camp_comments: Many upland tent sites, some beach sites at Neaps. Toilet reported but not seen. Permit required for overnight use. See: Camping Permit.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at small seasonal streams to W. Small cabin visible. Huu-ay-aht Treaty Settlement Land.

properties.title: Wishart Island east
properties.landing_comments: Protected low gradient clam bed beach of sand, mixed rocks, scattered boulders. SE aspect. Accessible also from N but not favoured.
properties.camp_comments: 3-4 lumpy tent sites on long grass at forest margin above beach. Likely usable with minor levelling. Upland accessible with brushing for potential additional tent, hammock sites.
properties.other_comments: Anchorage. Wishart Island reported to have a R Washburne cabin - location, condition unknown. See Mahpahkum-Ahkwuna/Deserters-Walker Conservancy.

properties.title: Lasqueti Ecological Reserve
properties.landing_comments: South-facing grassy point offers beaches mainly of small rounded boulders at low water, pebble at high water with NE, SW aspects. Bedrock outcrops. More drift logs on NE aspect beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Non-extractive recreational use permitted. Extensive open grass areas. Regrettable evidence of campfire use.
properties.other_comments: Attractive, view. Wildlife viewing.

properties.title: Uncle Johns Cabin
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient protected clam bed beach with scattered boulders. Boat run at mid water levels avoids some boulders. Up to 200 m carry on firm mud at low water. High water approach better - only short carry through a few bushes to cabin.
properties.camp_comments: Cabin derelict, scheduled to be demolished 2013, but still standing in 2024. Currently no clearings in salal (2024). Some brushing possibly required to reach cabin from beach due to berry bush growth but access achieved easily 2024. Some space for tents near cabin if brushed. 3 additional tent sites on gravel beach top at Neaps, but might flood at Springs.
properties.other_comments: No water source seen but likely present. See Mahpahkum-Ahkwuna/Deserters-Walker Conservancy.

properties.title: Spencer Cove WFP Campground
properties.landing_comments: Protected cove. Mixed gravel, mud beach. Ramp reported for small boats. High water preferred for launch, landing, maybe because of mud. W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Level grass clearings. Vehicle accessible sites including RVs. Picnic tables. Fire pits. User maintained. Updated July 2025 Two outhouses, both in need of repair - door hinge missing, toilet seats broken, overfull pits - and filthy.
properties.other_comments: Koprino Rd, Quatsino. About an hour’s drive from Holberg on active logging roads. WFP is using private radio channels so even having a mobile radio doesn’t help with road safety. Small dock reported but not confirmed. Anchorage. Vehicle access, ramp means heavy summer use by fishers. Parking unknown if not camping at site.

properties.title: Fair Harbour Marina and Campground
properties.landing_comments: See Fair Harbour (launch) site. Concrete or gravel boat ramps near dock, fuel float 300 m to W. Rougher landings directly at campground, easier at high water.
properties.camp_comments: Busy developed vehicle-accessible campground, near to inlet head, with feasible water transport access. Fire rings, picnic tables. Pit toilets. Other services 250 m to W at store. Reservable. See fairharbourbc.com for details.
properties.other_comments: Services in Fair Harbour include: campground, rental cabins, store, washrooms, showers, laundry, fuel dock, potable water, propane, paid supervised parking with video surveillance, community free parking area. Campsites range from $20 - $25/night. Daily, weekly and monthly parking rates. Water at tap. Wifi/phone available near store. Private parking lot by store provides some vehicle protection. Article on Water Taxis. Visit Fair Harbour campground website..Visit Fair Harbour campground website.

properties.title: Simoom Sound Head
properties.landing_comments: Clam bed beach of angular cobble, some boulders. Smooth rock shelves at sides.
properties.camp_comments: Grass at forest margin. Other grass sites damp. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Portage to Shawl Bay takes about 1 hr.

properties.title: Tzartus Tombolo
properties.landing_comments: Rocky beaches. Gravel tombolo. Aquaculture immediately to N.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping. Perhaps some possible at Neaps.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Smugglers Cove Victoria
properties.landing_comments: Nearly circular cove protects beach of gravel, pebble, some sand. Moderate to steep gradient. Easy access from road.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Enter from Tudor Avenue, McAnally Road. Limited parking. Charted name seems to Maynard Cove, but not listed as official name. Municipality of Saanich. Shown as kayak launch on some maps. Very limited parking.

properties.title: Grilse Lane
properties.landing_comments: Small protected gravel beach next to marina. Beach access is via short set of stairs beside marina office and easy access from paved parking lot. Beach likely floods at Springs.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Adjacent to Anglers Anchorage Marina 905 Grilse Lane Brentwood Bay V8M 1B5. Parking is $5 for the day with payment at the marina office.

properties.title: Glencoe Cove
properties.landing_comments: Sand, gravel, pebble beach in rocky cove. S aspect. Apprx. 40 steps to upland.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Bench.
properties.other_comments: Two coves face N, S. Trails, steps to beaches from Gordon Point Drive, (N cove) or Paul's Terrace, Shore Way (S cove). Limited day parking. Glencoe Cove – Kwatsech Park, 3.6 ha. District of Saanich. See Glencoe Cove map

properties.title: Piers Island
properties.landing_comments: Gravel, sand beach. NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Beach fronts onto a park with picnic table, shelter, toilets, but use of land above high tide line formally restricted to island residents only. A walk on ferry from Sidney is available.

properties.title: Sidney Island Spit
properties.landing_comments: Sand beach. W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping on spit. See nearby site on Sidney Island.
properties.other_comments: Temporary winter closures for hunting, exotic deer cull. Hiking trails. Birding but no boating permitted at lagoon. See Sidney Spit

properties.title: Cormorant Point
properties.landing_comments: Sand, gravel beach. NE aspect. Likely soft mud at low water. Mixed rocks at mid water levels.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Balmacarra Road has official District of Saanich beach access approx 300 m to SE along shore of Margaret Bay. Long metal stairs.

properties.title: Mount Dick west
properties.landing_comments: Moderately steep gravel, pebble beach. S aspect. Sheltered from NW.
properties.camp_comments: Steeply sloping upland accessible but offers few or no level tenting areas. Upper beach rough, with drift logs.
properties.other_comments: Attractive lunch stop. See South Texada Island Provincial Park

properties.title: Napier Waterfall
properties.landing_comments: Rock shelf or low gradient gravel, cobble beach depending on water level. Some boulders. SW aspect. Judged difficult in high winds.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping.
properties.other_comments: Year round creek falls into tidepool at beach top. Possible bathing site. Reliable year-round water source. Walk-in cave repoerted 50 m N. See South Texada Island Provincial Park

properties.title: Bamfield East Dock
properties.landing_comments: High sided dock in protected inlet.. Vessel traffic
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Park up Frigate Rd 140 m distant.

properties.title: Mount Shepherd
properties.landing_comments: Easy on small cobble, gravel beach SE aspect. Alternate gravel beach around headland has W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Large site in open forest, large grassed clearings. Access from S up somewhat steep grassed slopes. Access easier from W.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Views. Remains of cabins or homestead. Possible seasonal creek. Seep in fissure near SE landing has year-round water in small volume. See South Texada Island Provincial Park.

properties.title: Turnour Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on moderate gradient gravel beach with boulders, smaller rocks on lower beach. Located in big bay, SW aspect. Alternative landings on steep banks at inactive log dump to S at Air Point or to W on E bank of bay at old road spur.
properties.camp_comments: Opening gives easy access to upland open forest, with some clear level areas. Additional sites at road end of inactive log dump located on E bank of bay. Minor brushing might be needed. Old vehicles, some debris.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round stream entering bay may be located from logging road bridge upstream approx 200 m. Flowing during mid-July 2023 drought. Log dump to S. Logged behind.

properties.title: Big Bay Stuart Island
properties.landing_comments: Dock float or rough beach
properties.camp_comments: Some paddlers arrange short-term camping on sloping lawn behind store near community centre.
properties.other_comments: Useful staging for Yuculta group of rapids. Store has food, alcohol, flush toilet with shower, laundry facilties. Provisions, pub, restaurant.

properties.title: Reid Bay
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient clam bed rocky beach with mostly angular cobble surface rock in large bay.  E aspect. Protected from most winds. Long carry at low water can be avoided by landing on N shore.
properties.camp_comments: A few forest tent sites, subject to brushing. Hammock opportunities. A couple of sites on beach-top grass edge. Delta of creek likely to be damp in wet weather.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Water at seasonal stream with flow during mid-July 2023 drought.

properties.title: Moorecroft Regional Park
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient beaches in 2 very protected coves that dry at low water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilets near parking. Tables.
properties.other_comments: Take Northwest Bay Road to Stewart Road, follow Stewart Road to end. Gate closed at night. Parking lot distant from shore. Attractive, view. Walking trails, nature viewing, picnicking, swimming, scuba diving. 34 ha Regional District of Nanaimo park. See: Moorecroft Regional Park.

properties.title: East Trail Island 2
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected pebble, small rock beach behind breakwater, dock, float.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Roadway descends to beach through steep banks.
properties.other_comments: Roadway ends at dock. Used by island residents for moving supplies by ATC. Mooring at dock for small boats to about 8 m. Garage building on property.

properties.title: Conville Bay
properties.landing_comments: Protected narrow cove at bay head with SE aspect has beach of angular pebble, rubble, cobble, boulders. Mud at low water. Visible boat run.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping but might be possible with brushing.
properties.other_comments: Some industrial debris visible. Aquaculture licence in outer bay. Beach fires are banned all year round.

properties.title: Conville Point south
properties.landing_comments: Protected cove with S aspect has beach of angular pebble, rubble, cobble. Mud at low water.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping but might be possible on open grassy areas or with minor brushing. Beach fires are banned all year round.
properties.other_comments: Aquaculture licence in outer bay.

properties.title: Tsusiat Landing
properties.landing_comments: A huge rock blocks SW swell. Huge waves may enter this bay 20-50 m E of rock, but keeping rock 10-20 m to port avoid them. Rock connects to shore at low water by a rock shelf.  High water sand landing becomes boulder strewn rock shelf at low water, so plan for tides above 1.5 m, ideally 2.0 m.
properties.camp_comments: Not an established Parks Canada site but occasionally used as campsite. Tsusiat Falls site lies 850 m NW. Both have similar sand beaches. Camping fees charged.
properties.other_comments: Water at falls 730 m to NW. Landing or camping on the West Coast Trail is not permitted and could result in fines, except in emergency situations.

properties.title: Boat Nook
properties.landing_comments: Public access trail has rough bedrock shelf landing. Beach nearby to E of gravel, sand.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Official beach access. Steps with signage lead to, from road.

properties.title: Arbutus Cove
properties.landing_comments: Cove SE aspect. Gravel at high water with limited beach.drift logs next to bank or cliff face. Some sand. Many boulders at mid or low water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Picnic tables, benches on grass above beach.
properties.other_comments: View. Parking. Road access from Gordon Head Road, 2210 Arbutus Cove Lane. Arbutus Cove Park 1.8 ha, District of Saanich. Trails, many stairs with handrails to beach.

properties.title: Shingle Bay Park
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected beach of sand, pebble, mud, scattered boulders at head of bay. Wooden walkway ramp to beach suited to use of wheels.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Vault toilet. Swings. 3 picnic tables.Open playing field.
properties.other_comments: Park on road shoulder or wide grass verge.Different site from GINPR campsite of similar name. No easy access between two sites except by water. Hiking trail to Roe Lake, Shingle Bay campground.

properties.title: Irene Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected moderate gradient sand, gravel beach. W aspect. 40 m short but moderately steep gravel trail to beach. Angular stones at mid water levels. Wheels useful.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Parking for 2 vehicles at Beach Access sign. Overlooked by 1 residence.

properties.title: Port Browning Marina
properties.landing_comments: See launch site nearby for details.
properties.camp_comments: Camp in grass field adjacent to pub, restaurant with some trees at perimeter. Individual or 2 group sites, all reservable. Fees (2023) individual orchard site for up to 2 tents $65. Group site for 3-4 tents $90-135. Lower shoulder season rates. Flush toilets, showers. Ph (250) 629.3493. See: Port Browning Marina and Resort. Ten minute walk to grocery store, pharmacy, liquor, hardware, bakery.
properties.other_comments: Pub, restaurant, marina, parking. laundry. Kayak rentals adjacent, guiding outfitting. 10 min. walk to shops: grocery, pharmacy, liquor, hardware, bakery.

properties.title: Georgina Point
properties.landing_comments: Sand beach in narrow cove between bedrock ribs. Many drift logs. NW aspect.  Currents, Vessel traffic.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted Flushing toilets (summer) or vault toilet (winter). Picnic tables, gazebo.
properties.other_comments: Water at tap reported, View, historic lighthouse, wildlife viewing, short hiking trails. Day parking only. Road access via Georgina Point Road. Gulf Islands National Park Reserve. See Georgina-Point

properties.title: Radcliffe Lane
properties.landing_comments: 20 m of brush at end of paved lane way leads to pebble beach. Drift logs. Adjacent to McMicking Point. Reported easier at high water. Beach partly protected from swell.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Take Hood Lane off Beach Drive, then Radcliffe Lane. Gravel day parking area, max 2 hrs for 3 cars. Lane narrow with no room for street parking. No parking in turn-around.

properties.title: Orchard Avenue
properties.landing_comments: Pocket beach of pebble, larger rocks lower, Moderately steep  Stairs to beach. Easy access.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Picnic tables near parking area.
properties.other_comments: Parking on the street or better in the marina parking lot next door. Water, restrooms and coffee shop can be found at the marina across the parking lot.

properties.title: Mariner Way
properties.landing_comments: Exposed, low gradient sand, pebble beach. NE aspect. Avoid low water. Easy, level beach access from vehicles.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: View. About 4 similar public access road ends or trails lead off Mariner Way/Shorewood Drive immediately W of Rathtrevor Beach Park. Plentiful day parking. No overnight parking. Residences adjacent to launches.

properties.title: Cook Park
properties.landing_comments: Pebble beach. Easier at mid or high water. Moderate gradient gravel path leads in 30 m to beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. 2 picnic tables.
properties.other_comments: Cook Road leads to Island View Close in residential area. Limited street parking. Cook Park managed by Cowichan Valley Regional District.

properties.title: Fernwood Wharf
properties.landing_comments: Easy on pebble, gravel, sand, beach of moderate gradient with shallow access steps from road. Optional launch at float at end of long public wharf.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Limited parking on North Beach Road/Walker's Hook Road. Restaurant opposite. Wharf, floats managed by Capital Regional District as a Small Craft Harbour.

properties.title: Vesuvius
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, gravel beach. W aspect. Directly accessible from road by wooden stairs.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Congested parking on roadsides near junction of Langley & Goodrich Roads. Attractive, swimming. Amenities nearby. Toilet.

properties.title: Southey Point
properties.landing_comments: Pocket sand beach between rock fingers. Protected N aspect. Short narrow trail gives access from road, with some steps.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: At end of Southey Point Road. Limited parking at road end. Attractive, view. Swimming.

properties.title: McMorran Park
properties.landing_comments: Concrete ramp from road to beach. Moderate gradient sand beach. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: View. Attractive. Toiiets. Playground. Amenities nearby. Parking on Cordova Bay Road.

properties.title: Gloria Place
properties.landing_comments: Sand beach. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping
properties.other_comments: View. Attractive. Amenities nearby.

properties.title: Southview Road
properties.landing_comments: Exposed sand, gravel beach. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Southview Road off Hwy 101. Beach access signed with trail provided by qathet Regional District from roadside parking.

properties.title: Sturt Road west
properties.landing_comments: Exposed gravel, cobble, boulder beach. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Park at Sturt Road or Hwy 101. Close to boat ramp but around a bluff so not accessible from there.

properties.title: Sturt Road Boat Launch
properties.landing_comments: Exposed concrete boat ramp.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: End of Sturt Road off Hwy 101.

properties.title: Island View
properties.landing_comments: See Island View Beach launch site. More sand than at day launch area.
properties.camp_comments: Vehicle accessible campground for RVs, tents. No reservations. Open from Victoria Day May long weekend to Labour Day Sept long weekend. $15 per night tenting fee (2018). Tents in section farthest from beach - approx. 150 m. Portable toilets, picnic areas, group fire ring.
properties.other_comments: Water at taps. Walking trails. 48 ha. Dunes. Birding. View. See: Island View Beach Regional Park.

properties.title: Maquinna
properties.landing_comments: This cove is very protected. When approaching from the south, there appeared to be boomers and rocks near the entrance, but there was open access into the cove and the kelp beds keep the surf down; better access is from the north side of the cove; the south side has more rocks.
properties.camp_comments: Good refuge with a moderately sloped beach and pebble beach or upland camping for at least 4 tents. There is a good creek at the south end of the cove.
properties.other_comments: See:

properties.title: Daniel Point Ɂayalus
properties.landing_comments: Rough bedrock foreshore with small beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Rest stop or safety stop at small Regional Park 1.4 ha. Undeveloped beach access. 4190 Orca Road. From Irvines Landing Rd. turn right onto Lee Rd at 800 m turn left onto Orca Rd. View. Steep 2.5 km (or less) trail from road. Ɂayalus means lookout in shashishalhem. the Sechelt language. This word can refer to ‘keeping an eye out’ for someone or something that is expected.

properties.title: Pacifica Paddlesports
properties.landing_comments: The Swartz Bay/ Canoe Cove shop gives access to the southern Gulf Islands for a variety of single or multi-day trips. They have an easy launching ramp which costs $5 a day. People can drive down to the shop, at the front end of E dock, and can get a parking pass to display in their window. Reported May 2024 that  launch site is opens in May when their office is open at the marina. Their ramp is closed when the shop is closed, leaving only dock launching and the dock is rather high.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: This is also access to the Salish Sea Marine Trail. Enjoy! Pacifica Paddlesports. Open from 9 am to 5 pm.

properties.title: Cabin Point Beach
properties.landing_comments: Protected gravel beach, moderate gradient. SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. No fires.
properties.other_comments: Extensive hiking trails. Interesting shoreline. Sea caves nearby. See: East Sooke Regional Park. Operated by Capital Regional District.

properties.title: Osborne Bay Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on protected sand, shell, gravel, pebble beach. NE aspect. Move boats to upland to give room to other beach users.
properties.camp_comments: Picnic area.
properties.other_comments: Road access from Trans-Canada Highway (from Duncan) turn E on Herd Road, L onto Osborne Bay Road, R on Adelaide Street / Smith Road, bends to right, or (from Nanaimo) Turn E off Trans-Canada Highway on Chemainus Road, turn L on Crofton Road, turn L on Chaplin Road, R on York Street, Lt on Adelaide Street / Smith Road, bends right. Parking. Close to amenities. Osborne Bay Regional Park, Cowichan Valley Regional District. 25 ha. Long access trail to small 6 - 8 vehicle parking lot. Swimming. Trails. Formerly Morton family farm. See Osborne Bay Regional Park

properties.title: Clo oose
properties.landing_comments: Sand beach. S aspect. Mostly well-protected. Moderate shelter in heavy W swell conditions. Follow N along narrow rock reef to W corner of bay.
properties.camp_comments: Any planned landing visit requires prior permission of Ditidaht Nation.
properties.other_comments: Seasonal stream. Water year-round at Cheewhat River accessible overland but likely brackish until far above footbridge. 3 old cabins near stream at E end believed not regularly inhabited. Landing or camping on the West Coast Trail is not permitted and could result in fines, except in emergency situations.

properties.title: Holland Point
properties.landing_comments: Exposed sand, gravel beach. S aspect. Easy stair, ramp access to beach from road.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Toilets on Dallas Road adjacent to pond.
properties.other_comments: Street parking with no posted restrictions. Mile 0 monument, Terry Fox statue 300 m to NE. City of Victoria park.

properties.title: Retreat Cove
properties.landing_comments: High float at public dock in sheltered cove. Sheltered by island from NW. Small beach immediately E of wharf appears public, might offer easier sea access.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: End of Retreat Cove Road. Limited parking on road before turn-around area. Wharfinger Kiyoshi Okuda 250.539.5557 (2017). Operated by Capital Regional District as a Small Craft Harbour. No known nearby services. Easier launch areas might be nearby.

properties.title: Spanish Hills
properties.landing_comments: Public dock with high float. W aspect. No easy nearby beach access on sandstone ledges, steep rock shores.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping. Toilet near Community Hall.
properties.other_comments: Just off Porlier Pass Road. Also known as North Galiano dock. Roadside parking for 10-15 vehicles. Community Hall 150 m N. Spanish Hills Wharfinger Dan White 604.230.8115. Boat access to smaller islands. Water taxi service on demand.

properties.title: Miracle Beach
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient sand beach, cobble at high water, rocky patches. NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Developed vehicle access campground. Gravel drive-in sites approx 350 m or more from beach. Wheels advisable. Pit and flush toilets. Group sites. Hot showers. Picnic shelters. Reservations recommended. Limited services in winter.
properties.other_comments: 137 ha. Water at taps. Parking. Nature house. Swimming, change room. See: Miracle Beach Provincial Park.

properties.title: Manzanita Road
properties.landing_comments: Beach of small cobble 50 m long. S aspect. Drift logs. Mostly protected. Vessel traffic. Very short trail to road.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Rustic bench, tarp frame.
properties.other_comments: Large gravel turn area with parking at road end. Path from road to shore approx. 15 m. Private land posted on both sides of public road end.

properties.title: Sombrio Beach east
properties.landing_comments: Aim for the NW corner of small bay keeping large rock just on left side. Preferable landing to river mouth in surf conditions. Exposed rock shelf at water levels below 1 m makes landing more difficult. See image for route.
properties.camp_comments: Beach sites. Toilet. Food storage bin. Dispersed camping permitted on beach only. Camping fees apply year-round. May pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites. Fee $10.00 per adult per night (2018) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System.
properties.other_comments: Water at stream about 50 m E of landing. Beach often used by hikers. Quieter than beach to W. Lies on Juan de Fuca hiking trail. See: Juan de Fuca Provincial Park.

properties.title: Hardy Island
properties.landing_comments: Bedrock ledges at entrance to sheltered cove.  Rough beach with sharp rocks to 200 mm.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. No developed trails. Limited number of small level walk-in sites on rock ledges in bluffs. Main tent site sometimes used by paddlers lies above E tip of Musket Island.
properties.other_comments: Anchorage, Provincial Boat Haven. Most of 17 ha park lies on Hardy Island. Small Musket Island is separated from Hardy Island only at mid or higher tide. Aka Musket Island. Popular with boaters for swimming, viewing, diving, fishing, wilderness camping. Not set up for paddlers. See Hardy Island Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Shelter Point
properties.landing_comments: Two long beaches 2 km. Sheltered but low gradient S and open, steeper W aspects. Sand, gravel. Concrete boat ramp, second unpaved ramp.
properties.camp_comments: Developed in 2 locations for RVs, tents. Picnic tables, shelter, fire pits, showers, flush toilets, playground. Some sites close to beach. 2 group sites reservable, others not. Some facilities open only mid April – mid October. Fees charged. Gates locked at night. On-site caretaker 604 486-7228 or email shelterpointpark@qathet.ca
properties.other_comments: Potable water. Boat launches. Parking. Nature trail. Food sales concession (seasonal). qathet Regional District Park. See: See Shelter Point Regional Park

properties.title: Francis Bay
properties.landing_comments: Small gravel beach or rock ledges in sheltered cove.
properties.camp_comments: Day use only. No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Francis Point Park over 80 ha. W peninsula Moore Point is Ecological Reserve with no entry permitted. Possible launch site. Also called Middle Bay. Hiking trails. Road access at Merrill Road approx 0.4 km. Close to residential area. See Francis Point Provincial Park

properties.title: Shingle Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy on moderately steep gravel beach, exposed to S, SE.
properties.camp_comments: Developed. Upland sites near beach with tables mainly intended for RVs. Pit toilets. Picnic shelters, other structures. Campsite summer host. Camping, parking fees $18/site/per night (2023). Reserve up to 60 days ahead.
properties.other_comments: Water at tap. View. Attractive. Parking. Cliffs adjacent. See: Shingle Beach Campground

properties.title: Partington Point south
properties.landing_comments: Easy on moderate gradient gravel beach W aspect. Alternate rougher beach with SE aspect. Sabine Channel known for high wind.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Camping not currently sanctioned by BC Parks. Potential camping on level upland in open forest or on upper beach on gravel. Large site on spit under Mt Shepherd. Rustic kitchen area.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Views. Seasonal creek reported at N end of bay. See South Texada Island Provincial Park

properties.title: Boulder
properties.landing_comments: Easy on small pebble or gravel beach at all tide levels. SW aspect. Rock bluff at S end. Giant boulder landmark.
properties.camp_comments: Mostly sloping site. Several undeveloped sites on grass among alder trees. Some debris, remains of cabins. Some logging debris.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round creek. Possible inland access on old industrial road. Appears to have once been a log dump. See South Texada Island Provincial Park

properties.title: Smuggler Cove
properties.landing_comments: Very protected cove has small rough beach at head. Gravel, cobble. Boats must be lifted up awkward 1.5 - 2 m bank for stowage.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilet at park road entrance approx 500 m - 700 m from landing.
properties.other_comments: Popular anchorage. Possible fresh water sources at adjacent beaver ponds if purified. Some short hiking trails. 700 m approx from parking lot. Long term parking permitted. See Smuggler Cove Provincial Marine Park

properties.title: Brooks Cove
properties.landing_comments: Small mixed beach in protected cove. S aspect. Some drift logs, bedrock, Soft mud clam bed at low water. Easiest at mid - high water levels. Short carry from vehicle.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Easy vehicle access at Brooks Rd. Parking at roadside signed No overnight parking or 150 m away at Smuggler Cove trail head - overnight status unknown. Area of residences.

properties.title: Pebbly Beach South Thormanby
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected smooth pebble, gravel beach of moderate to steep gradient. Some broken cobble at low water. E aspect. Drift logs can impede landing at very high water above 4.4 m. Prominent park sign. Vessel traffic, currents in adjacent Welcome Passage. Beware of ship wash.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped site. Small uneven grassed area among alders. Hammock opportunities. Picnic table. Tends to be damp. E aspect so shaded after noon.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Extensive hiking trails including loop to Spyglass Hill. See Simson Provincial Park

properties.title: Porpoise Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, pebble, gravel beach. SW aspect. Low to moderate gradient.
properties.camp_comments: Developed campsite. 6 (or more) walk-in sites for cyclists, paddlers with 6 tables. Flush and vault toilets, showers, picnic tables, cooking shelters. Playground. Group site.
properties.other_comments: Water at taps. Plentiful day parking. consult park operator about longer term parking. See Porpoise Bay Provincial Park

properties.title: Farm Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on moderate gradient broken cobble, pebble beach in narrow cove.  Slightly exposed SE aspect. Well protected from other directions. Many drift logs, flotsam potentially awkward at high water. Prominent white park 'dogwood' sign to N on low cliff near cove entrance.
properties.camp_comments: Campsite in roomy, grassy upland along former roadway, but sloped. Picnic table. No fires permitted but sign no longer present (2024). Hammock opportunities nearby.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water year-round at beaver pond 200 m NW. Wildlife viewing. Potential additional tent sites at adjacent former farm site near Park kiosk. Extensive hiking trails. See Simson Provincial Park Also known as Alder Bay.

properties.title: Simson Central
properties.landing_comments: Easy on moderate gradient large protected beach of small rocks. Protected E aspect. Many drift logs. Rough trails cross small marsh behind beach in front of upland.
properties.camp_comments: Slightly lumpy sloping grass meadow, old roadbed offers several sites subject to minor levelling. Some drainage flows through site. Hammock opportunities. One high bluff tent pad. Numerous hazardous dead alder snags suggest avoiding during high winds.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at seasonal stream. Extensive hiking trails throughout Park, including to Spyglass Hill. See Simson Provincial Park Also known as Drift Bay,

properties.title: Home Bay Jedediah Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy on firm mud with fine sand at top in protected cove. To avoid drying mudflats with embedded oysters, time landings for water levels 2.0 m or higher.
properties.camp_comments: Dispersed camping permitted on roomy, grassy site. 2 semi-developed sites, one near beach SE of orchard, one near orchard, homestead. Possible overflow sites nearby. Composting toilet. Camping fees apply 15 May to 15 September. May pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites. Fee $5.00 per person per night (2024) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration.
properties.other_comments: Anchorages. 3.5 km of hiking trails. Historic farm, orchard. Feral sheep. Warm water swimming. Aka Sand Beach. See Jedediah Island Provincial Marine Park

properties.title: Sea Egg Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy on pebble, gravel beach at high water Cobble at low water. Protected from SE, NW. Many drift logs. Ship wash. Rock cliff on W side of site.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. 3 or 4 beach sites at most tides. Steep upland offering potential small tent sites requiring levelling, brushing on cliff top or mossy shelves. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: View.

properties.title: Friendship Park
properties.landing_comments: 10% slope, gravel, pebbles to 75 mm, drift logs. Exposed S aspect. Smooth concrete car-top boat ramp to beach  from sea wall.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Easiest of many other access points. Paved walkway. Short term 2 hr parking nearby. Toilets. Playground. Benches, picnic tables, shelter. Accommodation, fuel nearby , provisions, services. Pedestrian pier. Portage across town to Porpoise Bay. District of Sechelt municipal park.

properties.title: Tzoonie Narrows
properties.landing_comments: Cobble beach. Some boulders.
properties.camp_comments: Large established upland campsite, pit toilet. fire ring. Grassy areas. Food cache bin. Old roadways provide further level sites. Suited to groups. Deadfall in some tent sites will need clearing. Blowdowns, hazard trees noted on trails 2024.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek, reported location N49.702792, W123.779885 about 200-300 m W of site. Follow old road but stay near shore when it goes uphill. For last 50 m trail leaves road. Former log handling site, hippy commune - some debris remains. Old fruit trees. Anchorage. See Sechelt Inlets Marine Park

properties.title: Roberts Creek Park Access
properties.landing_comments: 10 deg slope, low tide 150 mm cobbles, high tide 50 mm gravel, bedrock formation provides some shelter from S, W, and N waves at some tide levels.
properties.camp_comments: Developed campground is 1.4 km from landing beach directly up Park Ave.
