properties.other_comments: Pit toilets, water. See Roberts Creek Provincial Park

properties.title: Kunechin Bay
properties.landing_comments: Bay with SE aspect mostly sheltered but open to E winds from Salmon Inlet. Mixed moderate gradient beach of pebble, cobble, some boulders. Mostly gravel, some sand at high water. For E side sites, land between two large rocks at boat run. Second boat run also cleared. Beach mostly floods at high water.
properties.camp_comments: Small developed all weather campsite, pit toilet, fire pit. More sheltered than Kunechin Point. Limited sun exposure. Main area is large level flat at E end. Secondary area to left of a sign with awkward climb and plank. One good site, one marginal site along main trail.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. Anchorage. See Sechelt Inlets Marine Park

properties.title: Thornhill Creek
properties.landing_comments: Mostly sheltered small beach of gravel, small rocks, cobble, boulder band with gaps, sand below. Rougher landing with many boulders 100 m to W near first BC Park sign. Paddlers are advised to continue E to second beach. N aspect. Sheltered from W. Wind hazards in Salmon Inlet.
properties.camp_comments: 2 spacious camp areas in small developed campsite. Camp on point on grass or on gravel old roadbed by beach or in open grass areas. Pit toilet. Fire pits. N aspect. Sunny much of year but damp with limited sun in winter. Room in area for many more tents.
properties.other_comments: Trail to water at year-round creek. View. Former log dump. Old road runs through site to point believed to be no longer connected to highway. Petroglyphs. See Sechelt Inlets Marine Park

properties.title: Kunechin Point
properties.landing_comments: Pebble, cobble beach. E aspect. Boat run cleared of boulders in centre but not seen by 2022 reporter.
properties.camp_comments: 3 wooden tent platforms. Further sites on rock or grass on point and on lower shelf to E. Small established campsite, pit toilet, food bin. No fires permitted. Exposed to E wind. Awkward access up steep trail.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Popular SCUBA dive site nearby. Seal colony on islets - camping not permitted there. See Sechelt Inlets Marine Park

properties.title: Halfway
properties.landing_comments: Cobble with pebble, gravel above. Semi-exposed. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Large established campsite, pit toilet, group fire pit. 2 food caches. Some sites on bluff to S.
properties.other_comments: View. Water at seasonal creek. Swimming. Seal colony on Halfway Islet. Marginal anchorage. See Sechelt Inlets Marine Park

properties.title: Skaiakos Creek
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient gravel, pebble, cobble beach. A few boulders. Exposed with E aspect. Believed to have no visible park sign.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Level upland sites in open forest. Rustic camp furniture, fire pit. More sites on flat ground N of old foundations. Serves as overflow site for Halfway.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek just to S. Foundation of building to N. Other possible sites, landing beaches to N. See Sechelt Inlets Marine Park

properties.title: Nine Mile Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy on low gradient rough rubble, gravel beach. Finer gravel N of creek mouth at high water. Sand band at low water. W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Large developed campsite on both sides of substantial creek. 2 group fire rings. Pit toilet. 3 food cache bins.
properties.other_comments: View. Water at year-round creek. Petroglyphs. Nine Mile Point proper lies 0.5 NM N of campsite. See Mount Richardson Provincial Park

properties.title: Egmont
properties.landing_comments: Partly paved rough boat ramp in sheltered corner of Secret Bay. Adjacent beach of pebble, cobble to 150 mm. Government dock also nearby.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Good near-shore camping at various area resorts.
properties.other_comments: Limited street parking near ramp. Some free, some pay parking available nearby at Bathgate General Store. Turn from Egmont Road to Maple Road, then right on Bradwynne and Jib Road. Aka Secret Bay. Other nearby options. Staging point for transit of Sechelt Rapids.

properties.title: Piper Point
properties.landing_comments: Sand, gravel beach. Exposed to SE
properties.camp_comments: Small established campsite on bench. Spacious but shaded. Pit toilet.
properties.other_comments: Mostly day use. Marginal anchorage. See Sechelt Inlets Marine Park

properties.title: Tuwanek Point
properties.landing_comments: Moderately steep gravel, pebble, cobble beach. Creek at centre. Bluffs to N suited to lining boats.
properties.camp_comments: Established campsite, pit toilet. Fire ring. Many tent sites on level forest floor. Sunny in afternoon. Food cache.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. Swimming. Mostly day use. Marginal anchorage. See Mount Richardson Provincial Park

properties.title: Mermaid Cove
properties.landing_comments: Rocky beach. Paddlecraft may be launched at protected small ramp designed for disabled scuba divers giving water access approx 70 m from vehicle access. Nearby small cove also suitable, even more protected. S aspect. Vehicle access close to shore for boat pick up or drop off.
properties.camp_comments: Most sites set up for vehicle camping. Pit toilets, showers, change rooms. 15 sites may be reserved 1-800-689-9025. Fees charged.
properties.other_comments: View. Water at 5 taps in summer only. Walking trails. Wildlife viewing. Popular with scuba divers. Underwater bronze mermaid statue. Separate day use area, boat ramp, 1.5 km to W. Aquaculture operation close by. See Saltery Bay Provincial Park

properties.title: Plumper Cove Keats Island Chaich-Ph
properties.landing_comments: Easy on small sheltered gravel beach adjacent to numerous floats, dock. S aspect. Landing option on beach with N aspect. Stowage for portable boats at beach top. Access up bank easier on N beach.
properties.camp_comments: Developed sites of packed soil, gravel in open treed area with central grass clearing. 5 sites are large. Fire rings, picnic tables. 4 pit toilets. Reservable group site also available. Some sites have S exposure, others on N slope. Mostly shaded. Fees charged.$16 per night per party (2023). Resident attendant. Winter camping with reduced services. Separate picnic area,
properties.other_comments: Water at hand pump seasonally. Large dock, anchorage, mooring buoys. Swimming. 2 km hiking trail to small seasonal store, foot ferry, dock at Keats Landing. Squamish (Coast Salish) name Chaich-Ph. See Plumper Cove Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Halkett Bay Ch’á7elsem
properties.landing_comments: On W shore 200 m before head of protected bay. Low water access on E side of rock islet. Beach of sand, gravel pebble beside dock at high water, gravel, cobble to 100 mm S of creek. Some mud, mixed rocks at low water. S aspect. Park dock, float if present gives good access but not adjacent to sites.
properties.camp_comments: Developed sites some on 8 wooden platforms in semi-open meadow with sword ferns, grass. Pit toilet. Some picnic tables. Food storage bin. No fires. Some additional sites muddy in wet weather. Several unsanctioned overflow sites also regularly used. Camping fees apply year-round. May pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites. Fee $5.00 per person per night (2025) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System.
properties.other_comments: Water at small waterfall at seasonal creek 5 min uphill from camp. Attractive. Extensive hiking trails. Dinghy dock under repair or removed 2025. Anchorage. Squamish (Coast Salish) name Ch’á7elsem. See Halkett Bay Provincial Marine Park

properties.title: Porteau Cove Xwáŵchayay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on mud, sand, rubble in sheltered cove or on exposed cobble, pebble outer beach. Lirrle or no foreshore at high water. See also Porteau Cove launch site description.
properties.camp_comments: Developed campground, reservations strongly recommended, walk-in sites 100% reservable. Toilets, picnic tables, shelter, fire pits, benches, showers, changing room.
properties.other_comments: Water at taps. Parking. Views. Noise from adjacent railway, highway. Anchorage. Short hiking trails. Squamish (Coast Salish) name Xwáŵchayay. See Porteau Cove Provincial Park

properties.title: Bold Head Pekwesqan
properties.landing_comments: Difficult landing in bay to W with exposed SW aspect on small boulders or to SW (also SW aspect) on rock ledges or boulder beach of peninsula under Bold Head cliffs. May be difficult in W wind.
properties.camp_comments: 9 raised wooden tent platforms on clear level areas on rock headland. Vault toilet. No fires. Exposed to W. Camping fees apply 1 June to 15 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at Lund or Okeover launch sites, but no reservable sites. Camp only at designated sites.
properties.other_comments: View. See Desolation Sound Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Curme Islands east
properties.landing_comments: Moderate on rock shelf, small beach in central drying cove between W, E islands. Reefs.
properties.camp_comments: 12 wooden tent platforms on rocky shelves among low bluffs. S or E aspect. Toilet, picnic area. No fires permitted. Foot access at low and mid tides only to West Curme Island. Camping fees apply 1 June to 15 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at Lund or Okeover launch sites, but no reservable sites. Camp only at designated sites.
properties.other_comments: View. See Desolation Sound Marine Provincial ParkPark Operator: 1312768 BC Ltd email DesolationSound.Camping@outlook.com

properties.title: Tenedos Bay Kumken
properties.landing_comments: Easy on mixed beach in protected bay. W aspect. Cleared boat run. Beach largely floods at Springs.
properties.camp_comments: Protected all weather site. 3 raised wooden tent platforms, cleared grass areas. Vault toilet. Picnic area. Fire rings. Interpretive sign. Suitable for group. Camping fees apply 1 June to 15 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at Lund or Okeover launch sites, but no reservable sites. Camp only at designated sites. Food cache above the tent platforms on the right.
properties.other_comments: Year-round stream flows nearby. Short hiking trail to lake swimming. Popular anchorage. See Desolation Sound Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Hare Point Maseqw
properties.landing_comments: Easy on 2 sheltered rough beaches of pebble, larger stones on W (SW aspect) and E (SE aspect) sides of small peninsula. E side with boat run, smaller stones usually preferred. Strong currents, turbulence at tide changes.
properties.camp_comments: 17 wooden tent platforms. 2 toilets. Picnic area. No fires. Camping fees apply 1 June to 15 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at Lund or Okeover launch sites, but no reservable sites. Camp only at designated sites.
properties.other_comments: View. Also known as Maseqw or Purple Urchin. See Desolation Sound Marine Provincial Park. Sometimes overcrowded.

properties.title: Feather Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy on beach of angular cobble at low water, smoother pebble above. Gentle gradient. Exposed to N but otherwise protected. N aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Sites in trees with 9 tent platforms on E headland. Metal food bin. Toilet. No fires. Beach camping possible also at neaps only. Camping fees apply 1 June to 15 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at Lund or Okeover launch sites, but no reservable sites. Camp only at designated sites.
properties.other_comments: Site shared with branch of Sunshine Coast hiking Trail. See Malaspina Provincial Park

properties.title: Wishart Whale Tail
properties.landing_comments: Sheltered bays around whale-tail-shaped isthmus. Various easy approaches onto low gradient pebble, mud or clam bed beaches. Drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: Sheltered, undeveloped. Pebbly upper beach sites for 2-3 tents at Neaps but unreliable at Springs. Easy upland access but dense vegetation. Possible upland sites if brushed. Hammock opportunities. Other tent sites might be found nearby with more searching. Possible camp at neck of isthmus. Wishart Island reported to have a R Washburne cabin - location, condition unknown.
properties.other_comments: See Mahpahkum-Ahkwuna/Deserters-Walker Conservancy.

properties.title: Boyles Point
properties.landing_comments: Land on 25 m band of sand at centre beach of long bay N of point. Cobble, boulders to 30 cm at sides or at mid or high water. Enter bay to E of boomer. Reefs give some protection from E, otherwise well sheltered. Strong currents in Wells Passage. Abundant drift logs. Paddlers may prefer to land at hung small float marker nearer rocky point for easier high water tent site access.
properties.camp_comments: Upland site for 2 tents 30 m behind point or rock bluff at S end of beach. Look for hung float. Additional small upland sites in forest 50 m -100 m further N if brushed of salal. Drift logs hinder access. Some users have camped on flat rock ledges to W of point.
properties.other_comments: 1 NM to N, Kenneth R in Kenneth Bay offers possible water source, but access not verified.

properties.title: Cattle Islands
properties.landing_comments: Easy on shell, sand beach W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Sheltered, undeveloped. Large forested upland site reached from S end of beach along shell trail. Suited to small groups. Additional beach camping except at Springs. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Attractive but beach visible from Fort Rupert 0.8 NM away. Shellfish aquaculture floats offshore nearby.

properties.title: Bere Point
properties.landing_comments: Moderate to steep cobble beach. Drift logs, kelp.
properties.camp_comments: Developed site set up for RVs. Picnic tables. Pit toilets. Reservations accepted. The Mamalilikulla prefer this site not to be shown to the public for archaelogical reasons.
properties.other_comments: Non-potable water at tap. Boat launch (high water only). Hiking trail to whale rubbing beach, viewing platform. Hydrophones. Regional Park of Mt Waddington Regional District. See Bere Point Regional Park

properties.title: Graeme Point north
properties.landing_comments: Cobble beach. Exposed. Fairly steep. Kelp.
properties.camp_comments: Many possibilities along beach berm.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Graeme Point
properties.landing_comments: Cobble beach. Exposed. Fairly steep. Kelp.
properties.camp_comments: Many possibilities along beach.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Penn Islands central
properties.landing_comments: Moderate on rough boulder beach with low to medium slope, reefs. Pebble, smaller 10-20 cm angular cobble in broad band with oysters at lower water. Larger 20-30 cm angular cobble at high water. W aspect. Exposed to W, S
properties.camp_comments: 2 upland sites at centre bay if brushed. w possible upper beach sites at neaps. NE side has further potential. 1-2 additional sites possible with second beach access. Small sites on mossy rock bluffs.
properties.other_comments: View. Old cabin, garbage present (2023).

properties.title: Browns Bay
properties.landing_comments: Busy small boat marina with fuel dock. Boat ramp.
properties.camp_comments: Commercial campground, mostly RVs with tenting on small grass point.
properties.other_comments: Staging for Seymour Narrows. Marina. Aka Brown's Bay Resort. CHS charted as Brown Bay. Pay parking. Good gravel road connects to highway.

properties.title: Waiatt Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on low gradient pebble, shell clam bed beach. Cobble at high water. Sheltered. Long carry at low water,
properties.camp_comments: Some camping use. Small forest clearing. Undeveloped user-maintained wilderness site.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. Attractive. Trail to lake. Heavy day use. Staging for portage to Small Inlet. View. Beach fires are banned all year round. See Small Inlet Marine Park.

properties.title: Shark Spit
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, pebble. SE side preferred as conditions permit. Long carry at low water, especially from NW side. Currents.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped beach site tides permitting or grassy upland in trees. Pit toilet. No fires. Camp furniture. 2 picnic tables. When occupied, some paddlers have camped further S on same shore, also nearer to W shore.
properties.other_comments: Camping by paddlers tolerated by generous landowner to date (2024). Significant local use. Please make every effort to camp responsibly adhering to Code of Conduct.

properties.title: We Wai Kai
properties.landing_comments: Easy on low gradient protected pebble beach. Long carry at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Developed commercial campground. Waterfront serviced sites for RVs etc. Toilets, showers, water at taps. Office, further sites across road from beach.
properties.other_comments: Adjacent to Rebecca Spit Provincial Park. Trails, other nearby facilities. See We Wai Kai Campsite. Owned and operated by the Cape Mudge Indian Band (We Wai Kai Nation). Fees charged. Beach fires are banned all year round.

properties.title: Rock Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy, sand beach or concrete boat ramp with cobbles at low water. Docks, large protecting floating breakwater.
properties.camp_comments: Developed RV campground. Limited tenting sites. Toilets. No water available. Contact Rock Bay to confirm tenting availability (778) 744-3218.
properties.other_comments: Secure parking available. No access to small Provincial Park which is along rocky shoreline to S. Rock Bay reached over 18 km logging haul road from North Island Highway. (Hwy 19).

properties.title: Wa Wa Kie Beach
properties.landing_comments: Moderately easy on exposed rough cobble beach with some boulders. Landing offers some protection at mid or higher tides. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Undeveloped.
properties.other_comments: View. Staging for Cape Mudge. Public beach access at 2 road ends N of Smiths Rd. Kay Dubois hiking trail parallels shore. Possible launch site. Limited parking. Beach fires are banned all year round.

properties.title: Mels Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy, on protected moderate gradient cobble, pebble beach in protected bay. N aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Gloomy, damp but spacious. 1 tent site in upland second growth forest. Second site requires brushing. 2 or 3 additional sites overgrown (2021). Minor brushing could yield more tent sites. Larger sites on E side. Possible beach camping. Suited to hammocks. Sites littered with debris. Many trees reported to be rotten so camping could be hazardous in windy conditions.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. Hiking trails crossed island but reported to be impasable. Whale watching. Bay known as Dong Chong Bay. One of the 4 sites on Hanson I sanctioned by Yukusam Heritage Society for public use. Logging relics. Messy with abandoned boat gear that was to be removed by YHS/Namgis 2014 but still present 2021.

properties.title: Potts Lagoon
properties.landing_comments: Easy in sheltered bay except at low water. Rocks at high water, sand, mud at low.
properties.camp_comments: Upland forest site. Access up steep bank with rope to assist on E side of bay. Alternate access via rocks 20 m to N. Fire ring.
properties.other_comments: Ecologically interesting. Anchorage.

properties.title: Paddlers Inn Broughton Archipelago
properties.landing_comments: Low floats.
properties.camp_comments: No camping but several opportunities nearby. Float house self catering lodge, small cabin and shore sited cabin available for rent. Shower, flush toilet.
properties.other_comments: The main goal of the Paddlers Inn is to provide their clients with the beauty of the BC coastline combined with comfortable, safe experiences. Mostly easy and interesting paddling, comparatively safe for beginners. Phone: 250-230-0088 or e-mail: info@paddlersinn.ca or website: Paddlers Inn.

properties.title: Kinver Street
properties.landing_comments: Beach in cove well-protected by breakwater. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping
properties.other_comments: At foot of Kinver Street, off Munro Street. Limited street parking. Township of Esquimalt beach access park. Walking access at low water on beach to Fleming Beach.

properties.title: Fleming Beach
properties.landing_comments: Small sandy beach or concrete boat ramp in cove well-protected by breakwater. SW aspect. Vessel, vehicle traffic.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Access via Munro Street, off Fraser or Lampson Streets. Parking lot. Esquimalt Anglers Association club house, club-developed boat trailer ramp. Part of, adjacent to Macauley Point Park, Township of Esquimalt. Part of Victoria Waterways Loop - a regional paddling route covering a 8.4 NM with one 950 m portage. Loop has four sections with launch points allowing paddles in any section. See: Victoria Waterways Loop.

properties.title: Ardwell Avenue
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient beach. E aspect.  Long carry at low water. At low tide you might have to deal with a long muddy walk but at mid to high tide its ok.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Picnic tables.
properties.other_comments: E end Ardwell Street. 2 hour parking limit close to launch. Best to unload boats then park vehicle away from street end. 24 hr parking stay limit in Town of Sidney. Busy.

properties.title: Amherst Avenue
properties.landing_comments: Short trail, stairs to beach. Firm mud at low water. Suited to all water levels.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Benches.
properties.other_comments: E end of Amherst Avenue. Vehicle turning area. View. 4 hr parking. Advisable to unload at turnaround then park vehicles. 24 hr parking stay limit in Town of Sidney, reported to be rarely enforced (complaint-driven) in residential neighborhoods.

properties.title: Telegraph Bay Road
properties.landing_comments: Pebble, sand beach in cove, protected except from N. Scattered boulders at low water. N aspect. Level path from parking to beach gives easy access..
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: At end of Telegraph Bay Road. Parking for 20 - 30 vehicles. Official name appears to be Telegraph Cove - not used because of possible confusion with other coves of that name.

properties.title: Agate Lane
properties.landing_comments: Easy beach access. Good launch site. Sand, gravel beach. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: 0.23 hectare Agate Park just off Agate Lane, Saanich. 2 picnic tables, bench. Small parking lot for about 10 vehicles. No overnight parking. District of Saanich.

properties.title: Hot Springs Cove - ʔupnit
properties.landing_comments: Sheltered inlet. Easy at high water at cleared boat run among boulders. Moderate at low water on steep boulder, cobble beach. Boat, float plane traffic. Optional landing near public dock.
properties.camp_comments: Developed campsite with very small rough sites. Tent sites are long walk from public / park dock, beach where some paddlers might prefer to land. Shelter, picnic table. Rough pit toilet, likely unusable. No fires. Fee charged. Site operator suggests using composting toilets in adjacent Provincial Park. Site operator will bring water from village in jugs but only on request. Subject also to Ahousaht Stewardship Fee.
properties.other_comments: Access fee requested $15 per person for accessing the hot springs along boardwalk. 2 km walk from dock to Hot Springs. Water is available at the adjacent provincial park. Hot springs open to general public from dawn to dusk but permitted commercial operators may only bring guests in 11 am-5 pm. Some hours reserved for Nuu-chah-nulth visits only.

properties.title: Yuquot
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on sand, gravel beach S of large dock. Yuquot Heritage site landing fee.
properties.camp_comments: Developed commercial campground in mowed field and cabin accommodation nearby. Paddlers may camp on upland beside beach. Landing and camping fees. Toilets. Yuquot Camping Rental
properties.other_comments: Tiny community. Trailhead for Nootka Trail. Other small trails in vicinity. Historic site. Summer freighter service from Gold River, Tahsis. Anchorage - Provincial Boat Haven. Museum in former church. Lighthouse may be visited. Aka Friendly Cove

properties.title: San Josef Heritage Park
properties.landing_comments: Steep gravel launch in river maintained by BC Parks.  Advisable to paddle river at high tide. Low water impedes 3 NM channel, can give high surf at river mouth.
properties.camp_comments: NB. Road closure for bridge replacement Sept 2018. Developed. San Josef Heritage Park Campground. Pit toilets, fire pits, picnic tables. Ph. 250-288-3682. Reported (7-2024) The commercial campground near the boat launch has been abandoned and doesn't appear to be a safe place to leave a car anymore.
properties.other_comments: Water, but not potable. Safe overnight vehicle parking. Fees charged.

properties.title: Esquimalt Gorge Park
properties.landing_comments: Protected sand beach. N aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Part of Victoria Waterways Loop - a regional paddling route covering a 8.4 NM with one 950 m portage. Loop has four sections with launch points allowing paddles in any section. See: Victoria Waterways loop. Gorge is most sheltered section loop but contains sensitive wildlife habitat, tidal rapids at narrows under Tillicum Road bridge.

properties.title: Pedder Bay
properties.landing_comments: Boat ramp, float. Adjacent beach in protected cove.
properties.camp_comments: Full service RV campsite.
properties.other_comments: Fee for launching. Approach via Rocky Point Road, Metchosin.

properties.title: Albert Head
properties.landing_comments: Gravel,  beach. Moderate gradient. SE aspect. Scattered boulders at low water. Some drift logs. Protected from W but exposed to SE, E. Easy access.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Gravel parking lot with room for 10+ vehicles also roadside parking on Delgada Road, Metchosin. Capital Regional District Park. Albert Head Lagoon adjacent - sandbar limits entry to highest tides and is bird sanctuary. %km of gravel beach to NE of site.

properties.title: Weirs Beach
properties.landing_comments: Sand beach. SE aspect. Many drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Easy access. At foot of Sandgate Road in Parker Bay. Adequate roadside parking.

properties.title: Chenuh Marina at Spirit Bay
properties.landing_comments: Concrete boat ramp, floats behind marina floats in protected cove.
properties.camp_comments: Former commercial campground near launch closed. Paddlecraft launch fee (2023) $10 per kayak. Paddlers must load boats before bringing to ramp - not to be left on ramp prior to/after launch/retrieval. Ph 250-478-3535 Fax 250-478-3585. Email bb.fn@telus.net
properties.other_comments: 4901-B East Sooke Rd. Sooke. Water at taps. Aka Becher Bay Marina, 365 berths. Owned, operated by Beecher Bay First Nation, also known as Scia’new Nation.

properties.title: Sioux Place
properties.landing_comments: unknown
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Parking on Sioux Road; access to Esquimalt Gorge Park; North America's first Japanese garden in park Township of Esquimalt (Park)

properties.title: Whiffin Spit
properties.landing_comments: Option of inner or outer beaches. Outer beach exposed sand, pebble with cobble small rocks below. Inner beach gravel, silt. Strong currents at E end of spit.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: View. Walking trail. Access from Hwy on Whiffin Spit Rd. Paved parking lot for day use only. Local streets may offer additional parking. Part of Whiffin Spit Park, Quimper Park, District of Sooke.

properties.title: Coopers Cove
properties.landing_comments: Gravel beach floods at high water. Easy carry to beach. Public boat ramp.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Located on Sooke Road. Lots of parking.

properties.title: Bowser Road
properties.landing_comments: Beach of pebble, sand, cobble. Moderate gradient.  E aspect. Easy level access to parking. Rough trailer boat launch.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Limited street parking. Public beach access managed by Regional District of Nanaimo.

properties.title: Willows Beach
properties.landing_comments: Sand beach in semi-protected bay. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Toilets.
properties.other_comments: Water at drinking fountain. Near intersect of Dalhousie Street, Beach Drive. Plentiful street, lot parking. Change rooms, tea room, picnic tables, benches, playground. Walking paths Restaurants nearby. 1.2 ha District of Oak Bay park. The park and beach area get busy during the summer. if you are going to launch do so in the morning. Very safe day use stop.

properties.title: Oak Bay Marina
properties.landing_comments: Gravel beach protected aspect immediately NW of marina parking lot with concrete stairs, paved ramp. Alternate, less protected gravel beach, concrete stairs on SE side of marina entrance.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Many services nearby. Street parking with no posted restrictions. Private parking at marina.

properties.title: Selkirk Trestle
properties.landing_comments: Low floating dock down ramp near S end of trestle. Dock serves harbour water taxi cutsomers.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Small boat dock aka Railyard Dock. Some free parking in area, plentiful at weekends. Regatta Point Park, City of Victoria.

properties.title: McNeil Bay
properties.landing_comments: Moderately steep pebble beach. At high tide there may be surf making landing/launching difficult as waves may wash against concrete wall. Concrete pedestrian ramp to beach from roadway.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Approx. location 370 Beach Road. Roadside parking.

properties.title: Middle Copeland Nuxwum
properties.landing_comments: Easy on 2 beaches of gravel, cobble with either NE or SW aspects at opposite ends of small island. Preferred landing is at N tip. S landing has little or no area for boat storage ashore. Vessel traffic in Thulin Passage.
properties.camp_comments: 10 tent pads. Vault toilet in centre. Picnic area, table at N end. No fires. Exposed to W. Camping fees apply 1 June to 15 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at Lund or Okeover launch sites, but no reservable sites. Camp only at designated sites.
properties.other_comments: Attractive, view. Aka Weed Island. View. See Copeland Islands Marine Park

properties.title: Cadboro Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on low gradient sand beach. SE aspect. Long carry at low water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Toilets, playground. Picnic area.
properties.other_comments: Large parking lot. Cadboro-Gyro Park 6 ha District of Saanich park with beach access. See: <Cadboro-Gyro Park

properties.title: Tudor Beach
properties.landing_comments: Steps lead down to sand beach. NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: At end of Tudor Avenue. Area of large residences. Might also be known as Spring Bay, but no official name found. Municipality of Saanich.

properties.title: West Curme Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy in central cove at mid or high water. Small beach or rock shelf. Awkward at low water. Narrow channel dries. Reefs. Also in small bay on NE side at all tides.
properties.camp_comments: 9 wooden raised tent platforms on treed rock ledges, bluffs on W side. Vault toilet. Picnic area. No fires. Camping fees apply 1 June to 15 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at Lund or Okeover launch sites, but no reservable sites. Camp only at designated sites.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. E and W islands connect at mid, low water. See Desolation Sound Marine Provincial ParkPark Operator: 1312768 BC Ltd email DesolationSound.Camping@outlook.com

properties.title: Patricia Bay Park
properties.landing_comments: Narrow gravel, small cobble beach with limited access at high water. Good shelter. Ramp at top, steps below lead over steep bank. Larger beach next to airport 150 m to S has difficult access - fence or riprap bank.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Parking lot to S at Patricia Bay Park Information kiosk, picnic tables, washrooms with wheelchair accessible paved trails leading to beach, plus limited parking on road. West Saanich Road, District of North Saanich. General regulation bans parking over 24 hrs.

properties.title: Pig Ranch north
properties.landing_comments: Easy on low gradient firm clam bed beach with cobble, pebble surface in protected bay. No beach at high water. Drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: Semi-exposed, unattractive 2 sites in trees. Camping on point to S not permitted. Occasional use by commercial groups.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. Views. See Qwiquallaaq/Boat Bay Conservancy.

properties.title: Broken Islands Havannah Channel
properties.landing_comments: Easy, rough pebble/cobble beaches, reefs, kelp, sheltered cove NE side of largest island.
properties.camp_comments: Semi-developed camp in forest or small rough beach sites between logs. Beach on NW side might offer another option depending on number of drift logs. Not used often. Windthrown trees might block some tent sites and/or create hazards for camping.
properties.other_comments: Views, wildlife.

properties.title: Kaikash Creek
properties.landing_comments: Easy, on firm gravel, pebble/cobble. At low water avoid larger rocks at centre beach. Vessel traffic, exposed.
properties.camp_comments: Extensive site along old road. Composting toilet. Site needs some maintenance (2022). Picnic tables in disrepair. Adjacent commercial site has irregular tent platforms, other structures but is not part of public site.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. View. Whale watching information sign. Good wind protection. Site maintained by Namgis First Nation. Adjacent site receives heavy use by guided groups.

properties.title: Naka Creek
properties.landing_comments: Easy on gravel, pebble beach. Exposed. See Naka Creek hand launch.
properties.camp_comments: Semi exposed developed site. Pit toilet. Picnic tables. At least one party camped on breakwater at N50D 28.733M,W 126D 25.19M (WGS84).
properties.other_comments: Water from culvert above the rec site - use at own risk. Road access via Eve Main and Naka Main but could be rough. Eve Main is active logging road, use mobile radio (June 2025). Parking. View. Boat launch. Caretaker occasionally. No fee charged but some paddlers have been asked to pay. Robson Bight whale rubbing beach, is over 5km away AND is closed to all entry. Not even kayakers may enter the bay.

properties.title: Nichols Bay
properties.landing_comments: Deep bay with steep pebble, gravel beaches. SE aspect. Many piled drift logs make landing difficult at mid, high water.  Beach normally floods. Well protected from W. Open to SE swell. Wash from N bound ships comes ashore. Reporter in 2024 considered high water landing too dangerous to attempt due to drift log pileup.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Small areas of beach gravel give access to small cleared upland forest site on NE of bay. Minor brushing may be needed. Clearcut behind. Beach sites might be possible at Neaps, avoiding carry over drift logs, deadfall.
properties.other_comments: Usable for NW conditions at low water but marginal.

properties.title: Waterfall Beach
properties.landing_comments: Moderate on pebble beach, exposed to NW. Some shelter in creek mouth.
properties.camp_comments: Hazardous. Upland forest site 50 m S of creek in front of small cliff had rockfall 2021 May 2023 report of difficult access, also fallen tree at waterfall, At Neaps potential beach camp next to drift logs.
properties.other_comments: Water at small falls, likely year-round. View.

properties.title: Walkem Point
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient silty clam bed at low water. Cobble, scattered boulders, pebble at high water. Existing boat runs in need of maintenance. Various other pebble beaches along shores to E.
properties.camp_comments: Beach sites feasible at tides below 4.1 m. Extensive open third growth forest, thinned some years ago. Several level areas. Big spruce tree at main beach site, upland access.
properties.other_comments: Water at braided seasonal creek crosses centre beach. View. Aka North of Walkem Islands.

properties.title: Sonora Island southwest
properties.landing_comments: Easy on low gradient gravel, cobble beach in shallow bay. Riprap breakwater protects N side. Exposed SW aspect. 50 m carry at low water. Currents offshore. Ship wash. Prominent rock pile at entrance.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped, sheltered large inactive log dump. Grass, broom.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek, possibly year-round. View. Inactive log handling reserve. Old orchard, cabin. Aka Discovery Mountain Cove.

properties.title: Florence Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, mud, pebble beach with some larger rocks. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Small upland grassy site about 15 m up from beach or sites on beach except during Springs. Potential for more sites. Sheltered. SW aspect. Somewhat damp. Could be buggy.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. Report of year-round water at creek 200-300 m to N around point suitable for boat access. Staging for local channels. Some fish farm and other debris. Possibly a former or inactive log dump.

properties.title: Little Bear Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy, gravel/pebble/cobble, exposed, vessel traffic, currents, wind. Land at river mouth between camp sites..
properties.camp_comments: Developed. Picnic tables. Heavy RV use. pit toilet, picnic tables, fire rings. Maintained.Nearby fish hatchery runs audible generator at all times.
properties.other_comments: Water at nearby creek. View Parking limited if not camping. See also launch site details. .

properties.title: Octopus west shore
properties.landing_comments: Beach inside S facing point. Easy on low gradient mud, pebble, clam bed beach adjacent to bedrock outcrops. SW aspect. Sheltered from most winds.
properties.camp_comments: Grassy upland sites on two lightly forested levels. Undeveloped user maintained wilderness site. Site was previously suggested 190 m SW across bay at muddier, lower gradient shore.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek 100 m to W in corner of bay. Attractive. View. Beach fires are banned all year round. See Octopus Islands Marine Park.

properties.title: South Rendezvous Island south
properties.landing_comments: Awkward in protected cove N of islet. Some rubble, gravel, pebble. Boulders at high water. All-weather protection. Boat run cleared of larger boulders. Boat may be lined out to W. Alternate approach to S of islet also has boat run but rougher except at tides below 1 m when N side shows awkward concrete retaining wall.
properties.camp_comments: Camp in sloping protected grassy meadow. Clear tent sites, some shaded. Open air pit toilet no longer serviceable (2024). Undeveloped user maintained wilderness camping. One tent site on islet. Hazardous tree snag noted 2024.
properties.other_comments: Possible but unreliable water at seasonal creek. Former homestead. Pilings of old boathouse. Attractive. Staging area for tidal rapids. See Rendezvous Island South Provincial Park

properties.title: Waiatt Bay south
properties.landing_comments: Easy on mud, pebble.
properties.camp_comments: At least one upland sloped dry site on duff above bank. Others on lower grassy wet areas that might flood at Springs. Potential for more sites. May be better tent sites slightly to W. Undeveloped user-maintained wilderness site.
properties.other_comments: Largest island to NE is recently acquired (2019) for Park. Has frequently visited old cabin full of memorabilia left by visitors. Beach fires are banned all year round. See Octopus Islands Marine Park.

properties.title: Waiatt Bay islet
properties.landing_comments: Awkward on bedrock ledges. Easy on gravel at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Open grassy bluffs at S end.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Beach fires are banned all year round. See Octopus Islands Marine Park.

properties.title: Freedom Point
properties.landing_comments: Moderate on beach of sharp angular cobble, pebble, rubble. Approach from S. Boat run cleared through larger rocks. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Large semi-developed site on point, could use more leveling. Other dispersed tent sites. Composting toilet along trail to NE away from shoreline. Warning: June 2025 hazardous tree along path to rear tent sites- caution.
properties.other_comments: Water at small seasonal creek. Staging for Surge Narrows. Occasionally used by large groups. Aka Surge Point - so named on topo maps but Surge Pt proper lies to N.

properties.title: Frederic Point
properties.landing_comments: Moderate on steep gravel, cobble, rubble, rock beach. Small rocks at low water. Boulders to 600 mm at high water. Fish farm metal barrier hard to see. Landing at point feasible only in calm conditions. Otherwise cove to W is better with moderately long gear carry.  SW to NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Rough tent sites with minor brushing. Potential for more sites. Mossy bedrock bluffs.
properties.other_comments: View. Attractive, sensitive natural area. Wildflowers. Inactive shellfish lease. but debris remains from it.

properties.title: Whale Passage
properties.landing_comments: Approach from S. Rough rock-strewn entrance lip to small gravel basin at high water. Awkward with kelp, weed at low water. Boats arriving at low water could be tied nearby until basin floods to give easier access or face long carry. Advisable to land at mid-high water. SW aspect. Exposed to S.
properties.camp_comments: Small fairly level upland bluff sites in 2 areas on peninsula among arbutus, firs. Some tent sites overlook passage to E. One panoramic site on open mossy bluff has active eagle nest May 2018, 2019. Stay 100 m away Mar to Aug. Site to S with possible easier access off separate beach short distance to S.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Oyster lease at foreshore inactive but some debris remains (2024).

properties.title: Penn Islands southwest
properties.landing_comments: Mixed exposed beach of varying gradient. Easy at high water on tides of 4 m or greater on gravel, pebble medium gradient with small boat run.  Awkward to difficult at all lower water levels on steep beach of boulders, smaller mixed rocks, Boulders to sides, reefs in W approach. S aspect. Could be hazardous in S wind, swell. Report in 2024 of blowdown trees in landing area.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. 1 good site on mossy W bluff, 2 other feasible with brushing but sloped or lumpy. 1 or 2 beach sites if levelled, but might flood at Springs. Be aware of hazardous tree reported at W bluff and other blowdowns.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Wildlife viewing.

properties.title: Bay south of Von Donop
properties.landing_comments: Long low gradient beach on mixed rocks. NW aspect. Reported at N50.171283D, W-124.986667D outside bay proper, but more likely location is N50.170864D, W124.986805D nearer to bay head.
properties.camp_comments: Marginal sites at beach top or upland in sloping forest. Levelling, brushing likely needed. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Aquaculture in bay to N.

properties.title: Von Donop Inlet
properties.landing_comments: Boat run offers clear path through boulders on small steep beach. Easier access at high water. All weather protection. Tidal currents. Vessel traffic to anchorage.
properties.camp_comments: Large semi-developed user-maintained site. Some cleared sites on grassy headland. Beware of hazard trees. Fire pit.
properties.other_comments: Trails, reversing tidal rapids, lagoon nearby. Anchorage. Historic portage to Squirrel Cove. See Ha'thayim (Von Donop) Marine Provincial Park.

properties.title: Big Bay Beach Hanson Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy, on moderate gradient cobble beach in sheltered bay, with exposed rock shelf at low water. Large rocks at low water. SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Camping area is reserved for commercial group based on private lease from Yukusam Heritage Society.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. Attractive, sunny. Views, trails cross island, big cedar tree. Sundance lookout, Orca lab, whale viewing. Structures at W end of beach left behind from former youth camp and debris to be removed (2014) but still present in 2020. Avoid using mossy rock bluff S of beach close to adjacent commercial site in narrow bay around point (i.e.Shakers or Big Bay Point).

properties.title: Little Hanson Island
properties.landing_comments: Moderately difficult rock, rubble - shelf between two northerly islands in sheltered channel between Hanson Island and Little Hanson. Usable at mid, high water levels. Landing, launching at water levels below 1.5 m not recommended. Signs of a narrow boat run. Strong currents, rough water in Blackney Passage. Vessel traffic.
properties.camp_comments: Semi exposed, part developed. Tent sites on exposed rock, or on soil among trees. Sites strung along trail around S end of island also on smaller island to S.
properties.other_comments: Views. Aka Island 61 or Blackney Passage Island. One of the only 4 sites on Hanson I that are sanctioned by Yukusam Heritage Society for public use.

properties.title: Blinkhorn Peninsula
properties.landing_comments: Easy on pebble, cobble beach sheltered by peninsula. Land either side. NE side cobbles, some boulders at high water. SE side small smooth pebbles. Vessel traffic.
properties.camp_comments: Sheltered forest upland camping in 3 locations or on large beach. Picnic table. Composting toilet. Site maintained through contract with Namgis First Nation. Number of sites reported as 9 in 2025. See SCR297 for camp location details.
properties.other_comments: Seasonal creek. Whale viewing. Anchorage. Historic hiking trail to Telegraph Cove. Hiking trail across islet to navigational marker.

properties.title: Growler Cove northwest
properties.landing_comments: Easy on rock, pebble beach at head of prominent protected bay. Many boulders, bedrock outcrops at low water. Cobble, small angular rocks above. Evidence of boat run at centre beach. Gradient moderate to steep. SE aspect. Protected from NW. Rocks offshore.
properties.camp_comments: Sheltered, undeveloped. Tent sites in open forest along flagged trail or on beach, tides permitting. Additional sites if brushed. Hammock opportunities. Fire pit.
properties.other_comments: Views. Occasional use by commercial groups. See Qwiquallaaq/Boat Bay Conservancy.

properties.title: Little Blenkinsop Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy, on white sand. Low gradient. Dries a long distance.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on beach or in forest clearings. JK guide has camp at 50 28.95N 126 01.64W. Some sites are adjacent to logged area further from creek.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. Aka West Blenkinsop Cove on Cruising Planner map.

properties.title: Pine Point
properties.landing_comments: Exposed beach of pebble, cobble. NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: On E side of point, camping unknown. Likely in upland, needing much brushing. Previous to 2022 site was at now-commercial site on W side of point run by Grey Wolf Expeditions. Might have space for limited number of public visitors in sheltered undeveloped clearing behind trees, reported to be overgrown 2021 but cleared more recently. Pit toilet reported to be unusable but likely repaired. Some trees reported to be hazardous.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal or year-round substantial creek. View.

properties.title: Camp Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy on low gradient, broad, pebble, gravel beach. Exposed to NW. Current hazards, turbulence. Vessel traffic.
properties.camp_comments: Large undeveloped site.
properties.other_comments: Road access in past. Aka Prince of Wales Bay. Large 33 Ha. site.

properties.title: Turn Bay west
properties.landing_comments: Easy on broad low gradient sheltered mixed beach of pebble, cobble. Mostly floods at high water. S aspect. Protected by island, islet.
properties.camp_comments: Small upland sloped forest sites will need minor brushing. One possible beach top site seems dry at all tides. Hammock opportunities. Potential for many sites.
properties.other_comments: Seasonal creek at site. View.

properties.title: Frances Bay head
properties.landing_comments: Moderate on low gradient boulder, cobble, pebble beach, exposed to SE. May be long carry.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped in upland forest. Dense vegetation at water's edge makes access awkward.
properties.other_comments: Water at 2 creeks - at head of bay or in Raza Passage. View. Temporary logging float camp 2013-2014. Anchorage.

properties.title: Raza Point
properties.landing_comments: Moderate on steep cobble, boulder beach in protected cove. Boat run clear of boulders. NE aspect. Rougher landing at S aspect beach also within Recreation Reserve.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Small gloomy cleared upland forest sites, reported as needing brushing, levelling 2021 & 2022. Hammock opportunities. Well sheltered.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. Trail between bays. Peninsula 16 ha area is all Recreation Reserve incl S beach. Some industrial debris.

properties.title: Shipwreck Bluff
properties.landing_comments: Sheltered coves on either side of promontory. Easy silty, muddy clam bed on W side. Easier but longer carry at low water. Cobbles, rock, sand in E cove. Hazardous derelict dock tied up in W bay (June 2025).
properties.camp_comments: Semi-developed in small clearings in 2 upland areas - at promontory neck or in forest behind boat wreck along short trail.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Staging for local channels. Old roadbed beyond wreck reported hazardous in places. Lake 500 m N on road network.

properties.title: North Rendezvous Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy, shell beach at high tide, moderate, many boulders at low tide. On a small islet joined by rocky tombolo to NW of N Rendezvous Island. Boats may be lined out to W of cobble tombolo.
properties.camp_comments: 4 site in upland in trees on islet plus room for 1 small tent. Fire pit. 25 m carry at low water. Sites brushed out 2025. Additional site in trees on larger N Rendezvous facing across tombolo on S shore - see site plan. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: View. Aka North Rendezvous Islet. Most of N Rendezvous Island is private land. Strathcona Regional District mapping shows adjacent lot of 4.14 ha as Regional Park - Rendezvous Park, so not private.

properties.title: Whiterock Passage
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient tombolo clam bed of gravel, mud, sand connects to isthmus. Shoals. Approach from SW or from N. Long carry at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Upland sites in old growth forest approx. 80 m S or SE of tombolo. Additional exposed small sites on dry, grassy area or on rocky isthmus.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek 100 m to SE of forest camp. View. Cabin ruins not seen 2024. Inactive shellfish lease (2009, 2018). Debris remains 2018. Was active 2004. Land nearby to S appears to be private.

properties.title: South Rendezvous Island north
properties.landing_comments: Gravel, pebble at low water. Moderate with some boulders at higher water. Between headlands. Can launch from rocks. Exposed to N. Reported in Aug 2021 landing (low tide) and launching (high tide) challenging. Rocks at centre beach are hard to carry a boat over. Numerous logs limit launch area at high water. Ramp cleared north of islet.
properties.camp_comments: Attractive cleared sites on headland E of beach. Undeveloped user maintained wilderness site. Please pay attention to good sanitation practices.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Views. Staging area for tidal rapids. Entire island is park. See Rendezvous Island South Provincial Park. Toilet appears to be repaired. Add dry leaves to it if no shavings.

properties.title: Ashlar Creek
properties.landing_comments: Easy, on pebble, cobble beach at all water levels. Larger rocks, mostly rounded, at low water. W aspect. Some protection from NW.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Large clearing in small trees. Suitable for groups.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round creek. View. Hiking trail leads inland from clearing to unknown destination. Beach fires are banned all year round.

properties.title: Discovery Creek
properties.landing_comments: Moderate on pebble, cobble beach depending on tide level. Exposed to SE, NE. Vessel traffic. Broad fan offers several landing locations including creek mouth.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Protected from wind.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round creek.

properties.title: Penn Islands north
properties.landing_comments: Easy on mixed gravel beach, some reefs. Lies in hook of land protected from most directions. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Three sites on grass, bedrock shelf on bluff with trail access. Short crude stair on trail. Three additional sites above landing, in open forest. Composting toilet. Hammock opportunities. Avoid camping near dead tree on bluff especially in high winds. Make no upland fires. Nearby islet to S offers 1 overflow tent site.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. View. Attractive, secluded site. Many other sites among these islands. Frequent use by large guided groups. Alert: The BCMT recently cleaned the site in mid-July but apparently a squatter is on site and has left a mess there. We will try and clean the site in late August or September.

properties.title: Carrington Point
properties.landing_comments: 2 small boat runs through rubble beach next to cliff. Beach mostly floods at high water. Moderate gradient. Inside islet with good protection. W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Clear tent sites in open forest. Marine debris makes access difficult.
properties.other_comments: View. Attractive. Trickle of water at seasonal creek. Poorer beach 200 m to NW. Likely possible to use sites behind that other beach via small trail. Carrington Bay Park, Strathcona Regional District.

properties.title: Maud Island Discovery Passage
properties.landing_comments: Easy on moderate gradient pebble, cobble beach, or on steeper causeway riprap in protected bay. SE aspect. Currents outside bay. Private float nearby. Difficult access from W.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Camping on Quadra shore adjacent to causeway on W or E side. Some shelter from NW, but wind may funnel. E side offers more protection. Possible alternative site at N 50D 7.923M,W 125D 20.278M not assessed.
properties.other_comments: Near former Ripple Rock. Access hiking trail maintained by RSTBC. Anchorage. Reported small tidal electric generating plant in causeway to island but nothing visible 2018. Aquaculture nearby in S bay. Purpose and ownership of float and gangway unknown - presumably energy company property. Saltwater lagoon nearby. Beach fires are banned all year round.

properties.title: Twin Islands Islet
properties.landing_comments: Rough oyster beaches of pebble, boulders, bedrock. One beach in small cove on NW side, another in small cove on SW or facing Twin Islands. Mostly protected but some landing sites exposed. Easier landing at high water. Avoid low. mid water levels - reported as hazardous  - oysters. Avoid use in Spring nesting season to protect resident Black Oystercatchers (shore birds).
properties.camp_comments: Upland clear areas on centre to W side 50 m from S side cove.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Small trails across islet. Larger islands are private.

properties.title: Roberts Creek Day Area
properties.landing_comments: 5% slope, low tide 150mm cobbles, high tide 50mm gravel to sand.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. (Vehicle accessible campground located 1400 m away up Park Avenue.) 1 pit toilet. No fires. 4 Picnic tables.
properties.other_comments: Good access from shore, road, seasonal water at tap, day parking. Would require special permission for paddlers to camp. See Roberts Creek Provincial Park

properties.title: Poett Nook
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing or launching on ramp in protected cove. Vessel traffic..
properties.camp_comments: See separate entry for adjacent commercial campsite.
properties.other_comments: Good staging point for Tzartus Island, Deer Group. Vehicle parking $8.00 per day (2024). $8.00 kayak/canoe launch fee (2024). http://www.poettnook.com/rates.html

properties.title: Port Desire
properties.landing_comments: See Grappler Inlet launch site.
properties.camp_comments: Small developed campground. Open grassed areas may lack privacy. Toilets, food bins, picnic area, playground, pay showers RV or boat pump-out station. Water at hoses. Gazebos, BBQ grills. Call 250 728-3006. Information Centre staffed through summer season. Pay phone available year round. Fee $26.50/night (2022). Email communityparks@mybamfield.ca
properties.other_comments: Close to village, amenities. Boat launch. Eileen Scott Centennial Park, 345 Grappler Rd, Bamfield. Parking $5/ day (2022).

properties.title: Cowichan Bay Marine Gateway
properties.landing_comments: Special canoe/kayak dock.  Need to be able to launch and land from a low dock.  Alternatively use beach beside dock. Short carry and easy launch. Avoid stepping on flower/plant garden.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Paddlecraft access/launch opened January 2013, managed by Cowichan Valley Regional District. Approx 60 m carry to dock. Overnight parking along road. Built to encourage paddlers not to use Hecate Park foreshore or Cowichan Bay Boat Launch ramp located at the south side of the large parking lot .

properties.title: Anderson Bay
properties.landing_comments: Protected cove. Inner rough beaches of cobble, rubble. Rock shelves at low water. S aspect.  Also smoother, easier beach moderate gradient on outer side of isthmus, N aspect. Cobble upper beach, gravel lower.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped on isthmus of peninsula. Fire pits. Small clearings in open forest. Low salal undergrowth.
properties.other_comments: View. Provincial Boat Haven. Inactive log dump on W bay shore. Head of bay is outside Park, has crown lease upland, low gradient silt beach, mudflats, flotsam at low water. Also reported as having public road access to or near shoreline. Island immediately to S has rough landing beach on N side for possible picnic site. See Anderson Bay Provincial Park.

properties.title: Little Tribune Bay
properties.landing_comments: Long sand beach with shingle, bedrock patches. Low gradient so long carry at low water. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Road access to beach via Little Tribune Road. Limited parking at road end with no overnight parking permitted.

properties.title: Mackenzie Anchorage
properties.land_tenure: Crown, Crown tenure - Section 17 designated use area
properties.landing_comments: No comments.
properties.camp_comments: Site might be up to 80m to N of indicated position.
properties.other_comments: Huu-ay-aht Treaty Settlement Land. Permit required

properties.title: Clarke Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected sand, shell beach that extends on both W, E sides of small point. Moderate gradient. Some rock outcrops.
properties.camp_comments: Open meadow. Camp among trees. Composting toilet. See: Brochure..Required 1) National Park Entry Pass if age 18 or older; 2) Backcountry Camping Permit $9.80 per person/night; 3) Site reservation. No standbys!; See: National Park PermitSee: Camping Permits & Reservations or 1-877-RESERVE
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Maximum stay 4 nights. Maximum group size 12. Several sandy lagoons on island.

properties.title: Dodd Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sheltered pebble beach of moderate gradient in natural harbour. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Camp in forest clearings. Composting toilet. Beach on south side better. N Beach only ok at high tide, has rock shelf at mid and lower tides. See: Brochure..Required 1) National Park Entry Pass if age 18 or older; 2) Backcountry Camping Permit $9.80 per person/night; 3) Site reservation. No standbys!; See: National Park Permit. See: Camping Permits & Reservations or 1-877-RESERVE
properties.other_comments: Historic fish traps in adjacent bay. Maximum stay 4 nights. Maximum group size 12.

properties.title: Willis Island
properties.landing_comments:
This site is currently closed. Site closures may occur for a variety of reasons, including environmental protection, weather-related damage, safety concerns, or directives from First Nations. BC Marine Trails will update this site’s status as new information becomes available. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation in helping preserve these areas for future generations.

Notice: closed by Parks Canada in association with Tseshaht First Nation. A large windstorm damaged the area including the composting toilet.
properties.camp_comments: nan
properties.other_comments: nan

properties.title: Charlaine Boat Ramp
properties.landing_comments: Mixed pebble, sand, mud beach or concrete boat ramp. N aspect. Good protection from most directions except N.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Located on Hammond Bay Road. Sign. Paved day parking only (2017). Portable toilet. City of Nanaimo park, boat launch.

properties.title: Turret Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected shell, sand beach at NW end of Turret I. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Sheltered sites under giant spruce. Composting toilet. See: Brochure.. Required 1) National Park Entry Pass if age 18 or older; 2) Backcountry Camping Permit $9.80 per person/night; 3) Site reservation. No standbys! See: National Park Permit. See: Camping Permits & Reservations or 1-877-RESERVE.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Maximum stay 4 nights. Maximum group size 12. Visible midden. Very large trees.

properties.title: Hand Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected tombolo shell beaches. Aspects SE or NW. Reefs offshore.
properties.camp_comments: Open, grassy area. Composting toilet. See: Brochure.. Required 1) National Park Entry Pass if age 18 or older; 2) Backcountry Camping Permit $9.80 per person/night; 3) Site reservation. No standbys! See: National Park Permit. See: Camping Permits & Reservations or 1-877-RESERVE.
properties.other_comments: Maximum stay 4 nights. Maximum group size 12. Closest of Broken Group islands to Secret Beach popular launch site.

properties.title: Gibraltar Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, gravel beach.
properties.camp_comments: Campsite exposed to Imperial Eagle Channel. Composting toilet. See: Brochure. Required 1) National Park Entry Pass if age 18 or older; 2) Backcountry Camping Permit $9.80 per person/night; 3) Site reservation. No standbys! See: National Park Permit. See: Camping Permits & Reservations or 1-877-RESERVE
properties.other_comments: Views. Maximum stay 4 nights. Maximum group size 12. Toilet is in poor condition probably because of over use in popular and crowded site

properties.title: Long Bay Jedediah Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy on firm mud beach in protected bay at mid-high water i.e. approx. 2.0 m or higher but drying mud flat at low water. Tides above 4 m leave no foreshore. Boats must be carried up grass slope if not left at anchor to settle in mud. Alternative landings in coves to W on Bull Passage - Sunset, Otter Coves.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on roomy grass bank. Unofficial capacity very high. Pit toilet. Optional approach from adjacent Otter, Sunset Coves avoiding low water mud flat, but camping discouraged In those coves because of distance to toilet. Camping fees apply 15 May to 15 September. May pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites. Fee $5.00 per person per night (2019) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. 3.5 km of hiking trails. See Jedediah Island Provincial Marine Park

properties.title: Porpoise Bay Wharf
properties.landing_comments: Concrete ramp in sheltered inlet next to floats, large public wharf.  Posted ramp fee of $5 (2017) exempts paddlecraft. Alternate undeveloped landing just to W has high step.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Water at tap. View. Many amenities, accommodation, pub, restaurant, marina nearby. Float plane air service. Unlimited free day parking, $10 per night (2017) 3 day limit. Kayak, cabin rentals adjacent immediately to W. N terminus of 1 km portage route from Trail Bay.

properties.title: Gilbert Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected sand, gravel beach with some rubble. NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Sheltered site in open forest. Composting toilet. See: Brochure.. Required 1) National Park Entry Pass if age 18 or older..2) Backcountry Camping Permit $9.80 per person/night..3) Site reservation. No standbys! See: National Park Permit...See: Camping Permits & Reservations or 1-877-RESERVE
properties.other_comments: Maximum stay 4 nights. Maximum group size 12. Water source on Effingham I.

properties.title: Escalante River
properties.landing_comments:
Easy to difficult access to river depending on swell height. Rocks exposed at low tides.
Can have landing issues due to surf, but if you go past rocks at Escalante point north there is a small cove that is sheltered.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on upland, or on sand at S bank of river mouth. Exposed. Lots of area to set up tents on sand by the river. Water was running very well in June, very clean, and a couple of spots to swim in. Beautiful beach that runs into Escalante north where there are more camp sites on sand also trail starts here to Escalante south look for buoy in tree for start.
properties.other_comments: Water upstream in river. Brackish at mouth. Attractive. View. Huge Recreation Site 111 Ha area runs S to Escalante Point N.

properties.title: Crib Island
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient beach of mud, sand with many small boulders at low water.  S aspect. Protected. Long carry at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on high bench in trees behind large boulder on beach. Beach sites possible at Neaps but beach floods at Springs.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek to W of tent sites. Attractive. Aka Sunday Harbour. See Broughton Archipelago Provincial Park

properties.title: Pearl Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on protected beach. Low gradient clam bed of mud at low water. Mixed boulder, cobble, rubble beach of moderate gradient at high water. Weed-covered boulders at low water are best avoided by attention to timing. Evidence of old boat run.
properties.camp_comments: Some tent sites might require brushing. Not used much. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: See Broughton Archipelago Provincial Park

properties.title: Coopers Green tituls
properties.landing_comments: Easy, on moderate gradient gravel, sand beach in Lyons Cove. Concrete ramp. Protected by islet. SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilets. Large grassy area, picnic tables. Volleyball court, horseshoe pit, BBQ pit, change rooms, Large hall with kitchen, fireplace. Hall redevelopment planned.
properties.other_comments: Free unrestricted parking in locations outside park off Redrooffs Road or Fishermans Road. Main parking lot for boat trailers marked as no overnight parking. Enforcement of roadside parking overnight ban on Fishermans Rd is complaint driven - unlikely to result in ticket if parked respectfully. Hiking trail in wetlands. Site also used by divers. Please keep boat ramp clear of gear, boats, cars. See Coopers Green Regional Park. Sunshine Coast Regional District. Located at 5500 Fishermans Road, Halfmoon Bay.tituls means big rocks in shashishalhem, the Sechelt language.

properties.title: Log Boom Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected gravel beach in shallow cove, generally not used for anchorage. Completely dries at low water. To paddle in requires 2.0 m or higher water level.
properties.camp_comments: Not approved for camping by BC Parks. Pleasant grassed area overlooks bay head. Pit or vault toilet along trail towards Deep Bay approx 400 m.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. 3.5 km of hiking trails. See Jedediah Island Provincial Marine Park

properties.title: Laura Bay
properties.landing_comments: Sloping bedrock shelves In sheltered cove. Some sand. Numerous boulders make carrying gear hazardous.
properties.camp_comments: Sites In trees on N side of cove head. One view site overlooks sea.
properties.other_comments: Popular anchorage. Provincial Boat Haven, hence less privacy than many other sites. Passage at Trivett Island navigable by paddlecraft at high water. Seldom used by paddlers.

properties.title: John Island northwest
properties.landing_comments: Sheltered shell, sand, mud beach NW aspect. Reported 2025 that site coordinates may be wrong. Suggest looking at beach 250 metres to SW.
properties.camp_comments: Access up moderately steep bank via overgrown trail to upland sites, needing brushing mostly of dense salal.
properties.other_comments: Spring tides may leave little room for boat storage. See Broughton Archipelago Park.

properties.title: Wakhana Bay
properties.landing_comments: Beach in sheltered inlet. Sand at low water. Boulders, smaller rocks above. Awkward access at high water due to rock scramble, also at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Semi-developed camp S of creek. Evidence of commercial or group use (2012). Largely overgrown (2020), marginal. Requires heavy brushing. Possible to fit 2 small tent on trail to lake. Recently logged nearby (2020).
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round creek. Trail to lake 800 m but bushy at 300 m.

properties.title: Battle Bay
properties.land_tenure: Treaty Settlement Land designated for public access
properties.landing_comments: Easy all tide landing on wide sand beach. Some surf on W side.
properties.camp_comments: Many beach sites or 5 cleared, flat tent sites in trees. One site is large enough for 2 tents. Note that no camping is permitted at nearby Battle River and Acous Peninsula which are in private Treaty Settlement Lands.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round creek at E corner. Hose makes water collection easy. Pool for bathing but maybe seasonal. Attractive, View. Anchorage - Provincial Boat Haven. Formerly part of Mquqwin Brooks Peninsula Provincial Park, now public access Treaty Settlement Land under the Maa_nulth Treaty. Park boundary nearby to E.

properties.title: Lord Waterfall
properties.landing_comments: Easy. on small pebble, cobble beach, with mostly boulders at high water. 150 m SE of creek.
properties.camp_comments: Small headland and cleared patch above. Little shade. Old road bed provides further sites if elderberry brushed.
properties.other_comments: Water at large year-round creek. Trail to creek. Waterfall, swim hole. View. Fish farm nearby.

properties.title: Santiago Creek
properties.landing_comments: Land N of creek by sign on beach of gravel, rock 2-10 cm, occasional boulders, protected from S. Other adjacent beaches of cobble. Channel winds can be strong but currents not a factor. Vessel traffic.
properties.camp_comments: Site currently closed by RSTBC. Danger trees in area and caution is warranted until removal. Many sites on clear grass area, also in forest behind. 2 picnic tables in disrepair; one useable. Pit toilet in good condition (2025). Site maintenance needed. Fire pits.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. Former dock removed, so site unlikely to be used by power boaters in future. Sunny, but somewhat buggy.

properties.title: Saltery Bay Esperanza Inlet
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected shallow gradient alluvial fan beach of mixed gravel, cobble.
properties.camp_comments: One site at top of beach. Several sites accessed via rocky creek beds in upland forest. Large area, but rough, bushy. Brushing likely needed. Likely to be damp in wet weather.
properties.other_comments: Water at small creek. Strategic location.

properties.title: Oyster Beach
properties.landing_comments: Protected small beach in protected cove at point. Land on gravel, mixed rocks, scattered boulders.
properties.camp_comments: Established small campsite on terrace. 3 separate gravel tent sites. Pit toilet. Group fire ring.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. Marginal anchorage. Former shellfish aquaculture location. See Mount Richardson Provincial Park

properties.title: Stud Islets
properties.landing_comments: Steep white shell, sand beach, SW aspect. SW aspect. May be subject to dumping waves but islet in front offers some protection.
properties.camp_comments: Pleasant upland for at least4 campsites. Beach sites at most tides. Rustic kitchen area. Poorly placed fire pit.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Well-used by paddlers, fishers.

properties.title: Tsusiat Falls
properties.landing_comments: Exposed. Surf likely. Bedrock shelves.
properties.camp_comments: Beach site heavily used by hikers. Composting toilet. Food storage bins.
properties.other_comments: Prominent waterfall. Landing or camping on the West Coast Trail is not permitted and could result in fines, except in emergency situations.

properties.title: Francis Island
properties.landing_comments: Land either side of sheltered sand tombolo at N end. Rocky at lower tides. Protected from swell.
properties.camp_comments: Some paddlers have camped below high water mark when tides permit.
properties.other_comments: Convenient for access by boat to Ucluelet, but overland route crosses private land.

properties.title: Thrasher Cove
properties.landing_comments: Sheltered sand beach.
properties.camp_comments: Arrive early for best site. Toilet.
properties.other_comments: Desirable designated stop, strategically located for paddlers. Also located near end of West Coast hiking Trail. Landing or camping on the West Coast Trail is not permitted and could result in fines, except in emergency situations.

properties.title: Sombrio Beach
properties.landing_comments: Popular surfing beach. Might be difficult for canoe, kayak landings in heavy surf conditions. River mouth gives easier landing opportunity. Steep in places. Mixed cobble, sand.
properties.camp_comments: Camping permitted beach camping pads at W end. Bear cache. Pit toilet. Camping fees apply year-round. May pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites. Fee $10.00 per adult per night (2018) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System.
properties.other_comments: Well used by hikers. On JDF hiking trail. 1-2 km to trailhead vehicle access. 500 m carry to beach from trailhead. See: Juan de Fuca Provincial Park.

properties.title: Mystic Beach
properties.landing_comments: Exposed. Expect some surf. Beach mostly of sand.
properties.camp_comments: 10 platforms added 2023/24. 2 food bins. Small sites at top of beach. Pit toilet. Camping fees apply year-round. May pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites. Fee $10.00 per adult per night (2018) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System.
properties.other_comments: Hiker use. On JDF hiking trail. 2 km to trailhead vehicle access, lots of day hikers, campers especially at summer weekends. See: Juan de Fuca Provincial Park.

properties.title: Esquimalt Lagoon
properties.landing_comments: Easy. Short carry. Outer protected sand, gravel beach on spit near mouth of lagoon. Kayak, canoe access permitted to lagoon
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Toilets but location not known.
properties.other_comments: Access via Lagoon Road. Park near end E of Ocean Boulevard. Migratory Bird Sanctuary managed by Canadian Wildlife Service encompasses lagoon, adjacent lands within 100 m of high water. City of Colwood park. Walking trail, swimming, wildlife viewing.

properties.title: Jordan River
properties.landing_comments: Cobble, pebble beach. Land in river mouth near bridge on E bank. Beware of pilings. See image for best approach. Surf somewhat likely.
properties.camp_comments: 4 pit or vault toilets. Year-round campground. Walk-in sites with tent pads, RV sites. Fire rings. Unofficial sites may serve as overflow.. No reservations - first come, first served. Fees charged via drop box.
properties.other_comments: Limited water at drinking station. Vehicle access. View. Adjacent to highway. 3.5 km cobble beach. Hiking trails. Jordan River Regional Park, 187 ha. Capital Regional District. See: Jordan River Regional Park.

properties.title: French Beach
properties.landing_comments: Subject to moderate surf. Cobble, steep in places.
properties.camp_comments: No beach camping permitted. Developed sites 500m from beach but group site is closer. Pit toilets, picnic tables.
properties.other_comments: Water at tap. 5 min trail to campsite. Vehicle access - gated for group site closer to beach. French Beach

properties.title: Gerald Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected pebble moderate gradient beach. WSW aspect. Other beaches suitable depending on wind, swell direction. SW side normally preferred. NW cove gravel, cobble, some boulders, SE cove cobble with many drift logs. Other pebble beaches may also be suitable. The trail developing over the South bluffs provides some lovely Georgia Strait views without impacting the more sensitive vegetation on the north trail (Deer lichen).
properties.camp_comments: Day Use only permitted. Several level day use areas on upper beach pebble berm, other upland areas. No facilities or services.
properties.other_comments: Ongoing volunteer efforts to control Invasive invasive plants growing on parts of island, Spring cleanup work (2025) has been a huge benefit: species such as Ocean Spray and Bleeding Heart are cropping up in cleared areas. Some rare plants. Attractive. Park created 2013. Management plan not yet prepared (2024). Area 12 ha. See: Gerald Island Provincial Park.

properties.title: Whytecliff Park
properties.landing_comments: Protected sand, gravel beach. Drift logs. Beach accessed on foot 200 m from parking area on broad paved ramp. Narrower concrete ramp to water often blocked by tidal debris.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: District of West Vancouver park located at end of 7000 block Marine Drive. Parking, water at tap, toilets, barbecues, playground, ramp for divers with disabilities, outdoor shower, picnic shelter, picnic tables. Seasonal food services. Scuba diving area. Marine Protected Area. Swimming. Hiking trails. Day parking fees for 2024 in effect daily, year-round, 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. $3.75 per hour, plus tax. Residents of West Vancouver may buy $20 annual pass.
