Park reported to be normally ungated so early/late departures feasible, Overnight parking only by prior arrangement.

properties.title: Chaster Creek
properties.landing_comments: Exposed beach 5% grade, of gravel, round pebbles to 100 mm. Open W aspect, drift logs. Small estuary might give easier access in wind.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilets.
properties.other_comments: Aka Chaster Park, Bonnybrook Beach. 1577 Ocean Beach Esplanade. From Hwy 101 take Pratt Road, right on Gower Point Road to Ocean Beach Esplanade. Ample nose-in parking. 2.1 ha waterfront park. Sunshine Coast Regional District park.

properties.title: Secret Beach Gower Point
properties.landing_comments: Exposed pebble beach, some boulders at high water. Drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: 5 parking places. From Hwy.101 turn down Pratt Road, left on Gower Point Road. Park access to right before sharp corner. Trail, long concrete stairs lead to beach. Sunshine Coast Regional District park.

properties.title: Ocean Beach Esplanade north
properties.landing_comments: Sand, pebbles, up to 100mm cobbles, 5% slope, logs, slight 2m rise to road and parking,
properties.camp_comments: No camping
properties.other_comments: Parking at N end of Ocean Beach Esplanade, long beach, portable toilets near centre, residential housing on east side of road

properties.title: Snug Cove Kwíl’aḵm
properties.landing_comments: Sand, gravel, angular cobble beach at cove head, beyond marina. Completely protected. Alternative at small beach or at adjacent government dock next to ferry terminal.
properties.camp_comments: Day use only at large park. No camping. Toilets, picnic tables.
properties.other_comments: Large foreshore park. Historic Davies Orchard. Easy roll-on ferry access. Water, services nearby. Restaurants, pub. Extensive hiking trails. Crippen Regional Park - Metro Vancouver Regional District. Squamish (Coast Salish) name Kwíl’aḵm. Paddlecraft rentals near government dock. Walking trail to Dorman Point lookout.

properties.title: Bargain Harbour
properties.landing_comments: Protected small low gradient beach of pebble, silt near head of harbour.. SW aspect. Easy foot access 50 m. on grassy gravel roadway.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: End of Bargain Harbour Road off Hwy 101. Parking restrictions unknown but no signed restrictions. Avoid private property. Roadway access to former gravel boat launch now has concrete blocks to stop vehicle access to beach.

properties.title: Hopkins Wharf
properties.landing_comments: Gravel, sand beach, low gradient, SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Foot of Hopkins Road. Long pedestrian wharf, float. Float unsuited to paddlecraft. Beach access, no or very restricted street parking, please respect signage, access to residences. Hopkins Landing Dock owned, managed by Sunshine Coast Regional District.

properties.title: salalus
properties.landing_comments: Community dock with floats. Small gravel beaches. Public concrete boat ramp, additional  private ramp..
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Parking on streets behind, Water, toilets, showers, provisions. Public transportation. Launch donation requested. Community of Madeira Park. Former name Madeira Park.

properties.title: Jervis Island
properties.landing_comments: Protected bay inside Bunny Island on W side. Beach of gravel, shell. W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Upland sites in treed grove above beach. Rustic wooden stairs lead up moderately steep bank. Rustic outhouse in need of maintenance.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Former homestead with built water catchment basins, now defunct. Some trails reported to lead across island. Anchorage. See Sabine Channel Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Squitty Bay
properties.landing_comments: Approach from Little Squitty Bay, protected cove to S of cove with dock, park sign. Inside entrance on N shore, small pebble beach has moderate gradient. Less flotsam than other coves nearby, giving easy landing.  Alternate beach at cove head. Larger boats use  N'erly cove i.e. Squitty Bay with sign at narrow entrance. Government float with long-term boats usually moored there. Mostly rocky shores except at head.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. No fires. Large grassed area with trees. Road, small gravel parking lot. Vault toilet. 2 picnic tables. Juniper reserve to E separated by chain link fence to keep out deer, sheep.
properties.other_comments: Park offers no water - fresh water pump reported but not seen 2016, dock. See Squitty Bay Provincial Park. Original area 13 ha. Extended to 52 ha 2009.

properties.title: Horseshoe Bay Ch’axáỳ
properties.landing_comments: Sand, mud beach. Access down concrete steps. Private boat ramp also may be used for a fee.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Foreshore park. Nelson Ave closest loading zone to water. Long term parking available, water, toilets, accommodation, outdoor shower, provisions, other services. Ferry terminal access for roll-on boats awkward. Squamish (Coast Salish) name Ch’axáỳ.

properties.title: xwesam Pier
properties.landing_comments: Gravel, sand beach. Breakwater gives shelter on 2 sides, small creek mouth.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: 4 toilets, water at tap, day parking, picnic tables. Waterfront park next to beach, has a large pier with bench seats. View. Sunshine Coast Regional District park. Former name Roberts Creek Pier.

properties.title: Nelson Beach west
properties.landing_comments: Cobble beach with some boulders. Some protection from NW. Access could be difficult at high water. Beach probably floods.
properties.camp_comments: Forest very dense behind beach but up rocks on E side is small level point with room for 3 or more tents in upland forest. Some brushing needed.
properties.other_comments: Water at small creek. View.

properties.title: Stimson Reef
properties.landing_comments: Cobble beach with some boulders. S aspect. Reef gives some protection from NW.
properties.camp_comments: A few upland forest sites with potential for many more.
properties.other_comments: Water at small creek.

properties.title: Steamboat Bay
properties.landing_comments: Sheltered beach of small rocks, sand.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Protected site in trees, but gloomy, damp. Light brushing recommended. Hammock opportunities. Please remove upland fire ring hazard if visiting.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek.

properties.title: Vere Cove
properties.landing_comments: Sand, gravel, cobble low gradient beach in cove, open to W. Little beach at high water. Hazardous currents locally in Johnstone Strait.
properties.camp_comments: Upland forest sites for approx 6 tents in NE corner of cove subject to brushing. Upland sites might have overgrown. Only 1 beach tent site found by 2022 reporter. Beach unreliable at Springs. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek.

properties.title: Octopus Islands
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on rock ledges in protected bay on W of island.  Some low gradient grass, slimy mud. Sand at low water. Optional landing in rocky drying channel adjoining islet on S of island. Several other possible landing sites on shores of Park but specific information withheld at the request of local First Nation and BC Parks.
properties.camp_comments: Good upland sites among trees on grass and rock, accessed by trail. Avoid trampling wild flowers, other vegetation. Undeveloped user maintained dispersed sites throughout Park.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View.. Note that several large islands are private. Beach fires are banned all year round. See Octopus Islands Marine Park.

properties.title: East of Adam River
properties.landing_comments: Wide cobble beach. NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Some brushing in second growth forest needed. Beach camp possible at neaps.
properties.other_comments: No comments

properties.title: Mount Milner
properties.landing_comments: Moderately steep cobble, pebble beach. Currents. Landing has short vertical log on beach near high water, NW of main creek.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Semi-clear upland area on large level site among alders. Inactive log dump. Old roadways. Alternative beach sites on gravel at Neaps.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. Road access in past.

properties.title: Nelson Road Community Boat Launch
properties.land_tenure: Regional, Road end right of way
properties.landing_comments: Easy on public concrete boat ramp or adjacent sand beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Portable toilet.
properties.other_comments: At E end of Nelson Road off Barnes Road. Aka Cedar Boat Ramp. Used as trailer, cartop boat launch. Limited day only parking so recommended for day use only. Please load/unload quickly at 2 vehicle space on S side of ramp, instead on ramp itself. Nanaimo Regional District leases community ramp as park. Several parking tickets have been given out by the police (2019). Paddlers have been blocking the ramp for lengthy periods of time. Please respect this community.

properties.title: Courtenay River
properties.landing_comments: Easy at concrete ramp. At low tide, river has marginal depth.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Kayak shop. Provisions. Accommodation. Parking unknown. Address shown as Courtenay Marina Park, 510 Courtenay Riverway Heritage Walk, V9N 3S3

properties.title: Idol Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy.
properties.camp_comments: No camping
properties.other_comments: Undeveloped, exposed.

properties.title: Dinner Rock
properties.landing_comments: Exposed cobble, pebble bedrock beach with 2 boat runs. Easy in calm weather, but not recommended for all conditions. Look for road end, levelled campsites with tables approx 0.8 NM to NNE of Dinner Rock itself - prominent islet with cross on top. Shoreline mostly steep, rocky except for roadway.
properties.camp_comments: 2023 RSTBC Notice: Site Closed. Site is closed for overnight camping to address public safety concerns and impacts to the land.Developed campground, pit toilets, picnic tables, fire pits. Open year-round. Well-spaced secluded sites in steep forest. Other unofficial sites on nearby bluffs or at top of beach, tides permitting. Some sites have view over Malaspina Strait. No fees charged (2023).
properties.other_comments: Some seasonal surface water, seeps. View. Used by SCUBA divers and others. Car top boat launch. Hiking trails. 18 km N of Powell River on Hwy 101. 3 km S of Lund. Turn at sign down steep 1.5 km hill. Site is partly located on Tla'amin treaty settlement land and managed in partnership with Tla'amin Nation.

properties.title: North Copeland Kwukwutays
properties.landing_comments: Steep protected gravel beaches NW and SE of camp area for all tide levels except NW access beach dries extensively at lowest water levels -  long carry then required. Boulder-free boat run in NW bay.
properties.camp_comments: 21 raised wooden tent pads in open forest or on points, some accessible from NW others from SE landings. Fence separate island. 2 composting toilets. Picnic area, table. No fires. Camping fees apply 1 June to 15 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at Lund or Okeover launch sites, but no reservable sites. Camp only at designated sites.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. See Copeland Islands Marine Park

properties.title: Lund
properties.landing_comments: 2 concrete ramps, wharf, floats. Launch fee charged both in and out $4 (2021).  Back down ramp rather than carry boats & gear but note that !0 min only allowed.
properties.camp_comments: Commercial campsite in area.
properties.other_comments: Flush toilets, water at tap, showers for dock patrons. Pay parking available by inquiring at Hotel. Stores, restaurants, accommodation. Lund Harbour Authority.

properties.title: Sarah Point
properties.landing_comments: Exposed rough boulder beach in bay lies 250 m ESE of Sarah Pt site where map icon is displayed. SW aspect. Long carry to camp at position of icon. Some platforms might be accessible closer to landing beach. Hiker drop-off point used by water taxi unsuited to landing, unloading paddlecraft.
properties.camp_comments: Landing beach is near mid-point between park ten platforms at Sarah Point and cabin at Sarah Point trailhead. 4 tent pads in upland 200 - 300 m WNW of landing beach accessed by trail up steep bluffs. Composting toilet also vault toilet at trail head. No fires. Also poor but possible beach camping. Camping fees apply 1 June to 15 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at Lund or Okeover launch sites, but no reservable sites. Camp only at designated sites. Public cabin, toilet located at separate Recreation Site approx. 300 m to SSE of landing along trail.
properties.other_comments: View, Site intended for hikers but not ideal for paddlers. At start of Sunshine Coast hiking Trail. View. Rough road access nearby to S from Bliss Landing 4 km. View. See Malaspina Provincial Park

properties.title: Althorp Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand in cove. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Upland sites in dense forest with salal may need brushing. Protected from W.
properties.other_comments: Clearcut behind beach. Fish farm in W cove. Occasional log storage in bay.

properties.title: Smelt Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, gravel, pebble beach. Sand shoal S of shoreline parking lot. Exposed to SW.
properties.camp_comments: Developed campground in trees about 300 m from beach via trail. Pit toilets. Some picnic tables. Group site. Some reservable sites. Camping not permitted on grassed areas near beach.
properties.other_comments: Water at taps. Trail. Boat ramp. See Smelt Bay Provincial Park

properties.title: Poyntz Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy pebble upper beaches on both shores with larger rocks, boulders lower down. Choice of beaches facing NE or SW. Many drift logs on exposed SW facing beach, so beach with SE aspect usually preferred. 2024 report that "access is blocked by a large fir tree lying across the entrance E. would be very hard to remove but it is possible to wade or carry boats by a small opening on the E side of the cove." Beaches flood at Springs.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped but comfortable site. Level headland has some clear areas, but mostly scrub, Few trees, thin soils.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Bird colonies. Rec res notation No. 6540 (283).

properties.title: Carterer Point south
properties.landing_comments: Moderate, cobble pebble, rubble. Near Wellbore Ch (Whirlpool) tidal rapids. No beach at high water. Protected except from SE.
properties.camp_comments: Minor brushing may be needed. Upland only sites in second growth forest. Entire beach floods.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek, likely flows year-round. Just S of Whirlpool Rapids. Aka Wellbore Channel E.

properties.title: Channe Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy, protected cobble beach. E aspect. 100 m wide. Shallow gradient at high water. Steeper at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Potential for 1-3 more sites on level upland forest areas. One site currently (2017) blocked by fallen tree. Wild Coast Vol 3 suggests a site in next bay NW at N50 27.33, W125 19.92. A site with old cabin and some debris reported at N50 27.380, W125 19.978 with room 2 tents and beach space at most tides for at least one tent with some shifting around of minor flotsam. The cabin location might be the same as the previous one mentioned here.
properties.other_comments: Quiet - fish farm noise inaudible.

properties.title: Yorke Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected pebble beach among boulders in cove behind islets on S side of island. Beach at Courtenay Bay on E side of island may be preferred access, camp location but is hazardous because of barbed wire defences in undergrowth. Very rough, hazardous water conditions may occur near S and W shores of in strong wind, ebb tides.
properties.camp_comments: Several unofficial sites on grass by shore or on trails further N. Loses sun early. Preferred camp location not yet established but likely near Courtenay Bay landing, possibly in 2019. Composting (mouldering) toilet at fort site. No camping near fort.
properties.other_comments: Historic WW2 defensive gun position. Hiking trails. Maintained by Sayward Futures Society. Hazards include overgrown bunkers, wire, decaying buildings. Conservation work proceeding. See: Hənʎəmdzi Məkola/Yorke Island Conservancy.

properties.title: Johns Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy sand, pebble beach in sheltered bay. E aspect. Currents, turbulence off point. Alternative, rougher NW aspect beach on other side of neck.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on grass under alder trees on headland. Old picnic tables in haphazard arrangement, some stacked. Move tables to use additional tent sites.
properties.other_comments: Debris from old saw mill. Mooring buoy. View.

properties.title: Blair Islet Mackenzie Sound
properties.landing_comments: Sheltered sand, gravel beaches with some boulders either side of point. Little or no beach at high water.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Access up old trail by steep midden bank just W of S tip of islet. 2-3 level upland sites, others on slope could be brushed. 1 beach site at neaps. Thick salal, extensive deadfall, tree hazards reported, making most of the former approx 9 sites unusable without lots of work. Sunny, protected. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Marginal for small party but brushing, deadfall clearing needed for any additional tent sites.

properties.title: Watson Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy at all water levels on moderate gradient beach of gravel, shell, some 40-200 mm barnacled rocks S of sawmill ruins.  Prominent derelict dock visible (2021). Beach floods at at water levels above 4.8 m. Carry boats up to trail. Currents to N of site.
properties.camp_comments: Short paths to upland. Choose steep one or awkward side hill with erosion issues. Picnic shelter, table. Sites on midden bank, in grassy area clearing behind ruined dock. Potential additional sites if brushed. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Water at small seasonal creek. Village site prior to sawmill site. Possible site for 1 tent in Windy Bay to S. Used occasionally by large commercial groups.

properties.title: Shorter Point west
properties.landing_comments: Beach of sand, cobble, rock. NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Upland sites W of creek. Small trees, deadfalls.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek.

properties.title: Moore Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on dock with float. NW aspect. Rough, rocky adjacent beach landing to SE gives harder access on cobble, boulder, bedrock at all water levels. Sign visible from water.
properties.camp_comments: Developed site in mature trees. 4 picnic tables, benches, pit toilets, fire pits, some tent platforms. Slightly gloomy.
properties.other_comments: Small seasonal creek. Dock, float, anchorage. Rough landing if float not usable.17.8 Ha.

properties.title: Atkinson South Islet
properties.landing_comments: Access channel between Atkinson I, small islet to S. Cobble rock, boulder landing.  Strong currents. Channel may dry at low water. Other channel to S blocked by logs, stumps. Safest land approach over rough terrain from E side.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped small marginal site in salal. Potential for more with minor brushing. Rough site.
properties.other_comments: Some supplies at Sullivan Bay 1 NM to E visible in photograph.

properties.title: Cypress Harbour
properties.landing_comments: Moderately steep beach in sheltered inlet. Patches of sand, grass but mainly mixed rocks at low, mid water. Sign visible from water.
properties.camp_comments: 5 developed large double sites. 4 picnic tables. Fire rings. Pit toilet. Can be damp, buggy. Regrowth of small alders, bushes.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek 0.5 NM to E. Site might be former log dump.

properties.title: Tribune Channel north
properties.landing_comments: Boulders, rough rock beach at creek, sand below. Avoid mud flat.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Clear areas for 2 tents in small alders E of creek. More sites possible with brushing.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. Old logging road. Might be former log dump. Pictograph nearby.

properties.title: Cane Point
properties.landing_comments: Beach in small sheltered cove. Bedrock, boulder landing at high water only. Low water landings impractical on awkward boulder shore.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Clear grassy area, sloping rock ledge at SE end of beach.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Sometimes known as Mauve Islet or incorrectly as Mauve Point.

properties.title: Deep Sea Bluff
properties.landing_comments: Easy on smooth shell beach NW aspect, protected by reefs. Drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: Beach camping for 2 tents on tiny tombolo, if tide less than 4.1 M Alert Bay but driftwood might prevent use. Upland accessible up steep bank with 3 potential rough tent sites, in need of brushing. Hammock opportunities. Site reported as unusable 2021.
properties.other_comments: View. Wildlife viewing.

properties.title: Tribune Channel east
properties.land_tenure: Indigenous Protected and Conserved Area, Provincial Forest
properties.landing_comments: Exposed rocky mixed beach N of creek.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Satisfactory level tent sites N of creek in mature open forest, subject to minor brushing.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at creek. Pictographs. Reported to be in IPCA (2025).

properties.title: Polkinhorne Islands
properties.landing_comments: Easy in cove with good protected clam bed beach with rock outcrop. Approach isthmus from S or shorter from NE using old boat run. Long carry at low water.
properties.camp_comments: 1 good foreshore site possible at Neaps, 2 established upland tent sites. 1 marginal in forest, 1 excellent on grass, facing cove to S of landing site. Camp furniture. Slightly gloomy N aspect. Small exposed rock ledge site on rock peninsula.
properties.other_comments: Strategic all-weather location. Attractive.

properties.title: Burdwood Group north
properties.landing_comments: This site is currently closed. Site closures may occur for a variety of reasons, including environmental protection, weather-related damage, safety concerns, or directives from First Nations. BC Marine Trails will update this site’s status as new information becomes available. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation in helping preserve these areas for future generations.
properties.camp_comments: nan
properties.other_comments: nan

properties.title: John Island southeast
properties.landing_comments: Middle island in Benjamin Group has sheltered shell beach but mostly floods at high water.  SE aspect. Report of fallen trees at beach.
properties.camp_comments: Level rock platforms at S end of cove. Some potential forest campsites usable if brushed.
properties.other_comments: See Broughton Archipelago Provincial Park

properties.title: Cockatrice Bay
properties.landing_comments: Rough shallow beach with 30-60cm boulders. Sheltered except from W. Awkward at high water, but easier at all other water levels.
properties.camp_comments: Sheltered, undeveloped. 1 good site to N of creek. 2 exposed tent sites on bedrock at shore. Others possible in trees with brushing. Little beach at high water. Hazardous dead standing snags/trees suggest avoiding use in high winds.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round creek. Wreck.

properties.title: Dobbin Bay
properties.landing_comments: Shallow mud beach with boulders. Impractical at lower tide levels.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Possible site to W of creek or at the head of the bay on solid rock which is dry at nearly all tides.
properties.other_comments: Marginal site. Water at small creek.

properties.title: Echo Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy, pebble, shell beach. Seawall above with easy access to upland to S.  Dock and floats not maintained, taken out of service 2012.
properties.camp_comments: Sheltered, mouldering toilet. Camp in large grass field.
properties.other_comments: No water in park. Creek nearby. Post office, accommodation, store. museum. 2 marinas, private docks, anchorage. See Echo Bay Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Kumlah Creek
properties.land_tenure: Indigenous Protected and Conserved Area, Provincial Forest
properties.landing_comments: Easy at high, mid water, moderate at low water on mixed beach in wide bay. Some protection. E aspect. Beach of small rocks to 40 mm, sand at high water. At mid water rocks 50 - 200 mm over sand with some boulders. At low water, generally more rocks, boulders. Drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Easily accessed sites in level open forest. Most sites reported S of larger creek mouth. Additional sites identified. including beach sites 100 - 200 m to N. Minor brushing needed. Upland site at N50D 44.404M W126D 10.945M.
properties.other_comments: Water at 2 small seasonal creeks.Kwikwasut’inuxw Haxwa’mis village site, Kyimla, near Trafford Point. First Nation land advisory sign N of creek. Reported to be in IPCA (2025).

properties.title: Cullen Harbour
properties.landing_comments: Protected sand, gravel beach .
properties.camp_comments: Grass site to S of beach. Small level rock areas. Feasible to camp on outcrop. JK's guide places site at 50 46.34N 126 44.83W.
properties.other_comments: Marginal site. Site reported at W end of Long I not found. Coastal Waters Recreation maps shows a site in Booker Lagoon on N shore Centre W arm. No other information.

properties.title: Fox Group Islands
properties.landing_comments: Easy on gravel, shell, mud beach on Island 66 in Retreat Passage. At SW tip of island SW aspect. Good protection from SE. Fair protection from W. Steep bank access with short rope.
properties.camp_comments: Sheltered tent sites. Camp in cleared areas in forest on small headland facing an isle across rocky neck. Suited to all weather. In conjunction with Kwikwasut’inuxw Haxwa’mis First Nations 12 tent platforms, 2 kitchen shelters, composting toilet added May 2023.
properties.other_comments: Frequently used by commercial groups. Trails connect sites. Aka Retreat Passage. See Broughton Archipelago Provincial Park

properties.title: Tracey Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy  at mid, high water on small shell beach or through narrow gap in high rock shelf. More awkward at lower water levels or land on beach to W and walk into campsite.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Small sheltered upland site in forest backed by cliff. S aspect. Beach or forest sites.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Frequent water taxi pick up/drop offs. Aka Monday Anchorage. See Broughton Archipelago Provincial Park

properties.title: Dusky Cove north
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, rock beach. Some boulders.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on rough grass. Likely wet at Springs.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Sargeaunt Passage
properties.land_tenure: Indigenous Protected and Conserved Area, Provincial Forest
properties.landing_comments: Protected landing on sand, mud S of creek delta.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped forest sites, possibly overgrown. Party could not find site (2020). 2 sites also possible N of creek but harder to access. Possible grassy area sites at Neaps. Other sites to S are feasible. Muddy area.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek- might need to go up a distance to find fresh water. Anchorage. Reported to be in IPCA (2025).

properties.title: Sedge Islands
properties.landing_comments: Easy on low gradient mud, mixed rocks beach in bay with S aspect. Alternative landing in long narrower SW aspect cove on W side of largest island has longer approach to site, but also easy on rock, cobble beach with mud, sand below. Well protected from swells. Long carries of 100 m at low water, but a report suggests much longer.
properties.camp_comments: Upland gloomy, damp site with 2 cleared tent pads in salal. Suited to hammocks. W side bay has strip of grassy sand between beach, forest for possible additional sites, but might floods at Springs.
properties.other_comments: Rough connecting trail between bays. See Broughton Archipelago Provincial Park

properties.title: Cedar Island
properties.landing_comments: Sand, gravel beach in cove at S end of island. SW aspect. Sand, pebble at high water. Cobble, some boulders, eelgrass at low water. May have surge. Currents in Providence Passage. Passage between Cedar, Midsummer Is dries.
properties.camp_comments: Large clear area in gloomy forest. Some sites slope.
properties.other_comments: Open to afternoon sun. Good alternative to Owl Is N. See Broughton Archipelago Provincial Park

properties.title: Owl Island south
properties.landing_comments: Easy on cobble, small boulders at high water, sand or smooth clam bed at low water. Boat run at centre beach. Protected bay. SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Sheltered, undeveloped. Large clear upland area in forest. Hammock opportunities. At Neaps, beach top pebble tent sites possible at NW side of bay. Lowest tent sites soggy in wet weather. Several hazardous trees felled 2023/24 but some remain.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Modest view. See Broughton Archipelago Provincial Park

properties.title: Lady Islands
properties.landing_comments: Sheltered landing on small rocks. Sand at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Brushing needed. John Kimantas guide has camp at 50 38.53N 126 25.88W. Another location is on islet connected to E island (Little Lady Island). Various possibilities.
properties.other_comments: View.

properties.title: Crease Island north
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sheltered sand, pebble beach. Boulders at low water, easy to avoid.
properties.camp_comments: Semi-developed. Beach or upland forest sites in rough clearings on W side of bay. One sandy beach site at E end. Pit toilet. condition unknown or now absent (2024). Mostly shaded, so often damp.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Crease Island south
properties.landing_comments: Report received of poor landing on rough beach with big rocks.  Easier, on sand pebble, cobble beach at high water. Easier landing in bay to SW, (50.618,-126.647). but marginal at high water (assume beach floods).
properties.camp_comments: Report of former sites being overgrown, entry from beach impassable due to blowdown. No visible tent sites. Previously assessed as Sheltered sites in young forest May need brushing. .
properties.other_comments: Provincial Boat Haven.

properties.title: Swanson Island west
properties.landing_comments: Easy, on cobble, pebble beach. SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Sheltered, undeveloped. 2 forest sites on S side of creek, 1 on N and 1 in farther N corner. Access awkward. Also camping on point reported.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. Commercial use likely. Views.

properties.title: Vernon Bay east
properties.landing_comments: Enter creek mouth at S end of long, wide sand beach 350 m long. Turn after passing gravel berm. S aspect. Offers more shelter than open beach landing. Creek mouth may dry at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Some beach campsites present. Possible nearby location might be better or more accurate - reported by SeaTrails Charts Seattle, WA as N48D 59.9520M W125D 08.0640M (map datum unknown) so site could be further to W i.e. at opposite end of beach, away from creek mouth. However, this or another site was assessed at N48D 59.825M W125D 07.911M NAD 83 in creek mouth on grassy patch on N bank. Site might flood at Springs or in wet weather.
properties.other_comments: Water nearby at year-round creek. Also nearby seep. Report of nearby resort partly overlooking site.

properties.title: Eden Island east
properties.landing_comments: Easy on smooth shell beach. Moderate gradient. Protected. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Upland sites in forest above high bank. Low forest slope. Beach top sites also feasible at Neaps, but forest comes to waterline, so overhung with branches. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Narrow trails. Broughton Archipelago Conservancy. Musgamakw Dzawada’enuxw sign asks for respect. Please observe BCMT Code of Conduct.

properties.title: Halkett Bay Dock
properties.landing_comments: Float, dock or adjacent 7% slope gravel beach at high water, similar at medium and low water, some drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: Flat grassy bench or roadway at 1 m elevation for day use above beach.
properties.other_comments: In emergency, 2 or 3 possible tent sites. Dock owned, managed by Sunshine Coast Regional District. Main access to adjacent Camp Fircom (United Church Family camp) with its 3 other beaches. Hiking trails lead off from public roads.

properties.title: Spiller Passage
properties.landing_comments: Landing at all but lowest tides best from west pocket beach behind rock promontory. Small cove with white shell beach. Steep wooded 'platform' above. Access from main E beach blocked 2025 by downed trees. May land on W side of rocky point instead.
properties.camp_comments: NW corner has smooth stone point with flat rock midden earth step leading to isthmus-like feature. One visible good tent site just above the landing. Follow trail leading E about 100 m to 2-3 more forest sites.
properties.other_comments: Large dead tree defines west edge of main tent site. When tree falls, it will uproot and destroy site. Good afternoon sun nearby. Seep in the woods possibly useable if filtered. In wetter year, water would likely be fine

properties.title: Sp'akw'us Feather Park
properties.land_tenure: Municipal public access, Private with public access provision
properties.landing_comments: Pocket sand beach in tiny bay on end of Mamquam Blind Channel. Re-developed former industrial shoreline. Protected from N, S. Vessel traffic, Frequent kiteboard use off launch area.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Flush toilets 2025. Former dog exercise area.
properties.other_comments: Gated road access. locked at night. Overnight parking being planned but not yet available (2024). Parking on nearby gravel lot (2024). Further development to include parking, housing, commercial space, moorage, tourist dock, multi use public areas including this park for paddlecraft launch etc. See: https://squamish.ca/assets/SODC/f732f5809b/150422-Squamish-Oceanfront-Boards-lr.pdf (#12 on map kayak launch). Launch site lies outside park proper.

properties.title: Squamish Spit Inner
properties.landing_comments: E side of dike - easier access, better at medium to high tides. Beach of gravel, firm mud.  W side - 2 m riprap bank, short carry to Squamish River nearby, minimal current. Shoals in estuary. Area known for high winds.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not permitted.
properties.other_comments: Park, launch before lockable gate, beyond which launch fee is required by Squamish Windsports Society. Wildlife Managment Area. hiking, bike trails. Birding. Wildlife viewing. View. Parking unrestricted (2015). Road directions - follow 'windsurfing' signage from centre of Squamish. Follow Buckley Road, Queens Way curving left onto Government Road. Go 1 km past railway crossing, turn right on gravel road then left (S) at T junction at dike. Continue to gate on Squamish River Dyke Road.

properties.title: Squamish Adventure Centre
properties.landing_comments: 1 m bank down to short 15% gravel and silt beach in sheltered tidal slough of Mamquam River Bllnd Channel. Short carry. Low or unusually high water could give some problems.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Rose Park is nearby, having simialr access to the Channel. Adjacent to river bank, across Loggers Lane from Centre in large gravel overflow parking lot. No indicated parking restrictions (2015). Centre offers various tourism services.

properties.title: Sandford Island
properties.land_tenure: Crown tenure - Section 17 designated use area
properties.landing_comments: Bay with partly protected sand beach 50 m long, E aspect. Strong surge at times.
properties.camp_comments: Upland sites on gravel up 2 trails. Food hang rope. Camp furniture. Picnic table. Occasional commercial use. Coords reported as N48.86931, W125.16479. Toilet broken, non-functional.
properties.other_comments: Attractive.

properties.title: Holford Bay north
properties.landing_comments: Beach W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No comments.
properties.other_comments: Possible water source 50 m to S. Tzartus Island

properties.title: Ben and Nicks Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy on pebble beach.
properties.camp_comments: Possible camping on beach or upland.
properties.other_comments: Not a desirable site. Dark. See Vargas Island Provincial Park. See Vargas Island webpage with information on Ahousaht access passes.

properties.title: Saranac Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy but rocky at low tide. Large pebble, rock beach. SE aspect. Land in W portion of double bay.
properties.camp_comments: 2 established sites in upland, about 4 on beach. E side beach might also have sites but rougher landing. Beach across neck to NW also has potential tent sites. Hammock opportunities,
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal streams in E bay or in next bay to S. Larger site than Robert Point. Remnants of a trail around point to another beach to NW.

properties.title: Pacheendaht
properties.landing_comments: Entering Gordon River mouth avoids any beach surf. Extensive sand beaches. Steep at river.
properties.camp_comments: Developed commercial site. Toilets, shower, fire pits.
properties.other_comments: No potable water (2009).

properties.title: Sooke River Campground
properties.landing_comments: Easy on gravel bars in river or tributary creek.
properties.camp_comments: Developed campground. Grassy meadow. Showers, flush toilets. Picnic area. Fire pits. Seasonal opening 1 April.
properties.other_comments: Water at tap. Owned by Sooke Community Association. Ph: (250) 642-6076 for reservations.

properties.title: Muir Creek
properties.landing_comments: Cobble, pebble beach. Exposed south facing beach but if able to access into creek, protected landing further up on either side of creek. One of the photos showing on map web site taken at extreme low tide when mouth of creek blocked by gravel/sand bar. 2023 assessment done at relatively high tide, sandbar across mouth of creek can create wave action.
properties.camp_comments: Large sand, gravel area upland with gated road access to highway 500m. Unknown if camping is permitted.
properties.other_comments: Large site to SE being developed 2009.

properties.title: Sandstone Ledge
properties.landing_comments: Awkward on exposed, sloping rock ledges, covered with fucus at low water. Surf possible when windy. Fair weather stop only. Landing, loading impractical in any significant waves. Short stair leads to upland. Current hazards in Porlier Pass.
properties.camp_comments: Camping permitted at specified sites only, each with picnic table, gravel pad, several on bank above shore. Pit toilet. Access difficulty reduces value of site to paddlers. Food cache reported. No fires. This marine park has become a favorite bike-packing location and can be extremely busy. Wooden kayak racks at trailhead into campsites. Summer camp host at Parry Lagoon. Some overflow sites. Camping fees apply 1 May to 30 September. May pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites. Fee $5.00 per person per night (2022) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System.
properties.other_comments: Water at pump at Parry Lagoon must be boiled or treated. Rack for boat storage. Extensive hiking trails. Use by cyclists seems to be tolerated. Sandstone headlands, tidal lagoon to N. Wildlife viewing. See: Dionisio Provincial Park.

properties.title: Pebble Beach Galiano Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy on smooth sand, pebble beach. exposed to NW. Occasional boulders at low water. Beach mostly floods at high water. Drift logs. Surf possible in NW conditions.
properties.camp_comments: Upland camping not permitted. Wide level grassy area adjacent to beach. No fires permitted most of year. 4 potential beach top sites subject to minor flotsam clearing. Drying clearance marginal at Springs.
properties.other_comments: Popular for day use by walkers on well-used loop trails from Melissa (1.3 km), McCroskie (1.7 km) Roads, continuing to Cable Bay. Upland forest managed by Galiano Parks and Recreation Commission (CRD) as nature reserve, conservation, recreation area. Pebble Beach Nature Reserve, Great Beaver Swamp, also mapped as Pebble Beach Recreation Site, Pebble Beach District Lot 63.

properties.title: Reid Islet
properties.landing_comments: Difficult, rock ledges.  Protected from NW but exposed to SE. Easier access on NE side at lower tide levels.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not recommended. Undeveloped.
properties.other_comments: On unnamed islet S of Reid Island. Hence name.

properties.title: Gloucester Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy on gravel, pebble, cobble beach. Scattered larger rocks. Exposed NE aspect but protected from E-W, S winds. Subject to outflow wind from Toba Inlet, presumably mostly in winter. Drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: One site partly brushed in level forest. Possible marginal beach site(s) offers little clearance but usable at Neaps. Several additional sites could be brushed with effort in dense vegetation.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek, possibly seasonal, near centre beach slightly to W of site. Site of former homestead. Old trails or roads behind beach, largely overgrown.

properties.title: Deer Passage
properties.landing_comments: Moderate on exposed low gradient gravel, cobble, boulder beach. General W aspect.  Vessel traffic. Low water landing at S point limited to single boats at a time.
properties.camp_comments: Level clearings in upland forest. 10 m S of boulders follow path 4 m into upland above beach. Beach camping feasible at neaps. Fire ring. Point to S also feasible for 1 tent but more exposed. Another site in bight S of point to S has poorer landing in cove protected from NW but offers more shelter - option in rough conditions.
properties.other_comments: Water at creeks which appear to be year-round. Small waterfall.

properties.title: Hepburn Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy, on low gradient beach of gravel, sand. Easy at mid, high water. Awkward oyster band at low water. Exposed NW aspect. Drift logs. Bay S of Hepburn Pt.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Potential for up to 8 sites with re-brushing of previously cleared areas, some now overgrown. 3-4 tent sites brushed 2023. 3 hammock hangs cleared. Beach camping at small tides. Path at forest opening right of fir among alders in centre beach.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek at bluff side of bay. Former logging camp, Some debris remains, Active log dump (2009) 200 m to NE or next bay NE. Dump appears inactive 2021.

properties.title: Lewis Channel north
properties.landing_comments: Easy on beach N of peninsula facing NW. Fine gravel at high water. Cobble, scattered boulders at low water. Mid tide rock band with boulders, rougher below. Beach floods to logs at Springs. Protected from S. Frequent boat wash. Vessel traffic. W wind funnels N in Lewis Channel.
properties.camp_comments: Several brushed sites in open level forest. Good clear site N of 1 m x 3 m boulder at beach S end. Good potential for more sites if levelled. Beach camping feasible at most water levels.
properties.other_comments: View. Attractive. Old roads lead into mature second growth forest.

properties.title: Lewis Channel central
properties.landing_comments: Easy on pebble, sand, rubble beach on N side of small point. A few boulders at low water. Band of rocks has smoother section at centre beach. Protected from S.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Small sites at back of point up short trail. Exposed to S. Beach camping tide dependent. Further sites in forest above beach with brushing.
properties.other_comments: View. Attractive. Water possible at nearby seasonal creek. Aka Lewis Channel south

properties.title: Roscoe Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on clam, oyster shell beach at head of long, very sheltered cove. Boat run cleared of oysters. Heavy vessel traffic particularly at high slack water for transits of narrow shoal entrance.
properties.camp_comments: Grassy tent sites at bay head. Pit toilet. Food bin. Picnic table. Little privacy from many passers-by. Many boaters anchored in bay walk to lake through occupied campsites to avoid rougher beach. Camping fees apply 1 June to 15 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at Lund or Okeover launch sites, but no reservable sites. Camp only at designated sites.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek or at broken pipe that drips water off cliff near trail to ruins. Lake another potential year-round source. Lake swimming nearby along hiking trail. Busy anchorage - no discharge zone. Hiking trail to viewpoint. See Roscoe Bay Provincial Park

properties.title: Melville Island west
properties.landing_comments: Moderate on exposed steep cobble, rock beach. S aspect. Land on rocky neck between islet and W tip of island. Boat run. Alternate landing on N side.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not permitted.
properties.other_comments: Views. See Desolation Sound Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Otter Channel
properties.landing_comments: Easy on rough protected beach with cleared boat run in centre.
properties.camp_comments: Good rest areas under trees or on bluffs. Camping no longer permitted.
properties.other_comments: View. Aka Otter Cove. See Desolation Sound Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Galley Bay
properties.landing_comments: 2 cleared boat runs through boulders, mixed rocks on moderate gradient beach in protected bay. NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: 1 large site at beach top. Small trails might lead to other possible sites in sloped forest. Hammock opportunities. Fire pit on bluff.
properties.other_comments: Stern ties for cruising boats. Aquaculture in bay. Some private homes. See Desolation Sound Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Gorges Islands
properties.landing_comments: Various awkward or difficult bare rock shelves or on small rock, oyster beach. Significant oyster band at low water. Likely easier at high water. Generally protected from winds, swell. Landing choice depends on site selected for use.
properties.camp_comments: Tent sites on rock ledges among bluffs. Favoured locations for paddlers on W island or on shelf at E side of main (E) island. Fire pit seen but No Fires rule in place.
properties.other_comments: View. Attractive. Wildlife habitat to be avoided during Spring nesting season. Busy anchorage. Water in seasonal creek at Butler Point. Pipe may may collection easier. See Walsh Cove Provincial Park

properties.title: Teakerne Arm
properties.landing_comments: Easy on pebble, small cobble beach in cove behind rocky peninsula W of park boundary. SE aspect. Reported as not obvious to find.
properties.camp_comments: Sloping grass bluffs of isthmus or peninsula have level areas of rock, grass. Geese evident on grass areas. Isthmus neck regularly floods at high water. Anchored pleasure boats reduce privacy.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Park day use area nearby - access by water - has anchorage, floating dock, pit toilet, waterfall, hiking trail, lake swimming. Paddlers have been known to camp there on flat rock. Lacks privacy.

properties.title: Lloyd Creek
properties.land_tenure: Crown tenure - Section 17 designated use area, Provincial Forest
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, gravel, mixed cobble beach. Oyster band at lower water. N aspect.  Protected from S.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Camp in upland open forest N of creek. Berry bushes. Light brushing needed. Potential for more sites with brushng. Beach camping at lower tides.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. Oyster lease to N. View.

properties.title: Elworthy Bay
properties.landing_comments: Moderate on cobble beach, rough at low water. Reefs.
properties.camp_comments: 3 tent sites, 2 fire pits all usable. Some wooden structures remain from earlier squatter occupation.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. Part of site may be tenured as log dump. Anchorage.

properties.title: Mary Islands
properties.landing_comments: Moderate on rough beach with boulders. SE aspect
properties.camp_comments: No known or sanctioned camping.
properties.other_comments: View. Rugged islet. See Desolation Sound Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Kinghorn Island
properties.landing_comments: Moderate to difficult on moderately steep cobble, boulder beach E of headland. N aspect so exposed to NW. At mid water levels, narrow cleared boat run helps, but boulders above, below affect access at high, low water. Report received that rock ledge to N assists. High winds could make leaving difficult. tough landing, Beach floods to trees, drift logs. Another landing around headland might be easier on low gradient pebble beach. NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Upland cleared sites in forest. Terrain flattens behind beach. Benches, fire pit. Rustic kitchen furniture. Olive barrel for food storage. Well shaded. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Views. Water at creek. Site regularly used by paddlers. Historic anchorage of Captain Vancouver. Occasional use by large guided parties.

properties.title: Martin Islands
properties.landing_comments: Easy on either N or S of tombolo except S side reported blocked by log (2022). Shale, gravel with cleared boat run on N side running W to E through boulders, visible when close. S side has many drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Sheltered large clear site in centre, smaller areas on W island. Picnic table, benches. Suited to groups. Potential for more sites. 3 or more upland fire pits.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. On dry tombolo - islands not completely split as shown on chart. High use requires attention to good sanitation practices. Report received of high use by instructional or commercial groups for prolonged periods.

properties.title: Call Bight
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient broad estuary gives easy all-tide access on small gravel, pebble, rubble, oyster beach. Scattered boulders. Exposed to SW. SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Small trails in sloped forest. Camping not permitted.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creeks. See Desolation Sound Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Okeover
properties.landing_comments: Paddlers are asked to use beach to N of public wharf.  Rough beaches on either side of wharf in sheltered inlet with protective boom. To avoid boulders, plan for mid or high water use. Concrete boat ramp adjacent with signs telling kayakers to not use it. Slightly smoother beach lies approx. 100 m N near campground. Harbour Authority charges launch fees.
properties.camp_comments: Picnic shelter, fireplace. Developed campground nearby. 14 drive in sites 4 walk-in sites.
properties.other_comments: Launch fee $5. Concrete boat ramp, floating docks, wharf. Picnic area, water at tap. Pay parking nearby.. Parking for vehicle $5/day. Okeover Harbour Authority. See Okeover Arm Provincial Park

properties.title: Scobell Island
properties.landing_comments: Rock ledges in sheltered bay. S aspect. Likely easier at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not permitted. Grass area. Noise from many anchored boats.
properties.other_comments: See Desolation Sound Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Openit east cove
properties.landing_comments: nan
properties.camp_comments: nan
properties.other_comments: This site is currently closed. Site closures may occur for a variety of reasons including environmental protection, weather-related damage, safety concerns or directives from First Nations. BC Marine Trails will update this site’s status as new information becomes available. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation in helping preserve these areas for future generations.

properties.title: Sansum Narrows
properties.landing_comments: 2 pebble beaches of moderate gradient with 1 m high bank. Beaches sit between small rock outcrops. A reporter could not find suitable landing beach at high water (3.6 m). NW aspect. Currents, vessel traffic.
properties.camp_comments: Dispersed camping permitted. Moderately level sites in attractive open forest, some on old roadbed, about 20 m above either of pebble beaches. Minor brushing likely required. No fires. Precise location might vary depending on site chosen. A reporter could find no suitable tent sites 2023.
properties.other_comments: Water at nearby seasonal creek. View. Hiking trail located 200 m to SE connects with main park trail #20 near junction with #23. Hydro right of way trail not maintained entirely. See: Burgoyne Bay Provincial Park.

properties.title: Mars Tracey Narrows
properties.landing_comments: Easy, on protected pebble/rubble beach. Mud at low water. E aspect. Possible access also from W. Currents in narrows to approx 5 kn.
properties.camp_comments: Sheltered, undeveloped. Broad, grassy site with difficult or no high upland access. Appears prone to flooding at Springs. Likely damp.
properties.other_comments: Site featured in Wild Coast Guide, but should be used with caution, at small tides only. See Broughton Archipelago Provincial Park

properties.title: Wakes Cove
properties.landing_comments: Land on smooth sloping sandstone bedrock shelf. Mostly steep rocky protected shores. Octagonal float dinghy dock at end of raised jetty.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Hiking trails. Boat dock, float.
properties.other_comments: Anchorage. See Wakes Cove Provincial Park`.

properties.title: South Kendrick Islet
properties.landing_comments: Moderate to difficult, on rock ledges at W shore approx 70 m SE of main tenting area indicated on map.  Easier at low water. Swells, current hazards, vessel traffic.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped, large semi-exposed grassy level area on islet top.
properties.other_comments: West Vancouver Yacht Club outstation nearby on main Kendrick Island W shore. Anchorage. Adjacent to Wakes Cove Provincial Park but not within Park.

properties.title: Klaskino Lagoon
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient sand beach makes for long carry at low water.  More protected than Keith R Site 4.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on beach. Possible upland sites.
properties.other_comments: Adjacent to clearcut.

properties.title: Klaskino Site 1
properties.landing_comments: Easy on steep gravel beach at N end of long beach.  Beach to S not accessible from seaward because of blocking reefs.
properties.camp_comments: Very limited space at Springs. 6 or more sites otherwise.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Quatsino Caves
properties.landing_comments: Easy on pocket beach.
properties.camp_comments: Many logs. Dense vegetation in upland.
properties.other_comments: Good picnic site in calm weather. Little space for camping. Seasketch shows as Provincial Recreation site but status believed to be Reserve.

properties.title: Battle Bay Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on protected sand beach inside deep cove. S aspect. Moderately steep at low tide, accessible at all tides. Approach from SW. Other coves in vicinity. A cove to E appears connected, but is usually separated by jagged rocks.
properties.camp_comments: 2 beach sites on pebble, small stones. Possible upland sites if heavily brushed. An area of sea grass could yield tent sites at Neaps. Hammock use also require brushing.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. See: Mquqwin Brooks Peninsula Provincial Park.

properties.title: Big Bunsby Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on small pebble beach. Mossy rock with spruce trees has tombolo to main shore on beach of sand, gravel. Good protection from SE.
properties.camp_comments: Camping here discouraged by BC Parks
properties.other_comments: Big Bunsby Island Provincial Park.

properties.title: Too Tah Island
properties.land_tenure: Treaty Settlement Land designated for public access
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on sheltered sand beach at all tides. NE aspect. Alternate approaches, landings on beaches with W, S aspects.
properties.camp_comments: 3 sheltered upland tent sites on treed neck between 2 beaches. Large private cabin with private outhouse at W aspect beach - no permission for public use of either. Exposed beach top sites suitable at Neaps but maybe not at Springs.
properties.other_comments: First Nations (KCFN) owned Maa-Nulth Treaty land. Reasonable public access to be provided. Fees not currently charged (2023). Aka Barneys Island or Gay Passage Island. Frequent water taxi drop-off / pick up site. Indirect report of campers being asked to leave when cabin owner is present.

properties.title: Nipple Mountain
properties.landing_comments: Choose from S or N facing beaches. S side easy to moderate on steep pebble beach, various rocks.  N side easy on moderately sloped sand, pebble beach. Dumping surf in high swell can likely be avoided on one side or other. N side reported usually easier.
properties.camp_comments: Many camping possibilities on beach, upland either side of small peninsula. 1 good upland site on S beach. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Water at S beach clear creek believed to be year-round. Swim hole. Trail between N & S beaches. Some hiking trails along creek on S beach. IMAP shows REC136267 Provincial Recreation Reserve.

properties.title: Santa Gertrudis Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy. Small shale, gravel beach in very protected cove. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Reporter did not see the picnic table or the clearing which was described in earlier write ups. The landing is otherwise as described although there were many logs. 3-4 upper beach sites available behind the logs.
properties.other_comments: At Santa Gertrudis Cove, there is the main cove visible when entering and three smaller coves to the north. The closest cove is eel grass and mud at low tide. The small cove to the ocean becomes a passage at higher tides. Hiking trail to Jewitt Lake. https://bcparks.ca/santa-gertrudis-boca-del-infierno-park/Gloomy. See: Santa Gertrudis - Boca del Infierno Marine Provincial Park.

properties.title: Nuchatlitz Islet
properties.landing_comments: Easy beach but subject to surge and waves, less strong on NE beach. Gradient 3 to 5 percent. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Room to camp above tide line with two or more reasonable campsites on beach and upland (NE facing beach) Exposed to weather.
properties.other_comments: 3 islets N of Ensanada Islet offer camping potential in this S Nuchatlitz area. Ensanada Islet itself has rough landings.

properties.title: Ross Islets
properties.landing_comments: Crushed shell beach. Mixed rocks, cobbles lower. Approach from E at all tides. Access at high water from W, N.
properties.camp_comments: Small sites in relatively close proximity. Protected.
properties.other_comments: Attractive but impacted heavily by users. Frequent use. Reported in July 2024: Established kitchen area used by boaters and paddlers. Grills left at site. .

properties.title: Keeha Bay
properties.landing_comments: Crescent sand beach, rocky headlands. S aspect. Expect surf ranging upwards from minor in 1 m swell to heavy in high swell.  Easier at N end (IR) in NW conditions.  Could land at IR then wheel craft to within park.
properties.camp_comments: Toilet. Food cache. May be subject to park use restrictions e.g. no pets. Reservable dates in 2022 May 1, 2022 - October 11, 2022.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Hiking trail to Bamfield 3.5 km, so expect heavy use. Suited to calm weather. Pacific Rim National Park Reserve. AKA Keeha Beach.

properties.title: Kirby Point southwest
properties.landing_comments: E end of sand beach. SW aspect. Sheltered by island. Turbulent water likely at entrance in SW swell.
properties.camp_comments: Camping fees are normally charged. Permit required for overnight use. See: =Camping Permit. Rustic beach huts are no longer present. Any previous above beach camping areas were overgrown. We did not see anywhere to put a tent. A native graveyard was seen.
properties.other_comments: Huu-ay-aht Treaty Settlement Land.

properties.title: Jepther Point
properties.landing_comments: Moderately steep cobble, pebble beach. Difficult in high swell. Landing easier at either end of the beach.
properties.camp_comments: Beach sites on gravel, cobble.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at creek. No access to N Coast hiking Trail. Reported (7-2024) they were unable to locate any streams or other water sources or any dry creek beds. Also stated that water was available approximately 2.5km East along the coastline.See: Cape Scott Provincial Park

properties.title: Shushartie Wharf
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand beach.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not permitted at this time.
properties.other_comments: Nice site if tides are not too high. Historic ruined wharf. See: Cape Scott Provincial Park

properties.title: Whaleboat Island
properties.landing_comments: Rocky landing at high water. SW corner has shell beach at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not permitted or recommended. Small, rocky site.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Tent Island
properties.landing_comments: nan
properties.camp_comments: nan
properties.other_comments: This site is currently closed. Site closures may occur for a variety of reasons, including environmental protection, weather-related damage, safety concerns, or directives from First Nations. BC Marine Trails will update this site’s status as new information becomes available. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation in helping preserve these areas for future generations.

properties.title: Bennett Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sheltered long sand, pebble beach. Drift logs. SE aspect. Fast currents in Georgeson Passage.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Picnic tables.
properties.other_comments: Wilks Road off Bennett Bay Road. Vault toilet close to Isabella Rd on trail to Campbell Point. Hiking trails. Swimming. Parking may be short-term only. Extensive old growth fir, garry oak. Meadow or old orchard being reforested. Gulf Islands National Park Reserve. See Bennett Bay

properties.title: Squamish Xwu’nekw
properties.landing_comments: Paved ramp in Mamquam River channel adjacent to wharf, floats. Adjacent mud  beaches.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Water. Parking with no known restrictions. Short walk to stores, services. Accommodation. Land approach via Vancouver Street, Loggers' Lane. Squamish (Coast Salish) name Xwu’nekw. Squamish Harbour Authority.

properties.title: Vansittart Island
properties.landing_comments: nan
properties.camp_comments: nan
properties.other_comments: This site is currently closed. Site closures may occur for a variety of reasons, including environmental protection, weather-related damage, safety concerns, or directives from First Nations. BC Marine Trails will update this site’s status as new information becomes available. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation in helping preserve these areas for future generations.

properties.title: Carl’s Crab Shack and Nytom
properties.landing_comments: White sand beach. Surf tends to wrap around the point to W but  beach 10 m to S of site has a  channel with good sand landing. A  floating line usually marks entry. Keep rope on immediate port side.
properties.camp_comments: Beach camping on sand. Not a recognized Parks Canada site.
properties.other_comments: Seasonal food may be available from temporary restaurant/cafe.

properties.title: Aylard Beach
properties.landing_comments: Large sandy beach. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Day use only. Camping not permitted. Pit toilets, picnic tables.
properties.other_comments: Hiking trails, parking at 300 m up trail. Large area. Interesting shoreline. Sea caves nearby. See: East Sooke Regional Park. Operated by Capital Regional District.

properties.title: Pacific Lions Marina
properties.landing_comments: No comments.
properties.camp_comments: Grassy sites. RV use. Services.
properties.other_comments: 4 day minimum. Might apply to boat-based camping.

properties.title: Coon Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on low gradient sand beach, steeper at top. N aspect. Surf possible in strong NW conditions. Alternate access by Parry Lagoon to SE of tombolo. Enter SE'most  lagoon entrance. Very low gradient, dries at low water. Third landing option 400 m to W of tombolo on moderate gradient gravel in well-protected Maple Bay. Longer carry but on good trail. High current, turbulence hazards in adjacent Porlier Pass.  Vessel traffic stays mostly well to N.
properties.camp_comments: Camping permitted only at specified forested sites away from shore. Each has gravel pad, picnic table. No fires. Shoreline for day use only. Pit toilets. Resident camp host in summer. Benches. Camping fees apply 1 May to 30 September. May pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites. Fee $5.00 per person per night (2022) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Water at pump May - September must be boiled or treated. Former village site named Quelus'. Swimming. Sandstone headlands, wildflowers, tidal lagoon. Wildlife viewing. No sanctioned road or trail access. Extensive hiking trails. Car-based camping discouraged, Used (unauthorized) by cyclists. Regularly visited by power boaters. See: Dionisio Provincial Park

properties.title: Shah Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected low gradient sand, pebble beach. SE aspect. Low water might reveal more rocks, long carry. Some exposure to S.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Public beach. Upland road allowance approx 30 m wide lies between private lots with cabins, houses. Pit toilet, fire pit, picnic table placed by nearby property owner. Small ramp.
properties.other_comments: Trails, roads connect to island roads. Shah Pt private, properties to N, S private. Much of Rec Site is tidal or islet.

properties.title: Oyster Bay Shoreline Park
properties.landing_comments: Shingle beach. Drift logs. Short level trail from parking lot to shore over drift logs..
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Picnic tables Toilets.
properties.other_comments: Access directly from Hwy 19A Large gravel parking lot designated as roadside Rest Area. Overnight parking not prohibited but courtesy notice requests parking be limited to 8 hours.. Strathcona Regional District.

properties.title: Quarry Bay Finlayson Arm
properties.landing_comments: No comments
properties.camp_comments: Secluded site used by campers and picnickers. Firepit.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: French Creek
properties.landing_comments: Easy, protected pebble beach within harbour and boat tamp
properties.camp_comments: No known camping.
properties.other_comments: Parking available Parking is $8.99/day (2025). Assume overnight parking available for boaters, ferry users. Harbour area has pub, restaurant, store with provisions. Terminal for foot passenger ferry to Lasqueti Island takes 60 minutes and runs 4 times/day except 2 times/Sunday and no ferry on Tuesday. Winds can be strong in the channel so the ferry is another option if not paddling. It was easy to bring kayaks on our vehicles down to the ferry dock. There was ample room on the ferry to stow gear and the kayaks were stowed on the roof of the ferry.

properties.title: Duck Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy low gradient sand, pebble beach. Scattered boulders. Exposed SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. No residences behind beach as there are on most beaches of this heavily developed island.
properties.other_comments: Short trail access to beach from Savary Island Road/Vancouver Boulevard. Centre section of island owned/managed by The Nature Trust of BC, #119 Secured 2002 Conservation of a forested dune complex. Hectares 142.07 DL 1375 TRILLIUM. Prior to acquisition this property was owned by U.S. based Trillium Corporation who had various plans to subdivide, The Nature Trust of BC in 2019 became sole owner. Steward - A Bouffard - 613-857-8142

properties.title: Shehtekwahn
properties.landing_comments: Easy,  on sheltered sand, pebble beach, soft mud silt in places. Low gradient protected bay.
properties.camp_comments: Large open grass areas among trees. Posted as private but Day Use permitted. 3 picnic tables. Fire pits. Site had crude toilet in 1998 in trees E of beach but not seen, believed no longer present 2022.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at creek, likely year-round. Large site with vehicle access. Good shelter from most winds. Some debris from old log sort. Tla'amin Treaty Settlement Land, effective 2016. Name changed from Pocahontas Bay to Shehtekwahn per Treaty.

properties.title: Edward King Island west
properties.landing_comments: Small rocky beach has tiny pullout on N side. Little or no surf.
properties.camp_comments: Two upland sites, one small beach site. Secluded but rough. Two sources of water reported on SE shore of same island
properties.other_comments: Good picnic site.

properties.title: Proud Outlook
properties.landing_comments: Rough landing on slightly rounded rocks. At low water mixed rocks to 150+ mm.  At high water boulders range from 300 - 500 mm. Steep 20% grade to upland. 0.4 NM SW of Camp Potlatch.
properties.camp_comments: Pleasant upland tent sites beside creek, 2 in trees, 1 slightly lower in open glade. Sites 2 - 3 m above high water. Sunny.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek that appears to run year-round. Small waterfall. Potlach Creek 0.5 NM to NE has sure year-round water. Attractive. View.

properties.title: Roger Curtis Park
properties.landing_comments: Easy on pebble, cobble beach in sheltered cove shielded by boulders. Beach floods at high water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Extensive housing development in private upland. Otherwise ideal grassy camp areas out of bounds.
properties.other_comments: View. Development of site began 2009. Site just N of northernmost pier. Marina with 3 long piers for resident boats impedes public beach access. Alternate cove near navigation light also impacted by dock, floats. Municipal walking trail joins 3 adjacent coves along shore, cliffs. Road access.

properties.title: Dock Island
properties.landing_comments: Currents, vessel traffic.
properties.camp_comments: Day use only. Shoreline only. Upland is Special Preservation Area. No camping.
properties.other_comments: View. Intertidal life. Special preservation area. Gulf Islands National Park Reserve.

properties.title: Kin Beach
properties.landing_comments: Moderate to low gradient cobble, sand beach. NE aspect. Extensive cobble at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Developed vehicle-accessible campsite. Pit toilets. Playground. Picnic shelters. Day use area. Campsite reservations recommended. Call 250-339-6365. Group site.
properties.other_comments: Vehicle access via Ryan Road, to entrance to 19 Wing Comox. Turn left on Little River Road, right on Kilmorley Road. Stay left to the park. For closest parking to water go beyond park entrance to picnic shelter then approx 150 m further. Water at tap. Small store. Community-run Class C park. See: Kin Beach Provincial Park.

properties.title: Jáji7em and Kw’ulh Sandy Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy on S beach on sand, pebble. N beach has very low gradient so long carry at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Camping no longer permitted. Pit toilet. No fires.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Walking route to Denman Island at tides below 2.5 m. Sensitive flora. AKA Sandy Island, Tree Island. See: Jáji7em and Kw’ulh Marine Provincial Park.

properties.title: Ford Cove Hornby Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy, in protected bay with many floats. Land on small gravel beach that dries 100 m at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Developed year-round commercial site, tent pads, full facilities, indoor flush toilets, shower, outdoor sinks, S from landing beach behind marina office - wheels useful. Reservations recommended in summer. Cottages for rent. www.fordscove.com
properties.other_comments: Water at tap. aka Ford's Cove. Marina, provisions, restaurant.

properties.title: Qualicum First Nation Campground
properties.landing_comments: Easy, protected pebble beach, more exposed at low tide. Optional launch in river.
properties.camp_comments: Developed commercial campground. Full facilities, tent pads, hookups, store, picnic shelter, picnic tables, playground, toilets, showers, sani dump. Site on S bank is let by season. Operates May-Sept. Gates closed 9 pm to 7 am. Fees charged.
properties.other_comments: Road access at 5861 Island Highway West (Hwy 19A). Operated by Qualicum First Nation Ph: 250-757-9322, 250-757-9337 (Oct-June). See <Qualicum First Nation Campground

properties.title: Myrtle Rocks
properties.landing_comments: Easy on mainland shore in bays E or W of jetty. One should be always sheltered.Landing on islets unknown but appears easy. Easy access from vehicle.
properties.camp_comments: Launch site or day use only. Camping not permitted, but is known to occur on islets.. 2 commercial campgrounds close by :- Garnet Rock and Oceanside.
properties.other_comments: Foreshore, beach access park. Myrtle Rocks Regional Park located S of Powell River on Hwy. 101 near foot of Maris Road. Small unpaved parking area, also roadside parking. Beachcombing, bird watching, swimming, picnicking, canoeing, kayaking. Pedestrian access to islet from foreshore at low tide. Open year-round. Please do not cross private land to access islet.

properties.title: Willingdon Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy  on moderate gradient beach. SW aspect. Mixed pebble, sand to E of breakwater jetty, cobble to W.
properties.camp_comments: Developed municipal campground. Full facilities. Showers, electric hookups. Flush toilets, laundry room. Fire pits, picnic tables. Playground, water park. All sites reservable.at 604.485.2242 or reservations@willingdonbeach.ca. Group campsite.
properties.other_comments: 4845 Marine Avenue, Powell River. View. Parking. Water at taps. Swimming float. 1.5 km walk to central Powell River with all amenities. Hiking trails. Good launch site.

properties.title: Ocean Beach Esplanade central
properties.landing_comments: Sand, pebbles, up to 100 mm cobbles, low 5% slope, drift logs, exposed to W
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: 2 portable toilets at this location. Extensive nose-in roadside parking but no overnight parking, Whispering Firs Park hiking trails across road to E,

properties.title: Fairview Bay
properties.landing_comments: Mixed low gradient beach in bay, mostly 30 - 60 mm gravel. SE aspect. Some oysters, scattered boulders, patches of gravel, sand. Moderately long carry at low water. Easy shore access up low bank with trail.
properties.camp_comments: One wooden tent pad, one clearing, one smaller site for tents. Might be more tent sites further from cabin but not seen. Beautiful public use cabin or hut built by volunteers 2009, modified, renovated 2014. Accommodates 10 in upper sleeping loft. Composting outhouse toilet (2016). Paddlers advised to carry tent because hut often full. Reservations not accepted. Picnic tables, outside fire pit, sleeping loft, covered porch. No lighting, stove or heater.
properties.other_comments: Year-round water nearby. View. Hut part of Sunshine Coast hiking Trail. Sections lead along coast to Saltery Bay (2 -3 hr), or N to Rainy Day Lake, Sarah Point terminus (173 km). Under care of Powell River Parks and Wilderness Society. Swimming. Oysters. See Sunshine Coast Trail

properties.title: skelhp
properties.landing_comments: Concrete boat ramp with adjacent groin or cobble, pebble, sand beach, smoother at high water. S aspect. Exposed to S, W.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Picnic tables, 2 vault toilets.
properties.other_comments: Water at pump. S off Hwy 101. Parking, Overnight parking by permission. Swimming. Former name Saltery Bay (Jervis Inlet). See Saltery Bay Provincial Park

properties.title: Gastineau Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, pebble beach, some boulders. S aspect. Rougher at low water. Might be awkward due to drift logs at very high water.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Cleared sites in trees. With brushing, many others possible
properties.other_comments: Water at creeks to S. View. Attractive. Shelter from outflow winds. Intended log dump use. Licencee willing to remove boom in bay and not use site in summer months. Per F Ullman RSTBC. Aka Toba Inlet Entrance.

properties.title: Pryce Channel east
properties.landing_comments: Gravel, cobble beach. Some boulders. Moderate to steep gradient. ESE aspect. Protected from W. Some visitors prefer to land at N corner of this 40 m long beach.
properties.camp_comments: Dense vegetation smothered 4 former tent sites. Overgrown trail from SW end of beach leads to flat, spacious area which might be poorly drained. Heavy brushing needed to re-use for tenting. Sites no longer usable 2023. Possible beach camping at Neaps if effort spent on levelling, but beach is steep.
properties.other_comments: View. Attractive. Old long inactive log dump.

properties.title: Attwood Bay entrance
properties.landing_comments: Easy, on gravel beach with angular cobble above. Land N of creek mouth. Boat run at low - mid water levels. Little beach at high water, floods to treeline. Log boom may be across small bay mouth. W aspect. Exposed to W which causes strong chop at landing but not known to cause actual surf.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Some rough clearings N of creek. Good potential. If brushed, further tent sites feasible on flat dry ground growing ferns, brambles. Minor deadfall needs clearing. Hazard trees likely. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Water at seasonal creek with small waterfall. Creek might have year-round flow. Bathing opportunities. Float homes, development in bay to N. Log dump nearby to N.

properties.title: Turnbull Cove
properties.landing_comments: Very sheltered cove.
properties.camp_comments: Currently no camping. Brushing required if a site can be located. Reported to be near hiking trail to Huaskin Lake. Official capacity was 2 tents, maintained for some years by Silver King Ventures who still brush trail, but sites rarely used, so abandoned.
properties.other_comments: Short (500 m) hiking trail to Huaskin Lake has many stairs. Designated by Recreation Sites and Trails BC, maintained by Silver King Ventures. Sign. Provincial Boat Haven. Large landslide on opposite shore in approx 2009.

properties.title: Mission Point Park
properties.landing_comments: 10 % slope, 50 mm cobble beach
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
