properties.other_comments: Water fountain, picnic tables. District of Sechelt municipal park. Day parking across highway at Brookman Park or at Davis Bay south.

properties.title: Secret Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy on low gradient gravel beach. E aspect. 1st launch site is on the road just before the marina. 2nd launch site is located next to office and marina dock. Separate boat ramp for trailers at marina.
properties.camp_comments: See adjacent campsite. Drinking water not provided. Open May to mid-September. Gate locked at 11 pm nightly.
properties.other_comments: Launch site, marina owned, operated by Toquaht Nation. From Highway 4 turn onto gravel Toquaht Bay Road. Go straight 13 km. Secret Beach appears on right. 10 overnight parking spaces. Must pay before launching at either site. Fees (2017). parking $10 night, launch $15 (all plus taxes). Marina. See: Secret Beach. Campground is open May to September.

properties.title: Carriden Bay
properties.landing_comments: Land in large protected bay on moderate to low gradient boulder beach at high water, Extensive low gradient clam bed at low water. Paddlers might avoid long low water carry by landing 150 m to SW of site. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Tent sites along faint trail at S side of stream in second growth forest. Grassy upper beach patches may offer additional sites at Neaps. Hammock opportunities.Many other camp possibilities within large bay. Approx. 700 m to S are beaches NE aspect bounded by a tall cliff. Land on boulders, cobble, mixed rocks, pebble. Protected. Low slope forest behind beach, but no tent sites seen July 2023. Dry seasonal stream.
properties.other_comments: Water at stream with lake source flowing in drought mid-July 2023 - assume year-round. Larger year-round creek 350 m to N at N50.9135, W126.9062. No tent sites seen there. Anchorage. Large 111.9 Ha. Provincial Recreation Site.

properties.title: Barnacle Road
properties.landing_comments: High floats at end of long dock or small sand, pebble beach accessible by short carry over steep brushy uneven access path. Little beach space at high water, floods at Springs.  Either launch a bit awkward. Vessel traffic. Many ship movements immediately to N.
properties.camp_comments: No camping
properties.other_comments: End of Barnacle Road, off Dolphin Road. Parking limited to short term. Possible long term parking at marinas nearby or at ferry terminal. Easy access from ferries with boat cart. Managed by Capital Regional District as a Small Craft Harbour.. Formerly known as Swartz Bay Government Dock.

properties.title: False Bay
properties.landing_comments: Protected beach of 50 mm, varied cobble, 10% grade, Easiest at high water. Public wharf, Dock float access also - might be preferred at low water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Restaurant nearby. Ferry from French Creek does not transport vehicles, except bicycles. Unloaded paddlecraft transport possible, but inquire ahead of time.

properties.title: Baker Beach kwilkwilem
properties.landing_comments: Pebble beach, some sand, mixed rocks, drift logs. S aspect. Short 50 m approx forested wheelchair accessible trail to beach or walk on road.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. No fires. Picnic area, picnic tables. Portable toilet.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Parking in unpaved lot. Swimming. 12 ha waterfront Sunshine Coast Regional District park. 12499 Baker Road. Turn W off Hwy 101 at Francis Peninsula Road. Head W 2.5 km S on Warnock Road, to Davis Road, turn left. Follow Davis Road to Baker Road (no sign). Signage lacking until at site.kwilkwilem means covered with sand in shashishalhem, the Sechelt language.

properties.title: Hill and Dale
properties.landing_comments: Beach 5% slope, 100 mm cobble turning to 50 mm pebble higher. Many drift logs. SE exposure, but some shelter from W, E
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: 5512 Hill Road off Highway 101, near Dale Road. Limited parking on lane edges. 55 m easy walk to beach. Overview from adjacent housing but trees give some privacy.

properties.title: Little River Road
properties.land_tenure: Regional, Road end right of way
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient beach of pebble, white sand. Mixed rocks on lower beach. Exposed NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping or overnight parking.
properties.other_comments: Little River Road ends at beach. Roadside parking for about 6 vehicles.

properties.title: Burdwood Point south 2
properties.landing_comments: Navigate through rocks to small medium gradient sand, pebble beach. Beach moderately well protected by rocks on approach. More protected, less surf than Burdwood Bay.
properties.camp_comments: 10 tent sites on beach at tombolo, 2 more in upland. Cabin behind rock outcrop, tombolo. Old toilet along trail S of cabin. Potential for beach flooding at springs but tombolo normally dry. Safe refuge in rough conditions.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. Swim hole. Walking trail leads N from cabin.

properties.title: Kitty Coleman
properties.landing_comments: 2 paved boat ramps, one in  creek mouth other larger ramp at road end to N. Cobble beach. Exposed to wind.
properties.camp_comments: Vehicle-accessible sites. Group camping by reservation in summer 250-338-1332. Picnic shelter, picnic tables, pit toilets. Shared fire pits. Many narrow gravel sites on waterfront.
properties.other_comments: Vehicle enter via Coleman Road off Hwy 19A. Turn on Left Road, right on Whittaker Road. Parking. Water might require boiling. Nature trails. Swimming, 900 m shoreline. Community-run Class C park. See: Kitty Coleman Provincial Park.

properties.title: Singing Sands
properties.landing_comments: Exposed low gradient beach of cobble, sand.  At low water, carry can be 50 m or more.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Singing Sands Road ends at beach. Park on roadside. Comox Valley Regional District official beach access.

properties.title: Buckley Bay
properties.landing_comments: Small all-tide beach of pebble, cobble, to S of ferry ramp by old ramp. Access via short, rough trail might not be on public land. Foreshore below store, gas station no longer accessible (2019) due to vegetation overgrowth on steps, high fencing.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Day parking. Overnight parking unknown.

properties.title: Union Bay
properties.landing_comments: Boat ramps, float.  Protected from N by point and from S by breakwater. Launch N of breakwater on hard packed gravel, mud, shell beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Toilets. Plenty of parking. $5.00 launch fee (2019). Ramp leased, operated by Union Bay Community Club and Recreation Assn.

properties.title: Tuwanek
properties.landing_comments: Easy on beach of pebble, gravel, some cobble. W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Temporary chemical toilet. Picnic table, bench.
properties.other_comments: Very limited parking at roadside - 6 cars. Sechelt Inlet Road. Take care to respect residents' access to local properties. Site also used heavily by scuba divers, local users. Recommend paddlers use other sites for starting overnight trips.

properties.title: Foster Street
properties.landing_comments: Pocket beach in small cove. Boulders at low water, sand, pebble at high water. Open to S, SW. Several steps lead to beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: At end of Foster Street, Esquimalt. Parking restrictions likely but specifics unknown.

properties.title: Sweetwater Spring
properties.landing_comments: Twin gravel beaches S aspect. 15% slope. Gravel at mid, high water, 10 cm cobble at low water. Scattered boulders. Some sloping bedrock. Protected from N.
properties.camp_comments: Spring water is main reason to stop. Possible beach camping except at Springs. Some small upland tent sites might possible with brushing.
properties.other_comments: View. Fresh water at seep or spring on rock slab above S beach clearly visible. Coast strip has notation SEC 16 MAP RESERVE ENVIRONMENT, CONSERVATION, & RECR Subpurpose: GREENBELT

properties.title: Gooding Cove northeast
properties.landing_comments: Gravel beach. NW aspect. Possible surf.
properties.camp_comments: See nearby sites, e.g. Gooding Cove (W end of same beach). Many choose to camp at this launch site, for convenience. Grassy sites among bushes at back of beach. Fire pit. Easy access on short, rough roadway.
properties.other_comments: Sept 2020 Best to have map showing logging roads. Road access from Port Alice via maintained industrial road. (Forest Service Road 7989 01). Follow signs for Side Bay. Part of this is on decommissioned logging roads. At turn off sign for Side Bay, take road on the right. Road base in good condition but both small tree branches and bushes will significantly scratch side of vehicles. Parking on road or on site at top of beach. Vehicle may be driven on rough track to top of beach. Hiking trail reported leading to Rowley Reefs Peninsula south but start point not known, presumably from spur roads to S.

properties.title: Garden Bay
properties.landing_comments: 200 m shoreline. Dinghy dock, float, rebuilt 2018. SW aspect in protected harbour. Adjacent beaches rough angular cobble, stones but feasible for landings.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: 450 m circle trail, vault toilet, water at tap, gravel parking lot off Claydon Road, 2 picnic tables. Large upland area with other trails leading to Mount Daniel. Amenities nearby. Adjacent to First Nation graveyard, Indian Reserve. Anchorage. Small FN building on site. Historic site of large winter village Sawquamain with its 7 large longhouses - a part of Kalpalin. See Garden Bay Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Link Islet
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient sandstone ledges with small clam bed, silt, gravel beaches between rock ribs. Protected except from S.  Numerous landing options including beach between Link Island, Link Islet. S, SW, SE aspects.
properties.camp_comments: Extensive grassy areas with a few trees. Some camp furniture present (2019).
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View.

properties.title: Burgoyne Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on low gradient sand, mud beach. Much soft mud at low water. Vessel traffic. Subject to gap winds SE, NW. Currents in Sansum Narrows.
properties.camp_comments: No camping currently permitted.
properties.other_comments: Road with limited parking at 500 m or closer. depending on landing location chosen. Extensive marked hiking trails. Popular anchorage. Birding. See: Burgoyne Bay Provincial Park

properties.title: Winter Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy in sheltered cove. Gravel, sand beach either S or N of small 'Park use only' dock, float. Gravel launch ramp.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Picnic tables, pit toilets.
properties.other_comments: Dock, float. Popular anchorage. Hiking trails. Boat Passage viewing area. Parking lot. Gulf Islands National Park Reserve. See Winter-Cove

properties.title: Zilwood Road Retreat Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, pebble beach, bedrock outcrops in protected cove. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: 50 m trail runs from/to small parking area for 2 vehicles off Porlier Pass Road. Steep, awkward access for launching, stone steps to beach. Galiano Island Parks & Recreation Commission maintained official shore access #31"Zilwood Road". Gazebo on public trail.

properties.title: Jupata Way
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient bedrock beach of inclined strata sedimentary rock. Some shell patches.   80 m unpaved path to approx 18 concrete steps.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Turn off Lands End Rd onto Seabreeze Road, at roundabout take Jupata Way to N. Unrestricted parking (but local by-law limits time to 24 hr) for 4 cars. Might be other parking in area.

properties.title: Lake Bay
properties.landing_comments: Pebble, gravel beach with moderate slope.  Drift logs at high water, rounded rocks, cobble at mid water, boulders at low water.  SE aspect. Protected from N, W.
properties.camp_comments: Swampy, damp upland. Marginal for dry weather site camp with some brushing. Undeveloped user maintained wilderness site. Potential but marginal bluff site.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at small creek, probably year-round but which does not drain lake as charted. Usable refuge or day use site. Short trail leads from beach area. See Read Island Provincial Park

properties.title: Porteau Cove Boat Ramp
properties.landing_comments: Twin concrete boat ramps without float but central raised walkway. Subject to flotsam blockage. Adjacent sand, gravel, rubble beaches.
properties.camp_comments: See Porteau Cove campsite description.
properties.other_comments: Paved day parking for boat trailers. Toilets, change room, showers, picnic benches. Check with Park Operator at kiosk during open hours for limited overnight parking in upper lot (summer only). Popular dive site. See Porteau Cove Provincial Park

properties.title: Maple Bay Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy at protected pebble beach. Steep path to upland park facilities.
properties.camp_comments: No camping
properties.other_comments: Paddlers may launch either at the rowing club to S, or from beach within park, but use only Maple Bay Beach Park for overnight parking. Operated as park of Municipality of North Cowichan. Toilets, public beach, picnic tables, swimming raft. Located on Beaumont Avenue at Springett Street.

properties.title: Shingle Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sheltered beach of low gradient sand, gravel, pebble, mud, clam bed with angular stones, on NE side of bay with NW aspect. Protected by rocky headland, islet, reefs. Land at N side of open grass tent area in old orchard. Mud, weed at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Large gravel tent pads, picnic tables, in shaded orchard, vault toilet, kiosk, food lockers. No potable water. Hammock opportunities but may not use fruit trees, oaks or arbutus trees. Limit 5 persons per site, 2 tents/site. Fees charged year-round. Small overflow area for 3 tents lacks tables. All sites reservable Reservations advised in summer. Phone needed to call in on arrival if not already reserved. No fires permitted. 250-654-4000, Toll-free: 1-866-944-1744
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Gulf Islands National Park Reserve. Gated steep road access 240 m from end of Shingle Bay Road. Site shared with cyclists, walk-in users. Hiking trails. Small parking area for overnight use at gate. Irene Bay offers best local hand launch site. See camping

properties.title: Lavender Road
properties.landing_comments: Easy on small possibly disused boat ramp adjacent to parking area.  Beach substrate pebble, rock, shell, barnacle. Easy launch at high tides. Boulders gradually being moved off ramp.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Turn N off Dickinson Road to end of Lavender Road . Small park. Picnic table, bench. Day parking for 6 vehicles. Additional roadside parking not yet approved for overnight use. Access less popular than other local beaches because not sandy. District of Lantzville beach access park.

properties.title: Benwaldun Road
properties.landing_comments: Pebble beach, moderately steep gradient at top but mostly low gradient sand, eelgrass below band of larger pebble. Short carry from road at high water but long at low water.  N aspect. Small boat concrete ramp to beach next to short stairs. Suited to wheeled carts.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: End of Benwaldun Drive off Lantzville Road. Parking at roadside for 3 vehicles. No overnight parking. District of Lantzville municipality.

properties.title: Welbury Bay
properties.landing_comments: Steep concrete footpath with handrail, a few steps at bottom lead from roadside near BC Ferry booth to protected mixed beach that floods at high water. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Picnic tables at top of ramp. Flush toilets at ferry terminal.
properties.other_comments: Drinking water available at ferry terminal. Useful to have another paddler to assist moving boat down ramp. Very close to ferry making easy access with cart from Tsawwassen, other islands, but ramp itself is not cart-friendly. Regional park on N shore of bay with short hiking trail. Nearby 48 hr parking on Long Harbour Road.

properties.title: Cautious Point Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on pebble, sand, mixed rock beach. NE aspect. Usually well sheltered. More difficult on SW facing beach across island neck - rocky, some surf possible.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not currently permitted in Checleset Bay Ecological Reserve. However, a few much-used tent sites sit close together at upland margin. Others located further inland towards beach on opposite side (SE) of island.
properties.other_comments: Popular, attractive site. Aka Island 195

properties.title: Bunsby Islet 2
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing. Small sheltered sand beach at all tides.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not currently permitted in Checleset Bay Ecological Reserve. Grassy bench. Exposed to wind.
properties.other_comments: Very attractive. Aka Island 170.

properties.title: Bunsby Islet 1
properties.landing_comments: Easy sheltered landing on small shell beach.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not permitted in Checleset Bay Ecological Reserve.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Popular for picnics, swimming from shell beach.

properties.title: Davis Bay south
properties.landing_comments: Low  gradient 2% slope to 10% higher up beach, patches of sand, gravel, and varied to 50 mm cobbles. Long carry at low water. Short stairs concrete stairs or bank from walkway to beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Water at marker and outside washroom building. Toilets. Benches. S end of 1 km long Davis Bay Beach. District of Sechelt municipal park. Parking along whole length but not overnight.

properties.title: Davis Bay north
properties.landing_comments: 10% slope, 50 - 75 mm rounded cobbles. Short concrete stairs to beach from paved walkway.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: N end of 1 km long beach. Water at drinking fountain.Picnic tables, benches. Walkway along length of bay. Day parking along whole length but not overnight. District of Sechelt municipal park.

properties.title: Snickett Park
properties.landing_comments: 50 mm cobble beach, 15% slope. Bedrock outcrops. Awkward beach access over bedrock. Exposed to S.
properties.camp_comments: No camping
properties.other_comments: 5440 Shornecliff Avenue just off Highway 101. Limited parking for 5 or 6 vehicles but no overnight parking. Portable toilet. 50 m trail to beach. W end of 'Trail Bay Waterfront' walking trail. District of Sechelt beach access park.

properties.title: Silverstone Beach
properties.landing_comments: Beach of pebble, 50 mm cobble.15% slope. Exposed SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: 60 m walk-in access trail with steep section, long stairs. 6133 Sunshine Coast Hwy at junction with Norwest Bay Road. Limited parking along highway. District of Sechelt beach access park 250 m wide. View. Possible water source where creek in culvert enters beach at base of cliff.

properties.title: Sea Fiddler Road
properties.landing_comments: 15% slope, 50 mm round pebble beach, many drift logs at upper beach, exposed to S, some shelter from W.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: 6931 Sunshine Coast Highway. Up to 8 parking spaces in narrow lane. Walk 10 m to beach. Picnic table. District of Sechelt beach access park.

properties.title: Wakefield Road
properties.landing_comments: Easy on exposed gravel, pebble beach with 10% slope.  Dries far at low water. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Easy launch, parking for 2 cars 5 m from beach. Picnic table, bench. Waterfront walking trail links to Mason Road etc. District of Sechelt beach access park.

properties.title: Klashkish Inlet
properties.landing_comments: Steep gravel beach at high tide. Low gradient at mid, low tide. Gravel berm at beach top.
properties.camp_comments: Level sites on pebble berm top.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek in small bay to E.

properties.title: Gartley Road
properties.landing_comments: Pebble upper beach, sandy lower beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted
properties.other_comments: Gartley Road ends at beach. Parking unknown. Comox Valley RD beach access.

properties.title: Point Holmes
properties.landing_comments: Long concrete ramp over low gradient mixed beach. Exposed SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Ramp on Lazo Road leased from Comox municipality by Point Holmes Recreation Assoc, a community group. Launch fee charged for ramp use. Lots of parking but not overnight.

properties.title: Argyle Road
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient pebble, cobble beach. Boulders at sides. Boat run cleared. Exposed E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Easy vehicle access at end of Argyle Road off Highway 19A. View. Comox Regional District official beach access. Limited roadside parking.

properties.title: Dorothy Road
properties.landing_comments: Moderate gradient cobble, pebble, shell beach, approx. 20 to 30 m from vehicle access. Exposed E aspect. Boat run through larger cobble, boulder band. Several charted pylons help locate return to launch.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Walk-in access route at end of Dorothy Road, Royston off Highway 19A crosses mowed grassed area maintained by local resident, but on public right of way to foreshore. Adequate off-roadside parking, overnight permitted.

properties.title: Little Bunsby Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on small sand, pebble beach. Mostly floods at high water.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not currently permitted in Checleset Bay Ecological Reserve. However paddlers are reported have camped on beach and on now heavily overgrown upland sites.
properties.other_comments: None

properties.title: Paradise Beach
properties.landing_comments: Sand beach protected by large rock outcrop. S aspect. Expect surf. Rocky boulders on west end of beach hidden at high tides. Sketchy at a lower tide - amplifies the surf. Big rock garden in west end of bay. Surge and dump at lower tides. South swells may give difficult landing.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not permitted on beach - in Checleset Bay Ecological Reserve. Paddlers have camped on upland within Mquqwin Brooks Peninsula Provincial Park. 2 cleared sites known (2012). See: Mquqwin Brooks Peninsula Provincial Park.
properties.other_comments: Water at stream W of rocky point dividing beach. Possible freshwater bathing pool. Seasonal stream at E end of beach. Attractive.

properties.title: Little Bunsby Islet
properties.landing_comments: Easy sheltered landing on pebble beach.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not currently permitted within the Checleset Bay Ecological Reserve. However paddlers have camped on grassy upland above beach.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Growler Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy on pebble beach E or W of log-covered tombolo. Exposed to W wind.
properties.camp_comments: Semi exposed, undeveloped. Pit toilet not seen 2023. Camping discouraged here but was once a campsite..
properties.other_comments: Views. Provincial Boat Haven, anchorage. See Qwiquallaaq/Boat Bay Conservancy.

properties.title: McKenzie Bight
properties.landing_comments: Easy on pebble, cobble beach with some shelter
properties.camp_comments: No camping. No fires. Pit toilets. Best rest stop is 300 m S of creek mouth on gravel beach.
properties.other_comments: 1.3 km trail to parking lot. Other trails. Creek is seasonal, often dry. See Gowlland Tod Provincial Park

properties.title: Shehtekwahn east bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on broad moderate gradient beach of sand, gravel, pebble, other rocks. Drift logs. Scattered boulders. ENE aspect, protected from NW.
properties.camp_comments: A few small beach sites on sand among logs. Level upland areas in trees with sites for several tents, subject to minor brushing, levelling. Visible hazard trees. Crude camp furniture. Fire ring.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal stream crossing centre beach approx 200 m from site. Road or trail access so use possible by vehicle-based campers, fishers.

properties.title: Holford Bay south
properties.landing_comments: Protected beach in cove of small cobble, broken rock. SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Coordinates might refer to landing . Sea Trails Charts Seattle WA show a site 150 m to N at N48D 56.220M W125D 05.052M. Likely the same site but no further information.
properties.other_comments: Tzartus Island.

properties.title: Diana Island northeast
properties.land_tenure: Crown tenure - Section 17 designated use area, Crown?
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, gravel beach. Access between rock reefs at low water. N aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Beach top sites behind drift logs. Upland forest sites. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Attractive.

properties.title: Baronet Passage west
properties.landing_comments: Clam bed beach in protected cove with pebble at high water, cobble, boulders at lower water levels. NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Some upland sites in second growth forest. Brushing likely needed.
properties.other_comments: 2013 Conservancy management plan suggests new site in vicinity. See Qwiquallaaq/Boat Bay Conservancy.

properties.title: Northeast Bay
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient broad open pebble beach with mixed rocks to 100 mm. Creek estuary in  wide bay, exposed to N. May approach up creek channel at low tide. Alternate landing on steeper gravel beach immediately to SE, with access to similar upland.
properties.camp_comments: Sites among forest margin. Several sites to S of creek where trail from road enters. 1 or 2 sites on N side of creek. Potential for additional sites with brushing or could camp directly on old road.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Water at year-round Russ Creek, small waterfall, bathing pool. ATV access via broad trail or old road from larger main island road. AKA Russ Creek. UREP recreational status. Noted for recreational value by Regional District.

properties.title: Single Tree Point
properties.landing_comments: S of point proper, low gradient broad gravel, pebble beach at all water levels, steeper at top. Smooth area in centre between boulder, bedrock bands perpendicular to shoreline. Kelp.
properties.camp_comments: Beach top camp on gravel between drift logs dry at most tides. Minor brushing will give 1-2 upland sites. Hammock opportunities. Fire pit.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal stream (Suquash Creek) E of point, flowing in drought mid-July 2023. Route of inactive industrial road runs behind shore. Former Suquash village site assumed located in vicinity.

properties.title: Crabapple Islets
properties.landing_comments: Sand beach NW aspect. Easier landing than Marks Creek. Landing good in the bay behind islets.
properties.camp_comments: Beach sites. Random wilderness camping permitted. No fees (2018).
properties.other_comments: See: <Mquqwin Brooks Peninsula Provincial Park.

properties.title: Cape Cook Lagoon
properties.landing_comments: Moderate to difficult. Surf likely. Paddle into river channel to avoid sand bars. Easier approach at high water.
properties.camp_comments: Random wilderness camping. No fees (2018). Best sites on top of dune S of river mouth. Sheltered.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. Attractive. Unique lagoon. Drift Whale Bay to N has area's finest white sand beach. See: Mquqwin Brooks Peninsula Provincial Park.

properties.title: Jackobson Point northwest
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing all tides on moderate gradient gravel, sand beach in sheltered cove.  Accumulates drift logs after SE storms. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Upland cleared tent sites, Hammock opportunities. Shaded in afternoon. Well protected. Appears to have occasional use by commercial groups, fishers.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal stream at N end of beach. Anchorage, Provincial Boat Haven. Lagoon nearby. Short marked hiking trail across neck to Jackobson Point small sand beach in Ecological Reserve where camping not permitted. See: Mquqwin Brooks Peninsula Provincial Park.

properties.title: Nasparti Pocket Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on pebble beach.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on beach.
properties.other_comments: Small but adequate and quite secluded. See: Mquqwin Brooks Peninsula Provincial Park.

properties.title: Rugged Point
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient sand beach to N of point protected from surf except in NE outflow wind. N aspect. Sand beaches S of point often have surf. Headlands give varying protection to parts. S aspect. Expect long carries.
properties.camp_comments: Beach on N side of point has 2 -3 wooden tent platforms, cleared upland sites for additional tents, picnic table, picnic shelter, fire pit, composting toilet, metal food lockers. A beach 400 m to E beyond low rocks has 4-6 further tent sites, camp furniture, Random beach camping on sand at various locations depending on tides, plus on at least 3 separate S facing beaches across headland trail. Hammock opportunities. No fees (2025).
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creeks on S beach, E beach, W beach accessible on foot below hide tide or by headland trails. Awkward access to first creek on S beach, Year-round water at head of McLean Cove 0.8 NM NE by boat and at Sandpiper Creek 45 min along S beach.. Attractive. View. See: Rugged Point Provincial Park.

properties.title: Resolution Park
properties.landing_comments: Easy on low gradient gravel beach. N aspect. Gravel boat launch. Float, dock under repair 2020/21.
properties.camp_comments: Developed maintained sites with fire pits, picnic tables. Toilets. No fees (2021).
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. View. Rough boat ramp usable at high tide. Floating dock. Located on gravel road to Fair Harbour about 10 km from Zeballos Halfway along, past prominent viewpoint, where road veers sharply right, is turnoff to Resolution Park (signed). AKA Rhodes Creek.

properties.title: Spring Island south
properties.landing_comments: Steep shell sand gravel beach. Recommend approaching from E. W side landing more exposed.  Surf in some conditions.
properties.camp_comments: Sites in the trees N and S of tombolo plus numerous sites above beach but they can flood in storms. Wind may affect which sites can be reasonably used. Pit toilet in trees near rocks with old concrete pad. Recent observation 15 tenting areas.
properties.other_comments: Attractive, popular site. Site excluded from Treaty Settlement Lands in 2008 Maa_nulth Treaty. Rest of Spring Island FN owned but subject to public access under same Treaty. Careful of Giant Hogweed. Can burn skin. Toilet requires repair. Paddlers need to be aware that in certain sea states (strong winds from SE or NW and swells), this site is not easy to reach from Kyuquot Sound or to leave in bad weather. Surrounded by reefs. Allow a weather day.

properties.title: Vernaci Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected small shell, gravel, boulder beach. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. No fees. Camp in trees on benches above beach. 3-5 good sites available in clearing with tall trees surrounding. One potential site on other side of island. Hammock opportunities. Hazardous leaning tree reported 2022 over main site.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Quiet. Serves as overflow site for Charlies Beach. See: Bligh Island Marine Provincial Park.

properties.title: Charlies Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy on gravel, cobble beaches on both sides of isthmus. E side has finer gravel, more room for boat stowage. W side has some jagged bedrock. The fallen cedar and other leaning trees are easily seen when landing on the E side (preferred).
properties.camp_comments: Dispersed camping permitted. No fees. 5 open sites in upland forest above W beach with kitchen area, food cache, composting toilet. Three smaller sites on E beach. Other upland sites on E side were compromised by a large cedar tree taking out other trees when it fell. Users should exercise caution and make their own assessments.
properties.other_comments: Owner of float house in Cuttle Cove allowed some paddlers (June 2025) to obtain piped water. Other water sources very limited in summer. Anchorage. View. See: Bligh Island Marine Provincial Park.

properties.title: Burdwood Bay
properties.landing_comments: Sand beach. W aspect. W end of bay often has surf. NE corner, where the campsite is, may also have surf even in light winds. There is a small bay within the bay and to the southwest that is more protected from swell and has less surf. This bay is also suitable for beach camping above the high tide.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped beach camping. One protected upland forest tent site at NE end of bay, with more sites on the sand, gravel nearby. Many options. The area of strongest surf is near the creek so suggested camping at the other end of the bay on the SW side of the beach. . The NE end of the bay has 2 sea caves with the one closest to camp having a "back door" entrance accessible in most tides.
properties.other_comments: There is a tree leaning over the extended camping area at the NE end of the bay. The main area would not be affected, but campers should use caution as to where they set up their tent.

properties.title: Escalante Point north
properties.landing_comments: Exposed, reefs, subject to high surf. Broad sand beach. S end more protected. where kelp in cove between point, rocks reduces surf.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on attractive, exposed beach. Undeveloped. Space for many tents.
properties.other_comments: Water at river 1 km N. View. Rugged hiking trail across point to Escalante Pt south. Park boundary at point - land to S is Hesquiat Peninsula Provincial Park. Huge Prov Rec Site 111 Ha. area runs N beyond Escalante River.

properties.title: Heelboom Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on gravel beach.
properties.camp_comments: About 6 well established upland sites, 3 more on beach. Space in cabin but reported dirty and has mice. At least 2 more possible beach sites. camping,
properties.other_comments: Water source. Site needs toilet. Cabin might no longer be in usable condition. Anchorage, Provincial Boat Haven. Behind cabin, rough trail leads 4 hours to Great Cedar Loop, tree grove. Also accessible from Lemmens Inlet.

properties.title: Rassier Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy on smooth sand beach. Low gradient. S aspect. Protected from W, N.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on beach or on 2 small brushed upland sites in trees. Pit toilet (green throne) has recently filled, and has been moved to a fork down the trail. New hole was dug May 2025. Currently green throne is balanced on driftwood logs, centered over new pit. Functional and sturdy, but may not be a permanent solution. Old pit is overflowing with feces and is somewhat covered by sticks / grass. A new steel bear cache was dropped off last spring (2024), and was never installed. It is now semi buried on the beachFresh water should not be expected or depended upon anywhere on Vargas in summer months.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. 17.8 Ha Rec Site.

properties.title: Pirates Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy on moderate to steep gradient shell, gravel beach facing Ruxton Passage in cove S of Pirates Cove proper. Some exposure to S. Landing in Pirates Cove proper not advised.
properties.camp_comments: Walk-in sites with wooden tent pads, picnic tables, 1 vault, 1 composting toilets. Access from beach top via stair up steep bank to N. No fires permitted. Campers must remove all garbage. Camping fees apply year-round. May pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites. Fee $5.00 per person per night (2019) via Internet or in drop box near water pump. BC Parks Backcountry Registration
properties.other_comments: Potable water at pump 200 m from tent area. Walking trails. 2 dinghy docks in main cove to NW. Anchorage in adjacent NW (main) cove. Search for: Pirates Cove Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Chivers Point
properties.landing_comments: Sand, pebble, rock beach, rocky ridges at low water. Narrow approach. Beach mostly floods at high water. Exposed to NW. Bring boats up bank at highest water levels.
properties.camp_comments: 8 wooden tent platforms. Vault toilet. Food cache. Picnic table at each tent site. 2 small overflow tent sites. Hammock opportunities. No fires permitted. Camping fees apply year-round. Pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites or pay at site. Fee $5.00 per person per night (2025) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View from point, low ridge above tent sites. Hiking trails. Most popular of 3 sites on island for paddlers. See: Wallace Island Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Cabin Bay
properties.landing_comments: Boat run through rocks onto sand, pebbles or rock ledges between rock ribs at neck behind small promontory. Slight Exposure to N.  Alternative landing from SE at high water. Approach from NW suited to all tide levels unless blocked by drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: Tent platforms for 2 tents, placed close together. Camp only on designated sites. 2 picnic tables. Pit toilet at Chivers Point site 10 min walk away. No fires permitted. Stairs lead up steep bank to main island trail. Camping fees apply year-round. Pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites or pay at site. Fee $5.00 per person per night (2025) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System.
properties.other_comments: Attractive, Bring water - closest available Montague Harbour Provincial Park, Dionisio Point Provincial Park. Promontory suited to day use. Hiking trails. See: Wallace Island Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Mansons Landing
properties.landing_comments: Easy on shell, sand beach adjacent to wharf, floats. Good parking with easy access to beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Closest camping is at Smelt Bay Provincial Park.
properties.other_comments: Lagoon. Manson's Landing Harbour Authority. Adjacent Manson's Landing Provincial Park has toilets, other facilities. Parking. Potable water not available. Access via Sutil Pt. Rd. Popular tube ride from lagoon on ebb.

properties.title: Hudson Point
properties.landing_comments: Gravel boat ramp ends at beach of sand, gravel. Low gradient beach muddy at low water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Off North Beach Road. a short road descends to beach 800 m N of Fernwood Rd. Limited roadside parking. Sign.Believed to be maintained by Capital Regional District.

properties.title: Ladysmith Boat Ramp
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected beach next to boat ramp. Usable in most tides.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Water, showers toilets, parking. Wharf , floats. Location end of Ludlow Road. Services, accommodation nearby.

properties.title: Adam River
properties.landing_comments: Easy, rubble/pebble at breakwater, dryland sort or at boat club  concrete ramp. Currents, wind hazards in Strait.
properties.camp_comments: Active log sort in 2012. Seek permission to launch. Small boat club on private land. Former main camp area to S open and unattractive and currently under private lease. Reported site for camping away from industrial area not found.
properties.other_comments: Water at river. Road access well-maintained 2012. Launch site by permission. View. Vehicle access S of the dryland log sort area may be used by permission. Active industrial zone 2012.

properties.title: Alert Bay
properties.landing_comments: Concrete boat ramps in vicinity. Small sand beach with access via steps etc up sea wall. Ramp access up wall near large cannery sheds.
properties.camp_comments: No camping near beach. Small commercial campsite inland is difficult to access without vehicle. Hill St site is preferable with good access..
properties.other_comments: Village of Ya'lis. Namgis First Nation. U'mista cultural centre.

properties.title: Telegraph Cove
properties.landing_comments: 2 private businesses provide easy, sheltered concrete launch ramps and parking. One is year-round at north end of cove on Lagoon Road. See Telegraph Cove Marina & RV Park. The other is seasonal at south end on Telegraph Cove Road at bottom of hill entering cove. View of it is blocked by floats, boats when paddling back in. See Telegraph Cove Resort.
properties.camp_comments: Commercial camping located 0.8 km southeast of village at end of Bauza Creek Road. Up hill on gravel. Requires vehicle to access from landing.Too far to carry gear.
properties.other_comments: Restaurant, accommodation, provisions, fuel, water, toilet. Water taxi base.

properties.title: Gooding Cove west
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient sand beach. Protected, especially from W and SW.
properties.camp_comments: Beach camping at W end away from road access. Easier landing conditions for paddlers not accessing road.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek crossing beach near site. Possible launch site. Anchorage - Provincial Boat Haven.

properties.title: Mahatta Creek
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing up river mouth near sign except for tides below 0.5 m. Alternate landing on beach to W is easy at all tides.
properties.camp_comments: 5 or more sites on upland, connected by trail. Small boat storage areas beside trail near both beaches.
properties.other_comments: Collect water at highest navigable point up creek at waterfall 0.7 NM. Attractive. Anchorage. Provincial Boat Haven near Koskimo Islands. Cache location: 50.459230°N; 127.867490°W

properties.title: Rowley Reefs Peninsula north
properties.landing_comments: Easy on very protected low gradient sand beach. No surf. N aspect. Bedrock, shingle at W side with steeper gradient.
properties.camp_comments: Beach appears to flood at Springs. Some tent sites on upper beach. Upland sites at centre beach and in open forest near cabin may need minor brushing. User-maintained cabin in good condition 2015 but roof leak reported 2017. Pit toilet. Float near cabin.
properties.other_comments: Seasonal creek near centre beach. Logging evident behind beach. Short hiking trail to Rowley Reefs Peninsula south starts at W end of beach.

properties.title: Rowley Reefs Peninsula south
properties.landing_comments: Easy on broad pebble, gravel beach with some sand. S aspect. Protected from NW. Possible surf in SW wind, swell but reefs, kelp protect shores close to NW entrance. Treat reefs to W carefully on approach.
properties.camp_comments: Beach camping on fine gravel behind drift logs. Possible to clear upland level sites in mostly dense salal with open mossy forest behind. Good, large user-maintained public cabin. Stove. Propane cooker. Pit toilet. S aspect. Sunny.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at year-round creek approx 1 km S. Smaller seasonal creek closer to site. Hiking trails to Rowley Reefs Peninsula north from cabin and to Gooding Cove via old road, starting approx 750 m S along beach, marked by hung floats.

properties.title: Kwakiutl Point
properties.landing_comments: Use caution navigating between Kwakuitl Point and small reefs to protected beach. Easy landing on sand, gravel beach.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on beach. Random wilderness camping permitted. No fees (2018).
properties.other_comments: Attractive interesting shoreline to explore in calm conditions. Less exposed to SW winds than other nearby sites. See Lawn Point Provincial Park

properties.title: Keith River Estuary
properties.landing_comments: Accessible at high water, but river mouth dries at low tide making landing, launching difficult.
properties.camp_comments: Could be used as campsite but better use as a walk or paddle excursion from Keith River site to S. Camp on restricted shelf above river for 5 or more tents but not much room at higher tides.
properties.other_comments: Water at river. River navigable for some distance at mid - high tides.

properties.title: Chuish Island (Island 40)
properties.landing_comments: Easy on partly protected sand, gravel beach of moderate gradient (3 to 5 %). NNE aspect. Optional S side landing at same E point.
properties.camp_comments: 5 or more good, partly sheltered sites on gravel bench. Protected rustic kitchen area. Smaller sites among drift logs or on pebbly upper S beach and in grassy treed areas. No fees (2025). Green throne pit toilet on S side, W of main camp area, along short marked trail. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Aka Island 40 or Second Island. See: Nuchatlitz Provincial Park.

properties.title: Catala Island south
properties.landing_comments: Moderate sand, gravel, small cobble beaches exposed to surge, occasional surf, especially on pebble beach areas in W, NW winds. Gradient 3 to 5 percent. S, SW or SE aspects.
properties.camp_comments: Random wilderness camping allowed. Several sheltered upland sites at point or in mossy forest. S aspect. Camp furniture. Fire pit. No fees (2025). Other exposed beach sites on coarse sand, pebble on either side of point. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Rock gardens, sea caves, tide pools, beach walks, wildlife viewing. See: Catala Island Provincial Marine Park.

properties.title: Rosa Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sheltered small beach of fine sand, moderate gradient. N aspect. Beach entrance not easily seen behind reef from some directions.
properties.camp_comments: Several semi-developed upland tent sites of differing size. also some beach camping but little beach at Springs. Composting toilet. Metal food bins. Rustic kitchen area. Posted notice Re; no fires, no smoking. Reported Sept 2025: BC Parks has recommended not camping at Rosa due to unstable trees. They have done some work to remove hazards but not completed.You would want to use good judgment of overhead hazards if using the are in high winds.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Often busy - frequent drop-off point for water transport. Wildlife viewing. Sea otters. Anchorage - Provincial Boat Haven at rocky bay on E side of island. Short trail across island. See: Nuchatlitz Provincial Park.

properties.title: Robert Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected sand beach.
properties.camp_comments: 3 upland sites. Beach camping during moderate tides. Evidence of beach flooding during storms. One reporter describes as rough and somewhat inadequate campsite.
properties.other_comments: Quiet, secluded. We have created a Vargas Island webpage with information about Ahousaht passes and a link to the Ahousaht map where there is allowable camping and day use.

properties.title: Whaler Islet
properties.landing_comments: Easy sand beaches subject to surf.  Lee side usually protected enough.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not sanctioned by Ahousaht First Nation.
properties.other_comments: Unique island. Sand dunes. Multiple fire rings are evidence of past destructive camping behaviour, Follow our Code of Conduct.

properties.title: Whitesand Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy on broad sand beach. SE aspect. Occasional surf but more protected than Cow Bay.
properties.camp_comments: Beach and upland camping.
properties.other_comments: Wild Side hiking Trail to Cow Bay and Ahousaht village. $25 trail use fee (2014) applies outside park boundary. No camping fees (2018). Muddy hiking trail to warm spring in Matilda Inlet. Aka Gibson Marine Park, Whitesands Beach. See Wildside Trail See: Gibson Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Conover Cove
properties.landing_comments: Difficult, awkward on rock shelves, in sheltered cove. Easier at high water on tiny beach of pebble, some sand. High public float difficult for paddlecraft unloading or launching. Mud at low water. Alternate landing in Honeymoon Bay on E side of island N48D 56.283M, W123D 32.650M
properties.camp_comments: Numbered sites each with a picnic table plus possible additional random sites in open grass field, damp in Spring. Less suited for hammocks. Pit, vault toilets. No fires permitted. Food cache. Dining shelter. Camping fees apply year-round. May pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites. Fee $5.00 per person per night (2025) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System.
properties.other_comments: Dock, busy anchorage. Historic buildings. Bring water - closest available at Montague Harbour Provincial Park or Dionisio Point Provincial Park. Hiking trails. Mostly used by boaters who moor at dock or in cove. See Wallace Island Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Montague Harbour sum'nuw
properties.landing_comments: Easy shell, sand sheltered beaches on both sides of peninsula. Sand, mud at low water. Preferred beach E of dock near steps.
properties.camp_comments: 28 designated walk-in sites of which 21 reservable mid-May to early-Sept. Fees apply year-round $25/night per party summer, $13 winter (2025). BC Parks Camping. Group shelter. Picnic tables. Food bins. Vault and pit toilets. Fires rings. Additional sites in damp but pleasant mowed field to NE of main site. 16 additional drive-in reservable sites.
properties.other_comments: Water at taps. Anchorage. Amphitheatre, dock, boat launch. Pub, restaurant nearby. Trails. See: Montague Harbour Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: James Bay Prevost Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected sand, gravel beach at high water. Low gradient. Mud, eel grass, long carry at low water. NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Sites in old orchard. Damp. Unmown tall grass may reduce sites usable for tenting. Also better sites in trees on adjacent high cove bank. Hammock opportunities. 4 picnic tables. Food cache. Composting toilet. Fee charged year-round $13.50 person/night (summer) $7.50 person/night (winter) 2025 rates. No fires, including below high tide mark. See camping
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal stream at bay head. Attractive. Popular anchorage. Gulf Islands National Park Reserve. Walking trail to bay head continues to Peile Pt. Main beach at bay head might also known as O'Reilly Beach but unclear.

properties.title: Drummond
properties.landing_comments: Easy on low gradeent sand, silt beach at mid to high water. Trailer boats also launch directly on beach except at lower water when access becomes more difficult due to softer mud, distance from shore.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Picnic tables, picnic shelter, pit toilets.
properties.other_comments: Plenty of day parking on Isabella Point Road. Overnight parking not permitted. Owned by Fulford Hall Association, managed by PARC (Capital Regional District Parks). Adventure playground, . Also home to ‘Fulford Harbour Petroglyph’, a native rock carving. See: Drummond Park

properties.title: Genoa Bay
properties.landing_comments: Protected boat ramp. Shallow gradient.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Ramp is municipal but adjacent parking lot is private. Paddlers should park across from the cafe, against the bank, so large parking lot may be used by marina customers.

properties.title: Big Rock
properties.landing_comments: Concrete ramp. Beach of cobble, boulder. Drift logs. Hazardous currents, traffic, rips in area.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Parking. Picnic table. No toilet. In McCallum Park. Rotary waterfront trail.

properties.title: Beachside Drive
properties.landing_comments: Easy on moderate gradient smooth gravel beach in well-protected Long Harbour. N Aspect Alternate to Ontario Drive. 60 m smooth near-level path from vehicle to beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Large graded gravel parking area at road end. Posted restrictions (2022) are no overnight or long term parking, so now useful only for day trips.

properties.title: Price Road
properties.landing_comments: Easy on broad sand, pebble beach of moderate gradient.  Clams. In outer Ganges Harbour, protected from most directions. E aspect.  Beach 80 m from parking along near-level path,
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Price Road off Beddis Road. Small parking area for 3 or 4 vehicles. No posted parking restrictions. Other roadside parking opportunities, but please respect accesses required by local residents.

properties.title: Beddis Beach
properties.landing_comments: Crushed-shell beach. Long carry at low tide. Road 150 m from beach via wide trail.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. No open fires. Hours 7 am to 11 pm daily.
properties.other_comments: Small roadside parking area at junction of Lionel Crescent, Beddis Road on E side just past gate. Small sign. Attractive. Capital District Regional Park 0.6 ha.forested. Popular for beach activity. Pit toilet. Tidal pools. Swimming.

properties.title: Mill Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy concrete boat ramp and gravel beach at end of Handy Rd.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Limited public parking. Marina, restaurants and stores nearby.

properties.title: Island View Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy on pebble, cobble beach or boat ramp. Exposed to SE. The boat ramp is unusable by boats on a trailer because of the amount of driftwood on the ramp plus significant 5-10 foot break in the concrete ramp (June 2024).
properties.camp_comments: See nearby Island View site for camping information.
properties.other_comments: Toilets, picnic tables, day parking. Island View Beach Regional Park, managed by Capital Regional District. 10 overnight parking spaces on road available near RV sites - must buy permit from District of Central Saanich municipal hall. Parking fee $10.50 for each 24 hours. See: Island View Beach Regional Park.

properties.title: Sand Dune Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy on broad sand beach. SE aspect. Occasional surf but more protected than Cow Bay.
properties.camp_comments: Beach and upland camping with tent platform. Functioning composting toilet with step ladder angle with 5 steps to get up. (2024). Bear cache.
properties.other_comments: Wild Side hiking Trail to Cow Bay and Ahousaht village. $25 trail use fee (2014) applies outside Park boundary. No camping fees (2018). See Wildside Trail. Aka Gibson Marine Park or Whitesands Beach. See: Gibson Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Maquinna Point
properties.landing_comments: Avoid reefs on W side of beach as you approach - visible at mid tides. Surf less at mid beach or behind a reef except at high water.  Semi protected from NW, somewhat exposed to swell. Both Maquinna Point and Maquinna Point East are east of Maquinna Point and can be subject to swell, especially from the W and SW. Maquinna Point is easier to land here than at Maquinna Point East which has a steeper gradient beach. More protected at lower tide.  Mixture of sand, rounded cobbles.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on upper beach. Maquinna Point's beach has a low to medium gradient and it is a short headland walk away from Maquinna Lagoon and Maquinna beach that extends toward Yuquot.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. On Nootka hiking Trail. Short walk to Maquinna Pt. Outer Coast Nootka Island Recreation Site REC16199 as shown on IMAP.

properties.title: Hunt Islets
properties.landing_comments: N beach has preferred easy landing with boat run and small boat stowage area. S beach has boulders, rocks, unapproachable at mid, low tides.
properties.camp_comments: 4 separate secluded campsites along trail connecting the N,S beaches. 3 more on S. beach upland. Green throne pit toilet.
properties.other_comments: Attractive, comfortable site. Logbook cache located in stump at head of trail.

properties.title: Quatsino Park Beaches
properties.landing_comments: Easy on rock, pebble beaches.  Easiest on most easterly beach of group.  Steeper gradient on these beaches than elsewhere in the Sound so fewer low tide issues than elsewhere. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Possible to squeeze in one or two tents on each beach. Not enough room for 3 tents.
properties.other_comments: Several small dispersed beaches suitable for one or two tents each. See Quatsino Provincial Park

properties.title: Grant Bay
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient sand beach. S aspect. Exposed to S, SW, wind, surf. Protected from NW winds, swell.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on grassy upland. Pit toilet.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. Trail access to road to Winter Harbour. Popular with hikers. W wind blows out of bay.

properties.title: Escalante Point south
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand beach protected by reefs, Escalante Island. te?	The start of the 1 km trail to North Escalante Point is marked with buoys. However with some blowdowns and vegetation growth in the middle section of the trail, it would be wise to add more flagging tape to avoid following wolf or bear paths
properties.camp_comments: 2022 ALERT: NO CAMPING AT REQUEST OF LOCAL FIRST NATIONS WITH SUPPORT OF BC PARKS.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. 1 km rugged hiking trail to Escalante Point north marked by buoys. Expect some blowdowns, Year-round water at Escalante R. See: Hesquiat Peninsula Provincial Park.

properties.title: Escalante Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing, protected sand beach.
properties.camp_comments: Small flat upland area above beach filled with sensitive plants. Not suitable for camping due to ecological sensitivity..
properties.other_comments: Very rocky island with unique geological features, plants. Please minimize human impact. Area of site 63 Ha.

properties.title: Balaklava Island Booms
properties.landing_comments: Sheltered, landing on moderately steep smooth pebble, shale beach. Be aware of back eddy near shore. More difficult at high water.
properties.camp_comments: Was at one time a very spacious, grassy site. Former log sort area now re-vegetating so needs serious brushing if more than a handful of tents are used. Rustic camp furniture.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at creek. Old roads for hiking. Former log dump. Strategic for paddling outside Nigei, Balaklava Islands.

properties.title: Nahwitti River
properties.landing_comments: Land at river mouth at W side of bay on sand beaches with N aspect. Subject to surf in high swell conditions, more so on E'erly shores.
properties.camp_comments: Dispersed camping permitted. Camp on beach or in upland near river mouth. Pit toilet. Bear cache, toilet, tent pads at separate North Coast hiking trail. Camping fees apply 1 May to 30 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at San Josef Bay trailhead, but no reservable sites.
properties.other_comments: May paddle up river. Drinking water at river above tidal zone. On N Coast hiking Trail. Cabin ruins. See: Cape Scott Provincial Park

properties.title: Harlequin Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on sand, crushed shell beach. Entrance to beach blocked at low water by rocks which might be fish trap weir.
properties.camp_comments: Sites in 2 mossy forest clearings above steep bank on N side of bay. Picnic table. Random wilderness camping allowed. No fees. Obvious midden location, so fires should be particularly avoided except on beach. Potential for additional sites if brushed.
properties.other_comments: Anchorage across bay. Trail across island from bay head to resort reported but not verified. See: God's Pocket Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Shell Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected shell beach at all water levels. S aspect. Vessel traffic hazards.
properties.camp_comments: Gravel tent pads. Hammock opportunities. Pit toilet. Picnic tables, food cache bin. Sunny SW aspect. Fee charged year-round. First come, first served. No fires, including below high tide mark. Sensitive areas have been damaged by trampling, so avoid overflow camping. Large parties should use Princess Bay instead. See camping
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Extensive trails. Large midden. Gulf Islands National Park Reserve.

properties.title: Beaumont
properties.landing_comments: Easy, on gravel, sand beach on either side of isthmus joining to Skull Islet.
properties.camp_comments: Picnic tables. Compositing toilets. No fires, including below high tide mark.
properties.other_comments: Trails lead to paved road 3 km, also to resort. Canada Customs clearance, drinking water at Poet's Cove Resort, 0.6 NM by boat. Hiking trail to Mt. Norman. Anchorage. Gulf Islands National Park Reserve.

properties.title: Musgrave Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, pebble, cobble beach. More rocks at small point. Protected from SE by islet. Sign visible from water. S aspect. Please do not land on sensitive small Musgrave Rock AKA 'Cactus Island' just off site.
properties.camp_comments: Beach floods at Springs. Several sites on old road in upland at SE end of beach. 2 smaller, marginal beach-top sites on gravel. Picnic table. Pit toilet. No fires in upland. Vehicle accessible from Musgrave Road so roadway sites vulnerable to being driven over.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek approx 300 m to SW. Attractive, view. From parking just off Musgrave Road, road leads SW to private residence, but branches S along old roadbed ending at site. Hiking trails in adjacent Musgrave Greenbelt including to 2 waterfalls. Rec Site area 35.5 Ha. Site maintained by Cowichan Kayak & Canoe Club.

properties.title: Arbutus Point
properties.landing_comments: Large moderate gradient shell beach W of point suited to most water levels. N aspect. Also choice of 2 closer easy shell beaches at high water only. Rock shelf at low water. Ship wash likely from frequent ferries.
properties.camp_comments: Tent pads in trees. Composting toilet. Picnic tables. Fee charged year-round. First come, first served for campsites. No fires, including below high tide mark. Sensitive areas have been damaged by trampling, so avoid overflow camping. Hammock use restricted to trees with durable bark. Large parties should use Princess Bay instead. See camping
properties.other_comments: View. Attractive. Wildlife viewing. Extensive walking trails. Gulf Islands National Park Reserve. Fallen tree on trail to camping area, reported May 7, 2025.

properties.title: Cougar Creek
properties.landing_comments: Sheltered gravel, mud beach next to boat ramp, floats.
properties.camp_comments: Busy developed drive-through large campground. Pit toilets. Picnic tables.
properties.other_comments: Pack your own water. Dock and boat ramp. Pay parking. Seasonal caretaker. Shorter access route to outer Nootka Sd than Muchalat Inlet. No kayak launch fees.

properties.title: Tahsis
properties.landing_comments: Concrete boat ramp.
properties.camp_comments: Vehicle based camping in vicinity.
properties.other_comments: Parking, toilet, water hose. Fee charged.

properties.title: Pool Point
properties.landing_comments: Moderate on sand on SE with boulders to N. Approach from E or W sides.
properties.camp_comments: Attractive. Open rocky area, trees.
properties.other_comments: Views, close to former fishing resort in Double Bay. Small brackish rock pool. 2014 to be leased to commercial operator by Yukusam Heritage Society but currently unused by any known commercial operator.

properties.title: Drake Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing in protected Pamphlet Cove with cleared boat runs through cobbles, boulders on two separate beaches. W aspect. BCMTN sign at the more northerly beach. Space at both beaches for boat stowage.
properties.camp_comments: Main area near sign on level grass on foundation of former Central Hotel, store. Approx 10-12 sites. Secondary single large site for up to 3 tents under fir tree off beach to W but may flood at Springs. Green throne pit toilet.
properties.other_comments: Historic settlement site. Boat wreck near secondary campsite. Short hiking trail between sites. Aka Limestone Island, Pamphlet Cove. Cache location: 50.520810°N; 127.655570°W

properties.title: Yellow Bluff
properties.landing_comments: Easy to moderate depending on swell height. Moderately steep gradient cobble, pebble, sand beach. Surf possible. Beach with E aspect NE of bluff most protected. Sheltered. Optional landing on sand, with W aspect across neck of bluff also offers shelter from NW.
properties.camp_comments: Beach camping on sand in various locations on both sides of neck. No known upland tent sites. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Water at stream crossing beach across Yellow Bluff Bay to ENE 1.2 NM. It can be accessed using the trail from Yellow Bluff Bay across the isthmus to the bay (approximately 150 meters). Flow was steady, likely year round. Water had tannins. Might be possible to use old Port Eliza Main road to walk to stream. Alternative stream at Tatchu 13 Indian Reserve across bay to W. Other closer streams appear less reliable. Attractive. Staging for rounding Tatchu Point. Anchorage. Sea Cave Cove 1.6 NM to ENE might offer further sites. Area 108.9 Ha.

properties.title: Haven Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on small low-gradient gravel, rock beach in well-protected cove.
properties.camp_comments: In salal above beach with brushing. Some grassy areas might remain dry at Neaps. You can set up two tents on a grassy slope on creek left (approaching paddlers’ right of creek). Boats would need lifting onto rock ledge.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. Sometimes used as anchorage for very small boats. There are two fish farms across the inlet that can be herd until 11ish

properties.title: Gregoire Point
properties.landing_comments: Hazardous, exposed rock, reef barrier, boomers extend S from point. Kelp. Good protection from NW, W, SE inside barrier. When entering bay, watch for avoidable small surf wave that may form on left two thirds beside rocks.
properties.camp_comments: Beach sites on sand. Comfortable, secure bad weather refuge.
properties.other_comments: Reliable water source reported at stream N of point. Walk on beach, through bush 1 km from site or reach by boat. Attractive. Protected site on a difficult shoreline. Area 42.6 Ha.

properties.title: Garden Point
properties.landing_comments: Sand tombolo joins to islet. Approach from NE behind islet to sheltered sand, mud, shell, cobble beach. Low gradient beach dries far, so long carry at low water. At low water if swell low, approach from W to follow creek channel with steeper but unstable pebble bank onto moderate gradient pebble beach. N, NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Tent sites in shady or sheltered forested upland at base of tombolo, or on upper beach. Two brighter campsites on islet. Pit toilet unserviceable (2021). Fire pit. Hammock opportunities. Good all weather site.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round Brodick Creek alongside site. Attractive. View. Wildlife viewing. Some forestry work in progress behind site 2024, 2025.This site is located within the Nuchatlaht Nation's Aboriginal Title Lands. See map of the Title area here. Look up term of Aboriginal Title lands in our glossary.

properties.title: Catala Island north
properties.landing_comments: Easy to moderate landing on steep sand, gravel, cobble beach, depending on swell height, direction. Some shelter from SW. Expect surf on approaches in high wind conditions.
properties.camp_comments: Random wilderness camping allowed among many drift logs. Camp near N point or on pebble bench. Limited camping off the beach. Several fire pits. E aspect. No shade. Unofficial pit toilet in need of maintenance 30 m inland from beach. No fees (2020)
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Sea caves nearby. MV Uchuck passes site. See: Catala Island Provincial Marine Park.

properties.title: Shuttleworth Bight
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient sand beach. Light to moderate surf likely. Some protection from W. W side favoured, also has creek entering at extreme W.
properties.camp_comments: Beach or upland camping. Large beach. Random wilderness camping allowed. Camping fees apply 1 May to 30 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at San Josef Bay trailhead, but no reservable sites. Hiking trail campsite located to W of Irony Creek mouth approx 1 NM to NE.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at creek. Historic settlement site. On N Coast hiking Trail. See: Cape Scott Provincial Park

properties.title: Bell Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing in cove on protected white shell beach. Limited room for boat stowage.
properties.camp_comments: Grassy, partially treed area on an obvious midden shelf above beach. Sheltered. Trail up to campsite can be very slippery and path closest to edge is giving way (so use inland path up and down if possible). No facilities. No fees. Avoid fires unless on beach.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Popular. Location gives access to multiple day trip options. Noisy generator at nearby fish farm reported to shut down 9 pm each evening. Overlooks fish farm. See: God's Pocket Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Nolan Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy on low gradient cobble beach. Long carry at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Spacious, sheltered, grassy area between trees, towards point. Afternoon sun. Rustic camp furniture.
properties.other_comments: Seasonal water at small creek. Attractive, popular site. Short trail. Glen-gla-ouch 5 Indian Reserve adjacent to W.

properties.title: Nissen Bight
properties.landing_comments: W beach is more protected.  Surf low to high.
properties.camp_comments: Many sites among drift logs. W side floods at extreme tides. Pit toilet. Bear caches. Dispersed camping allowed. Camping fees apply 1 May to 30 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at San Josef Bay trailhead, but no reservable sites.
properties.other_comments: On Cape Scott and N Coast hiking Trails. Water at creek E of beach approx. 1 km from camp. See: Cape Scott Provincial Park

properties.title: Songhees Creek
properties.landing_comments: Easy on well protected steep cobble, gravel beach. 100 m carry at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Spacious, semi-exposed camp on level gravel bar. Some protection from NW.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. Attractive. Road nearby.

properties.title: San Josef  WFP Campground
properties.landing_comments: Good dirt ramp to river.  Advisable to paddle river at high tide. Low water impedes 3 NM channel, gives high surf at river mouth.
properties.camp_comments: NB. Road closure for bridge replacement Sept 2018. Developed campground. Picnic tables, pit toilets, fire pits. Nice secluded sites.
properties.other_comments: Easy access to San Josef River. Overnight parking. May paddle river to access San Josef Bay. High water preferred. Western Forest Products San Josef Recreation site.

properties.title: Coal Harbour
properties.landing_comments: Best launch near aircraft hangar (Air Cab  250-949-6371).  Alternative on beach to E east of public dock.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Access to Quatsino Sd, Marble River. Parking fee $5/night near museum, floatplane base. Limited free parking near public dock. Washroom, small store beside dock.

properties.title: Crofton
properties.landing_comments: Concrete boat ramp, cobble beach N of ferry terminal.  Please respect other boat users of this busy launch ramp.  Best to use beach adjacent to ramp, but awkward at high water due to large rocks in between.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: No parking in launch area. Park across street in public parking area. Overnight parking permitted. Ferry access road between launch and parking may be blocked with waiting traffic. Toilets. Crofton has full amenities. Park operated by Municipality of North Cowichan.

properties.title: Brechin Boat Ramp
properties.landing_comments: Paddlecraft dock. Concrete boat ramp, adjacent to Departure Bay BC Ferry terminal. Protected channel but busy with vessel traffic, aircraft.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Short and long term pay parking. Be aware that City requires vehicles in the boaters; parking area to have a "visible means of transporting a boat" or they will be ticketed for improper use of the area. Kayak rentals. Numerous amenities e.g. toilets, change room, pub. City of Nanaimo facility.

properties.title: Maple Bay Ramp
properties.landing_comments: Easy at public concrete boat ramp with moderate slope pebble beach on either side, next to rowing club.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Toilets, change room at adjacent park.
properties.other_comments: Parking lot with more available at Maple Bay Beach Park to N. Operated by Municipality of North Cowichan. Located at Dimview Street, Beaumont Avenue.

properties.title: Fort Rupert
properties.landing_comments: Easy, shell/sand beach. Also boat ramp.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Storeys Beach. Tap water

properties.title: Union Island north
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on steep pebble beach at E side of small peninsula. Good protection.
properties.camp_comments: Twin sites on both sides of peninsula neck usable at all water levels. E site preferred. Light use so some sites will need brushing. High step up bank to trail at W landing. 8 usable sites reported in 2022.
properties.other_comments: Trail joins E to W beach. reported as overgrown 2022. Water at small seasonal stream at E end of E site. IMAP shows REC107035 Recreation Reserve.

properties.title: Calvin Creek Falls
properties.landing_comments: Exposed low gradient sand beach. SW aspect. Often difficult, expect high surf.
properties.camp_comments: Most hikers are using sites next to the falls but the kayak sites on the north end of the beach showed very little evidence of prior use but take time to find. 4 upland sheltered sites. Additional sites on beach in good weather. Pit toilet.
properties.other_comments: Water at falls. Campsite is used by hikers on Nootka (hiking) Trail.

properties.title: Marvinas Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing. Broad protected beach of pebble and cobble.
properties.camp_comments: Several possible sites. Old road bed behind beach offers flat areas but bush is mostly dense. S bank of large creek above beach is another option at most tides.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. Fishing resort and float home visible at N end of bay. Historic site.

properties.title: Ahous Bay
properties.landing_comments: Potentially difficult surf landing, light to heavy depending on conditions. N, S ends of overall large bay more protected, may be calm. S corner has hook for additional landing protection.
properties.camp_comments: Entire expansive sand beach suited to camping. Random wilderness camping allowed. Composting toilet at Fingers at N end (rock bound coves). Please use animal-proof food bins at N and S ends of bay.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek in centre of bay. Attractive long sandy beach. Hiking trail across S Vargas I. See Vargas Island Provincial Park. See Vargas Island webpage with information on Ahousaht access passes.

properties.title: Milties Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy on gently sloped sand beach. N aspect. Sand bar to E.
properties.camp_comments: Camp either end of beach or on upland clearing at E end. Centre of beach floods at moderate water levels. Entire beach floods at Springs. Please use animal-proof steel food bin. Green throne pit toilet in good condition (2019) but trail could use clearing as seen in 2024. Sometimes used by guided groups.There are two trails leading to open area upland tent sites and the beach is a pleasant area to walk. A safe refuge when the surf is too high and Dick and Janes Beach.
properties.other_comments: Small seasonal creek enters W end. We have created a Vargas Island webpage with information about Ahousaht passes and a link to the Ahousaht map where there is allowable camping and day use.

properties.title: Dick and Jane Beach
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient sand beach. More protected than beaches on W of Vargas Island but subject to surf in some conditions.
properties.camp_comments: Random wilderness camping allowed. Sheltered beach camping on sand among driftwood. Pit toilet. Please use animal-proof steel food bins. Note: See Vargas Island Provincial Park. See Vargas Island webpage with information on Ahousaht access passes. Two distinct sites at Dick and Jane beach. One at the top; northern corner of the beach and another midway along the beach. Both have food caches.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek entering beach near S end. Some upland is private. Paddlers must respect owners privacy. Do not trespass. It's possible to pick up passes at Tofino Kayaking or Paddlewest Kayaking offices.

properties.title: Narvaez Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy, on protected sand, gravel beach at all water levels. W aspect. Known as Little Bay.
properties.camp_comments: Gravel tent pads. Picnic tables. Pit toilet. Food cache. Fee charged year-round. Reservable mid May - Sept. No fires, including below high tide mark. All sites reservable Overflow area for 3+ tents.
properties.other_comments: Attractive bay, coves. Road access gated 1.3 km from beach area. Hiking trails to Monarch Head, Echo Bay. Swimming. Gulf Islands National Park Reserve. See

properties.title: Ruckle
properties.landing_comments: Small exposed shell, pebble beach unsuited to high water levels 150 m SW of Beaver Point light, close to campsites on a mostly rocky shore. Alternative landings in sheltered coves to N or S, distant from camp area. Otherwise exposed rock shelves.
properties.camp_comments: Camp at numbered sites in huge open field or under trees. Some tent platforms. Most sites non-reservable. Pit toilets. Picnic table at each tent site. Shared fire pits. 3 group sites. Wheelbarrows. Garbage collection. Field partly mowed twice each season.
properties.other_comments: Attractive, View. Water at 6 taps. 7 km shoreline. Extensive trails, wildflowers. Intact historic farm. Trail access to road 200 - 600 m. Parking. See: Ruckle Park

properties.title: Cabbage Island
properties.landing_comments: n/a
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: Effective April 15, 2025, Cabbage Island will be closed for day use and overnight camping due to cultural sensitivities. Mooring buoys remain available, but marine users may only access the island to use the payment kiosk or pit toilet, which are clearly marked by split rail fences. Parks Canada - Gulf Islands National Park Reserve has requested that visitors respect this closure by not extending their stay on the island or leaving the fenced area.
