Recreational use of the beach is prohibited. More information is available here

properties.title: Blind Creek
properties.landing_comments: Concrete ramp in protected bay 75 m long. Rough gravel, cobble beaches alongside ramp. Some mud.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Approach via Cortes Bay Road. Parking along road. Proposed equestrian facilities. Strathcona Regional District park approx 1.5 Ha.

properties.title: Mitchell Bay
properties.landing_comments: Ramp, adjacent pebble beach by wharf, floats. Best beach to W of red barn.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping.
properties.other_comments: Take Mitchell Bay Rd. Park by red barn. Malcolm Island Lions Harbour Authority.

properties.title: Blue Heron
properties.landing_comments: Easy on beach of bedrock sandstone, some sand, mixed small rocks.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Picnic tables, group picnic shelter, parking, toilets.
properties.other_comments: Road access from Yellow Point Road and Westby Road. Cowichan Valley Regional District community park. See: Blue Heron Park. Clearly no overnight parking. Parking is available on the shoulder of Yellow Point Road.

properties.title: Tuta Marina
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sheltered beach in cove adjacent to dock, floats.
properties.camp_comments: Developed commercial site with vehicle-based camping. Advise checking before arrival. According to host at Cougar Creek the road to Tuta Marina is open in June 2025. Closure duration unknown but owners known to travel to town occasionally. Tenting just above the trailer in a tent site.
properties.other_comments: Dock, floats, boat launch. Some supplies available. Pay parking.

properties.title: James Bay Victoria
properties.landing_comments: Protected double width concrete boat ramp. Adjacent to Coast Guard Base. Marine traffic.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Easy road access, full city services, accommodation, supplies. James Bay Anglers Association, 75 Dallas Rd. Fee charged at ramp $5 or $25 annual permit (2017). Unclear if this ramp is property of James Bay Anglers Assn.or City of Victoria. Day parking in lot, long term parking nearby to N $18.25 per wk (2017). Subject to change due to redevelopment plans (2017).

properties.title: Tofino
properties.landing_comments: Paddlers launch concrete ramp W of Government wharf. Small sand beach. Rocky at low water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Accommodation nearby. Toilet on adjacent wharf
properties.other_comments: Main launch site for Clayoquot Sound. Centrally located near services, accommodation, provisions. Overnight parking available a few blocks away near police station (RCMP). Note. Pre-purchase permits can be acquired at Paddle West Kayaking and Tofino Sea Kayaking - phone ahead - or order through the Ahousaht link below. See Vargas Island webpage with information on Ahousaht access passes. Link to the Ahousaht map showing where camping or day use allowed.

properties.title: Bell Rocks south
properties.landing_comments: Easy on exposed pebble beach. NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. May be developed as campsite in future. See Qwiquallaaq/Boat Bay Conservancy.
properties.other_comments: View.

properties.title: Lawn Point
properties.landing_comments: From N, take care when navigating around reefs. Usually better to approach in morning. Behind reefs, beach is well protected but expect surf in high S wind, swell. Reefs to SW.
properties.camp_comments: Beach sites, on pebble, gravel, exposed to S. Random wilderness camping permitted. No fees (2020).
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Grassy peninsula deceivingly rugged. Historic plane crash monument. See Lawn Point Provincial Park

properties.title: Keith River Site 4
properties.landing_comments: Easy protected landing on sand beach in bay. This might be only at high water. A report received that at low to mid water levels landing difficult to see with large sections of beach fronted by rocks/reefs.
properties.camp_comments: 3 or 4 beach sites, possibly fewer at Springs.
properties.other_comments: Year-round water to N at Keith River. Attractive.

properties.title: Newton Entrance
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on sand beach with moderate gradient except in strong SW conditions.  More protected than other nearby sites.  .
properties.camp_comments: Beach camping among drift logs. Protected from NW. Random wilderness camping permitted. No fees (2018).
properties.other_comments: Attractive. See Lawn Point Provincial Park

properties.title: Calvin Creek north
properties.landing_comments: Landing moderate to difficult on low gradient sand beach. Prone to surf, especially near centre beach at Falls area, so N end usually preferred. Extensive low reef or shoal gives some protection at less than very high water levels. Swells break at outer edge rather than at beach so often minor at beach. Go wide of extensive shoals to W to clear offshore breaking waves.
properties.camp_comments: Several sites on upper beach. Beach floods at higher tides or during storms. Report received that beach sites remain dry up to 3.9 m tide if tent is at forest edge, assuming no storm surge. Hiker shack, decorated with flotsam, in the woods. A new outhouse has been installed (one of those "urine diversion toilets" with the pedal).
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at falls. On Nootka (hiking) Trail.

properties.title: Hanna Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing. Small, gently sloping cobble, pebble beach. SW aspect. Limited landing area at high water. Some exposure to SW wind.
properties.camp_comments: Ample room behind beach logs. Small forest upland clearings could also support 2-3 tents. An overgrown roadway reported in area but not found during June 2025 assessment, however tenure sings present on beach.
properties.other_comments: Water at creeks. Nearby fishing shacks, dock visible from parts of site.

properties.title: Whaleview Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on sand, shell, gravel beach. Well protected from all directions.
properties.camp_comments: Random wilderness camping allowed. Beach camping possible almost any tide including summer Springs. Small forested upland sites likely need brushing. Ahousaht Stewardship Fee required. Please avoid Ahousaht Nation Tootoowilteno Indian Reserve at E end of beach.
properties.other_comments: Year-round water likely available by paddlecraft access to river approx. 0.5 NM to NE around point. Small, quiet, protected site. A good alternative to nearby Half Moon Beach in poor conditions. See:

properties.title: Hesquiat Harbour
properties.landing_comments: Long sweeping sand beach. Shallow, confused water. breaking waves over Hesquiat Bar.  Good protection beyond Bar. To avoid long carry at low water, avoid broad sand shelf at S corner of beach, adjacent to bar.
properties.camp_comments: Random wilderness camping allowed. No fees (2018). Entire beach is suitable for camping. See: Hesquiat Peninsula Provincial Park.
properties.other_comments: Water.

properties.title: Obstruction Island
properties.landing_comments: Moderate landing on sloping bedrock shoreline. Tricky at lowest tides.
properties.camp_comments: Random wilderness camping permitted. Rough camping on small level areas of rock, gravel, grass.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Anchorage - Provincial Boat Haven in cove.

properties.title: Barcester Bay
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient broad sand beach. Open to NW wind, swell. Expect low to high surf with less to S. Recommend use in settled conditions only.
properties.camp_comments: Beach camping between drift logs. Some shelter from S.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at creek crossing beach at S end.

properties.title: Isle de Lis
properties.landing_comments: Easy on exposed gravel, pebble tombolo between Rum and Gooch Islands. Choose either N or S aspect depending on conditions.
properties.camp_comments: 3 tent pads 150 m above beach. 2 pit toilets. Hammock opportunities. Fee charged year-round. No fires, including below high tide mark. Possible overflow site on tombolo. See camping
properties.other_comments: On Rum Island. Small attractive island with views, trail. seal, bird colonies. Isle de Lis (Lily Island) name given by former owner. Gulf Islands National Park Reserve.

properties.title: Sidney Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy sheltered sand beach at all water levels. BW aspect. Small seasonal dock. W aspect. Lagoon closed to all boating.
properties.camp_comments: Open grassy sites, tent pads. Picnic tables. Gear carts. Picnic shelter. Vault toilets. Fee charged year-round. Site closed for hunting 1 Nov - 28 Feb. Group camping site. No fires, including below high tide mark. IMPORTANT 100% reservable from May 15 to Sept 30 so paddlers advised to reserve. 2 small overflow areas. Mid-week sites often available on first come, first served basis. 250-654-4000,Toll-free: 1-866-944-1744. All sites reservable
properties.other_comments: Site no longer offers drinking water. Trails. Swimming. Anchorage. Birding, fallow deer, wildlife. Frequent foot passenger ferry in summer from Sidney. Gulf Islands National Park Reserve. See

properties.title: Princess Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on beach in protected bay. Gravel at high water, mud at low water, some sand, pebble. SE aspect. Dinghy dock.
properties.camp_comments: Camp in damp mown open field, an old orchard. Composting toilet. Picnic tables. Food cache. Short concrete steps give access up bank. Fees charged year-round. First come, first served. No fires, including below high tide mark. Suited to groups or overflow from smaller sites on Portland Island. See camping
properties.other_comments: Anchorage. Small seasonal dock. Aka Tortoise Bay. Kanaka (Hawaiian) history. Volunteers provide information service in season. Extensive walking trails. Gulf Islands National Park Reserve.

properties.title: Paddlers Beach Raft Cove
properties.landing_comments: Land to S of Macjack River mouth. Landing weather dependent but usually lower surf than on main beach. Protected from SW but expect high surf in strong NW winds.
properties.camp_comments: Numerous sites on sand, gravel beach. Camping fees apply 1 May to 30 September. May pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites. Fee $5.00 per person per night (2018) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System.
properties.other_comments: Water at Macjack River upstream. Navigable for some distance. Hiking trail on N side of river leads in 2.5 km to industrial road. See:

properties.title: DArcy Island
properties.landing_comments: Pebble beach. Exposed to SE winds. Strong SE wind may cause hazardous steep surf conditions. Alternative beach, NNE aspect, nearby to N offers longer but easy carry to tent sites.
properties.camp_comments: Gravel tent pads near beach with some shelter in mature forest. Pit toilet. 7 picnic tables. Hammock opportunities. Fee charged year-round. First come, first serve. No fires, including below high tide mark. See camping
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Rough trail across island to historic former leper colony. Gulf Islands National Park Reserve.

properties.title: Bamberton Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy sand/pebble beach, low gradient, so long carry at low tide. E aspect. Open to N.
properties.camp_comments: Drive-in campsite accessed by steep trail 500 m from beach or by road. Tap water, flush and pit toilets, picnic tables, change rooms. Overnight parking at campsites only. Not practical for boat-based camping - too far from shore.
properties.other_comments: Grassy picnic area for lunch stops. Camping not permitted at shore.

properties.title: Carrot Park Port Hardy
properties.landing_comments: Easy on beach of gravel, small rocks. E aspect. Might be easier slightly to N of main park area. Springs appears to flood beach to rip rap bank.
properties.camp_comments: Hostel in vicinity. No campsite nearby with access to beach launching. Picnic shelter.
properties.other_comments: Carrot Park. Walking paths. Day parking. View. Overnight parking at Government wharf/boat launch nearby to S. Supplies, water taxi services, accommodation.

properties.title: Nordstrom Creek
properties.landing_comments: Approx 100 m W of creek mouth, rocks of large outcrop extend into sea. Land at side of rocks in protected area about 6 m wide, navigating around reefs. Approach, landing depends on swell height, direction. Surf likely.
properties.camp_comments: Beach sites on sand E of creek. Grass above beach too steep for tents. Random wilderness camping allowed. No fees (2018).
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. See: Mquqwin Brooks Peninsula Provincial Park.

properties.title: Tongue Point west
properties.landing_comments:
Moderate gradient all-tide sand beach protected from SW behind small rock islet. Approaches from both sides of islet well protected. W might be preferred. N aspect.
All tide landing to west of Rock protection with a small swell at times. Mid to high tide the landing to the east side of the rock fronting the Beach is more protected and provides and easy landing. Only at low low tides is the east side not as accessible.
properties.camp_comments: Sand beach not really suitable for flat tent sites as sloped. Only one decent sized forested site with 2 very small nearby sites.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Aka Oldham Beach after Margaret and Ted Oldham, paddlers who spent many a summer week here. Recreation Reserve REC107007. Trail head to Louie Bay at easterly side of Beach. Trail marker to start but not well used trail.

properties.title: Benson Point
properties.landing_comments: Land E of point to avoid surf on W side. Easy on long sand, gravel beach. Gradient 3 - 5%. SE aspect. Moderate protection. Next beach to E is similar or better protected if overflow site needed.
properties.camp_comments: Exposed beach sites. Aspect S , W. As of July 31, 2021 "Warning: Benson Point currently has no toilet so BCMT strongly urges visitors to bring "wag bags" or similar to pack out human waste. On-site disposal is not recommended." There are a couple additional tent sites in the trees / sheltered from wind. Next beach to E suitable as overflow site.
properties.other_comments: Small waterfall at far W end of beach had flow Aug 2022 so might be year-round. Similar report of creek with waterfall just above the beach, 0.6 NM W of site, but measured distance might be 1 NM instead. Attractive. Interesting shorelines. Sea caves. Lagoon nearby.

properties.title: Third Beach
properties.landing_comments: Extensive moderately steep sand beach at high water. Low gradient at low water. S aspect. Protected from NW. Prominent large treed rock outcrop at W entrance breaks swell for surf-free landing behind.
properties.camp_comments: Beach sites on sand. Report of upland forest margin sites.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at year-round creek to E up along log into edge of woods. Freshwater bathing pool across E side of beach. Rope hang ladder on trail up onto treed rock outcrop. On Nootka (hiking) Trail. Frequently used as first night stop by hikers starting from Louie Bay. by float plane.

properties.title: Strange Island
properties.landing_comments:
Easy to moderately difficult at S end or elsewhere on long, 250+m gravel mixed rock, sand beach. Oysters at some water levels. Not enough beach space at high water to pull boat ashore. Middle beach area appears to be easiest for landing having a gentle slope and large sand/gravel areas at mid tides.
W beach required water exit, carrying boats up onto cobble/ boulder shore.
Slightly exposed to SW. Surf possible.
properties.camp_comments: At least 6 tent sites behind driftwood logs for beach camping. However this option would be unsuitable during spring tides as the area may flood.Otherwise look for a blue line strung from hemlock to alder trees marking a trail into the forest (see photos). Follow the trail 40 meters inland to find 2-3 tent sites. The area could be opened up with some brushing work. Danger trees present in this area and therefore the inland tent sites would be unsafe in 40km+ winds.Aprox location of trailhead: 49.682887N, -126.599995W
properties.other_comments: Attractive site. Work needed to remove danger trees from camping area.

properties.title: Loquillilla Cove
properties.landing_comments: 2 locations. Main beach: easy, on sand, gravel, cobble. SE aspect. E cove: easy, but some soft mud at low water. NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Sheltered sites in trees in both areas. 1 or 2 possible sites on main beach. Better camping in cove 0.5 NM E of main beach with spacious, level upland sites. Short walk to view over Goletas Channel.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creeks at SW, NE corners of main beach. Creek at SW hard to see but substantial. Creek on N side of E cove. Spring reported but location unknown.

properties.title: Discovery Island
properties.landing_comments: Pebble beach. Vessel wash. Strong currents near island. Pull kayaks up out of the water a bit higher as passing ships can cause larger hitting waves on the beach.
properties.camp_comments: Camp only in designated large open field SW of Pandora Hill. Pit toilet. Picnic tables. Food caches. No fires or pets permitted. Camping fees apply year-round. Pre-pay via Internet, or use drop-box but no reservable sites. Fee $5.00 per person per night (2019) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System.
properties.other_comments: See: Discovery Island.

properties.title: Medallion Beach
properties.landing_comments: Some exposure to surf. E side of beach usually preferred. W end of beach has low dunes causing erratic waves on lower tides.
properties.camp_comments: Random wilderness camping allowed. Camp on beach or on grassy upland. Many options. Composting toilet at W point of beach. Please use animal-proof steel food bin.
properties.other_comments: See Vargas Island Provincial Park. See Vargas Island webpage with information on Ahousaht access passes. Link to the Ahousaht map showing where camping and day use allowed.

properties.title: Cape Sutil
properties.landing_comments: Easy to moderate landing on sand beach. E aspect. Protected from NW. N'erly of 2 beaches. Paddlers mostly land on S half of N beach.
properties.camp_comments: Beach sites on sand. Dispersed camping permitted. N Coast hiking trail campsite around headland to SE has pit toilet, food cache, ranger yurt. Awkward access over logs in forest in first surge channel. Camping fees apply 1 May to 30 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at San Josef Bay trailhead, but no reservable sites.
properties.other_comments: Water at small seasonal creeks near N Coast hiking trail campsite. Attractive. Cape Sutil proper lies in I.R. so permission required to visit. See: Cape Scott Provincial Park

properties.title: Brentwood Bay
properties.landing_comments: Concrete kayak, canoe launch at sheltered small sand, gravel and mud beach immediately S of Brentwood Bay ferry terminal, dock and marina. Well-designed concrete inclined pathway from vehicle loading area to beach. At low tide, the area next to the water can get very muddy. At high tide, the water can come up to the bottom of the steps leading to the beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Unloading area (15 min max.) and (1 hr) short term parking nearby. No parking on Verdier Rd. Some nearby street parking. Flush toilets, picnic table. Verdier Park, small District of Central Saanich neighbourhood park.

properties.title: Bear Cove Kayak Launch
properties.landing_comments: Concrete small hand launch ramp (for kayak etc.). Area protected by breakwater, floats.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Easy access to dedicated kayak launch separate from main boat ramp. No user fee (2024). Approx 5 minute walk to ferry terminal for overnight parking ($50 per week 2024) - pay at terminal office during business hours. Toilets, water, electricity, picnic tables. District of Port Hardy. Sign shows BCMTN North Vancouver Island Circle Route, now called Cape Scott Marine Trail.

properties.title: Cattle Point
properties.landing_comments: 2 concrete boat ramps in small semi-protected bays with rock shores. Smaller E aspect. Larger S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Approach via Beach Drive, Scenic Drive. Plentiful day parking. Street parking with no posted restrictions. No fees (2017). Busy. Waterfront edge of 35 ha Uplands Park. District of Oak Bay.

properties.title: Klaskino Inlet
properties.landing_comments: Gravel beach launch site with rocks off.  Small boats only. High water use preferred.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping. Location uncertain. Provincial Recreation Reserve mapped as Recreation Site on Seasketch.
properties.other_comments: Road condition unknown, might be closed. If open, rough beach is on short spur off main access road. If closed, use Side Bay instead. Access to N. Brooks area. Very small parking area.

properties.title: Fair Harbour
properties.landing_comments: Concrete boat ramp between public dock, fuel float. Adjacent gravel ramp offers kayak launch area.
properties.camp_comments: See nearby site Fair Harbour Marina and Campground www.fairharbourbc.com for details.
properties.other_comments: Services include: campground, rental cabins, store, washrooms, showers, laundry, fuel dock, potable water, propane, paid supervised parking with video surveillance, community free parking area. Campsites range from $20 - $25/night. Daily, weekly and monthly parking rates Visit Fair Harbour website: https://fairharbourbc.com/

properties.title: Little Espinosa Inlet west
properties.landing_comments: Easy on cobble, gravel beach (unpaved boat launch) on N side of  road bridge. Some mud. Gradient 3% to 5%. Strong tidal rapid flows under bridge at times.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Parking for approx. 10 vehicles on nearby wide road margin W of bridge.

properties.title: Zeballos
properties.landing_comments: Beach near near dock. Other beaches in village.
properties.camp_comments: Cevallos developed campground in village.
properties.other_comments: Small community. Accommodation, store, pub, restaurant. Overnight parking for fee.

properties.title: Elk Bay launch
properties.landing_comments: Easy, pebble but exposed to N.  Gravel boat ramp.
properties.camp_comments: See Elk Bay campsite. Main camping area next to launch. Toilets.
properties.other_comments: Busy boat launch and camping site. Rec Site REC5810. View. Road access from Campbell River. Head north on Highway 19. Turn right just N of Roberts Lake, on Elk Bay road at 33 km. Turn right at Stella Lake road 11.3 km from highway, Follow for 3.2 km. Turn right at split by log dump. Site is 0.7 km S, Smaller part of site lies 400 m S.

properties.title: San Josef Bay
properties.landing_comments: 2 broad low-gradient sand beaches. Some surf. N beach provides more protection.
properties.camp_comments: Beach camping. Pit toilets. Bear caches. Camping fees apply 1 May to 30 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at San Josef Bay trailhead, but no reservable sites.
properties.other_comments: Water at river or waterfall on stream crossing N beach. Popular site with hikers. Hiking trail 2.5 km to parking lot. Longer trails to Lowrie Bay, Cape Scott etc. Sea caves, stacks. See: Cape Scott Provincial Park

properties.title: Cape Palmerston
properties.landing_comments: Gravel, rock beach. Watch for some rocks, reefs.  Easier landing than Cape Palmerston Recreation Site just to N or some of the Raft Cove options just to S. Some protection from NW.
properties.camp_comments: Beach camping. User maintained cabin.
properties.other_comments: More protected in NW wind conditions than Raft Cove sites.

properties.title: Topknot Point
properties.landing_comments: Sand, gravel beach. Light to moderate surf landing at N end, E of prominent creek.
properties.camp_comments: Exposed sites on sand, gravel above landing beach. Beach topography varies annually. Some more protected sites alongside smaller creek at centre beach.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at creeks. Visitor logbook at base of fir tree through salal underbrush at N50D 32.11M, W128D 12.681M.

properties.title: Raft Cove
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient sand beach. Easier landing S of river mouth. Expect surf at low water or when swell  exceeds 1 m.
properties.camp_comments: Upland sites N of river mouth. Also beach camping. Spit at river mouth may be used as campsite. 5-6 toilets. 5 or 6 Food caches. Camping fees apply 1 May to 30 September. May pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites. Fee $5.00 per person per night (2018) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at river upstream. Macjack River navigable for some distance. Hiking trail 2.5 km to industrial road. See: Raft Cove Provincial Park.

properties.title: Quatsino Park west
properties.landing_comments: Easy launch, landing at low water on long cobble beach, S aspect,
properties.camp_comments: Beach camping depending on tide level. Little space. Too small for 4 tents.
properties.other_comments: May be noisy due to proximity to Koskimo industrial area. See Quatsino Provincial Park AKA Prideaux Point.

properties.title: Shelter Bay
properties.land_tenure: Crown tenure - Section 17 designated use area
properties.landing_comments: Easy, white sand, mud beach in protected cove accessible at all tides but high water preferred to allow site access from N side of sand tombolo. Kelp.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on sheltered white sand beach E of Wescott Pt at most tides or in approx. 6+ cleared sites in forested upland. Additional forest site at E end of beach.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek in NE corner is likely year-round. Located at N50D 57.89M, W127D 24.70M (WGS84). Intertidal life. Some commercial use. Some lands are 'designated use area'. Anchorage. Trail E of creek to First Nations site accessed by climbing a rope.

properties.title: Cape Palmerston Recreation Site
properties.landing_comments: Rocks, boulders at landing near river mouth. Gravel beach with high, unstable gravel berm above high water line.  Difficult to haul boats up.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on gravel beach. Likely 6 or more tent sites, but beach conditions change from year to year.
properties.other_comments: RSTBC Recreation Site lies across river. Difficult haul with boats across creek. Toilet. Trail access to road.

properties.title: Guise Bay
properties.landing_comments: Difficult in SW wind. Surf, shallow sand beach.
properties.camp_comments: Camping on beach, upland. Exposed to strong gap winds. Pit toilet on E side. Sheltered from NW but exposed otherwise. Camping fees apply 1 May to 30 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at San Josef Bay trailhead or pay site host, but no reservable sites. Frequent use by hikers.
properties.other_comments: Water available seasonally. See: Cape Scott Provincial Park

properties.title: Lowrie Bay
properties.landing_comments: Broad sand beach. Expect surf. Difficult except in calm weather. SW portion by rocky outcrop usually easiest landing at high water, when poles at sand spit might be visible.
properties.camp_comments: Beach camping. User maintained old cabin in good condition at last report 2014. Camping fees apply 1 May to 30 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at San Josef Bay trailhead, but no reservable sites. Green throne toilet. Report of overgrown trails (2021).
properties.other_comments: Isolated. Attractive. Rough, muddy hiking trail to Sea Otter Cove, San Josef Bay. See: Cape Scott Provincial Park

properties.title: Helen Islands
properties.landing_comments: Sheltered, easy landing on pebble beach at mid to high water.  More difficult, large rocks, boulders, weed at lower water levels. W winds may bend to blow out of Sea Otter Cove. Landing on north beach is more sheltered and preferable.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on beach. Sites likely need leveling. Sheltered. Random wilderness camping permitted. Camping fees apply 1 May to 30 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at San Josef Bay trailhead, but no reservable sites.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. See: Cape Scott Provincial Park

properties.title: Lawn Point east
properties.landing_comments: Pebble beach with easy to moderate landing depending on conditions. Surf possible.
properties.camp_comments: Beach camping. More sheltered from wind, more secluded than main Lawn Point site. Random wilderness camping permitted. No fees (2018).
properties.other_comments: Attractive. See Lawn Point Provincial Park

properties.title: Heater Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on moderate gradient sand beach. NE aspect  Protected from W, SW. Landing on beaches on SW side of point subject to surf.
properties.camp_comments: Beach sites on NE aspect beach. More space near point. Additional unlimited sites on other beaches but access more difficult due to surf.
properties.other_comments: Possible water at creek, from small lake, crossing beach approx 200 m to E. Take rough trail across headland to beach on opposite side then head south across small 2nd headland to next beach, at the end of that beach is a very large cave work visiting.

properties.title: Klaskino Anchorage
properties.landing_comments: Protected from SE, SW. More protected in bad weather than Heater Point.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on gravel bench NE of creek. Roomy, protected site.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. Provincial Boat Haven.

properties.title: Rumble Beach Port Alice
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected pebble beach of moderate gradient. Some sand. Close to parking, road. Concrete ramp, float.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilets, picnic shelter, picnic tables.
properties.other_comments: Marina, boat launch. Pay parking $10 per day $80 per yr annual fee residential only (2022). Laundry and showers available. Pay Wharfinger or at Village Office, 1061 Marine Dr. Port Alice. Details at 250 209 2665 or 250 284 3391. See public notice.

properties.title: Winter Harbour
properties.landing_comments: Small launch ramp near general store. Fee for use.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Accommodation in community. See also Kwaksistah.
properties.other_comments: Small community. Store, accommodation, post office. Very little overnight parking available.

properties.title: Side Bay
properties.landing_comments: Gravel beach SW aspect. Some surf in SW wind. Protected from NW.
properties.camp_comments: Many camping options on both E and W beaches on gravel, grass bar. Grassed sites near road. Fire pit. Fewer campers by river away from road access. Wind protection from NW.
properties.other_comments: Sept 2020 Best to have road map showing logging road access. Road access on maintained industrial road. (Forest Service Road 7989 01). Road surface good from signed turn off to beach except in repaired section. Large sections of the road can wash out from heavy winter rains. Check prior to attempting last section from Side Bay turn off. Year round water at river near road, stream cuts deeply into beach.

properties.title: Kwaksistah
properties.landing_comments: Small boat launch.
properties.camp_comments: Small developed campground with vehicle access. RVs. Picnic tables. Fire pits. BBQ pits. Pit toilets. Park managers suggest site not suited to tents. No water, power or sewer.
properties.other_comments: Convenient launch site. Mt Waddington Regional District park. See Kwaksistah Regional Park

properties.title: Goldstream Boathouse Marina
properties.landing_comments: Easy concrete boat ramp, sheltered. Busy shipyard, marina. Vessel traffic.
properties.camp_comments: Camping available at nearby Goldstream Provincial Park.
properties.other_comments: Launch, parking fees apply.

properties.title: Red Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy on steep exposed beach of cobble, pebble, sand, bedrock in cove N side Parson Bay. S aspect. At E end of beach. Dark slate outcrop nearby. Easier at mid to high water. Many rocks at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Sheltered, attractive cleared tent sites. 3 tents on the lower level. A long and steep hike leads to many tent sites in the forest. Occasional commercial use reported.
properties.other_comments: Views, wildlife viewing. Geological features, fossils. Good view of Blackney Passage. Vessel traffic.

properties.title: Turnour Island
properties.landing_comments: Bay N of rocky islet. Shell beach at mid water levels. Rock shelf, muck, clam bed at very low water. A few boulders. Land on either side of rocky peninsula. S side preferred.
properties.camp_comments: Upland semi-developed level tent sites on duff in open second growth forest. Rustic furniture. Hammock opportunities. Additional level forest sites approx. 50 -100 m uphill.
properties.other_comments: Large, well-established site.

properties.title: Flower Island
properties.landing_comments: Site is currently closed. Closures may occur for a variety of reasons, including environmental protection, weather-related damage, safety concerns, or requests from First Nations. BC Marine Trails will update site status as new information emerges. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation in helping preserve these areas for future generations.
properties.camp_comments: No comments.
properties.other_comments: Consider using nearby Maggy Point, Rough Islets campsites with tent platforms and toilet.

properties.title: Leg Cove
properties.landing_comments: Sheltered sand, gravel, cobble beach in cove. NW aspect. Strong currents in Weynton Passage, Plumper Islands.
properties.camp_comments: Semi-developed spacious site in forested upland. Rough kitchen.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Whale watching. Aka Mossy Knoll. One of the few sites on Hanson I that is sanctioned by Yukusam Heritage Society for public use.

properties.title: Keith River
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing protected by rocks, reef, on low gradient sand beach.
properties.camp_comments: 10-20 or more good all-tide beach sites.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. May walk on beach to Keith River Estuary on most tides.

properties.title: Keith River Site 3
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on protected sand, gravel beach. Drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: Drift logs hinder beach camping but sites can be found.
properties.other_comments: Attractive.

properties.title: Wy ash Island (Island 44)
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, gravel beach. Sheltered on N, E sides. Gradient 3 to 5 percent. N aspect. Beaches on S shore, E point similar but more exposed to swell, wind.
properties.camp_comments: Random camping allowed. No fees (2018). Most of tent sites on beach. Undeveloped sites on gravel bench at high water line on N side and in protected clearings in trees. 'Green Throne' toilets placed next to each other at NW corner of island. (July 2024: New Toilet Material has been delivered. 2 food cache bins. Some tent sites on S shore at undeveloped beach sites, also at SE point on gravel, pebble tombolo or in adjacent forest.
properties.other_comments: 150 m hiking trail across to S beach. Gravel bar to Nuchatlitz Island IR to E dries on low tides. Sea otters. Aka Island 44. See: Nuchatlitz Provincial Park.This site is located within the Nuchatlaht Nation's Aboriginal Title Lands. See map of the Title area here. Look up term of Aboriginal Title lands in our glossary.

properties.title: Belmont Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy on broad sand, pebble beach. S aspect. Protected. Gradient 3-5%. Beach opposite near creek subject to surf.
properties.camp_comments: Beach camping.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at creek at SE side of beach, via 500 m beach walk. Flowing July 2025, so might be year-round. Recreation Site REC6081.

properties.title: Cow Bay
properties.landing_comments: Exposed to surf, some submerged rocks. The SE and NW beaches offer more protection. Landing by the creek on south and slightly west end of Cow Bay is a protected area to land.
properties.camp_comments: Random wilderness camping. Entire beach suitable for camping. Most popular places are SE end, NW beach or near information kiosk, tent pads, bear cache, pit toilets on SE beach.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at year-round stream crossing centre of W (Fourth) beach. Also seasonal creeks at other beaches e.g. near SE site. Avoid private residence at Fourth Beach - W'most beach, Camp instead on W side of stream or in another bay. Whale viewing. Wild Side hiking Trail to Ahousaht village has $25 trail use fee (2018) for area outside park. No camping fees (2018). See Wildside Trail for more info. See: Flores Island Provincial Park

properties.title: Half Moon Beach Flores Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy to difficult landing on sand beach, depending on wind, swell. Exposed to SW. Rocks, boomers, some surf.
properties.camp_comments: Lots of space on beach above high water.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Spectacular views. Do not confuse with Half Moon Bay near Tofino in Pacific Rim Park. See: Flores Island Provincial Park

properties.title: Experiment Bight
properties.landing_comments: Moderate on sand beach in wide bay. N aspect. Exposed with surf likely. W side normally preferred.
properties.camp_comments: Exposed on sand. Pit toilet at Guise Bay. Camping fees apply 1 May to 30 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at San Josef Bay trailhead or pay site host, but no reservable sites.
properties.other_comments: Less busy than other Cape Scott beaches. See: Cape Scott Provincial Park

properties.title: Goodnuff Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected pocket gravel beach at high water, large smooth rocks at low water. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Small sloped beach margin sites. Dense vegetation in upland. Reported space for 1 hammock. Marginal due to small size.
properties.other_comments: Marginal site but suitable for emergency or transitory use.

properties.title: Nels Bight
properties.landing_comments: Some surf, long low gradient sand beach. Exposed but protected from S, NE
properties.camp_comments: Beach or sheltered upland sites. Pit toilet. Food caches. Camping fees apply 1 May to 30 September. Either pre-pay permit via Internet or at San Josef Bay trailhead or pay site host, but no reservable sites. Ranger cabin (Park Facility Operator) at mid beach, reported to be open for public use Oct - May. Sleeps 6.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek or pipe. Most popular Cape Scott site with hikers. Can be very busy. See: Cape Scott Provincial Park

properties.title: Newcastle Island Saysutshun
properties.landing_comments: Generally easy, depending on water level. Land in channel between Newcastle, Protection Islands. Protected S or E aspect. Sand beach adjacent to boat shed. Mixed beaches of gravel, bedrock, sand, smaller rocks elsewhere. Oyster band at low water. Dinghy dock (fee charged), other options but hauling out boats officially restricted to developed S end of island. Vessel traffic.
properties.camp_comments: Developed year round campground inland 300 m. from official landing beach. Picnic tables. Flush, vault toilets, hot showers. Dining shelters, food bins at some group sites. Pavilion. Food sold in summer. 5 large additional field sites for group camping nearer beach. Small boats may be wheeled or carried to campsites. Reservations available for half of sites. reservable mid-May to early-Sept. Fees apply year-round $18/night per party summer,$11 winter (2024). BC Parks
properties.other_comments: Water at taps, extensive hiking trails, museum, history, wildlife. Frequent foot passenger ferry to Nanaimo. Anchorage, small vessel dock. See: Newcastle Island Marine Provincial Park. Snuneymuxw First Nation manage site.

properties.title: Descanso Bay Regional Park
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected rock shelf at high water or small gravel beach at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Developed year-round vehicle-accessible campground. Short walk from shore to camping area. Picnic tables, fire pits, flush, chemical toilets. Many sites have room for 2 tents. May reserve to be closer to water 250-247-8255. Resident attendant. Potable water.
properties.other_comments: 595 Taylor Bay Road. Water at pumps. Kayak rentals avaiable. 1 km to ferry, village. Parking. Vehicle access by ferry from Nanaimo. 16 ha park run by Regional District of Nanaimo. Adjacent 50 ha Cox Community Park has hiking trails. See: Descanso Bay Regional Park.

properties.title: Coulter Bay
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient silt, sand, mud, beach in sheltered bay. Good protection from SE. Long carry at low water. Gravel boat ramp usable at high water. Some beach areas soft. Scattered cobble, oysters. High water gives easiest access.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Strathcona Regional District public beach access. Gravel parking area for approx. 6 vehicles. No posted parking restrictions.

properties.title: Kinsmen Beach Chemainus
properties.landing_comments: Wide concrete boat ramp or adjacent low gradient pebble, sand, gravel beach with long carry at low water..
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Picnic area, tables. Toilets, change rooms. Playground.
properties.other_comments: At N end of Maple St. Overnight parking at no charge (2013). Swimming. Kinsmen Beach (Chemainus), park run by Municipality of North Cowichan. Overnight parking is permitted.

properties.title: Gorge Harbour
properties.landing_comments: Rough beach or float accessed from wharf. Sheltered bay. Boat ramp nearby. Beach adjacent to community dock reported to be best.
properties.camp_comments: Commercial full service campground at Gorge Harbour Marina.
properties.other_comments: Approach via Robertson Road. Services. Restaurant at marina.

properties.title: Ontario Place
properties.landing_comments: Easy on gravel beach or adjacent boat ramp in well-protected Long Harbour. Moderate gradient. N aspect. Vehicle may be driven to water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: By vehicle, from Long Harbour Road take Eagle Ridge Drive, Quebec Drive to Ontario Place. Limited roadside parking for few cars, competing for space with boat trailers.

properties.title: Cherry Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy on smooth low gradient beach at high water. Long carry at low water.  E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Parking, chemical toilet (April-Sept only), picnic area. Small park, stream. View. Nature viewing. Directions: E off Trans-Canada Highway onto Fisher Rd. Left onto Telegraph Rd, then right onto Cherry Point Rd, past vineyards then right onto Garnett Rd. Follow to end. Cherry Point Nature Park operated by Cowichan Valley Regional District park.

properties.title: Little Bear Bay launch
properties.landing_comments: Easy, gravel/pebble/cobble natural low gradient ramp, Partly exposed to winds from Johnstone Strait, vessel traffic, currents.. Land at river mouth between camp sites..
properties.camp_comments: See Little Bear Bay campsite
properties.other_comments: Attractive, convenient site Toilet. Approach from Hwy 19 via Rock Ck Road. Some active logging 2016. Road is rough in places. Rec site 0187.

properties.title: Kelsey Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sheltered concrete ramp or gravel beach near public wharf.
properties.camp_comments: Sayward village 4 km to S has a municipal campsite (K'husam Park) and commercial campgrounds. One small campground mostly used by RV users is adjacent to public wharf, ramp. 50D 23.841N 125D 57.710W.
properties.other_comments: 3 concrete boat ramps, govt wharf. Parking. Water taxi. Provisions, services, accommodation.

properties.title: Boundary Passage Drive
properties.landing_comments: Small pebble, cobble beach, drift logs, occasional boulders. NE aspect. Easy road access except for steep stairs.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: View. Beach access signs. Roadside parking. 75 m trail to road. Overlooked by residences.

properties.title: Hardy Bay northwest
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sheltered beach of small stones in protected cove. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on pea gravel below drift logs, 1 large level site, 1 more smaller site. Site floods in tides above 4.6m. Subject to occasional drift log movement. No upland sites seen but if brushed has low slope so likely would yield hammock & tent sites.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Conveniently close to Pt Hardy.

properties.title: Hole in the Wall
properties.landing_comments: Cobble, boulders in coves facing E or W. Carry boats over boulders to limited upland. Very near tidal rapids to SW.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Mostly very rough with boulders, drift logs. Marginal, exposed as a camp.
properties.other_comments: Staging for tidal rapids. View. Probably best used as staging or day use.

properties.title: Pig Ranch
properties.landing_comments: Moderate gradient pebble beach in second bay from S. Beach floods at high water - logs awash. Boat run in mid beach section. W aspect. Exposed to NW wind.
properties.camp_comments: Sheltered attractive tent sites in sloped forest. many more tent sites if brushed. Rustic kitchen area. Small trails between sites. Hammock opportunities. Composting toilet reported but not seen 2023.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek but not seen 2023. Former commercial site - Views. See Qwiquallaaq/Boat Bay Conservancy.

properties.title: Sargeant Bay
properties.landing_comments: Low 5% slope, mostly sheltered, sand to small cobbles,  Many drift logs. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Day use park. Pit toilet. Parking for 10 vehicles
properties.other_comments: Wetland bird habitat behind beach. Big rock at N end is private. Easy vehicle access. Overnight, long term parking unknown. See Sargeant Bay Provincial Park

properties.title: Pig Ranch South Point
properties.landing_comments: Moderately steep beach with many boulders at low water, smoother pebble, cobble, scattered boulders above. W aspect. Exposed to NW. Another rougher beach across neck of point offers access from S.
properties.camp_comments: Semi exposed attractive sites in open at forest edge. Old platforms in disrepair (2023). Rustic kitchen area, table, benches. Additional sites if cleared of brush, debris. Currently not used commercially.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Trail nearby to Eagle Eye whale lookout, Boat Bay. See Qwiquallaaq/Boat Bay Conservancy. See 2013 management plan.

properties.title: Sophia Islands west
properties.landing_comments: Easy, rock/pebble/cobble only at mid water levels. Most or all beaches flood at high water making landing difficult on angular bedrock. Boulders present at low water. Exposed E aspect. Larger W island of group. Another high water landing beach reported on S side but unverified, unlikely viable at Springs.
properties.camp_comments: Exposed, attractive small tent sites in open just above shoreline requiring difficult access up steep rocks. Challenging place to load, unload stow boats. At least 2 parties have tried to camp here but have given up.
properties.other_comments: View, wild flowers. See Qwiquallaaq/Boat Bay Conservancy.

properties.title: Robson Bight north
properties.landing_comments: Easy, pebble/shingle.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not recommended.
properties.other_comments: Close to W boundary of Ecological Reserve - inside buffer zone (rubbing beach). View. aka Lunch Beach. May be used as rest stop for guided groups. See Robson Bight (Michael Bigg) Ecological Reserve.

properties.title: Francisco Island
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected pebble, cobble low gradient beach in either of two bays. S bay rougher, long carry at low water with some outcrops, boulders. Bay to NW has easier shore access but further from tent sites. SW aspect. Tidal rapids nearby. Landing on E shore subject to strong currents.
properties.camp_comments: 3 sites brushed out at head of S bay. 2 sites brushed out at NW bay.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Staging for local channels. Rough trail leads to W bay

properties.title: Surge Narrows north
properties.landing_comments: Boat run through low gradient beach slightly to right of obvious grassy camp area viewed from water. Beach floods entirely. Strong currents nearby. Kelp. SE aspect, Beware of broken glass in beach silt.
properties.camp_comments: Large open grass area between beach, forest. Sunny. Long grass can make summer tenting awkward.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal stream. View. Walking trail around point. See Surge Narrows Park.

properties.title: Robertson Cove south
properties.landing_comments: Easy on varied shingle, pebble, cobble beach. Exposed to W.
properties.camp_comments: 1 clear upland sloping forest site. 2-3 sites on pebbles at either end of beach. Hammock opportunities. Pit toilet. Potential for many additional tent sites. User maintained wilderness site.
properties.other_comments: Attractive, view. Old road. Hiking trail from centre beach 260 m to Robertson Lake on S side of creek which is often dry. Hike 10 min up trail for year-round water. See Ha'thayim (Von Donop) Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: White Cliff Islets
properties.landing_comments: Drying cove on SE of largest islet. Lifting boats from here is not easy. Alternative high water landing on exposed sloped rock shelf, slippery at low water. Feasible at low water when barnacles exposed. Visit only in settled weather, low swell, low wind. Little significant protection from wind, swell if conditions turn rough during or after landing. Waters to NE towards Owl I quickly turn rough when large ebb runs out of Knight Inlet.
properties.camp_comments: Exposed, no shade. Grassy areas or level rock ledges offer some shelter from wind. Prone to overcrowding by large groups. Paddlers are known to have used NW islet as overflow site but not recommended. Essential to use sanitation method recommended in Code of Conduct.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Wildlife viewing. See Broughton Archipelago Provincial Park.

properties.title: Owl Island north
properties.landing_comments: Pebble beach, small cobble, gravel in small cove at NW side of island. Mud at low water. N aspect. Boat run suited to tides to 0.1 m.
properties.camp_comments: Open, spacious treed upland site. Mouldering toilet. Heavy use including by guided commercial groups. 2 rustic kitchen areas. Numerous hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Small trail leads across neck of land to boulder beach with W aspect for evening sun. See Broughton Archipelago Provincial Park

properties.title: Melville Island central
properties.landing_comments: Moderately protected bay has boat run in boulder beach - use at high and mid water levels. For low water, gravel patch at E end is preferred..
properties.camp_comments: Camping not permitted.
properties.other_comments: See Desolation Sound Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Prideaux Haven
properties.landing_comments: Rough beach with rock ledges at S end of William Islands. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not permitted. Site coordinates also reported as N50D 08.655M W124D 40.851M.
properties.other_comments: Busy anchorage. See Desolation Sound Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Diana Island east
properties.land_tenure: Crown, Crown tenure - Section 17 designated use area
properties.landing_comments: Pocket sand beach facing Helby Island. Low to moderate gradient. Protected NE aspect. Good for most water levels but little beach at high water. Floods at Springs. Some boulders at W end at high water.
properties.camp_comments: Semi-cleared flat upland sites reported for 2 tents in the trees 10 m above beach. Potential for 4 more. Beach camping unreliable at Springs. Camp furniture. Basic toilet but not reported by most recent visitor. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Easy access.

properties.title: Tatlow Road
properties.landing_comments: Gravel beach. High tides flood beach, making launching difficult.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: From Chalet Rd turn W on Tatlow Rd. 100 m pathway, approx 35 concrete steps down to beach. Parking between signs limited to 4-5 vehicles on Tatlow Road. Beach is also know as Chalet Beach with sign posted by North Saanich Municipality.

properties.title: Turn Bay Recreation Site
properties.landing_comments: Easy on low gradient sand, pebble, cobble beach in small bay. Beach mostly floods. W aspect but generally well protected.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Camp on moderately level sites in open forest with easy shore access at creek mouth. Minor brushing, levelling likely needed. Numerous hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. Previously named East Thurlow Island west 1, Walkem Islands inside 1. Recreation Site (Reserve) named Turn Bay but it lies outside of Turn Bay proper. 8 Ha area.

properties.title: Ramillies Channel ínaḵa Lhaxwm
properties.landing_comments: Wide 7% gradient sand, gravel, pebble beach in small bay. Scattered boulders. NE aspect. Beach may flood at Springs. Drift logs. Prominent sign visible from water. Similar beaches to N.
properties.camp_comments: Small level upland forest sites along narrow grassy bench just behind beach. Other possible small sites on pebble berm between drift logs except at Springs. Further options nearby. Composting toilet along shore trail heading to N up bank. All upland at the S end of the beach is private property. Please do not go beyond centre beach or posted signs. 2 aluminum food bins. Picnic table. Visitor log book. Fire bucket.
properties.other_comments: View. Attractive. Year-round water available 1 NM N at Gambier Creek. Squamish (Coast Salish) name ínaḵa Lhaxwm. Please do not trespass on adjacent private property immediately to S. Site stewards: Sea Kayak Assn of BC.

properties.title: Bold Island
properties.landing_comments: Moderate on steep cobble, boulder beach. SW aspect. Drift logs. Easier access at high water. Protected except from S.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Camp on old road that flattens above beach to W or on E side of beach. Minor brushing, levelling likely needed. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: View. Secluded. Walking on old roads feasible. Beach fires are banned all year round.

properties.title: Undercover Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy at all tides on steep beach of small cobbles. No large visible rocks at mid tide. SW aspect. Beach is not obvious at high water. BCMTN sign.
properties.camp_comments: Short trail rises to level upland area. 4 cleared tent sites in sparse undergrowth, trees.
properties.other_comments: Short hiking trail to lookout, further beach to E. Two small boat storage areas on upland above beach, beside sign or above beach centre. Cache location: 50.500366°N; 127.770371°W

properties.title: Lewis Channel south
properties.landing_comments: Unmaintained boat run on sharp rough boulder beach over coarse gravel. Low gradient at low water, but steep at high water. Some protection. W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Fire pit. Flat area on headland for large tent, more sloping area for smaller tent. 1 or 2 mmall sites on coarse gravel at beach top, also1 small grassy spot reported by beach. Some overgrowth.
properties.other_comments: Afternoon sun on bluff to N. Aka West Redonda.

properties.title: Otter Bay ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off.  See map for nearby launch option at Hyashi Cove. No feasible launch next to terminal.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to other Gulf Islands, Tsawwassen, Swartz Bay.

properties.title: Okisollo north entrance
properties.landing_comments: Easy in sheltered, shallow bay. Mud, pebble, tidal grass. Bay dries at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Sites in open forest or on narrow grassy bank. Damp grassy area near shore. Some reporters say it is gloomy.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek.

properties.title: Qualicum Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy on long beach of sand, gravel, shingle. Moderate gradient. N aspect. Various similar locations
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. No fires.
properties.other_comments: Toilets. Paved beachfront walking path. No overnight parking permitted.

properties.title: Howcraft Bay
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient mixed beach in large semi-protected bay. Long carry at low water. Patches of sand at all tide levels. Scattered boulders, bedrock outcrops. SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Camp among drift logs on sand beach at neaps or on beach grass by creek at higher water levels. Beach at N end reported dry at 3.9 m water level. Dense vegetation makes upland camping difficult but upland access feasible.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at seasonal creek crossing centre beach. Island at bay mouth 11 m high, not 1 m as charted on CHS 3547. CMTs.

properties.title: Russell Island
properties.landing_comments: Shell beach landing on W side. Also small dock.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Pit toilets. Picnic table. Hiking trails. Historic site with heritage home. Restored clam garden. Gulf Islands National Park Reserve. See Russell Island

properties.title: Warren Islands north
properties.landing_comments: Land at NE point on bedrock ramp or on shell, boulder tiny beach. Protected from W.
properties.camp_comments: Small bluff sites at NE tip. Fire ring, camp furniture. Easy carry.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View.

properties.title: Deep Harbour west
properties.landing_comments: Clam bed beach with cobble, some boulders above. Land at creek mouth. Forest comes down to water level. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Sites in open woods reported to E of creek, but no usable tent site found 2023. Steep creek banks. Potential sites could be brushed. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round creek but weak flow during drought in mid-July 2023. Other charted creek to NE might have greater flow with similar or better camping. Visible remains of old fish trap.

properties.title: Deep Harbour Narrows
properties.landing_comments: Protected rough beach with broken rocks, some scattered boulders. Moderate gradient. NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: 3 sites on grassy forest edge, subject to moderate tides. Could be damp in wet weather. 1 site on duff at forest margin. Adjacent inactive log dump to W has overgrown level sites in former clearings or roads, subject to brushing. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water possible but unlikely at seasonal stream crossing landing. Inactive log dump (2004, 2014) to W. Seasketch shows no licence or tenure here so industrial tenure might be retired.

properties.title: Call Inlet north entrance
properties.landing_comments: Beach of angular cobble beach with gravel above. Land at creek mouth fan.
properties.camp_comments: Site on bank of W creek in open woods. Hammock opportunities. Another site is 200 m to W in level forest at grassy beach top. Steep forest behind. Poor landing on boulders.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round creek, flowing during mid-July 2023 drought.

properties.title: Cutter Cove
properties.landing_comments: Very low gradient mixed clam bed beach of pebble with barnacles at high water, mud at low water. Some boulders. W aspect. Land at N end by smooth rock bluffs. Good protection. Cove head has extensive mud flats. Expect difficult access at mid, low water.
properties.camp_comments: E side bank behind cedars has grassy tent sites, needing minor brushing.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal stream, dry in July 2023. Possibly former village site. Local First Nation suggested day use only to avoid wildlife conflicts.

properties.title: Brooks Point
properties.landing_comments: 2 pebble beaches each 75 m long between headlands. Rocky foreshore. Currents. S or E aspects.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. No fires. Vault toilet at Kloshe Road entrance.
properties.other_comments: Attractive, view. Capital Regional District Brooks Point Regional Park. 4 ha conservation area bought in 2001. Walking trail or Kloshe Road leads to Gowlland Point Road shoulder parking area. Fruit trees. Feasible launch sites on either beach - approx 200 m from vehicle unloading area at entrance at end of Kloshe Road. Navigation marker on Gowlland Point.

properties.title: Cattle Islands north
properties.landing_comments: Sand beach. Channel protected, suited for lining out boat.
properties.camp_comments: N of sand tombolo. Quite long carry.
properties.other_comments: nan

properties.title: Tod Inlet
properties.landing_comments: Beach, dinghy dock in protected inlet.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Picnic area with tables. Pit toilets. No fires.
properties.other_comments: Walking trail to Wallace Drive 15 min. Also leads to Benvenuto Avenue, Butchart Gardens. Extensive hiking trails, also horse and bike trails. Anchorage.

properties.title: Richardson Bay
properties.landing_comments: Moderate gradient sand, gravel beach at end of long protected cove. Scattered boulders. Protected except from SE. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. No fires.
properties.other_comments: Attractive natural area. Slightly difficult access up short bank to upland. Hiking trail to Portlock Point, lighthouse. Other unofficial hiking trails reported. Private areas nearby.

properties.title: China Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy landingon gravel, shell beach in small protected cove. N aspect.  Rope suspended across entry high above water might be to deter larger boat anchoring.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Access up bank or via rotten, overgrown boardwalk.
properties.other_comments: Old buildings, former hatchery. Orchard. Overgrown meadow. Gravel roadway from Cusheon Lake (private properties) access lane. Easy foot access to Ruckle hiking trails.

properties.title: Cy Hampson
properties.landing_comments: Sloped gravel path from parking lot. Cobble, boulders at high water. Sand at low water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilets. Picnic tables, benches.
properties.other_comments: Gravel parking lot. Roadside parking discouraged. 6.25 ha Cy Hampson District of North Saanich Park on Bazan Bay, part of CRD Lochside Regional Trail. W area across road is fenced off-leash dog area. Gravel, paved trails. Stairs, fencing, gates might make site unsuited to launching. Otherwise good beach access, viewpoint, Parking duration unknown.

properties.title: Estítkw Apodaca
properties.landing_comments: Moderate gradient coarse gravel beach in small drying cove. Boulders with wide gaps at low water. S aspect. Sheltered from N outflow wind but exposed to S. Little or no beach area at Springs. Prone to accumulate drift logs. Ship wash from frequent passing ferries. Vessel traffic.
properties.camp_comments: 4 tent platforms on level mossy benches high above beach. Access trail up steep bank near creek steers users away from sensitive bluffs. No fires. No overflow sites - to preserve vegetation. Composting green throne roofless toilet. Food cache bin, Canoe/kayak rack. Kiosk with signage
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Seasonal water at Optimist Creek. Waterfall, pool. Ecological values "unique rocky knoll vegetation." Higher elevations are Ecological Reserve. See Apodaca Provincial Park Squamish language name (Coast Salish) Estítkw. Pronunciation how to pronounce name

properties.title: Islet View Lhemlhemḵwús
properties.landing_comments: Cleared boat run through boulder beach, 5-10% grade. Substrate pebble, sand, mud. S aspect. Protected by low treeless rock islet. Prominent sign visible from water.
properties.camp_comments: 2 small, 1 larger cleared sites along upland strip of level ground. 2 or more sites up trail with steps to composting toilet. 2 wooden tent platforms along shore to E. Steel food bin. Any fires must be on beach only. Visitor log book, shared picnic table. Some users have blocked use of some tent sites with table etc. Please share this small site, its table and beach fire ring with other users.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Very small seasonal creek. Larger year round creek, waterfall 250 m to SW accessible by boat only. Avoid disturbing birds, seals on islet. Squamish (Coast Salish) name Lhemlhemḵwús. Site stewards: Sea Kayak Assn of BC.

properties.title: Von Donop entrance
properties.landing_comments: Easy on pebble, cobble beach. Drift logs. Protected by islet.
properties.camp_comments: Level clearing in upland forest. Undeveloped user maintained dispersed camping. Might be partly overgrown.
properties.other_comments: View. See Ha'thayim (Von Donop) Marine Provincial Park. Hazard - please note there are many snags and danger trees on this site. Not recommended on any windy day. Exercise caution.

properties.title: Elk Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy, on pebble beach but exposed to N.
properties.camp_comments: Vehicle accessible site can also accommodate tents. 2 sites are S of creek, separate from main group. Toilets, picnic tables, fire rings. Maintained.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. View. Boat launch. See:  Elk Bay Recreation Site

properties.title: Cinque Bay
properties.landing_comments: Two bays on Sonora Is 150 m apart separated by rocky promontory.  S bay has better beach of sand, pebblr, cobble, boulders. N bay landing rougher with sharp rocks, Beaches mostly flood at high water. W aspect. Ship wash.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped marginal sites. Camp in trees. Some brushing needed. N site rougher than S but less damp..
properties.other_comments: Water in N bay at stream from lake, so may be year-round. Aka Cinque Islands inside.

properties.title: Loggers Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy, pebble beach, exposed. Rougher with boulders on N side at low water. Currents, vessel traffic.
properties.camp_comments: Exposed to W. Large site. Camp either side of creek on grass in alders or on grassy small headland on N side of bay.
properties.other_comments: View. Water at small seasonal creek. View. Aka 'South of Point 45'. John Kimantas gives position as 50 12.75N 125 21.39W. Believed to be former log dump. Beach fires are banned all year round.

properties.title: Mount Lardner
properties.landing_comments: Steep beach of pebble, small rock. Some boulders near high water mark. Beach floods at high water. Rougher beach N of grassy tombolo to islet. Exposed to outflows from inlets. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Possible tent site at rocky point in hemlock trees between landing beaches or on grassy patches at Neaps. Mainland forest mostly very steep.
properties.other_comments: Water reported but not seen at seasonal creek at N end of beach. Marginal site.

properties.title: Arm Islands
properties.land_tenure: Crown tenure - Section 17 designated use area
properties.landing_comments: Pocket gravel beach among boulders on E side at NE tip of main, longest island. Protected from all directions.
properties.camp_comments: Small lumpy upland forest margin sites above landing. Might flood at Springs. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek 150 m to E on mainland shore. Passage to N reported navigable by small craft at all water levels to N of small islet. Seasketch shows as Provincial Forest or Crown rather than Sec 17 Reserve, so land tenure unclear.

properties.title: Deep Harbour south
properties.landing_comments: Small shell, pebble beach. N end of beach between rock points.
properties.camp_comments: Usable tent site seen. Access to forest up steep bank. Several potential sites if brushed or deadfall moved. Lumpy site, steeper behind. Marginal as camp.
properties.other_comments: Year-round water reported approx 50 m up from creek mouth but not viewed July 2023. Might be former village site along E bank of main creek. Musgamakw Dzawada’enuxw traditional territory sign.

properties.title: Thompson Sound Pool
properties.land_tenure: Indigenous Protected and Conserved Area, Provincial Forest
properties.landing_comments: Creek mouth.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round creek. Pool for bathing. Waterfalls. Reported to be in IPCA (2025).

properties.title: Millar Group Islands
properties.landing_comments: Well-protected central cove on N shore of largest island has beaches of mud, sand, scattered boulders. Enter from navigable channel in a SE direction.
properties.camp_comments: Suited to day use. For emergency use only, numerous suitable bivi sites will be obvious.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Wildlife viewing. Planning shows entire group for wildlife conservation with no intended recreational use. Sea lion, bird colonies mostly on lesser islands.

properties.title: Sangster Island
properties.landing_comments: Long sand, pebble beach.Drift logs. SE aspect. Smaller beach on opposite side of peninsula has NW aspect, so one or other should be sheltered.
properties.camp_comments: Entire island is private. Foreshore suited to short-term bivouac or emergency camp.
properties.other_comments: Situated close to crossing from Winchelseas to Lasqueti.

properties.title: Peel Island west
properties.landing_comments: 2 small beaches of white shell at high water, boulders, weed at low water. SW aspect. Easier access from S.
properties.camp_comments: At one time, semi-developed camp with covered picnic shelter. Subsequently returned to more natural state, so might need minor brushing. Open to NW wind.
properties.other_comments: Windows and garbage collected on site March 2025. View of Fort Rupert and Seven Hills Peninsula.

properties.title: Tsartlip Brentwood Bay
properties.landing_comments: Boat ramp.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Launch fee applies. Tsartlip First Nations.

properties.title: Arbutus Road
properties.landing_comments: Small gravel, pebble pools lie between bedrock ribs. Extensive shore at most water levels. NW aspect. Easy shore access.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Parking on roadside for several vehicles.

properties.title: Matthews Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand beach 400 m long at most water levels. Scattered boulders at W end. Likely little beach at Springs. S aspect. Currents, heavy vessel traffic.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Vault toilet at road near park entrance parking.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. 500 m developed trail to Bluff Road, steep near water with rope handrail. Parking. Wildlife, nature viewing. Other trails or planned e.g. to Mary Ann Point Road. 33.6 ha Capital Regional District Park, See: Matthews Point

properties.title: Thornbrough Channel txwnaḿ Chá7elkwnech
properties.landing_comments: Cleared boat run on small cobbles, pebble, through gaps in boulders, 5-10% grade.  Exposed S aspect. Several options at low water but limited pocket beach only at high water. Prone to blockage by drift logs. Alternate beach 30 m to W at creek mouth has smaller more rounded stones, but access to tent sites more awkward. Reasonable portable boat stowage at beach top at candelabra cedars. Prominent sign visible from water.
properties.camp_comments: 2 very small level cleared sites in steep forested upland near landing. 4 large wooden tent platforms, several other small sites on open mossy rock bluffs to SW accessed by bridge across creek then up steep, rough trail. 200 m carry to upper sites. Composting toilet on trail high above landing. Aluminum food bin near landing below trail, lower tent sites. Second bin higher. Visitor log book. 2 picnic tables intended for sharing near platforms. Fire bucket at landing. No fires in upland.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. Sunny beach, bluff, view. Keep to cleared trails on bluffs to prevent damage to mosses, vegetation. Squamish (Coast Salish) name txwnaḿ Chá7elkwnech. Aka Thornbrough Point. Site stewards: Sea Kayak Assn of BC.

properties.title: China Beach
properties.landing_comments: Difficult landing in high surf. Mixed sand pebble, cobble. SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Very long hike to developed main campground with 30 tent sites with vehicle, RV access. Beach camping not permitted. Fees charged.
properties.other_comments: Consider locking up paddlecraft if using main campground. See: Juan de Fuca Provincial Park.

properties.title: Mount Dick east
properties.landing_comments: Small beach of steep gravel, cobble, some rubble. Pebble at top. SSW aspect. Shelter from NW. 2 beaches split by large rock outcrop. Either beach offers landings. Little beach remains at high water.
properties.camp_comments: Recommended only for day use. 3 beach sites on pebble at Neaps but upper beach likely floods at Springs. Steep cliffs behind hinder any upland retreat if beach floods.
properties.other_comments: See South Texada Island Provincial Park

properties.title: Rathtrevor
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient sand beach in Craig Bay. Exposed. From E very long (900 m) carry at low water. From N or NE approx 200 m carry to cobble spit at Brandt Point. Advisable to avoid low water due to tidally-dependent access.
properties.camp_comments: Large developed campground, Walk-in tent camping in separate pleasant field with picnic tables. Full facilities including water, parking, washrooms, showers, picnic tables, shelters. Playground. Nature house. Group sites. Reservations BC Parks
properties.other_comments: 3 km S of Parksville on Highway 19A, Take exit 51 off Inland Island Highway (Highway 19) and follow signs. Water at taps, Wildlife viewing. Attractive. See: Rathtrevor Beach Park Fees apply year-round.

properties.title: Coles Bay
properties.landing_comments: Protected low gradient beach of gravel, mud. SW aspect. At low tide, long run out to the water. In the summer the water heats up from the beach rocks and gravel, nice place to swim.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Pit toilets, picnic tables. Open only in daylight hours.
properties.other_comments: Coles Bay Regional Park, 3.6 ha managed by Capital Regional District. 9324 Inverness Rd. Access from Ardmore Drive, W Saanich Road, Large gravel parking lot. Swimming. Walking trails. Birding, nature viewing. Potential launch site - but carry distance 245 m. See: <Coles Bay Regional Park.

properties.title: Ella Bay Roesland
properties.landing_comments: Gravel, sand beaches, W aspect in Ella Bay via grassy slope or adjacent Otter Bay N aspect via a few stone, concrete steps. Both moderately protected.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Picnic tables, flush toilets
properties.other_comments: View, walking trails, museum, old orchard, park offices, ranger station, park dock. No drinking water available. Road access from South Otter Bay Road. 200 m gravel road allows only authorized vehicles, so walk in from parking lot to beaches. Gulf Islands National Park Reserve. See Roesland

properties.title: Robbers Passage
properties.landing_comments: Tombolo
properties.camp_comments: No known camping. Small site might yield something at Neaps. Land status not yet checked.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Christie Passage
properties.landing_comments: Not visible from main passage. Protected beach in sheltered bay approx. 500 m SW of God's Pocket resort.
properties.camp_comments: Up steep bank 4 M high on obvious midden. A nice sand/rock beach that is accessible both low and high tides. 4 - 5 tent sites are available in the grass area as well the forest. . No facilities. Random wilderness camping. No fees charged. Obvious midden location, so avoid all fires except on beach. 50° 50.278'N 127° 35.618'W
properties.other_comments: Entrance to the campsite area is very steep. Alternate entrance under trees to the left of main entrance is not as steep. See: God's Pocket Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Walkem Bay central 2
properties.landing_comments: Easy landing on cobble beach. Sw aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Easy upland access. Mossy forest with some level areas. Minor brushing likely needed.
properties.other_comments: Site lies on border with Turn Bay Recreation Site immediately to N.

properties.title: Walkem Bay central 1
properties.landing_comments: Small rough beach of cobble, boulders. SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Access at creek mouth through dense salal forest fringe to open dark forest with some level areas.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek.

properties.title: Beachcomber Regional Park
properties.landing_comments: Two sand, pebble, bedrock beaches at peninsula neck
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Take Northwest Bay Rd (off either Hwy19 or Hwy 19A), Claudet Rd and Marina Way. See: Beachcomber Regional Park Managed by Regional District of Nanaimo. Area 1 ha. Tide pools.

properties.title: Bush Islets inside
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient broad sand, gravel beach. SE aspect. Drift logs. Exposed to SE.
properties.camp_comments: No sites found in low slope forested upland but access awkward over drift logs. Likely to yield sites if brushed.
properties.other_comments: Water at stream crossing centre beach. Flowing July 2023.

properties.title: Bear Beach
properties.landing_comments: Difficult on exposed rocky beach of cobble, some boulders at high water. Sand at low water. Potential for high surf, particularly in Fall, Winter, Spring. Swell normal. Watch for a back eddy at the point that gives protection from surf.
properties.camp_comments: 10 platforms added 2023/24. 2 food bins. Pit toilet. Access to camping area via hiking trail reportedly requires 3 m or lower tide height, but unclear if this is maximum tide level to access site from landing beach. Approximate location only. Fire pits. Camping fees apply year-round. May pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites. Fee $10.00 per adult per night (2018) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System.
properties.other_comments: Hiker use. Old growth forest. On Juan De Fuca hiking trail. See: Juan de Fuca Provincial Park.

properties.title: Meade Bay south
properties.landing_comments: Rock ledges at point W of islet or rough beach adjacent to smooth rocks.
properties.camp_comments: At moderate tides camp on flat bedrock shelf rock at shore.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View.

properties.title: Bassett Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected beach of gravel, large pebbles, small cobble. Larger rocks at low water. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on possibly damp road end. 3 or 4 above beach, others to N of creek in upland. Some local access evident. Benches for hikers at trail end. Fallen tree blocks one site (2017). Potential for additional sites.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek at N end of beach by campsites. Recreation Site or Reserve. Mainly intended for Eagle Lake where setup is for day use.
