Well-marked trail or rough road connects on S branch to Eagle Lake, Big Bay (3 km), on N branch to airstrip (1 km) . Bassett Bay is local name; not charted. Anchorage. Another possible site lies 450 m NE but has poorer landing.

properties.title: Meade Bay northeast
properties.landing_comments: Creek mouth in cove at NE side of bay. Protected clam bed beach with cobble, some boulders at top. W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Large level site in second growth forest on N side of estuary above a small flat.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round creek.

properties.title: Kains Beach
properties.landing_comments: Rocky approach. Seek the clear entry route through from Pinnacle Island to prominent sea stack near shore.
properties.camp_comments: Roomy sand, pebble beach. Some protection from SW, NW. Might be little room at Springs.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View.

properties.title: Hope Bay
properties.landing_comments: Floats at public dock. Small well protected beach, easy launch on small gravel.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Amenities, commercial services. Road access. Historic settlement, store. Floats managed by Capital Regional District as a Small Craft Harbour.

properties.title: Favada Point south
properties.landing_comments: Moderate landing on slightly steep cobble beach in small cove. Pebble, drift logs at top. Floods at Springs. 3 other possible landings in coves to NW.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on beach or forest margin except during Springs when 1 or 2 small sites high on mossy bluffs may be used, Hammock opportunities. Brushing, levelling could yield more tent sites.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal stream. Flagged trail leads up bluffs to unknown destination, possibly residence.

properties.title: Limekiln Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on large beach of rounded cobbles, boulders. W aspect. Exposed to many wind directions. 2 or 3 other landing areas to the S are also feasible.
properties.camp_comments: Report received of "Better camping than Crescent to S" - ref 'Seakayak Des Snd & Sunshine Coast' but none seen 2022. Potential sites subject to brushing, levelling. Possibility of better sites art landing in S of bay.
properties.other_comments: Tourism map of Texada I shows public beach access roughly at centre bay. Beach has public access from road that runs behind beach.

properties.title: Raven Bay Texada Island
properties.landing_comments: Moderate, low gradient, semi-protected cobble beach. Good protection from W. If lining out boat be aware of some boulders. However public land lies outside bay proper, so landing is more exposed.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Possible camping sites on both sides of creek but all parts private inside bay. N side has road access, so busier. Beyond E entrance a few sites along shore margin. Beach floods to tree line. Many locals camp at site in summer, leaving much garbage but these sites are on not on public land. Approx 4 sites on public land at outer S bay edge.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. Rough road access, so car camping likely, frequent.

properties.title: Texada Island north
properties.landing_comments: 200 mm boulders low tide, 75 mm cobble at high tide.
properties.camp_comments: Pocket beach may flood at Springs. Upland awkward to access but at least 1 party camped here.
properties.other_comments: Marginal site but potentially useful in a pinch.

properties.title: Grilse Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy to moderate om steep cobble, pebble, gravel beach at all tides, 15% slope. Vessel traffic. Optional cove landing on E shore with possibility of more protection but longer more awkward carry.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped, Occasionally also used for camping. Attractive flat gravel berm area just above beach but not visible from water level. Some shelter. Sites on grass roadway also feasible,
properties.other_comments: View. Large quarries nearby. Ferry service to Powell R from Blubber Bay, 0.7 NM to SW. Land tenure relates to navigation, communications aids on shore.

properties.title: Fegen Islets west
properties.landing_comments: Steep wide gravel beach at SE corner of islet. High water access easier. NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Roomy beach camping on gravel. Exposed.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. See Sabine Channel Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Sturt Bay
properties.landing_comments: Launch, visitors dock. 2 concrete boat ramps.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Van Anda township. Short walk for food, pay showers at Texada Island Inn. Overnight pay parking at Boat Club. Provisions, fuel, accommodation. Sturt Bay Regional Park also located nearby near Marble Bay Road at head of Caesar Cove in S portion of Sturt Bay. Unknown cartop launch characteristics.

properties.title: Powerline east
properties.landing_comments: Sheltered landing near creek mouth, large boulder, on beach of rounded cobble. NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Grassy sites among trees. Camp furniture. upland fire ring. Close to creek bank.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek with near year-round flow. Trail, BC Hydro access road nearby leading to primary island roads. AKA Long Beach.

properties.title: Powerline west
properties.landing_comments: Low to moderate gradient smooth beach of gravel, pebble, sand. Drift logs. S aspect. Larger E beach preferred over SW aspect beach under lines. Protected from several directions by rocky islet.
properties.camp_comments: Grass areas under trees. Possible beach top sites. Hammock opportunities. Sites further from lines likely to be found 300 m to SE along beach. Another suitable potential camping beach lies 0.5 NM to SE.
properties.other_comments: Water at large seasonal creek 300 m to SE. RD Official Community Plan notes as UREP with high recreational potential. Mapping shows BC Hydro right of way for transmission line. Some land near shore Crown lease. West Texada Island Cable Terminal. Road might be private (gated) until it joins FSR Davie Bay/Shingle Beach Roads 400 m from Terminal.

properties.title: Cockburn Roberts Homesite
properties.landing_comments: Pea gravel, 15% slope at low water. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Semi-developed. 10 or more tent sites on several grassy level areas, some on old roadbed. Unenclosed pit toilet (Green Throne) presumably installed by Regional District. Several 'No Fires' signs on this and adjacent BC Hydro site. Camping neither officially sanctioned nor prohibited by Regional District but known to occur ,evidently tolerated.
properties.other_comments: Beach locally known as Harry's Beach (after Harry Roberts). Old home nearby at W end on adjacent leased property owned by BC Hydro is historic Roberts homestead Sunray. Boundary not marked between private land held by BC Hydro, SCRD Regional Park. Respectful camping without fire use also permitted there. Avoid entering sensitive wetlands behind beach area.

properties.title: Willow Point Campbell River
properties.landing_comments: Easy, on boat ramp or cobble, pebble beach. Hazardous currents, rips in area. Vessel traffic,
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Flush toilets, picnic area, water at tap. Parking (might be insecure). Subject to winter closure due to tidal debris. Located in Ken Forde Park 2501 S. Island Hwy. Parking appears to be unrestricted (2019).

properties.title: Heriot Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sheltered concrete ramp or adjacent beach.
properties.camp_comments: Commercial camping nearby at Heriot Bay Inn has convenient direct access from water and beach or landing floats.
properties.other_comments: Water at tap, flush toilets. Restaurant, accommodation, provisions, fuel. Long term parking available for fee. Launch fee $4 cash (2025) payable to Heriot Bay Harbour Authority, Antler Road. Wharf, floating dock. Upland behind foreshore to W of wharf is Esplanade Regional Park of the Strathcona Regional District. Beach fires are banned all year round.

properties.title: Squirrel Cove
properties.landing_comments: Gravel beach adjacent to wharf, floats in protected cove.  Also concrete boat ramp. Do not drive onto beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: View. Vehicle access by Whaletown Road to Squirrel Cove Road. No known toilets (2020). Earlier report of toilets, showers, laundry at nearby Squirrel Cove Store. Pay parking at store. Launch fee for paddlecraft. Harbour Authority of Cortes Island. Provisions. Water at tap. Restaurant.

properties.title: Moulds Bay
properties.landing_comments: Moderate on rough beach. Low gradient. Many angular, stable boulders, cobble. Open to SE. Short but rough access from vehicles. Drift logs. Preferable to avoid low water.  Launch at cable right of way.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: At end of Valdez Road off Village Bay Road. Park along Valdez Road but posted no overnight parking hence for day use only. Overnight parking by users reported at side of Valdez Road (2020). Small hiking trail leads NE to next bay. Beach fires are banned all year round.

properties.title: Hoskyn Channel
properties.landing_comments: Easy, on partly protected cobble/pebble beach. For brief visits, landing may also be made at float to S of beach with ramp link to shore.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Hoskyn Channel Landing Park of Strathcona Regional District. Dock (float). Water at year-round creek running through beach. Boat ramp use discouraged for trailers. Final roadway suitable for 4x4 vehicles only. Congested roadside parking up steep hill. Hiking trail to Surge Narrows viewpoint maintained by Quadra I Rec Soc. Paddlers requested to minimize loading time, parking use. Regional District committee requested no paddlecraft launching to minimize possible inconvenience to residents of outer islands. Beach fires are banned all year round.

properties.title: Granite Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy at protected boat ramp of crushed gravel or adjacent beach. Long float.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Launch or parking fee, portable toilet, 2 picnic tables. Granite Bay Park built, operated by Strathcona Regional District. Small boat docks, long float, ramp. Beach fires are banned all year round.

properties.title: Port McNeill
properties.landing_comments: Easy on gravel beach near public wharf or on concrete ramp.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Restaurant, accommodation, flush toilets, water at tap, provisions, fuel. Water taxi. Parking available.

properties.title: Tulista Park
properties.landing_comments: Narrow gravel beach. Tall concrete sea wall.  Easiest access through breaks for 2 wide paved boat ramps
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Toilets, picnic shelter, tables. Parking for 3 vehicles carrying roof top boats with pass up to 24 hours. Other short term stalls. Reported Oct 2024, temporary notice, parking in the park limited to 3 hours only because of construction ongoing across the street. Approach via Lochside Drive. Fees charged for ramp use. Long stay pay parking for fee at corner of Bevan Avenue, Second Street. Town of Sidney-by-the-Sea park. See Tulista Boat Launch Information

properties.title: Cape Keppel northwest
properties.landing_comments: Easy 10% grade. Gravel beach up to 25mm. Some exposure to S. Some fallen trees obstruct landing (2022).
properties.camp_comments: Some beach sites, others with easy access on flats on upland grassy bank. Rustic camp furniture, table, chairs. Pit toilet. Reported to need cleanup, brushing (2022).
properties.other_comments: View. Has been used for overnight visits.

properties.title: Buccaneer Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on moderate gradient sand beach in large semi-enclosed bay, protected from waves from most directions. E aspect. Landing also easy but more exposed on outer W aspect sand beach.
properties.camp_comments: Camp in designated sites only in sandy flats. 2 pit toilets. 5 Fire rings. 5 Picnic tables. Metal food cache. No reservable sites, no user fees (2023). Park operator reported to not tolerate overflow camping if designated sites already occupied. Paddlers, boaters have been required to move at short notice. Site has no wind or sun protection except for pole structures that could be enclosed with a tarp.
properties.other_comments: View, trail to N Thormanby boat dock. Aka Grassy Point. Frequent use by power boaters. See Buccaneer Bay Provincial Park

properties.title: Broken Islands Lodge
properties.landing_comments: Paddlers can launch from beach in front of the lodge or possibly from the dock.
properties.camp_comments: n/a; Broken Islands Lodge houses paddlers.
properties.other_comments: The Broken Islands Lodge provides round trip water taxi transportation from Bamfield or Toquart Bay (soon to open again) for $90, including the kayak. Find the rates here. The MV Frances Barkley also arrives and unloads kayaks or canoes at the dock in front of Broken Islands Lodge but is cancelled for 2021.

properties.title: Bamfield Ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off.  Dock with float adjacent to ferry.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: Lady Rose Marine service between Port Alberni, Sechart Lodge, Bamfield, Ucluelet. Offers transport for small paddlecraft on 200 passenger ferry.

properties.title: Port Washington
properties.landing_comments: Public wharf with two sets of floats.  Ladder to aid access to small boats.
properties.camp_comments: n/a
properties.other_comments: Parking within walking distance. Operated by Capital Regional District. Wharfinger Rod MacLean 250.629.6111. Closest facilities, shops, restaurant at Hope Bay 3 km.

properties.title: Raynor Islands south
properties.landing_comments: Moderate gradient sand beach at low water, cobble above. Scattered boulders. N aspect. Beach wraps around W side of island, also to NE side. Exposed to NW but in lee of other islands. Protected from SE. One side or other should be protected in most conditions.
properties.camp_comments: Access upland at hung float. 4+ open forest clear tent sites. Hammock opportunities. Beach sites reported, but none seen that has tidal clearance.
properties.other_comments: None.

properties.title: Okeover Arm Tuxwnech
properties.landing_comments: Easy access on shallow steps from parking area, walk-in sites to rough low gradient beach with scattered boulders. E aspect. Close to Okeover public harbour.
properties.camp_comments: 14 vehicle access sites, 2 double sites, 4 walk-in sites open seasonally. 4 smaller walk-in sites open all year. Light forest.
properties.other_comments: Water at tap. Swimming. 4 ha park. Overnight pay parking nearby if leaving campsite. See: Okeover Arm Provincial Park

properties.title: Donkersly Road
properties.landing_comments: Broad low gradient beach. Patches of sand, areas of cobble, scattered boulders. Drift logs have cleared access route. Concrete pedestrian ramp from parking to shore. Exposed SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Access off Highway 101 on Donkersly Road to end. Small parking area. No posted restrictions. Short path to shore.

properties.title: Thunder Bay
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient rough beach of various sizes of rock. SE aspect. Jumbled drift logs, debris at beach top. Likely exposed to outflow Jervis Inlet wind. Gravel pathway leads to beach with moderate to steep gradient.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Bench.
properties.other_comments: Off Highway 101 follow Roberts Road then turn left on Thunder Bay Road. Beach Access sign posted at junction. Gravel parking area with no posted restrictions except for no camping.

properties.title: Chop Bay west
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient clam bed beach with pebble, scattered boulders in protected bay. Expect long carry at low water. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Tent sites in second growth forest.
properties.other_comments: Attractive.

properties.title: Henrietta Island
properties.landing_comments: Protected beach clam bed beach, moderate gradient, with pebble, cobble, scattered boulders. Rougher at top.
properties.camp_comments: Tent sites subject to brushing on small plateau where slope behind beach flattens. Little undergrowth. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Baronet Passage east
properties.landing_comments: Rough beach of gravel at high water but boulders at lower water levels. Clam bed below.
properties.camp_comments: Tent sites in level, open forest with minor brushing. Beach top tent sites on gravel feasible at most tides.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Baronet Passage north
properties.landing_comments: Large protected bay with broad clam bed beach. Moderate to low gradient. Cobble, some boulders. Long carry at low water, so use at high water suggested. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Beach top tent sites on gravel will be dry at most tides. Level second growth forest could take 2-4 additional tents with brushing, clearing of minor branches. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Spacious. Stream mapped at centre bay but not seen 2023.

properties.title: Grassy Island Plumper Islands
properties.landing_comments: Land on exposed rock ledges. NW shore preferred. Strong currents.
properties.camp_comments: Exposed sites on rock lacking shade.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. See Cormorant Channel Marine Park.

properties.title: Plumper Islands
properties.landing_comments: Pebble, cobble , small boulder beach in cove on N side of largest island in Park. N aspect. Few drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: Easy upland access to tent sites in gently sloping forest. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: See Cormorant Channel Marine Park.

properties.title: Pearse Islands south
properties.landing_comments: Pebble, gravel beach at high water. Low water landing unknown, but appears to be cobble, some boulders. Many drift logs. SE aspect. Similar but narrower beach 250 m to SW.
properties.camp_comments: Easy level entry to gently sloped forest with ferns beyond drift logs, salal. No tent sites seen but potential sites likely subject to brushing. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: See Cormorant Channel Marine Park.

properties.title: Bughouse Bay
properties.landing_comments: Choice of rough beaches. Eastern beach is small clam bed with occasional boulders. Easy access to forest from beach. Beach floods.
properties.camp_comments: Damp, marshy flat areas of second growth forest along stream bank. No development of Recreation site seen. No tent sites found. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Area 92.6 Ha. Year-round water at lake exit not seen. Water at seasonal stream.

properties.title: Collinson Bay
properties.landing_comments: Boulder, rocky beach in protected cove within larger bay.
properties.camp_comments: No tent sites found in second growth upland forest.
properties.other_comments: Water at small creek, possibly year-round with flow during drought of mid-July 2023. Recreation Site area 149 Ha.

properties.title: Claydon Bay
properties.landing_comments: Protected beach of cobble, rubble, scattered boulders. Few drift logs. At low water likely low gradient clam bed, 200 m long carry. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Tent sites on grass banks or in jumbled second growth forest. Many additional sites if brushed or deadfall removed. Hammock opportunities. Some areas damp where tributaries enter main stream.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round stream. Remains of large wharf. Large 142 Ha. Provincial Recreation Site. Anchorage.

properties.title: Edsall Islets
properties.landing_comments: Narrow, rough beach at NE corner (N facing) of main islet or on gently sloping rock shelves. Currents.
properties.camp_comments: 1 possible tent site on grassy area. Open ground too lumpy. Forest not checked.
properties.other_comments: Staging for Greene Point Rapids Northbound transit.

properties.title: Martin Cove
properties.landing_comments: Semi-protected cove with high banks. SW aspect. Beach of angular rocks to cobble size. Boat run at centre beach on smoother gravel. Drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: Likely not permitted but possibly feasible on steep back bank if platform levelled or built.
properties.other_comments: Trail to beach from Francis Peninsula Road. Significant area of steep wooded public land at bay head. Parking limited due to mail boxes, fire hydrant. Private residences nearby with only minor overlook.

properties.title: West Ballenas Island south
properties.landing_comments: Easy on well-protected pebble, gravel beach in cove 50 m wide between bedrock walls. S aspect. Moderate gradient. Derelict concrete boat ramp at centre beach. Drift logs. Low water landing mud, barnacles but good above 2m tides..
properties.camp_comments: At this time, only BC Marine Trails Coastal Caretakers, who are looking after the island, may camp at this site.
properties.other_comments: Attractive, view. Old overgrown trail flagged from SW beach N to lighthouse through woods to avoid trampling fragile vegetation on the dry bluffs. Possible haven for small craft but shoal. Tide pools, nature viewing, swimming. Relative to Gerald Island there is limited presence of invasive species (based on bushwhacking from Site 3 campsite along north and south shorelines). Exception the decommissioned Light area, which is over-run with Himalayan blackberry. Could this be a containment project to prevent spread to remainder of Island?

properties.title: East Point
properties.landing_comments: Small beach 75 m wide of shell, mixed rocks. NE aspect. Currents, turbulence off point..Tumbo Channel currents run always to E.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Pit toilets. picnic tables.
properties.other_comments: View, walking trails, wildlife viewing, museum. Gulf Islands National Park Reserve. Parking for about 12 vehicles but no overnight parking permitted. Otherwise well-suited as launch site - 150 m carry on graded path. See East Point

properties.title: Rebecca Spit
properties.landing_comments: Paved boat ramp in sheltered harbour or adjacent sandy beaches. W aspect. Many drift logs on E aspect shores.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. See adjacent We Wai Kai campground.
properties.other_comments: 177 ha. Pit toilets. Picnic area. Swimming. Hiking trails on both sides of 2 km spit. Potable water not available. Anchorage. Day parking only. Overnight pay parking at We Wai Kai by arrangement. See Rebecca Spit Marine Park. Beach fires are banned all year round.

properties.title: Porpoise Drive Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy on all tide sand, pebble beach. Davis Brook enters inlet over beach. N aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: V steep 90 m trail from Porpoise Drive beside residence. Swimming. Parking for approx. 6 vehicles at road end. Evidence that trail to be improved by Regional District. Municipal official Beach Access.

properties.title: Bowden Road Sidney
properties.landing_comments: Steep stairs to very protected small beach. SSE aspect. Gravel near tree line, mud lower beach, making a long muddy carry at low water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: S end Bowden Road. Small day parking lot. Town of Sidney 24 hr parking limit, but reported to be rarely enforced (complaint-driven) in residential neighborhoods. Part of Roberts Bay Bird Sanctuary.

properties.title: Walker Hook
properties.landing_comments: Road ends at beach in very protected lagoon. Low gradient mudflat, some sand. Long carry at low water. Rough boat ramp at road end.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: At end of Grantville Street off Walker's Hook Road. Attractive. Grassy sand tombolo to rocky peninsula has unknown land status, no easy public land access .

properties.title: Annex Road
properties.landing_comments: Rough protected beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Steep trail to/from beach with stairs, boardwalk 250 m to road aka Cardiac Hill. Limited parking at Belle Road or Annex Road. Entry off Highway 101 at Redrooffs Road. View. District of Sechelt beach access park at road-end right of way. Secluded. Swimming. Adjacent property undeveloped (2017).

properties.title: Parksville Community Park
properties.landing_comments: Easy access to low gradient firm sand beach. Long carry at low water. Wheels useful. Exposed to NW, N, NE.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilets.
properties.other_comments: Access via Corfield Street N, Beachside Drive. Water at tap. Playground, picnic shelters. Many other facilities. Day parking. No known overnight parking.

properties.title: Lochside Drive
properties.landing_comments: Exposed gravel beach SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Benches, picnic tables.
properties.other_comments: Various locations. Walking path runs along Lochside Drive, Town of Sidney. 4 hr parking in small lots with 24 hr max parking off Lochside Drive regulation reported to be rarely enforced (complaint-driven) in residential neighbourhoods. See <a href="http://www.sidney.ca/Things_To_Do/Parks__Walkways___Trails/Parks_at_a_Glance/Lochside_Waterfront_Park.htm" target="_blank" style="color:blue"Lochside Waterfront Park

properties.title: Fifth Street Sidney
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient gravel, mud beach. NE aspect. No stairs, flat terrain. At low water could involve a long, muddy carry..
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: N end Fifth Street. Vehicle turnaround. Very limited day parking. 24 hr parking stay limit in Town of Sidney. Part of Roberts Bay Bird Sanctuary.

properties.title: Fort Rodd Hill
properties.landing_comments: Gravel beach N of Fisgard Lighthouse. Long carry from vehicles.
properties.camp_comments: Permanent large oTENTik tents (cabins) for rent. Wood floors, bunks, each sleeps 6. Rented May 15 to September 30. Fee approx $130 per night. Walk up hill from beach to tents. http://www.pc.gc.ca/eng/lhn-nhs/bc/fortroddhill/activ/activ6.aspx. Toilets.
properties.other_comments: Take Ocean Boulevard off Highway 1A to Fort Rodd Hill with adjacent Fisgard Lighthouse National Historic Sites, managed by Parks Canada. Free parking. Fees charged. Also suited to day use. Daily access hours 10 am to 4:30 pm winter, to 5:30 pm summer. Next to the Victoria Waterway Loop at: https://vicwaterloop.ca/

properties.title: Victoria Canoe and Kayak Club
properties.landing_comments: Paved ramp
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: VCKC Clubhouse, adjacent areas are leased from the Municipality of Saanich for the use of Club members. Dock privately owned by VCKC. Adjacent paved deck, drives and launch area are included in Gorge Waterway Park and are open to public. Launch site for Victoria Waterway Loop Trail, a 8.4 NM paddling route with a 950 m portage. Loop is in 4 sections with multiple launch points. May be completed in a day. See: Loop. Gorge is tranquil, sheltered. Paddling here passes sensitive wildlife habitat and Tillicum Narrows tidal rapids at Tillicum bridge.

properties.title: Ogden Point Breakwater west
properties.landing_comments: Protected gravel, cobble, rip rap beach inside breakwater, often fouled with drift logs and/or flotsam/jetsam.  Short awkward carry from parking.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.Toilets.
properties.other_comments: Vehicle access on Montreal Street. Day parking on street. Overnight parking in lot nearby. Close to Victoria Waterway Loop but not part of.it.

properties.title: Selkirk Beach
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient beach of gravel, light mud. Easy access on gravelled trail with moderate gradient.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Cecelia Cove Park, City of Victoria at 335 Waterfront Crescent off Jutland Road. Limited parking 2hr (9 am - 5 pm) parking but less restricted at weekends, evenings.. Adjacent to Galloping Goose bike, walking tail. Part of Victoria Waterways Loop - a regional paddling route covering a 8.4 NM with one 950 m portage. Loop has four sections with launch points allowing paddles in any section. See: Loop.

properties.title: Craigflower Kosapsom Park
properties.landing_comments: Easy access to gravel beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Playground, picnic table, toilets.
properties.other_comments: District of Saanich municipal park on Gorge waterway. Site of former Kosapsom village. Historic Craigflower Schoolhouse. Parking for vehicles off Gorge Road W. Part of Victoria Waterways Loop - a regional paddling route covering a 8.4 NM with one 950 m portage. Loop has four sections with launch points allowing paddles in any section. See: Victoria Waterway Loop.

properties.title: Stewart Avenue
properties.landing_comments: Gravel beach in protected cove with steep stairs to street. Boat ramp built into stairs. Limited parking.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: At foot of Stewart Avenue. View Royal municipal beach access. Part of Victoria Waterways Loop - a regional paddling route covering 8.4 NM with one 950 m portage. Loop has four sections with launch points allowing paddles in any section. See: Victoria Waterway Loop.

properties.title: Ogden Point Breakwater east
properties.landing_comments: Gravel beach with drift logs. Exposed to swell. SSE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Toilets.
properties.other_comments: Vehicle access from Dallas Road or Montreal Street. Parking close by in lot. No street parking. Close to Victoria Waterways Loop https://www.vicwaterloop.ca/.

properties.title: El Verano Boat Launch
properties.land_tenure: Regional, Road end right of way
properties.landing_comments: Sand beach. Strong currents immediately in front of launch in tidal narrows. Currents run at 50% rate of Dodd Narrows. Rock reefs divide channel.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: AKA False Narrows ramp. Part way along El Verano Drive off South Road. Many dinghies on shore used for access to Mudge Island by residents. Parking space for many vehicles, but often busy.

properties.title: Stalker Road
properties.landing_comments: Sand, pebble beach reported as approx 1000 m long. Sandsone shelf reefs at low water.SE aspect. Moderately protected. Strong tidal currents in nearby Gabriola Passage. Vessel traffic. 10 -15 m path  to shore.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Picnic area, pit toilets.
properties.other_comments: Follow South Road, turn S on Stalker Road, follow to end. Drumbeg Provincial Park Large parking lot. Overnight parking unknown. 2 km of hiking trails. Wildlife viewing. Used by SCUBA divers. See: Drumbeg Provincial Park

properties.title: Drumbeg
properties.landing_comments: Protected sand, pebble beach reported as approx 1000 m long. Scattered boulders at low water. Drift logs. Strong tidal currents in nearby Gabriola Passage. Vessel traffic.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Picnic tables, pit toilets. No fires.
properties.other_comments: Follow South Road, turn S on Stalker Road, follow to junction in park then turn left. Drumbeg Provincial Park Parking lot. Overnight parking is available. 2 km of hiking trails. Wildlife viewing. Used also by SCUBA divers. See: Drumbeg Provincial Park

properties.title: Saxe Point
properties.landing_comments: Pocket gravel beach. May flood at high water. W aspect. Trail, steps in rock seawall lead to beach. Moderately difficult for carrying boats, gear.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Saxe Point Park at end of Fraser Street, with footpaths off of Munro, Bewdley Streets. Township of Esquimalt park. Part of Victoria Waterways Loop - regional paddling route covering 8.4 NM with one 950 m portage. Loop has four sections with launch points allowing paddles in any section. See: Victoria Waterway Loop.

properties.title: Neck Point Park
properties.landing_comments: Relatively protected pebble beach, drift logs. SE aspect. Approx. 50 m from parking. Beach gradient at top under 5%. Outer beaches also gravel various aspects. Further from road.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Toilet in parking lot.
properties.other_comments: 1055 Morningside Drive off Hammond Bay Road. Hiking trails. Wildlife viewing. Picnic tables. Popular with SCUBA divers, local walkers. Unrestricted day parking for many vehicles with overflow parking at nearby school. No overnight parking. Gated access closed 9pm November 1 to March 31, 11pm April 1 to October 31. No access to parking when gate closed. Adjacent to Morningside Beach Access park, City of Nanaimo park.

properties.title: Cypress Street
properties.landing_comments: Protected small gravel beach approx 20 m wide or concrete ramp approx 10 m to S of road end. Easy at mid tide or higher.  Mud at low water. Busy harbour channel.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Cypress Street off Stewart Avenue. Limited parking on Cypress Street. Stewart Avenue parking limited to 4 hours. Other private parking nearby.

properties.title: Brickyard Point Nanoose Bay
properties.landing_comments: Protected pebble beach. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Trails 150 m or longer lead out to either Amberwood Lane or Andover Road. Brickyard Community Park of Regional District of Nanaimo. 2 ha.

properties.title: Little Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy on coarse sand, pebble beach  W aspect. Well protected.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Parking lot at end of Beach Street (2 hour limitations) with short 50 m carry from vehicle. Longer street parking available on nearby Peninsula Road. Portable toilet, picnic table.

properties.title: Pipers Lagoon Park
properties.landing_comments: Exposed gravel beach. Moderately steep 15% slope. Drift logs. E aspect also open to NW. Approx. 30 m level carry to beach. Alternate is low gradient beach that dries far in muddy protected lagoon, NW aspect. Feasible only at high water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: 3600 Place Road. From Hammond Bay Road go NE on Lagoon Road then SE on Place Road to end. Parking. Picnic tables, toilets, hiking trails, wildlife viewing. City of Nanaimo park. 8 ha area. Gate closes 9pm November 1 to March 31, 11pm April 1 to October 31. No parking access when gate closed. No overnight parking. Unrestricted day parking.

properties.title: Gorge Portage
properties.landing_comments: Short gravel path from street. Mud at low tides
properties.camp_comments: No camping
properties.other_comments: End of portage trail from Esquimalt Harbour. Launch site for Victoria Waterway Loop Trail - a 8.4 NM paddling route through the Capital Region with one 950 m portage. Loop is in 4 sections with multiple launch points. May be completed in a day. See: Victoria Waterways Loop.

properties.title: Wheatcroft Park
properties.landing_comments: Pebble, cobble beach at entrance to Pipers Lagoon. NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: 3710 Lagoon Rd, off Hammond Bay Road. Parking for 3 vehicles.

properties.title: King Edward Bay
properties.landing_comments: Wide beach in significant bay, moderate 12% slope.  Sand, gravel to 50 mm, drift logs. SW aspect. Well sheltered from other directions.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Minimal overlook from adjacent properties. Bowen Island municipal park. Stream at S side of beach. Very limited parking on road above.

properties.title: Keats Landing
properties.landing_comments: Beach of pebble, sand S of public dock, floats. Adjacent concrete boat ramp. Prone to flotsam, drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Some services including foot passenger ferry or water taxi to Gibsons. Dock owned, managed by Sunshine Coast Regional District. Displayed as Keats Landing name unofficial. Second dock owned by Keats Camp (Baptist Church). Small marina. Launch site for Keats residents. Road, trail connects to Plumper Cove.

properties.title: Tunstall Bay
properties.landing_comments: Sand, pebble beach in wide bay. Moderate gradient. W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Pit toilet.
properties.other_comments: Road ends at beach. Parking for about 10 vehicles. No posted restrictions.. Bowen Island municipal park. Popular small boating launch off beach..

properties.title: Brighton Beach
properties.land_tenure: Provincial Recreation Reserve, Provincial Recreation Site
properties.landing_comments: Small beach at high water of rounded 50 mm gravel. Moderate 15% grade. S aspect, protected from N, E, partly from W.  Some drift log obstacles likely. Landing at low-mid water more difficult due to boulders, bedrock. Tide heights of above 3 m or below 1 m give reasonable landings. Beware of ferry wash.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped.
properties.other_comments: View. Attractive. large - 60 Ha Prov. Recreation Reserve - joins to Hope Point with numerous private (prime) pockets excluded. 2 Ha. adjacent Prov Recreation Site.

properties.title: Little Flower Islet
properties.landing_comments: Protected tiny coves of gravel, bedrock, mussels, cobble on either side of isthmus between Hutt Island and islet. Low water landing easier. Challenging at high water on steep sloping bedrock. Exposed to wind, swell.
properties.camp_comments: Fragile grassy, mossy upland areas in tiny arbutus grove. No fires. Picnic table (2017)
properties.other_comments: View. Attractive. Google names islet Hart Island (Formerly Passarini).

properties.title: Bowen Bay
properties.landing_comments: Pebble beach to 75 mm at low tide, smaller grain size at higher water, moderate gradient. SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Pit toilet.
properties.other_comments: Road end at beach. 1 or 2 parking possibilities directly upland, some down paved road to S. Bowen Island municipal park. Community stored boats and Tunstall Bay Canoe Assoc. boathouse.

properties.title: Cohoe Bay
properties.landing_comments: Large v low gradient sand estuary area all floods, but long carry at LW. Scattered boulders, cobble.
properties.camp_comments: Good upland access. Potential upland sites if brushed or potential hammock use. No dry beach sites seen.
properties.other_comments: Year-round stream flows though estuary but unknown how far upstream to go to collect non-brackish water.

properties.title: Olivia Islet
properties.landing_comments: Land at boulder gully on steep NE shore of islet.
properties.camp_comments: Up gully to right are small flat spots in trees, tall salal. Brushing likely needed. Short carry.
properties.other_comments: Better suited to lined out boat rather than canoe or kayak due to awkward land stowage for portable boats.

properties.title: Brigade Bay Ho mahmk
properties.landing_comments: Gentle 5% slope, varied rounded rocks 25 mm to 150 mm, more sand and less sloped to N.
properties.camp_comments: No camping
properties.other_comments: Large sign notes historic use as a First Nations gathering and camping area, privately marked upland in line with southern upland.

properties.title: Kelvin Grove Beach
properties.landing_comments: Best landing on small sand patch at low water is at S end beach in small bay of mud, small broken rocks, gravel, bedrock outcrops with some boulders. Moderate gradient. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilet. Picnic table, barbecue stand, garbage bin. No fires. Closes at 10 pm daily.
properties.other_comments: From Hwy 99 exit at Kelvin Grove Way, follow Tidewater Way to end. Small park of Village of Lions Bay in area of residences. Popular dive site. Hourly or daily pay parking in large paved lot above train tracks. No overnight parking. 100 m trail to beach from street with wood stairway.

properties.title: Anvils Foot
properties.landing_comments: Difficult on gently sloping smooth bedrock shelf at high water in tiny cove, some exposure to winds, swells.  Shelf may carry stream drainage in wet weather. Unknown landing at low water. NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Potential for several tents in upland light forest, salal on gentle slopes. Steeper slopes immediately behind lower area.
properties.other_comments: Unlikely haven on inhospitable shore. Water at seasonal creeks. Benches also exist to N & S where determined paddlers could land on bedrock ledges to possibly camp on a bluff.

properties.title: Brunswick Beach
properties.landing_comments: Narrow beach of coarse gravel above, small cobble, larger rocks, occasional boulders at low water. Drift logs. Beach floods at Springs. Exposed SW aspect. Short level access to road across drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. No fires. No facilities. Closes at 10 pm daily.
properties.other_comments: Access off Hwy 99 at Brunswick (Beach) Road. Aka Alberta Bay. Village of Lions Bay park. Minimal parking except for residents. Please respect parking regulations. Possible overnight parking adjacent to Hwy 99 at foot of Crystal Falls Road 540 m from beach.

properties.title: Montagu Channel east
properties.landing_comments: Steep beach 15-20 % slope, sharp 75 mm gravel at all water levels in small cove. NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: 2 undeveloped upland sites on grass among small trees, one additional site possibly on bluff.
properties.other_comments: Awkward 4 m climb to upland bluff. Trains run infrequently on track immediately above. No highway access.

properties.title: Ramillies Channel north
properties.landing_comments: Easy on narrow long beach of 75 mm sharp gravel, 10 % slope. E aspect. Shelter from Anvil Island opposite.
properties.camp_comments: Picnic sites or possibly 3 or 4 small tent sites at top of beach between drift logs, steep upland.
properties.other_comments: View. N part of Ramillies Channel marine recreation site

properties.title: Buccaneer Beach
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient sand beach. Rocks, barnacles at low water. Exposed NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Buccaneer Beach Road off Maple Guard Drive, Jamieson Road. Parking for 2 or 3 cars. Please avoid blocking driveways. Public beach access managed by Regional District of Nanaimo.

properties.title: Madrona Drive
properties.landing_comments: Pebble, rock beach, 100 m long. NE aspect with some protection from most winds. Enclosing rock shelf barrier at low water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: View. 20 m path to beach opposite house #1407. Small parking area. Regional District of Nanaimo beach access. Madrona Point Community Park is a good alternative, lying at the end of Madrona Drive 360 m to NW.

properties.title: Deep Bay Marina
properties.landing_comments: Boat ramp (fee).  Launch without fee to right of sign on small pebble/mud beach.
properties.camp_comments: Private campground next to ramp.
properties.other_comments: Launch fee at boat ramp $6 single $8 tandem (2013).

properties.title: Blueback Community Park
properties.landing_comments: Cobble beach in protected cove. N aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Toilets, changing room.
properties.other_comments: Blueback Community Park managed by Regional District of Nanaimo. Turn off Dolphin Drive onto Schooner Road then onto Blueback Drive. Park is at junction with Tyee Crescent - 3121 Tyee Crescent, Nanoose Bay, BC V9P 9H9. Two rough trails lead 50 m to Tyee Beach. E trail has wooden stairs, W trail slopes gently. Large rocks removed to make path from trail end to water. Area 0.2 ha. Roadside parking for 6 cars. Popular recreational dive site. Residential neighbourhood. Restricted overnight parking.

properties.title: Sebastion Road
properties.landing_comments: Choice of sandstone rock shelf or sand, pebble beach.  40 m - 100 m carry to water, depending on tide. High water preferred. Sandstone shelf can cause some surf. N or E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: At N end of Sebastion Road off Lantzville Road. Busy site. Parking may fill early. Space for several vehicles. No overnight parking permitted. District of Lantzville beach access.

properties.title: Higginson Road
properties.landing_comments: Pebble beach with NW aspect in long bay. Protected from S but open to NW. Approx 90 m on trail from road to beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Small blue beach sign. Turn off Northwest Bay Road onto Higginson Road. Parking at roadside. Regional District of Nanaimo beach access.

properties.title: Fillinger Crescent
properties.landing_comments: Beach of pebble, cobble with rock shelf at low water. N aspect. Wooden stairs.40 m walk. Boat cart useful.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Limited parking. Public access opposite 5040 Fillinger Crescent. City of Nanaimo beach access park - Fillinger Waterfront Park #1.

properties.title: Elliots Beach
properties.landing_comments:
Easy on mostly rocky beach of 50 mm to100 mm rounded rocks, cobbles, scattered boulders. Upper beach sandy in parts. S aspect. Sheltered by Coffin Pt to E.
Approx 70 m path from parking lot to beach with small concrete ramp. Little elevation change.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Picnic area, 2 tables. Toilet.
properties.other_comments: AKA Coffin Point Park. Approach from Trans Canada Highway. Head E onto Brenton-Page Rd, right onto Shell Beach Rd, right onto Elliot Way. 30 m from gate along wide pathway. Overnight parking. Swimming. Cowichan Valley Regional District community park. See: Elliots Beach Park

properties.title: Jacks Road
properties.landing_comments: Cobble beach. N aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Jacks Road off Dickinson Road ends at beach. Short walk across rough rip rap boulders to beach. Similar to to Lavender Road. Parking for 2 to 4 vehicles. No overnight parking. District of Lantzville.

properties.title: Nile Road
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient cobble, sand, pebble beach. Avoid low tide. Loose sand.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Nile Road off Highway 19A. Parking at turn around or along Nile Road for about 15 vehicles. Public beach access managed by Regional District of Nanaimo. Additional launch site at Nile Creek, accessed from Crane Road 300 m SE of Nile Road.

properties.title: Growler Cove Head
properties.landing_comments: 3 low gradient unattractive beaches at head of protected cove.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Not much to recommend this site for day use. Cove is Provincial Boat Haven but use as anchorage is being discouraged by BC Parks. See Qwiquallaaq/Boat Bay Conservancy.

properties.title: Goose Spit
properties.landing_comments: Most paddlers launch on more sheltered inside water. Mostly sand shorelines, drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Parking nearby at 3 lots with additional roadside parking. Closes at 11 p.m. Views, Picnic tables, benches, fire rings. Portable toilets. Park steward April to October 250-334-6363. Hiking trails. Wildlife. Leased from Province, Goose Spit Park operated by Comox Valley Regional District. Aka Pelxqikw. Access via Hawkins Road from Hawkins and Torrence Roads.

properties.title: Eagle Eye Trailhead west
properties.landing_comments: Moderate gradient beach of gravel, pebble. Some cobble, scattered boulders at low water. Bedrock outcrops. W aspect, open to NW wind.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted but no signage.
properties.other_comments: Steep trail to lookout, Warden Camp, Boat Bay. See Qwiquallaaq/Boat Bay Conservancy. Aka Pig Ranch South.

properties.title: Maggy Point
properties.landing_comments: Easy in bay N of Rough Islets. SW aspect. Pebble, gravel beach, with cobbles, boulders at sides. Moderate gradient. Protected from N, E, SE. Currents to 3 kt in Swanson Passage.
properties.camp_comments: Sites in forest. Pole shed kitchen shelter in need of minor roof repair 2023. Camp furniture. 5 tent platforms, new 2025. Food bin. Composting toilet.
properties.other_comments: Former commercial site. Short trail to nearby Rough Islets site. Wildlife viewing. See Broughton Archipelago Provincial Park.

properties.title: Surfers Beach
properties.landing_comments: Some surf but easy landing on sand beach except in SW wind.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not permitted in Ecological Reserve. Beach is within Checleset Bay Ecological Reserve. However paddlers have camped on upland which is within Mquqwin Brooks Peninsula Provincial Park. See: Mquqwin Brooks Peninsula Provincial Park.
properties.other_comments: Closest potential camping to S of Brooks Peninsula.

properties.title: Quatsino
properties.landing_comments: Public dock, can be busy.  Tie up at dock if space, or land on beach beside dock.
properties.camp_comments: May be community camping here in future.
properties.other_comments: Historic early settlement. Attractions include: oldest church in North Island, museum. cemetery. Hike through old growth forest to Colony Lake.

properties.title: Gabriola Sands
properties.landing_comments: Easy low gradient sand beaches at sandy neck facing W, Taylor Bay - requires walk across field or E, Pilot Bay - short level path from parking. More drift logs in Pilot Bay. Long carry at low water on either side.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Good day use site. Picnic tables, pit toilets.
properties.other_comments: Road access from Berry Point Road, Ricardo Road. Parking. See: Gabriola Sands Provincial Park

properties.title: Kirshaw Islets
properties.landing_comments: Medium to low tides easy beach landing. Beach floods at high tides so boats must be hauled onto rocks.
properties.camp_comments: Sensitive site. Camping not recommended other than for emergency.
properties.other_comments: Best suited as lunch stop between Saranac Is and Heelboom Bay because of soft grassy terrain sensitive to high impact.

properties.title: Matlset Narrows south
properties.landing_comments: Easy but rocky at low tide. Tombolo to islet. Large pebble, rock beach might refer to site on north shore of narrows.
properties.camp_comments: Mostly covered at high water. Marginal camping on higher grass areas. Not recommended.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Ebbing tides lead to exposed larger rocks before opening up to sand/pebble shoreline. Well protected from winds

properties.title: Lock Bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, gravel beach at low water 1 km long. Moderate on mainly boulders, drift logs at high water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. 2 pit toilets near shore. No fires. Picnic area, bench.
properties.other_comments: View. Long 1 km trail to parking lot, other trails, petroglyph, midden, wildlife, pond. See: Sandwell Provincial Park

properties.title: Wellbore Channel
properties.landing_comments: Rubble, sand.
properties.camp_comments: Camping might be possible on 2 rough, damp sites.
properties.other_comments: Better camping options nearby. Staging area for traveling N through rapids.

properties.title: Cordero Channel Islet inside
properties.landing_comments: Moderate on rough beach of cobble, boulders at low water. S aspect. Currents.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Some camping potential. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Better landing than on islet. Avoids some sensitive ecological values of islet habitats.

properties.title: Gonzales Bay
properties.landing_comments: Semi-protected sand beach in bay. May flood at winter Springs. Access via long stair or ramp. Describes by City as official canoe/kayak launch.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Toilets.
properties.other_comments: City of Victoria 8.1 ha park . Street parking with no posted restrictions. This park is one of the few parks, because of the restrooms, that the city is allowing homeless tents to be set up. As of March 2025, 5 tents were set up in the lower gras terraces and mostly out of site of the people using the park.

properties.title: Brem Bay
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient beach of mud, 50 - 70 mm rocks leading to grassy estuary wetland. Might be island.
properties.camp_comments: Clearing under trees for several tents at wetland margin. More sites feasible with brushing. Coordinates given as N50D 26.026M,W124D 40.408M
properties.other_comments: Water at river. Salmon Bay Indian Reserve lies immediately W. N Frazer suggests camping 150 m S near the breakwater by the log dump. It at W end of beach to E of breakwater. Comment that carry over mud is too far at this side and easier by jetty, on NE corner but in IR.

properties.title: Sunray Cape Cockburn
properties.landing_comments: Wide gravel beach SE aspect. Smaller gravel beach SW aspect. Rocky outcrop forms peninsula between beaches giving some protection.
properties.camp_comments: Many tent sites in upland forest clearings, lawn area. Pit toilet. Picnic table. Orchard. No fires permitted. Camping currently permitted by owner.
properties.other_comments: Attractive, View. Cottage is historic Roberts Homestead 'Sunray', leased by owner, BC Hydro, to non-resident renter/caretaker. Site located near to BC Hydro power cable terminus. Some of this entry refers to the other nearby Cape Cockburn sites also. Respectful visitors welcomed. Visitor log book at site.

properties.title: Deep Bay Jedediah Island
properties.landing_comments: Steep shoreline at cove head. Small rough beach. Sheltered. Often used by boaters with tenders. Little boat stowage room ashore.
properties.camp_comments: Dispersed camping permitted. Nearest to bay, sloped sites under trees adjacent to pit toilet 50 m above landing. Camping fees apply 15 May to 15 September. May pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites. Fee $5.00 per person per night (2024) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System. Better camping located at Log Boom Bay approx 400 m along trail but that location unsanctioned by BC Parks.
properties.other_comments: Popular anchorage with stern tie rings. Extensive hiking trails. See Jedediah Island Provincial Marine Park

properties.title: Lady Ellen Point
properties.landing_comments: Gravel, sand, pebble beach, moderately steep. A few drift logs. Exposed NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Sites in level forest. Old tarp camp seen 2023 to W of point, possibly same long term squat seen in 2002, presumably using trail/road access.
properties.other_comments: Mapped trail access on Lady Ellen Point Trail, branching from Ledge Point Main, likely de-activated industrial roads. From shore estimated 10 min walk to road.

properties.title: Blubber Creek
properties.landing_comments: Broad low gradient beach of soft sand. Floods on moderate to large tides. Easy launch from road. Security fence near ferry makes launching awkward on NW side of bay.
properties.camp_comments: No formal camping but beach possibly sites dry at Neaps or use marginal upland sites near road. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Seasonal or year-round stream enters beach. Some water flowed in Aug 2022. Road runs close to shore. Blubber Bay Ferry Terminal 1.7 km by road. Service to Powell River 35 min. Launching likely not permitted within BC Ferries fenced private area so laternativ elaunch here except for distance on road. Tourism map shows public beach access.

properties.title: Harmony Islands north N
properties.landing_comments: N or S on tombolo between N, NE islets. Land on rock shelves on N side. 20% approx grade.  S landing well-protected.  S landing 300mm rounded rock in 50mm gravel.  10-15% grade.  Boat run on W side of S landing
properties.camp_comments: 2 rough sites at top of beach on W side. Some additional sites possible in dense forest with major brushing. Warning: BC Parks say there is no usable camping site here.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Much work required for upland sites. Anchorage to S known as Kipling Cove. See Harmony Islands Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Clover Point
properties.landing_comments: Exposed shoreline with steep gravel, pebble beaches. SE or SW aspects. Usable in calm conditions. Small boat ramp.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: One of a number of Mile/km 0 points for the Trans Canada Trail terminus. Day parking on point. Street parking with no posted restrictions.

properties.title: Lions Bay
properties.landing_comments: Protected small sand beach at most tides. Floods at Springs. Drift logs. Retaining wall has concrete steps or sloped grass to upland. Seasonal swimming float with rope or boom. Adjacent to marina. Boat traffic.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Flush toilets. Change room. Picnic tables, benches, pavilion, playground. No fires. Closes 10 pm.daily.
properties.other_comments: Road access via Lions Bay Avenue exit from Highway 99. Water at tap. Please respect area parking restrictions. Hourly or day pay parking in large paved lot approx 100 m uphill below highway but no overnight parking. Village of Lions Bay park.

properties.title: Sir Thomas Lipton
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient beach of sand, silt, pebble, small rocks at head of sheltered West Bay. S aspect. Land near creek mouth, large sign visible from water.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped sites along shore or in open forest. Some close to large painted sign facing seaward, others further E. Pit toilet adjacent to graded gravel access road leading to New Brighton. Rough connecting trails involve minor creek crossing. No fires permitted, but one fire pit remains. Deadfall reported on some potential tenting areas. Avoid camping under deciduous trees especially broadleaf maples.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Year-round water at McDonald (or MacDonald) Creek or tributary 'Butcher Brook'. Small waterfall. Historic shipwreck. Sunshine Coast Regional District Park. Derelict dock washed up on beach. Road access no longer requires crossing gated private land (2022). Observe Rockfish Conservation Area in West Bay - no angling.

properties.title: Batchelor Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy on gravel upper beach with drift logs. Canoe run through mixed rocks, boulders on lower beach. Exposed to SW. Concrete steps, short steep ramp with slide bars, handrails. Short carry.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Overlooked by houses.
properties.other_comments: Located at end of Dufferin Ave off Marine Drive. No other facilities. Limited 3 hr street parking for 15 vehicles. Some other less restricted street parking possible in neighborhood streets but at a significant distance. Anchorage. District of West Vancouver beach access park.

properties.title: McNair Creek Kik'elxn
properties.landing_comments: Beach of sand, gravel, low 2 -3% gradient. E aspect. Log booms may be moored off beach. Gravel boat launch.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. No fires. Garbage bin. Picnic table.
properties.other_comments: 390 Dunham Road off Port Mellon Highway, Narrow unpaved road leads to small parking area, beach. Additional parking along road. Take care to not block driveways. Launch small boats off beach. Squamish (Coast Salish) name Kwíl’aḵm. (ḴIḴ'ELXN) IR land to N between site, mill. McNair Creek Regional Park, Sunshine Coast Regional District. Trans Canada Trail sign on post.

properties.title: Headlands Road
properties.landing_comments: Firm, sheltered sand beach. Good in all weather, all tide levels. Inside protected harbour.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: From centre of Gibsons follow Gower Point Road S around harbour, turn left (N) at Headlands Road to beach. Parking on nearby streets with no known restrictions.

properties.title: Twin Lagoon Islet
properties.landing_comments: Tiny shell tombolo in protected cove at lagoon entrance. Tombolo regularly floods.
properties.camp_comments: Steep upland. Dense salal. No tent sites seen 2023.
properties.other_comments: Attractive, view.

properties.title: Logan Creek
properties.landing_comments: At water levels of 1.7 m or higher moderate but safe landing on rocky beach protected by reef. More difficult at lower water levels.
properties.camp_comments: Established but unattractive campsite. Better suited for day use. Fees charged. Better alternative is Cullite Creek 1.3 NM to SW
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. Used by hikers on West Coast Trail. Landing or camping on the West Coast Trail is not permitted and could result in fines, except in emergency situations.

properties.title: Poett Nook Campground
properties.landing_comments: See adjacent launch site information
properties.camp_comments: Developed drive-in commercial campground. 130 sites. Showers, toilets. Camping $53.55 includes power (2021) for 4 people http://www.poettnook.com/welcome.html

properties.title: Rondeault Point
properties.landing_comments: Sand beach at low tide, pea gravel with sand in mid band, pea gravel and pebble at high water. Protected NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Many tent sites on sand beach. Protected from S and partially from W. Reported June 2024 that a No Trespassing sign has been posted in upland. Park boundary is winter high water mark - above that is private land.
properties.other_comments: Views. See: Maquinna Marine Provincial Park.

properties.title: Providence Cove
properties.landing_comments: Steep beach of shingle, cobble at head of protected cove. Swell does not penetrate deeply.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. No overnight sites currently (2019). Upper beach might flood at Springs. Steep cliffs at side banks. Upland at back of cove less steep.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek, reported dry in Aug 2021. Path connects to the Juan de Fuca hiking trail. Some hikers visit cove. Site of former Pacheedaht First Nation village. See: Juan de Fuca Provincial Park. AKA Yao Creek or Youh Creek.

properties.title: Sandcut Beach
properties.landing_comments: Sand, pebble, rock, steeply sloped beach. Offshore gravel bar reduces surf. Look for the approach to beach that is all sand to avoid boulders. Trailhead to road 400 m SE of landing.
properties.camp_comments: Toilet near road, parking along access trail 400 m to SE. Camping not sanctioned, but beach camping on moderately steep cobble has occurred here.
properties.other_comments: Trailhead 3.6 km E of Campground. Trail gives access to highway. No highway noise. Nearby is similar site with copious waterfall into sea, reducing surf. See: Jordan River Regional Park.

properties.title: Camper Bay
properties.landing_comments: Moderately steep pebble beach in cove. SW aspect. Swell hits main beach to give dumping wave in heavy swell conditions. NW beach has less or no swell due to protecting reef at cove entrance, depending on water level. Turn left or NW on entering cove if reef is blocking most swell.
properties.camp_comments: Camp at top of NW beach but not at all tide levels. Cliff behind give no easy upland access. Park fees apply. Might be feasible to carry gear to West Coast hiking trail campsite across lagoon at back of main beach to avoid being flooded at Springs.
properties.other_comments: Seasonal cabin normally staffed by local Pacheedaht trail guardians. AKA Camper Creek. Landing or camping on the West Coast Trail is not permitted and could result in fines, except in emergency situations.

properties.title: Cullite Creek
properties.landing_comments: In low swell, easy on sloped sand, pebble beach, with S aspect, mostly protected from W, NW.  Some surf likely in high swell conditions. To avoid scattered rock outcrops or boulders, aim for E side about 10 -15 m from base of steep cliff. See image for route.
properties.camp_comments: Tent sites under trees or on gravel creek bank. Food storage bin. Pit toilet. Fees charged.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. Used by hikers on West Coast Trail.

properties.title: Billygoat Creek
properties.landing_comments: Steep shingle beach; right channel (S) is a funnel too narrow for access in any swell; far left (N) best landing in NW swell.
properties.camp_comments: Possible camping.
properties.other_comments: Pacific Rim National Park Reserve. Landing or camping on the West Coast Trail is not permitted and could result in fines, except in emergency situations.

properties.title: Tsuquanah Point northwest
properties.landing_comments: Somewhat protected, fairly steep pocket beach. Surf may dump. Watch for rocks at NW end of beach. Beware of severe turbulence, standing waves, rips, breakers off Nitinat Bar especially when Nitinat Lake (tidal) drains seaward on ebb.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not currently sanctioned by Parks Canada but might occur. Space for 5 or more tents on beach.
properties.other_comments: Water at small stream. Secluded. In Pacific Rim National Park Reserve. Landing or camping on the West Coast Trail is not permitted and could result in fines, except in emergency situations.

properties.title: Meade Islets
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand on W side of islet at high water only. Cobble, weed, long carry at mid, low water. Easier approach from E, on steep cobble beach.
properties.camp_comments: 3 or tide-dependent variable number of sites on sand tombolo between drift logs. Upland site reported at centre of islet but not found (2017). Dense upland vegetation.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. No fires above high water.

properties.title: Cape Beale east
properties.landing_comments: Small pocket sand, gravel beach.  Easy landing with little or no surf in NW conditions. In SW conditions, expect less surf than Keeha Bay. .
properties.camp_comments: Camp on beach. May be subject to park use restrictions.
properties.other_comments: Safer landing alternative to Keeha Bay. Quiet, secluded site. No hiking trail access. Small stream. Pacific Rim National Park Reserve.

properties.title: Robinson Island Barkley Sound
properties.landing_comments: Easy approach on low gradient sand beach at all water levels. N aspect. Protected by rock reefs to N, E from swell, wind.
properties.camp_comments: 3 upland sites on strip above beach. 2 further upland sites feasible with minor brushing, levelling. Island at back of bay looks flat, may have potential for group camping.
properties.other_comments: Water possible at seasonal creek 0.3 NM to N behind point. Site may be accessed at high water in any weather via narrow channel to Julia Passage.

properties.title: Macktush Bill Motyka Recreation Site
properties.landing_comments: Easy on concrete boat ramp, gravel boat ramp and various beaches. 2 lagoons.
properties.camp_comments: Developed site for vehicle based camping. Pit toilets, playground, hot showers, store. Fees charged. Reservations.
properties.other_comments: Large campsite, launch used by sports fishers. Site is 30 km drive from Port Alberni along Canal Main. which also goes by Arden Creek. Near confluence of Macktush Creek and Alberni Inlet. Water at taps. Campsite located on Mosaic Forest Management land, managed by Silvifor Resource Consultants Ltd.

properties.title: Arden Creek
properties.landing_comments: Primitive boat launch.
properties.camp_comments: 2 pleasant walk-in pads overlooking water up steep paths and 4 vehicle pads in trees or along shoreline. Picnic tables, toilets.
properties.other_comments: Also launch site. Water at creek. Site 17.5 km along Canal Main. No fees charged (2014). Operated by Hupacasath First Nation.

properties.title: Homfray Creek
properties.landing_comments: Mixed low gradient beach of gravel with some boulders at higher water levels, rougher at lower levels with an oyster band. W aspect. Protected from S but otherwise exposed.
properties.camp_comments: Upland forest sites would need brushing, Alternative camp on old roadbed about 250 m N of main site with access from main creek, past large boulders. Area S of creek has grassy sections. Trail leads into upland. Report of difficult access to tenting area (July 2023) with no beach camping evident seems to refer to site to N of creek. 'Little to no boat storage at high water without difficult lift over large boulders. Our team used the floating dock for kayak storage and camped on old road bed.' Better camping area is S of creek.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round creek. View. Active log dump at head of bay 350 m to N of site. Logged behind.

properties.title: Lloyd Point
properties.land_tenure: Crown tenure - Section 17 designated use area, Provincial Forest
properties.landing_comments: Mixed low gradient beach of cobble with some boulders. SW aspect. Protected from N.
properties.camp_comments: Upland sites require brushing in level open forest. Possible sites among rocks in grassy open area at top of beach. 180 m to S at small creek additional upland forest sites reported suited to large group.
properties.other_comments: View. Water at Lloyd Creek to N with uncertain access along shore. Logged behind. Seasonal creek 180 m to SE.

properties.title: Teakerne Head
properties.landing_comments: Easy on long beach of large pebble. W aspect. Moderately protected from most winds.
properties.camp_comments: 1 secluded site behind old machinery float immediately usable. 2 or 3 other level forested sires at shore margin usable with light brushing.
properties.other_comments: Quiet. Log handling site nearby to N appears inactive. Old donkey engine float (2005), fruit trees. Swimming. Popular anchorage.

properties.title: Wall Beach
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient pebble beach.  Easier at medium to high water to avoid long carry.  Protected in SE, S, SW winds.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Limited parking along Wall Beach Road off Northwest Bay Road. Best for day trip access. Regional District of Nanaimo beach access. End of Seahaven Road gives scuba divers access to same beach farther to NE. Acacia Road also ends at a public right of way to Wall Beach.

properties.title: Schooner Cove Marina
properties.landing_comments: Double-wide concrete boat ramp, float. Very small adjacent beach of mud. oysters,mixed rocks..
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Access to through marina office to toilets, changing room, showers during business hours only.
properties.other_comments: Water at outside tap. Launch fee ($5 per canoe/kayak 2024) If launch fee paid, no fee for underground overnight parking. Fairwinds Marina 250-468-5364. Facilities, restaurant.

properties.title: Isabella Point Road
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand boat ramp on low gradient sand beach, mud flats. Long carry at low water. Protected from W, N,, partly from S.  E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Roadside parking for several vehicles. No posted parking restrictions. Aka Hamilton Beach.

properties.title: Mount Pardoe
properties.landing_comments: Small mixed rough beach of gravel to boulders. SW aspect. Protected by point to N. Exposed to S winds.
properties.camp_comments: No usable sites found. Beach camping on gravel feasible only at neaps. Upland camping feasible with heavy brushing.
properties.other_comments: Logged behind. Active logging 2014, inactive approx 2021. Small seasonal creek.

properties.title: Jamieson Island central
properties.landing_comments: Clam bed beach of varying gradients in bay, well-protected from W.   Gravel upper beach. A few small boulders. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Grassy gravel bench at beach top will be dry in most tides. Usable tent site if small drift log debris, small rocks were moved. Hammock opportunities. Dense vegetation in upland.
properties.other_comments: Attractive.

properties.title: Zorro Bay Ts’itpsm
properties.landing_comments: Easy on wide gravel beach, sheltered except from N. Moderate gradient. NE aspect. Land to N of wharf, boathouse. Drift logs often on beach. Prominent sign visible from water. Alternate more exposed beach of small round stones usable during outflows with good shelter from N across neck of isthmus. Faces S. Possible to carry gear to site 110 m across neck of isthmus on good trail across gated private land for safer access.
properties.camp_comments: Upland sites in mixed woods up trail behind centre beach. 1 site at beach top on pebble. 6 tent platforms, 2 accessed on N side of bay up wooden stair. Composting toilet. Steel food bin. Beach fire pit. Fire bucket. 2 Picnic tables, Visitor log book.
properties.other_comments: Water at stream with boat access only 200 m N. View. Swimming. Overlooked by derelict cabin on private peninsula. Boathouse, derelict wharf nearby. Please respect all private property. Squamish (Coast Salish) name Ts’itpsm. Site stewards Sea Kayak Assn of BC. Site is often used by visitors in powered vessels as well as in paddlecraft. Squamish Yacht Club mooring buoy in outer bay.

properties.title: Tantalus Landing Sxwan’shnm
properties.landing_comments: Semi-cleared boat run through rough boulder, bedrock shore 40 m W of creek mouth, or at high water, moderate landing at creek mouth on boulders, bedrock ledges. S aspect. 10% slope or greater, some portions gravel, varied 100 mm cobble. Prone to drift logs.  Prominent sign visible from water. Very limited portable boat stowage unless boats carried up bank.
properties.camp_comments: Steps lead up bank across footbridge crossing creek to upland sites at 3 small level flats near shore or 3 wooden platforms built on steep slopes above. Composting toilet. Steel food bin near landing, large picnic table built on old industrial concrete footing to be shared by all site users. Visitor log book. Please restrict any fires to near-level open rock slab near NE shore in calm conditions.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round stream, waterfall through centre of site. Attractive. View. Squamish (Coast Salish) name Sxwan’shnm. Site stewards: Sea Kayak Assn of BC.

properties.title: Booker Lagoon
properties.landing_comments: Islet 35 m long oriented SW to NE in sheltered lagoon. Approach at NW side, NE end. Rock shelf, no beach. Tidal rapid at lagoon entrance. Max current in rapid reported as 8 kn.
properties.camp_comments: Grassy saddle in mid islet with firs at either end. This location or slightly to S at end of islet used by Paddlefanatics group May 2014, who also checked other locations. Well protected. N Frazer gives coordinates as lat N50D 47.50M,W126D 44.98M (WGS84) which seems to be the same general site. Adjacent islet in similar orientation but slightly to W is apparently not the site.
properties.other_comments: Swimming from landing ledges.

properties.title: George Fraser Islands north
properties.landing_comments: Beach of pebble, boulders at low water, sand, gravel mid to high water.  Easier at higher water.  Protected from NW, but overall exposed location.
properties.camp_comments: Beach camping
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Finnerty Islands central
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected gravel, small rock beach. NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: One site on gravel berm or tombolo at head of beach, 2 or 3 others upland in juniper, arbutus grove.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Lagoons. Charted height 48 m on some CHS charts. See Sabine Channel Marine Provincial Park

properties.title: Philip Point west
properties.landing_comments: Protected creek mouth behind islet has clam bed moderate gradient beach of coarse sand, gravel with 50-70 mm cobble, occasional boulders. Beach grass on upper beach covers more cobble, rocks. Firm clam bed with some cobble st low water. Few drift logs. W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Upland tent sites on S bank in open second growth forest. Shaded in morning but open to afternoon sun. Berry bushes impede access to upland. Access would need brushing.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at creek, possibly year-round. Flowing in mid-July drought 2023. Attractive. View. Logging debris. Inactive log dump 0.6 NM to E (2023).

properties.title: Hannant Peninsula
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected smooth bedrock. Protected boulder cove to E dries, but likely suitable at high water.
properties.camp_comments: Tent site on dry beach grass at point. Other sites nearby on rock shelves. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Attractive, view, sunny. Water across bay at Little McIntosh Creek. Anchorage in cove N of Hannant Point.

properties.title: Nickless Islet
properties.landing_comments: Small shell tombolo beach links to rock islet with lone spruce. Scattered boulders. SW aspect. NE side of tombolo mostly bedrock, boulders.
properties.camp_comments: 1 site at tombolo top at Neaps in calm weather - unreliable. Steep terrain elsewhere.
properties.other_comments: Attractive, View.

properties.title: Creasy Bay
properties.landing_comments: Small cobble, boulder beach. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Potential sites on grassy fringe between beach and forest but lumpy. Hammock opportunities. Littoral unlogged zone above shore. Moderately sloped forest. Small animal trails.
properties.other_comments: Water at small stream flowing in drought of mid-July 2023. Large log handling site 250 M to N.

properties.title: Actaeon Sound
properties.landing_comments: 2 rocky landing beaches, one slightly E of creek with 2 high tide rocky points, second beach 200 m E.
properties.camp_comments: Upland camp reported in mature second growth forest but no tent sites seen 2023. NO CAMPING
properties.other_comments: Westerly beach has small seasonal stream.

properties.title: Boyle Point northwest
properties.landing_comments: Easy on semi-protected pebble beach of moderate gradient 0.2 NM W of Boyle Point. Scattered boulders. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Sunny beach sites or on grassy former homestead site. Large level upland bench slightly higher. Rest of upland steep. Mostly used by day visitors.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Seasonal stream. aka Betty's Beach, Diane's Beach. Rough steep trail leads in 1.5 km to main trail back to parking lot at end of East Road. Other extensive trails.

properties.title: Rest Islets
properties.landing_comments: Bedrock ledge at NE corner of largest islet accessed at half tide. Access at other water levels not known.
properties.camp_comments: Protected soft ledge beneath tree could serve as camp if boat can be secured, loaded.
properties.other_comments: Hoeya Head also known locally as Bowles Point.Part of unilaterally declared Indigenous Protected and Conserved Area at Gwaxdlala/Nalaxdlala (Lull Bay/Hoeya Sound) by Mamalilikulla FN. Conditions for continued recreational use unknown.The 10,416-hectare protected area includes extremely rare shallow coral as well as salmon-bearing streams that support grizzlies and black bears.

properties.title: Atchison Islet
properties.landing_comments: Land in drying channel between island, islet or on various rock ledges, depending on water level. Suitable for lining out boat. Easier access at high water, many boulders at low water. Currents. Kelp. Vessel traffic.
properties.camp_comments: Flat rock ledge facing S tip of Atchison Island or bluff sites on bedrock shelves at SW tip. Dense salal in centre.
