properties.other_comments: Attractive. View.

properties.title: Turner Cove
properties.landing_comments: W or E shore of protected cove. On W shore, moderately sloped clam bed mud beach with mixed rocks, gravel at high water. One area  next to a large rock outcrop on the beach free of low water boulders. Beach may flood at springs.
properties.camp_comments: On W shore at N50D 55.683M,W126D 43.925M beach gives access to upland that appears fairly level but dense, mossy forest with old logging surface disturbance. On E shore, grassy point could be brushed but might be too steep for easy camping. Either area requires work.
properties.other_comments: Attractive.

properties.title: Mackenzie Sound 1
properties.landing_comments: Steep rock shore with patch of grass on top lies half way into creek mouth. Bay overall shallow clam beds with low gradient.
properties.camp_comments: Upland forest camp on N shore of cove has old poles but not very level (1999). Not viewed on 2015 visit. Sunny.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek.

properties.title: Stuart Narrows north
properties.landing_comments: Clam bed beach, pebble gravel.
properties.camp_comments: Tent sites in second growth forest with little underbrush if dead branches, tree debris moved. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round stream flowing during drought of mid-July2023.

properties.title: Helen Bay
properties.landing_comments: Small pebble, gravel, small rock beach in W bay. Moderate gradient. Protected. Forest comes to waterline.
properties.camp_comments: Usable small tent sites in forest on moss, duff needing dead branches moved. Clearing in cedar trees above beach may require brushing, levelling. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal stream, dry July 2023. Anchorage. Flagging evident 2023 could relate to stream or intended logging? Junk freezer in bush. Debris. Might be old logging camp.

properties.title: Deep Harbour north
properties.landing_comments: Small moderate gradient pebble beach in bight. Scattered cobble, boulders. Forest comes down to waterline. No distinctive landmark. SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Tent sites in second growth forest on flat area 2-3 m up bank behind beach. Upland steep at sides.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Small anchorage.

properties.title: Joe Cove
properties.landing_comments: Shell tombolo which joins to steep islet. 2 small very protected beaches with N, S aspects. Moderate gradient. Occasional boulders.
properties.camp_comments: Many well-used all-weather upland tent sites on duff, bare soil. Rustic furniture.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water source reported at lake-fed stream in unnamed cove W of Joe Cove, assumed to be N 50 D 44.5818M, W126 D 41.6874 M. Commercial group use likely. Anchorage. Upland in Broughton Archipelago Conservancy. Waters, islets lie in Marine Provincial Park.

properties.title: Furry Creek Spit
properties.landing_comments: Just N of creek mouth, N and S aspect beaches of large rounded stones, boulders, some gravel. Many drift logs on N facing beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Open, park-like spit with trail, benches, viewing platform. No boat launching. No fires. No other facilities.
properties.other_comments: Trail to public day parking area. View. Viewpoint lies within private community, with public trail access. Managed by Squamish Lillooet Regional District. Popular river mouth fishing. Aka Olivers Landing.

properties.title: Watts Point
properties.landing_comments: Sloping bedrock ledges at either side of exposed point. Landing on S ledges sheltered from N, low rounded rock islet gives some protection from S.
properties.camp_comments: Small picnic sites among low rocky bluffs, salal covered bench to NE. Some evidence of previous overnight use at up to 6 tent sites.
properties.other_comments: View. Squamish language name Xwelxwalitn

properties.title: Watts Point south
properties.landing_comments: Small cove of bedrock shelves, boulders. SW aspect. Moderately protected landing.
properties.camp_comments: 3 small protected upland picnic sites nestled under low cliffs. Evidence of previous overnight use.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Trains run infrequently on railway above.

properties.title: Gambier Creek
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected beach, near creek mouth. Moderate gradient. Coarse gravel, pebble at high water. Rougher at low water with cobbles, boulders, larger rocks. NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Small cleared grass flat field near Gambier Creek. Set up, maintained as recreation day use site. Large upland fire pit. Reports of regular use as campsite but protocol for seeking permission unknown, if needed. Additional small upland grassed area just N of dock above another smoother gravel beach, believed to be public land i.e. part of upland property setback reserve.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at year-round creek immediately to S. Prominent dock, road nearby. Extensive hiking trail network. Aka Douglas Bay. Community of Douglas Bay is a 53 lot bare land strata waterfront and non-waterfront subdivision developed 2004 to 2006. Average lot 3.7 acres. First 20 m from high water mark inland is a legal setback Crown reserve. Site mapped as Community Park. Toilet needed if site is to be used for longer than day use.

properties.title: Transfer Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, gravel beach. Moderate gradient. SE aspect. Boat must be carried about 50 m.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Parking, Toilets, changing rooms. Picnic area. Spray park, playground, amphitheatre, swimming. Seasonal refreshments. Enter off Trans Canada Highway. Town of Ladysmith park.

properties.title: Grice Bay
properties.landing_comments: Concrete boat ramp in sheltered bay. N aspect. Cobble beach adjacent.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Parking. Picnic area no tables, pit toilets. View. Park use or parking pass required from Park office or Info Centre. Turn off Hwy #4 on Grice Bay Road and follow past airfield to end.

properties.title: Bain Creek Smenmántm Ḵ’í ḵp’ikw
properties.landing_comments: 2 small rocky beaches. S aspect. Moderate gradient curved cleared boat run of smaller rocks at N margin of creek mouth 50 m to E of prominent main sign facing water. Some boulders, bedrock.  Another narrower rough boat run through beach next to sign requires climbing on steps, hauling boats up bank. Frequent boulders elsewhere on main beaches. Limited area at high water. Alternate landing area 50 m to W of sign at W end of site on gravel with 100 mm rounded rocks at high water, but currently has poor upland access. Easiest boat stowage, best access on rack above E'most beach.
properties.camp_comments: Large shaded site. Several tent sites just E of main landing in upland forest SW of stream. S aspect. - several other sites higher up slope to SW. Hammock opportunities. Composting toilet up trail via steps. Steel food bin. Picnic table. Boat rack. Visitor log book. Fire bucket. Sunny bluff for picnics. No fires in upland.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. Small waterfall. View. Attractive except Port Mellon mill visible, audible. Prominent sign visible from water. Squamish (Coast Salish) name Smenmántm Ḵ’í ḵp’ikw. Charted creek named Bain Ck is elsewhere. This creek is unnamed - maybe should be Bain Creek #2. Site stewards: Sea Kayak Assn of BC.

properties.title: Moses Point Road
properties.landing_comments: 100 m level gravel path leads to several (3?) concrete steps onto beach of sloping bedrock with small sections of crushed shell. NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping
properties.other_comments: From Chalet Rd or Lands End Rd, turn W on Moses Point Rd. Day parking for 6 cars. Other parking may be possible nearby. Tide pools. View.

properties.title: Cook Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy in either of 2 coves with beaches of pebble, cobble with aspects generally N (NE, N)  Protected from SE, NW. Mostly floods at high water. Some riprap banks. SE cove gives easier upland access.
properties.camp_comments: Industrial site suited to emergency use only. Two semi-sandy tent sites at Neaps high water mark that likely will flood at tides above 3.3 m. One potential uneven upland site in forest. BC Hydro Transmission line nearby with grassed area, prominent cable sign. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek. Power transmission line right of way nearby. Road at nearby Jonathan Road, BC Hydro Utility Access Road leading to Porlier Pass Road.

properties.title: Twin Beaches
properties.landing_comments: Beach of small cobbles. SE aspect. Optional landing on similar but smaller beach on opposite side of neck. W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Camp on grassy ridge 15+ m elevation in open, level pine, fir forest. Steep obvious approach up open grass slope. Hammock opportunities. Undeveloped. 2 tent sites on grass, Additional sites to W may need light brushing of brambles, holly.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View.

properties.title: Macktush
properties.landing_comments: Concrete boat ramp, gravel  boat ramp and various gravel beaches in sheltered inlet.
properties.camp_comments: Adjacent to large campground.
properties.other_comments: If not camping, parking arrangements not known. 30 km by road from Port Alberni along Canal Main. which also goes by Arden Creek. Near confluence of Macktush Creek and Alberni Inlet. Water at taps.

properties.title: Jamieson Island west
properties.landing_comments: Beaches on N, S  of dying channel between islets give access to small clear bank areas. Gravel, clam shell, cobble, bedrock beach. Rougher on N side. SE or N aspects. Some boulders. Small lagoon on N side.
properties.camp_comments: 3-4 tent sites on grassy patches at forest margin. I site on bluff. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: unknown

properties.title: Foulger Creek north
properties.landing_comments: In cove, on large, jagged rocks, 600 mm, bedrock. Steep shore. N aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Picnic sites interspersed among trees, salal. Some level upland at 3 m elevation.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek to S. Attractive. Views to Woodfibre, Garibaldi and beyond.

properties.title: Yellow Rock
properties.landing_comments: Boulders, some exposed bedrock. Prominent boulder, painted yellow on shore.
properties.camp_comments: Damp picnic sites in alders.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek at N of beach. Inactive log dump. Small amount of residual logging debris.

properties.title: Esquimalt Harbour Portage
properties.landing_comments: Beach of mixed gravel, mud. Portage trail from Esquimalt Harbour to Gorge Waterway. Esquimalt Harbour is a naval base. Before entering, contact Queen’s Harbour Master (QHM) Operations on VHF Channel 10 or by telephone at 250-363-2160. Follow their procedures.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: No nearby parking. Launch site for Victoria Waterway Loop Trail - a 8.4 NM paddling route through the Capital Region with one 950 m portage. Loop is in 4 sections with multiple launch points.May be completed in a day. See: Victoria Waterways Loop.

properties.title: George Fraser Islands
properties.landing_comments: Beach of pebble, boulders at low water, sand, gravel mid to high water.  Easier at higher water.  Protected from NW, but overall exposed location.
properties.camp_comments: Beach camping.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Fleming Island Lagoon
properties.landing_comments: Shallow lagoon, with reef/rocks. Sand, gravel beach. It's actually difficult to find. The lagoon itself and the entrance are not readily visible as the entrance is hidden behind the rock reef. On more exposed NW side of island. Access easy at high water but awkward due to extensive mud at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Camp in upland - two locations. Stinging nettles at one of sites.
properties.other_comments: Pleasant, protected site but avoid low water.

properties.title: Frances Bay
properties.landing_comments: Moderate landing on beach of pebbles, large cobbles, some boulders. Exposed to S. Boat run. (not found at last site condition report) but likely nearby.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped beach camping between drift logs. 2 brushed upland sites (2023). Large level ground in upland, room for a few tents. Brushing would help. Other former tent sites on old roadway overgrown, unusable. Hammock opportunities for about 3 people. Beware of hazard trees.
properties.other_comments: View. Old industrial roads. Inactive log dump.

properties.title: Pachena Bay
properties.landing_comments: Large low gradient sand beach. SW aspect. Surf depends on swell direction.  Length of bay usually offers some shelter.
properties.camp_comments: Developed commercial campground. Set up mainly for RVs. Beachfront sites at forest edge. Hot showers, flush toilets, sani-dump. Open May-September. Limited off-season camping begins on March 1 for self-contained units only - main washroom/shower house remains closed until May. Reservations: (250) 728-1287 Email: Info@PachenaBayCampground.ca Web: https://pachenabaycampground.ca/beachfront-rv-and-tenting-sites/
properties.other_comments: Location next to Huu-ay-aht First Nation community of Anacla. Bamfield 5 km. West Coast hiking Trail trailhead nearby. Owned and operated by Huu-ay-aht First Nation. Attractive beach, river, wildlife viewing.

properties.title: Big Tree Trailhead
properties.landing_comments: Small rocky beach. Look for end of boardwalk and signage.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Hiking trail to Big Tree and ancient Hanging Garden Tree 1.2 km round trip.

properties.title: Hotham Sound Recreation Site
properties.landing_comments: 2 expansive beaches of gravel, 50-100mm rounded rock separated by cliff in bay. 5% low gradient. Mostly sheltered except from N. Overall length 500 m. S beach has stone jetty believed to be former log dump. Expansive delta beach. 15% grade. 50 mm rocks, gravel. N, W exposure.  Less sheltered than N beach.
properties.camp_comments: 2 locations either N or S of bay cliff. 6 sites or more at beach top, high water threatened. Room for fewer at Springs. Some campsites possible in treed uplands with brushing. Hammock opportunities. S area has large level areas, perhaps former log sort, now overgrown so brushing needed.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at 2 creeks. Foreshore tenure for conservation, recreation. SCRD property map shows as Hotham Sound Park - once thought to be a Regional Park but confirmed as Provincial Recreation Site..

properties.title: Bonner Islet east
properties.landing_comments: Protected, but surf possible on 2.5m or higher tides.
properties.camp_comments: Some beach sites at most tide levels but uncertain if usable at Springs. More wind protection than at W beach site.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. Trail to W beach for viewing sea state.

properties.title: Cook Island east
properties.landing_comments: Rocky tombolo beaches adjacent to islet at E end of island. Gravel at high water, rough cobble, clam bed at lower water levels. A few boulders. Varying gradients. S or NE aspects. NE facing beach rougher.
properties.camp_comments: 1 marginal tent site on grass at forest margin. Dense salal. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Stokes Road
properties.landing_comments: Protected low gradient beach at S entrance to False Narrows. At low water extensive flat bedrock shelves, hard pack beach with avoidable bands of boulders. Easier landing closer to trail at mid to high water. SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted
properties.other_comments: Community park at junction of Stokes Road, South Road. Former first nation camp "tlucu" Small boat hand launch site. Large parking area with unpaved road to water giving easy beach access.

properties.title: Langdale ferry
properties.landing_comments: Walk on, paddle off. Good adjacent launch beach to N. Cart recommended for walk to bus stop then take short trail to beach. Some drift logs. See Langdale for details. Public dock access closer to ferry, but fencing obstacles appear impractical for most boats.
properties.camp_comments: Toilets at terminal, trailhead.
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to Horseshoe Bay.

properties.title: Shingle Spit
properties.landing_comments: Protected pebble, gravel beach. Steep/slippery concrete boat ramp with exposed surfaces/rebar and drop off at end. W aspect. Various suitable launch locations, usable at all water levels.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: S of ferry, short road leads to public day parking area for trailers but no overnight parking permitted. Turn left just before entering ferry terminal, may have to bypass ferry lineup.

properties.title: Surge Narrows
properties.landing_comments: Nook in rocky shore with mixed rocks to boulder size. Enough room for several paddlecraft. Close to narrows so strong currents likely.
properties.camp_comments: Unknown but has hammock use potential.
properties.other_comments: Staging for Surge Narrows. Beach fires are banned all year round. See Surge Narrows Provincial Park.

properties.title: Naka Creek hand launch
properties.landing_comments: Easy on exposed beach of gravel, pebble. N aspect. Gravel boat launch reported suited to light trailer boats.
properties.camp_comments: See Naka Creek
properties.other_comments: Road access via Eve Main, Naka Main, may have rough sections. Parking. View. Former logging camp nearby. Caretaker seasonally. No fees charged but some boaters have been asked to pay.

properties.title: Restless Mountain
properties.landing_comments: Sand, gravel beach moderate gradient with steeper gravel sections. SE aspect. W side has more protection from surf. in lee of reefs,rock outcrops.  All sand to mid water, gravel at high water.  At centre beach heavy surf possible. Scattered rocks, boulders with clear sections.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Beach sites near forest edge, .One established tent site. No cleared upland sites. Two other sites between creeks. Sand, gravel sites may need minor leveling.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal streams crossing beach, Attractive. See Lawn Point Provincial Park

properties.title: Larson Bay
properties.landing_comments: Cove with small sand beach at high water, gravel mixed rocks at lower water. SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Steep trail to parking lot. Flush toilet at top of trail. Tennis court. Limited parking at end of Gleneagles Drive. District of West Vancouver Park , Larson Bay Park

properties.title: Britannia Beach
properties.landing_comments: Concrete boat ramp. NW aspect. Some protection from nearby large floats.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: 2 hr parking at ramp top in unpaved lot or longer term parking across Highway 99. Community Dock. Some services nearby. Historic copper mine site. Managed by Squamish Lillooet Regional District.

properties.title: Pace Road
properties.land_tenure: Public Foreshore, Road end Right of Way
properties.landing_comments: Flat bedrock launch site. E aspect. Walk moderately narrow path approx 350 m to beach. Cart recommended. Sort stairs to beach might need 2 people to lift boats.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Possible alternative to Nelson Road Community launch. No restrictive parking. Park at roadside.

properties.title: Dent Rapids north
properties.landing_comments: 3 adjacent small, rough beaches of gravel, bedrock, smaller broken rocks. Strong currents. Dent Rapids begin approx. 500 m SE during flood tides, closer on ebb tides. Vessel traffic. NE aspect.  Beaches within 300 m of each other. Centre beach appears to give best upland access.
properties.camp_comments: Steep vegetated bank, currently with no access trail, leads in 70 m to near-level high bench. Other semi-level sites lie to NW on steep hillside. Hammock opportunities. All sites require work (brushing, minor levelling) before usable for camping.
properties.other_comments: View.

properties.title: Sonora Island northeast
properties.landing_comments: Easy on small gravel beach, bedrock outcrops, boulders. Strong currents. Another similar but longer beach lies 650 m to NW. Vessel traffic.
properties.camp_comments: Gravel beach-top sites possible at Neaps. 2 potential sites with work (need brushing, minor levelling) in steep, heavily vegetated upland. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Good landing between rapids suggests suitable for day use to await for slack during split transits. Possible water at stream entering channel between beaches, approx 300 m NW. Florence Lake Access Road runs above site within approx. 100 m.

properties.title: Denham Bay
properties.landing_comments: Beach or float dock in semi-protected bay.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping - summer fishing resort has 4 rental cabins. Open approx May - September. Managers: Peter Geneau, Sarah Askwith. Peter: 250-703-6978 or Sarah: 250-218-8538 denhamdocks@gmail.com
properties.other_comments: For emergency use only, unless pre-booked.

properties.title: Dent Island Lodge
properties.landing_comments: Rough beaches, float docks. Vessel traffic, strong currents. Drying rapid, rocky channel adjacent to Lodge. Access possible from NW or SE sides but SE side more protected.
properties.camp_comments: Resort fishing lodge open June - September. Pre-booking required for all stays. Call 250-203-2553.
properties.other_comments: Listed for emergency use only. For emergency use only, unless pre-booked.

properties.title: Clowhom Recreation Site
properties.landing_comments: Gravel, mixed rock beach, 25 m wide. Generally protected. S aspect. Moderate 15% slope. Gravel mixed to 75mm, some interspersed rock to 300mm.
properties.camp_comments: Some upper beach tent sites at Neaps only. 2 hammock sites with light brushing. Other potential upland tent sites on steep terrain would need work. Pleasant S aspect. Good rest or picnic site.
properties.other_comments: SCRD shows as Clowhom Campsite Park on official mapping. 4.5 Ha.

properties.title: Espinosa Inlet north
properties.landing_comments: Easy on moderately steep pebble beach. Suited to all water levels, all-weather. NW aspect offering some protection from wind, swell.
properties.camp_comments: Small upland tent sites along short trail, 3-4 hammocks hangs, at S corner of beach. Potential for 3 more upland sites with minor work, plus beach sites if pebbles levelled. May be harder to access at Springs, but will be dry.
properties.other_comments: Inactive log dump with old roads behind. Better than Espinosa Inlet site to S.

properties.title: Abrams middle beach
properties.landing_comments: Well protected narrow rocky cove ends in low gradient sand, grit beach. Pebble above. Many drift logs. 2 all-tide channels, one channel navigable only at high water. S aspect. Boomers, kelp. Vessel traffic outside.
properties.camp_comments: 2 tent sites at a distance SE from high water landing. Additional sites if brushed. Scramble over rocks around headland. Hammock opportunities. Beach camping potential at Neaps. Deadfall hazards.
properties.other_comments: Might be former village site. See Vargas Island Provincial Park. We have created a Vargas Island webpage with additional information.

properties.title: Foster Island
properties.landing_comments: Beaches in rocky coves with drift logs, boulders. Best landing beach on cobble at NE side in protected cove. E aspect. Wind direction influences choices.
properties.camp_comments: No known or visible tent sites. Dense vegetation on all upland. Hammock opportunities in NE cove at forest margin.
properties.other_comments: Isolated island. Seabird nesting sites. Avoid visiting in Spring nesting season. Wildlife viewing.

properties.title: Goletas Waterfall
properties.landing_comments: In cove with NE aspect. Easy on moderate gradient beach of angular cobble, rocks to 200 mm, scattered boulders. Watch for larger submerged rocks at low tide, uncovered rocks are very slippery. Pebble above. Protected from all directions except NE. Lesser gradient on lower beach makes for long carry at low water.
properties.camp_comments: All-tide beach camping on pebble. Summer Springs to 5.0 m leave small beach area. Upland sites also possible with brushing. Potential for hammock use.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round creek, waterfall, pool. Attractive. View.

properties.title: Mud Bay Vargas Island
properties.landing_comments: Very low gradient broad mud beach. SE aspect. Exposed to S, SE. Beach mostly floods. Some drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping. Ahousaht requested no camping here. Rocky bluffs impede upland access.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Stream at head of bay but might be difficult to access. See Vargas Island Provincial Park. See Vargas Island webpage with information on Ahousaht access passes. Link to the Ahousaht map showing where camping or day use allowed.

properties.title: Elbow Bank north bay
properties.landing_comments: Easy on very low gradient protected sand, grit beach. Pebble above. A few drift logs. Beach floods. E aspect. Vessel traffic, currents at bay entrance.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping. Ahousaht FN requested no camping here. Dense salal in upland.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. See Vargas Island Provincial Park. See Vargas Island webpage with information on Ahousaht access passes.

properties.title: Vargas Island northeast
properties.landing_comments: Easy on moderate gradient pebble beaches off protected channel on either side of S point of unnamed island. Channel dries at extreme tides only. Beach floods at Springs.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping. Ahousaht requested no camping here. Dense salal at upland margin.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. See Vargas Island Provincial Park. See Vargas Island webpage with information on Ahousaht access passes.

properties.title: Mels Beach Vargas Island
properties.landing_comments: Broad low gradient exposed sand beach. NW aspect. Expect less surf & swell or none to W where island blocks wrapping.
properties.camp_comments: Dispersed beach sites except at highest Springs. At Springs, favour nearby Dick and Jane Beach. Green throne toilet.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Some private land, cabin at N end of bay with signage. See Vargas Island Provincial Park. See Vargas Island webpage with information on Ahousaht access passes.A short access trail to Dick and Jane's Beach and at low tides makes it possible to walk to Secret Beach on the sand. From Secret Beach there is a trail that takes one all the way to Surfers and Fingers beaches. The landing at the eastern end of Mel's Beach is protected by a tombolo at low tides.

properties.title: Cable Bay Qw'xwulwis
properties.landing_comments: 3 similar mostly protected beaches in small bay behind rock reef, ledge. Beaches of gravel, pebble, occasional boulders, rougher at bottom. Easy at moderate or lower water levels. At high water, beach mostly floods to drift logs, sloped sandstone bedrock shores. Moderate to good protection with choice of aspects, NW, N,SE.
properties.camp_comments: Upland camping not permitted. Possible beach top sites at Neaps. Might require minor log clearing. Pebble Beach Galiano Island might offer more tidal clearance. Moderately level upland, grassy at forest margin.
properties.other_comments: Hiking trails to McCoskrie Road (1 km), Melissa Road, Pebble Beach. Managed by Nature Trust of BC for nature preservation, day recreation area. aka Pebble Beach Nature Reserve, Great Beaver Swamp, Cable Bay Conservation Area, also mapped as Pebble Beach Recreation Site, Pebble Beach District Lot 63. Reserve - Qw'xwulwis - Cable Bay #176 Secured 2022 Managed by The Nature Trust of BC for protection of riparian, mixed Coastal Douglas-fir forest, and rocky marine shoreline.Ha 26.52 NTBC Land Manager Thomas Reid: 250-739-8458

properties.title: Taylor Beach
properties.landing_comments: Exposed sand, gravel beach backed by low bluff. SE aspect. Drift logs at beach top stay dry in most tides. Short walk on trail down bluff to beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Foot of Taylor Road. Popular with beach walkers. Small parking area for 6-8 vehicles, Additional parking at roadside. Devonian Regional Park lies 0.3 NM SW along continuous beach.

properties.title: Taylor Cove Galiano
properties.land_tenure: Private or Crown lease, Public Foreshore, Road end Right of Way
properties.landing_comments: Easy on protected beach of angular pebble to NW of prominent cable sign. Steep ramp at cove head for equipment access.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted, as far as known. Grassy headland accessible up ladders on NW cove bank or by cove head to public road. SE Bank near cable sign also grassy. Site gets some recreational use.
properties.other_comments: Sticks Allison Road runs by cove head. BC Hydro substation in upland.

properties.title: Oban Bay
properties.landing_comments: Open beach of angular broken rocks with bedrock at sides. Moderate gradient. W aspect with little or no protection.
properties.camp_comments: Site lies on border of Prov Park so exact placement might involve more detailed survey. Sloping vegetated bank above beach appears to have dispersed camping potential for several tents plus hammocks.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at seasonal stream running through beach. Connected to extensive hiking trail network. See Simson Provincial Park

properties.title: Camp Bay South Thormanby
properties.landing_comments: Challenging on beach of broken rocks, cobble with boulders below. Many drift logs. S aspect.  More protected if approached from E side of rock island. Optimal tidal level approx. 3 m.
properties.camp_comments: Potential tent sites on rough sloped upland require work or platforms, brushing. Small mossy level areas on rock island. Camping possibilities higher in upland forest. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at small seasonal stream. Hiking trail connects with extensive trail network. See Simson Provincial Park

properties.title: Bare Rock Bay
properties.landing_comments: Moderate gradient beach of angular broken rock to cobble size, occasional boulders. S aspect. Protected from most directions except SW, S, SE. Many drift logs. Preferred landing beach lies on W side of rocky promontory in longer small cove known as Cliff Cove. Outer bay known as Sled Bay.
properties.camp_comments: Potential sites for approx. 4 tents in sloping vegetated upland above Cliff Cove. Requires work, e.g. levelling or platforms. Hammock opportunities. Damp.
properties.other_comments: Small seasonal stream through site. Year-round water at large pond at about 1.5 km. Sled Bay, Cliff Cove portions joined by inland hiking trail that connects with Simson Park trail network but no beach connection on foot. Steel logging sled relic near E beach in trail. See Simson Provincial Park

properties.title: Alder Bay Resort
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand, gravel beach, float or concrete ramp. NNW aspect. Protected by breakwater.
properties.camp_comments: Large oceanside RV park with tent sites. Full service RV park. Tents welcome. Water, flush toilets, showers, laundry, food truck restaurant. Phone: 1-250-956-4117 Email: stay@alderbay.com
properties.other_comments: From Hwy #19 turn right onto Beaver Cove Road. Entrance 6km on left. Alder Bay RV Park & Marina, PO Box 1090 Port McNeill, BC, V0N 2R0. Double concrete boat ramp. Floats. Vehicles may be parked for $5.00/day fee.

properties.title: Cole Island
properties.landing_comments:
Dock on W side of island with low float. Esquimalt Harbour generally protected. Vessel traffic. If arriving by kayak or other small craft please telephone 250-363-3160.
There is a 100 m security zone around all Department of National Defence ships and facilities where civilian vessels are not permitted. You must maintain a distance of 200 m from naval vessels underway.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Cole Island in Esquimalt Harbour and past the Canadian Forces Base Esquimalt (CFB Esquimalt) naval base and home port to Maritime Forces Pacific and Joint Task Force Pacific Headquarters. The remaining buildings on the island have been restored. More than 150 years ago, the remote island was chosen to house ammo because of its distance from the naval hub, and was named after Edmond Picoti Cole, master of HMS Fisgard. Eventually, there were 16 solidly built brick and metal structures on the island including a jetty and a guard house. National Historic Site by the Historic Sites and Monuments Board of Canada. The Friends of Cole Island have worked hard to restore and preserve this piece of Canadian History. See: http://coleisland.ca/

properties.title: Silu
properties.landing_comments: Exposed sandstone ledges with gap pocket beach of cobble, pebble. NE aspect. Feasible in calm conditions. Land on sloped sandstone ledge at high water. Large step up required at some water levels.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. No fires. Level grassed areas at forest margin. 2 picnic tables. Signage. Vault toilet at parking lot.
properties.other_comments: Silu Community Park managed by Galiano Island Parks and Recreation Commission, an agency of the Capital Regional District. Trail approx 250 m connects to Bodega Beach Drive.

properties.title: Bodega
properties.landing_comments: Easy at mid or lower water levels on small mixed beach of sand, cobble, boulder. Floods to sandstone ledge at high water, so avoid high water landing.  Drift logs. NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Potential for beach top or upland tent sites at forest edge. Steep forested upland slopes might offer hammock opportunities only.
properties.other_comments: Bodega Beach Road approx 200 m inland. Bodega Ridge Provincial Park 397 ha. (321 hectares upland, 76 ha. foreshore). Most of the Park is on Galiano's W shore. See: Bodega Ridge Provincial Park

properties.title: Bodega north
properties.landing_comments: At mid or lower water levels, easy on cobble, pebble beach. High water landings more difficult due to drift logs, sandstone ledges. NE aspect. Reefs offer some protection.
properties.camp_comments: Appears to offer marginal beach top sites at Neaps on public foreshore. Steep, dense forest behind could yield unsanctioned sites. Approx. 400 m to Bodega Beach Road, but no trail known.
properties.other_comments: Lies NW of Bodega Provincial Park boundary. Otherwise preferred over Park site.

properties.title: Galiano east shore
properties.landing_comments: Beach of pebble mixed with boulders at low water. Drift logs. Beach mostly floods at high water. Protected from NW, Some protection from SE.
properties.camp_comments: Relatively level forest above short, moderately steep bank. Potential upland unsanctioned tent sites.
properties.other_comments: Lies .25 NM NW of Cable Bay.

properties.title: Artlish River south
properties.landing_comments: Rough gravel ramp or beach in moderately protected inlet. NW aspect. Drive to water's edge.
properties.camp_comments: Possible camping in or at margins of adjacent large gravel parking area.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal stream at E end of gravel lot. Site is tenured inactive log sort or dump (2022) that will likely be re-activated in future. Road condition unknown but presumed to be passable in 2022.

properties.title: Little Bunsby north
properties.landing_comments: Easy on sand pebble beach in small cove. Beware of reefs at low water. NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Overgrown former unofficial tent sites in mature open forest. Shaded. Camping not permitted in Checleset Bay Ecological Reserve.
properties.other_comments: 150 m across peninsula neck is Little Bunsby Beach. No known trail.

properties.title: Lasqueti Ecological Reserve north
properties.landing_comments: Large low gradient cobble, gravel beach. SE aspect. Many drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: Camping not permitted. Non-extractive day recreational use permitted.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View Wildlife viewing.

properties.title: Favada Cobble Beach
properties.landing_comments: Cobble, boulder beach runs at angle behind rock outcrop. Little protection from swells. Close to cliffs on N. Beach floods at Springs.
properties.camp_comments: 2 small upland sites, if lightly brushed. Better sites than at Favada Point south.
properties.other_comments: Marginal site overall.

properties.title: Favada Point Cove
properties.landing_comments: Angular cobbles, boulders with pebbles at top on beach of S aspect. Moderately steep. Drift logs. Protected except from S. Could be hazardous in strong S wind, swell.
properties.camp_comments: Grassy upland sites on headland to W. Hammock opportunities. Ruined cabin.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. More capacity than neighbouring sites. Flagging suggests trail leading to Crescent Bay Road or to stream entering Maple Bay to N.

properties.title: Laura Creek
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient exposed sand beach. Bands of rocks at lower tides. Subject to NW swell, winds, surf lacking protection.
properties.camp_comments: 4 tent platforms, food cache, pit toilet approximately 200 m W of creek on N Coast hiking trail. 1 or more beach sites on sand.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek. On N Coast hiking trail. Landing here is potentially hazardous.

properties.title: Welcome Bay west
properties.landing_comments: Rough, steep-backed cove. Beach of boulder, cobble with gravel, drift logs at top. Appears  to flood at Springs. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No obvious overnight sites. Steep backed but access possible up bank. Usable at Neaps, possibly even for overnight stay.
properties.other_comments: qRD OCP notes as un-managed recreation area. Does not appear usable at high water.

properties.title: Crescent Bay Road
properties.land_tenure: Public Foreshore, Road end right of way
properties.landing_comments: Gravel beach in bay moderate gradient, W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping.
properties.other_comments: Cresent Bay Road appears to run to shoreline for easy launch. Couple of small boats parked on grass. Overlooked by residence. Road condition unknown.

properties.title: Spotlight Cove
properties.landing_comments: Sheltered narrow cove within Spotlight Cove with mud, silt, pebble beach. NE aspect. Very short carry from Spotlight Drive.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Parking on Spotlight Drive for a few vehicles.

properties.title: Chesterman Beach north
properties.landing_comments:
Broad exposed sand beach. W aspect. Large rock reef at centre.
Expect surf. Swell above 1.6 m from most directions gives dumping surf, more difficult at low water. Bay ends reduce surf, in particular S end. Vessel traffic. Beware of surfers closer to beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilets, water at N end by tsunami warning tower.
properties.other_comments: Combined N, S beaches 2.7 km long. Residences. Wickaninnish Inn.Parking at Chesterman Beach N & S, with a few spots at Middle Chesterman. Roadside parking permitted on beach side where indicated.

properties.title: Chesterman Beach south
properties.landing_comments: Broad sand beach. SSW aspect. Often protected in summer from winds, swells. S swell makes infrequent big wave sets. W end landing usually easier. Reef, rock at E end amplifies waves. Rip near Frank Island. Vessel traffic. Beware of surfers near beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilets near E end.
properties.other_comments: Water at toilets

properties.title: Cox Bay
properties.landing_comments: Exposed sweeping low gradient sand beach. W aspect. Heavier, more consistent surf than nearby beaches in swells except from S.  Headland at S end offers more protection. Landing not advised in winter or in swells over 1 m. Vessel traffic. Beware of surfers.
properties.camp_comments: Bookable private commercial campsites e.g. Long Beach Lodge Resort, Cox Bay Beach Resort, Pacific Sands Beach Resort.
properties.other_comments: Tidepools. Parking at public lot accessed by entrance to Long Beach Lodge Resort. Also on Maltby Road.

properties.title: Arakun Islands
properties.landing_comments: Easy on small, moderately steep pebble beach. Difficult at very low water. Extensive mudflats to E. Vessel traffic including frequent float planes.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping. Frequent use by guided day groups.
properties.other_comments: Attractive S facing sunny site. Seasonal creeks on shore to E.

properties.title: Sharp Creek
properties.landing_comments: Very low gradient mud flat dries to sedge bank. Easiest at high water. At lower water, prefer  approach from N.  NW aspect. Winds funnel in Lemmens Inlet. Obvious opening in forest canopy at creek exit.
properties.camp_comments: Upland sites in forest clearing behind sedge directly up from landing. Camping on sedge or grass feasible at neaps. Pay attention to good sanitation, food protection - practice the Marine Trails Code of Conduct.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal creek running through site.

properties.title: Radar Beach north
properties.landing_comments: Series of pocket sand beaches. SW aspect. Reefs, submerged rocks create boomers, rips. but nay also break swell to give landing routes. Main (N) beaches moderately steep with dumping surf. Select an approach based on swell angle.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at seasonal creeks, more frequent to S.Hiking trail descends from Radar Hill lookout accessed via HWY 4. Day parking.

properties.title: Dixon Island Barkley Sound
properties.landing_comments: Sheltered N aspect bay on sand or E facing bay on sand across narrow neck. Site is located on Huu-ay-aht Treaty Settlement Lands. Day use with permit required, see: https://huuayaht.org/services/lands-permits/
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Day use with permit for Huu-ay-aht Treaty Settlement Land. See: https://huuayaht.org/camping-permit-application/
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Cohoe Bay Entrance
properties.landing_comments: Prominent small sand spit at bay entrance floods at high water.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Easy upland access. Possible hammock sites. No dry beach tent sites.
properties.other_comments: Potential water source at bay head unknown distance up Cohoe Creek.

properties.title: Raynor Islands central beach
properties.landing_comments: Large protected low gradient sand, clam bed beach. Rock islets. Scattered boulders, bedrock outcrops. Long carry at low water. N aspect.
properties.camp_comments: 2 beach top sites on grass, rocks. 1 site on flat rock outcrop. Other potential sites lack tidal clearance. Relatively easy upland access makes additional sites feasible with brushing. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Popplewell Cove
properties.landing_comments: Moderate gradient beach of boulders, cobble, sand in semi-protected cove. Grassy upland margin. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Protected tent sites in level second growth forest will need dead branches removed but no significant underbrush.
properties.other_comments: Water at year-round stream crossing beach, flowing in drought mid-July 2023.

properties.title: Wehlis Bay
properties.landing_comments: Clam bed beach with boulders, cobble at most water levels. Some sand, grassy patches. Large open bay. Drift log accumulation. SE aspect. Open to wind.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Tent sites in level second growth forest on N side of bay, if dead branches moved, but little underbrush. Various grass patches lumpy or boulder-strewn. Beach sites limited by drift log mass.
properties.other_comments: Water at 2 seasonal streams crossing beach at corners.

properties.title: Tomlinson Point north
properties.landing_comments: Protected low gradient clam bed beach with sand patches in small estuary mouth. Rock outcrops. Dries at LW, mostly floods at HW. N aspect. Feasible landing also S of point, depending on swell.
properties.camp_comments: Potential tent sites at beach top under trees but flood in tides over 4 m. 1 flattish rock dry at all tides. Low slope upland forest sites feasible if brushed.
properties.other_comments: Possible water at estuary creek but at unknown distance to not be brackish.

properties.title: Radar Beach south
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient sand beach. W aspect. Outer reefs break swell,  protecting landing. Main (N) beaches moderately steep with dumping surf. S beach often surf-free. Approach varies based on swell angle, height.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Secluded with few visitors., unlike Radar Beach north. Report of unmaintained overland access trail.

properties.title: Nanat Bay
properties.landing_comments: Bay with beach of mixed rocks, gravel. NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping. Other opportunities along same shore to south.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Riley Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy on small moderately steep beach in protected cove. Small rocks in centre beach. Scattered boulders, small flat mudflat shelf at low water. Land at all tides, most weather. NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Site currently best suited to day use (2024). 2 or 3 beachtop tent sites at E end between stumps. Path to 5-6 additional potential tent sites requiring levelling. Hammock opportunities. Limited space at high water.
properties.other_comments: Year-round water at cove head from lake-fed Riley Creek. Attractive. Sunny. Former cannery location. Old growth forest.

properties.title: Doyle Islands
properties.landing_comments:
Small boulder, cobble beach with shelf or reef at side. Moderate gradient, steeper at sides. Protected. from most directions. NE aspect. Drift logs may impede landing at higher tides.
,
properties.camp_comments: No known camping. Beach floods at most tides. Low slope forested upland behind beach suggests possible overnight use.
properties.other_comments: Critical location for safety pullout. Away from aquaculture. Good shelter.

properties.title: Anacla
properties.landing_comments: Gravel boat ramp on Pachena River.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Parking available at campground further S along Emchiss Way. Site reported at this location not yet independently verified. Treat data with caution. Site Condition Reports welcomed.

properties.title: Fishboat Bay
properties.landing_comments: Beach SE aspect. Mostly large boulders, rocks at high water. with small sand area at centre beach. Mostly rock-free sand at mid - low water levels, Partly protected, but surf possible. Stairway to parking lot.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted
properties.other_comments: Large parking area located at end of Fishboat Road off Hwy 14. 3 ha Capital Regional District Nature Park. Information kiosk, seasonal washroom, short trail,stairway to 88 m long natural sand beach. Reasonable launch site in good conditions, but stairway reduces accessibility.

properties.title: Gordons Beach
properties.landing_comments: Open sloping beach with mostly 15 cm+ rocks. Exposed S aspect. Expect surf with almost any wind swell. High water reaches beach top drift logs.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping.
properties.other_comments: Close to Highway 14.

properties.title: Iron Mine Bay
properties.landing_comments: Somewhat protected beach. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No upland camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: East Sooke Regional Park. Extensive walking trails. Toilet at parking lot 20 minutes up trail from beach. Busy in summer - W start/end of Coastal Trail.

properties.title: Wittys Lagoon
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient beach of sand, gravel, silt. SE aspect. At low tide, there is a long sandy run out including off shore sand bars. Can be wave action when windy. Lagoon, marsh lies behind beach. The lagoon can be entered but only with a higher tide and can be paddled up to Sitting Lady Falls.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Toilets. Picnic tables. Shelters.
properties.other_comments: Road access via Metchosin Road. Attractive. Parking. 5 km of walking trails. Wildlife viewing, birding. See: Witty's Lagoon Regional Park. 58 ha area.

properties.title: Finnerty Cove
properties.landing_comments: Accessible at all tides with exception of no beach at very high tide. North East facing exposed sand beach. Strong NE or E winds may create large waves.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Day use site only. Nice beach in small cove. A few picnic tables on bench land just above the beach. This is Island Heath's Queen Alexandra Hospital buildings and grounds. Next door is the Variety Garden Park where there are bathrooms, picnic tables and walking trails. Fresh water might be obtained from QA Hospital or the Variety Garden Park bathrooms. Pay parking in lot near hospital.

properties.title: Douglas Creek
properties.landing_comments: A few scattered large rounded boulders in the water near the beach are the only hazards. Gravel and sand beach accessible at all tide levels. NE open exposure. Possibility of large waves with strong winds out of the E or NE. Beach is long and shallow especially at low tide.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Toilets. Playground. Picnic tables.
properties.other_comments: Day use only. This is part of the large 188 acres Mount Douglas Park (aka PKOLS). Entire park gets heavy use in the summer especially weekends. Path and steps (50m) down to the beach. Large parking lot next to public bathrooms. Fresh water available at restrooms on bench off beach. Picnic tables are available on bench.

properties.title: Cordova Bay Park
properties.landing_comments: This is a small park next to a neighborhood store. Long sand with pebble, rubble mix  beach with extensive shallow run out at low tide. Park beach is water covered at extreme high tide so unusable. Exposed East facing, waves probably with strong E or NE/NS winds.
properties.camp_comments: Day use only, no camping, with picnic tables and playground on bench above beach. Bathrooms off beach.
properties.other_comments: Roadway to beach 50m. District of Saanich park. The beach is protected by large concrete blocks to lessen the impact of winter waves on bathroom building. Small parking area off road or parking across the street available. Bathrooms open in the day from May thru Oct. May be fresh water available at the store or check bathroom. Some use by locals in the summer as this is a long beach lined with homes and a good place to go for walks.

properties.title: Hook Beach
properties.landing_comments: Sand, pebble beach. Drift logs. Exposed SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Convenient rest stop along shore with few landing opportunities.

properties.title: East Redonda southeast
properties.landing_comments: Choice of small beaches. One in protected cove. others more exposed but larger. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Undeveloped. Camping not permitted in Ecological Reserve.
properties.other_comments: Site adequate for emergency or lunch stop.

properties.title: Browning Islands
properties.landing_comments: Moderate gradient cobble beach in small bay. Protected from NW but exposed to E. E aspect. Drift logs make beach access more awkward at high water.
properties.camp_comments: 1 potential tent site. At least 2 easy hammock sites. Lumpy, rough terrain, beach.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Cook Island south
properties.landing_comments: Large clam bed lies behind rocks. Cobble, boulders. SE aspect. Alternative access from low gradient clam bed on other side of neck. NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Small bluffs areas offer possible sites. Dense salal. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Sointula
properties.landing_comments: Gravel beach. Short carry from road.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping.
properties.other_comments: at 1 St, 15 Ave. Parking unknown. Facilities, services, ferry service close by. Many other options in area.

properties.title: Wells Passage west
properties.landing_comments: Clam bed at low water. Cobble, boulder at high water. Exposed to wind from several directions. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Beach top sites on cobble possible at Neaps. Dense upland vegetation. Possible hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal stream.

properties.title: OBrien Bay north
properties.landing_comments: Sheltered smooth rock ledges or adjacent small cove with cobble, boulders. NE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Tent sites on grass at most tides.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View.

properties.title: Daedalus Peninsula
properties.landing_comments: Relatively smooth cobble, boulder, beach in double bay with additional bay across rocky neck. Moderate gradient. E aspect. Protected except from NE.
properties.camp_comments: Small beach-top site good for most tides. Marked trail with rope for assistance up bank, leading to rustic bench. I upland site off trail. Potential for more sites with brushing. Hammock opprtunities.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Wildlife viewing. Tex Lyon hiking trail runs nearby. Water source at head of bay immediately to S i.e. Basket Eaters Bay. Some confusion in naming, identity of sites. Official name, if any, unknown.

properties.title: Kutcous Point
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient sand beach, steeper at top. Spit to island reef creates heavier wave, surf than elsewhere. Avoid landing at main beach in heavy swell. Alternative landing in cove to E of main beach more protected but longer carry.
properties.camp_comments: 25+ sites on beach camping except during winter storms. Some scattered upland forest sites. Toilet. Bear cache.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Water at river at NW corner but go far upstream for fresh water. Part of Wild Side hiking trail.

properties.title: Fingers
properties.landing_comments: Coves between rock fingers protect sand beaches from dominant NW winds, surf. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Beach sites on sand. Composting toilet. Animal-resistant food cache. Hammock opportunities. Amazing site. Obviously popular so difficult to get a good site in peak summer
properties.other_comments: Also known as Little Baja. Short trail 300 m to large beach with W aspect known as Surfers' Beach. Water at creek at centre of main bay 1.5 km. Hiking trail across S Vargas I. See Vargas Island Provincial Park. See Vargas Island webpage with information on Ahousaht access passes.

properties.title: Cow Bay west 2
properties.landing_comments: Broad sand beach of moderately low gradient. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Beach sites on sand among drift logs.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water sources at Cow Bay west, approx 500 m to W.

properties.title: Numas Islands Big Cove
properties.landing_comments: Cobble, boulder, drift log beach in protected large rocky cove. N aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No visible tent sites.
properties.other_comments: Seabird colonies. Avoid visits during Spring nesting season. Wildlife viewing.

properties.title: Popplewell Point north
properties.landing_comments: Clam bed beach at low water. Sand, silt or mud, pebble. Boulders at high water. Moderate gradient. Protected from S,W. E aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Beach top site at Neaps. Grassy at forest margin. Brushing likely needed. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Water at seasonal stream but Popplewell Cove 0.3 NM to SW more reliable source.

properties.title: Ahous Bay south
properties.landing_comments: S end of overall large bay usually more protected, may be calm. Hook at S corner gives more shelter.
properties.camp_comments: Entire expansive sand beach suited to camping. Random wilderness camping allowed. Please use animal-proof food bins at N and S ends of bay. New fully enclosed outhouse 2024. Kitchen pole structure for hanging a group tarp.
properties.other_comments: Water at creek in centre bay. Attractive long sandy beach. Hiking trail across S Vargas I. See Vargas Island Provincial Park. See Vargas Island webpage with information on Ahousaht access passes. Link to the Ahousaht map showing where camping or day use allowed.

properties.title: Sansum Point West Closure
properties.landing_comments: No landing
properties.camp_comments: "This site is currently closed. Site closures may occur for a variety of reasons, including environmental protection, weather-related damage, safety concerns, or directives from First Nations. BC Marine Trails will update this site’s status as new information becomes available. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation in helping preserve these areas for future generations."
properties.other_comments: No authorized access to this culturally sensitive site. Cowichan Valley Regional District is engaged in a Management Plan process in collaboration with Cowichan Tribes for a management and access strategy for Stone Hill Regional Park.

properties.title: Irvines Landing
properties.landing_comments: Sheltered gravel beach accessible on short trail from road. Substantial public dock lacks floats.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping.
properties.other_comments: Parking for 6 vehicles. No posted restrictions. Pender Harbour Ocean Discovery site adjacent with private dock.

properties.title: Sydney Inlet Entrance
properties.landing_comments: 2 moderate gradient sand beaches in cove with rock outcrop between. Protected from SW. Land on either side of rock. At high water, may land at lagoon entrance behind rock. W aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Beach sites on sand for emergency camping. Designated camping at Halfmoon bay to the north.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Lagoon. Used by outfitter at one time. Marine debris collected for future pickup on S shore.

properties.title: Dewinetz Trail
properties.landing_comments: Moderate gradient pocket pebble beach at low water. Sandstone bedrock sloped ledges at most water levels. SE aspect largely protected by extensive rock reefs to N, NE. Prominent signage.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Trail 450 m through open forest from parking area on Bodega Beach Drive. Space for 20 vehicles. Portable toilet at parking area. Galiano Shore Access #50. Private land on either side of trail.

properties.title: Georgeson Bay
properties.landing_comments: Sand, pebble beach moderate gradient. Floods at high water. E aspect. Strong currents, frequent large vessel traffic.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Wildlife viewing. 100 m public beach access trail from Active Pass Road. Steps, steep parts. Access to hiking trails at Mt Galiano & Collinson Parks.

properties.title: Bellhouse Bay
properties.landing_comments: Protected low gradient sand, pebble beach. SE aspect. Strong currents. Frequent large vessel traffic.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Municipal beach access trail 125 m to Farmhouse Road. Parking for 1 or 2 vehicles. Potential launch site on level trail. Steps at beach. Galiiano Shore Access #10 "Scorpion Point".

properties.title: Cain Beach
properties.landing_comments: Sand beach with bedrock fingers, outcrops. Moderate protection except from E. Short near-level 20 m trail to road.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Municipal beach access trail at Cain Road. Parking for approx. 6 vehicles.

properties.title: Chetarpe
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient sand beach, usable at all water levels. Small surf possible. Point at S offers protection. Beach generally floods. Marine traffic hazards. Hazards off Chetarpe Point in S approach to beach.
properties.camp_comments: Tent sites at 2 current (2024) clearings under willow trees. Some potential for hammocks, but most trees small.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Sunny. Water at seasonal stream.

properties.title: Ross Passage
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient protected clam bed, mixed rocks, some sand. Small boulders at low water. At tides above mid level, more W approach saves a carry. S aspect. Shelter from outer island. Safe for all weather, tides.
properties.camp_comments: Currently beach tent sites at Neaps only. Potential for further 3-4 tent sites with brushing, levelling. Emergency camping location on the paddling route to Muxsia Hot Springs at Nismaakqin (Maquinna Park).
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal stream requiring boat access at higher tides. Aquaculture nearby.

properties.title: Atleo River
properties.landing_comments: Easy on gravel beach. W aspect. Protected from S, open to N. Vessel traffic. Frequent high afternoon winds.
properties.camp_comments: 4-5 tent sites in W-facing open forest clearings. Rustic site requiring more site levelling work. 2-3 additional beach tent sites to N. MHSS Stewardship Fee (Ahousaht First Nation) required to camp.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Year-round water at Atleo R approx. 600 m to S.. On paddling route to Mux̣šiƛa Hot Springs at Nism̓aakqin. Refer to FN Info box for payment of stewardship fee.

properties.title: Howcraft Point south
properties.landing_comments: Mixed low gradient beach of sand at low water, with cobble, scattered boulders at mid water or above, with many drift logs at top. SE aspect. Sheltered from NW.
properties.camp_comments: No beach tent sites appear dry at all tides. Low slope upland but access would not be easy. Some potential for upland sites, hammock use.
properties.other_comments: Marginal.

properties.title: Azure Road
properties.landing_comments: Small pebble, gravel beach. SW aspect. 80 m steep trail joins to Ganner Drive.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. Potential launch site. Stone steps to beach. Limited roadside parking at Ganner Drive. Public Galiano Shore Access #27. AKA Serenity Lane on some maps.

properties.title: Consiglio Trail
properties.landing_comments: Sandstone bedrock sloped ledges with pocket beaches. Exposed NE aspect. Prominent signage.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Approx. 450 m trail to Bodega Beach Drive. Parking for several vehicles. Public Galiano Shore Access #49.

properties.title: Shaws Landing
properties.landing_comments: Sheltered cove of pebbles, sand, bedrock ribs. Steps to beach.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Located opposite 19210 Porlier Pass Road. Short access trail. Parking for approx. 2 vehicles. Galiano Shore Access #34.

properties.title: Clam Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy on beach of shell, small boulders, with low gradient at low water. Easier at N end.
properties.camp_comments: 1 possible small tent site for emergency use (2024). Marginal site. Please pay voluntary stewardship fee to recreate in Ahousaht traditional territory.
properties.other_comments: Water at seasonal stream. Part of paddling route to Mux̣šiƛa Hot Springs at Nism̓aakqin.

properties.title: Deserters Islet
properties.landing_comments: Protected beach of bedrock, small boulders in channel between islands. All-tide. S aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Walk across rocks to small grass patch for 1-2 small tents. Sheltered except from S. Short carry. Small, easily used site.
properties.other_comments: Lift boats up rocks to store ashore. See Mahpahkum-Ahkwuna/Deserters-Walker Conservancy.

properties.title: Deserters Meadow
properties.landing_comments: In protected cove, low gradient sand, mud clam bed beach. Scattered boulders. Gravel at high water. NW aspect. Much rougher alternative landing on E (outer) shore.
properties.camp_comments: 5 or more tent sites in small meadow. Short trail up bank from beach via awkward step. Small gravel beach top sites for additional 3 tents, dry at 4.5 m tides but marginal at 4.8 m. Ensure to minimize your impact on sensitive wildflowers.
properties.other_comments: View. See Mahpahkum-Ahkwuna/Deserters-Walker Conservancy.

properties.title: Tomlinson Point south
properties.landing_comments: Large low gradient sandy clam bed beach. Steeper at beach top. More rocky at sides. Exposed to SW but mostly protected from NW, SE. Some upper beach remains dry at Neaps, but Springs might flood it entirely. Long carry at low water.
properties.camp_comments: Up to 10 beach top sites under trees on sand appear to be dry most tides. Easy upland access to approx. 3 additional small tent sites requiring brushing. Hammock opportunities.
properties.other_comments: No comments.

properties.title: Raynor North inside
properties.landing_comments: Cobble, pebble beach in small rocky cove mostly floods. Moderate gradient. SW aspect but protected behind island.
properties.camp_comments: Easy upland access. 1 dry site on grass but too lumpy to use unless some rocks moved, site levelled.
properties.other_comments: Possible stream but not verified.

properties.title: Triple Bay
properties.landing_comments: E bay in group of 3 rough but protected bays. Beach of relatively smooth cobble, small boulders. Moderate gradient, steeper on 1 side. Drift logs. SW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No obvious beach tent sites. 1 site possible atop rock. Level forest behind beach with reasonable access for possible upland tent or hammock sites if brushed.
properties.other_comments: Seasonal stream with good water flow July 2024. Upland of W'most bay of the 3 bays is private.

properties.title: Jeannette Islands
properties.land_tenure: Crown tenure - Section 17 designated use area
properties.landing_comments: Enter sheltered cleft in bedrock, Log-choked at head. Very small rocky beach.
properties.camp_comments: Steep rock slope, heather bank leads by scramble to exposed heather ridge. Stunted trees on top. Maybe could camp 2+ tents with brushing.
properties.other_comments: View, Attractive,

properties.title: Staples Island northwest
properties.landing_comments: Protected low gradient clam bed beach. Mud at low water, boulders, cobble at mid, higher water levels. Visible grass mostly floods. Long carry at low water. Old boat run visible at mid, high water. N aspect.
properties.camp_comments: 1 tent site on gravel beach top clear of tidal challenges, 2 possible additional sites upland w much brushing of vegetation.
properties.other_comments: See Mahpahkum-Ahkwuna/Deserters-Walker Conservancy.

properties.title: Shelter Passage Islet
properties.landing_comments: Low gradient beaches in moderately protected bay. Bedrock outcrops. Few drift logs. NW aspect.
properties.camp_comments: Possible 1 tent site on flat rock with marginal tidal clearance. Upland access moderately easy. Additional 1 upland site with much brushing.
properties.other_comments: Short carry if flat rock is used.

properties.title: Wishart Island west
properties.landing_comments: Easy in sheltered cove on very low gradient large clam bed, gravel beaches with scattered boulders. Beaches mostly flood. Few drift logs. Long carry at low water.
properties.camp_comments: 1 site on grass under cedar. 1 potential gravel beach top site at Neaps. Upland potential. Easy upland access for additional tent or hammock use with brushing.
properties.other_comments: Fish farm bunkhouse clearly visible. See Mahpahkum-Ahkwuna/Deserters-Walker Conservancy.

properties.title: Robertson inside
properties.landing_comments: Cobble, boulder beach at head of bay facing island. Big stumps washed ashore. NW aspect. Partly but not completely protected from NW by island.
properties.camp_comments: No visible beach sites. Upland accessible so hammock use or brushing of tent sites feasible.
properties.other_comments: Better sites exist in area.

properties.title: Marsh Bay Head
properties.landing_comments: Moderate gradient beach of cobble, rounded boulders. Drift logs. Protected except from SE. SE aspect.
properties.camp_comments: No sites seen at beach top. Access to low slope upland feasible for possible hammock or tent sites with brushing.
properties.other_comments: Closer checking might yield better sites nearby.

properties.title: Petes Bay
properties.landing_comments: Broad shingle, pebble beach of moderate gradient. SW aspect. Exposed to NW.
properties.camp_comments: Grass areas adjacent to intact (2024) unoccupied furnished house. Much debris, materials near house. Adjacent grassy areas for tents.
properties.other_comments: House in Rec Site apparently used by locals.

properties.title: Furry Creek Beach
properties.landing_comments: Easy on any of 3 moderate all-tide gradient gravel, sand beaches. Drift logs. W or SW aspects.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. 2 composting toilets. Extensive beach areas connected by trails. Not suited to launching boats from vehicles due to distance from trailhead.
properties.other_comments: Signed public parking across railway tracks via bridge or near Olivers Landing. condominium complex. Walking trails. Regional Recreation Site adjacent to private golf course, private community, with public trail access. View. Popular for picnics, swimming. Managed by Squamish Lillooet Regional District.

properties.title: Pages Resort
properties.landing_comments: Two options: 1. Kayak docking area on the south side of our marina with a lowered launching area and storage both on racks or on the docks.  2. There are campsites right on the water overlooking the bay.  Kayaks can be pulled right up on the shore at these sights.
properties.camp_comments: Page's Resort has 8 sites within 100 metres and they also have wheelbarrows to make it easier for these and the other 8 sites that are a little farther away.
properties.other_comments: They are open year-round and have washrooms with showers, a BBQ area, and a grocery and liquor store on site. Book your camping spot on the Page's Resort.. Or email the resort at info@pagesresort.com or phone 250-247-8931. Their address is: 3350 Coast Road, Gabriola Island

properties.title: Muchalaht Marina
properties.landing_comments: Protected concrete double ramp.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Fees (2021) $10 kayak launch. Parking inside fence $15/day. Pay at small building near launch.

properties.title: Surfside Drive West Beach Access
properties.landing_comments: Beach access.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Parking to be checked out.

properties.title: Bear Cove Ferry Terminal
properties.landing_comments: No paddlecraft launch at site. See adjacent Bear Cove Kayak Launch site.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: BC Ferries service to McLoughlin Bay, Klemtu, Prince Rupert. Overnight parking available. Can roll or carry boat onto ferry or to load and strap it onto their kayak trailer. Gear can be put into baggage carts for retrieval at destination. Be sure to check destination signage on carts!

properties.title: Pedals and Paddles
properties.landing_comments: Small pebble beach in Lamb Bay. NE aspect. Short carry from vehicle.
properties.camp_comments: No camping. Rentals of wide selection of paddlecraft. Tours, guiding offered. Please call ahead to book 604-885-6440. Regular opening hours June- September. Open on request in shoulder early Spring. Parking/launch fee for guests bringing own paddlecraft $10 day first day, $4 day subsequent days (2025).See Pedals & Paddles
properties.other_comments: 7425 Sechelt Inlet Road. Plentiful parking (behind locked gate at night) for both renters and those hand-launching their own boats. Turn W at sign near Todd Road.

properties.title: Soames Road
properties.landing_comments: Smooth sand beach, some pebble, shingle. Floods to drift logs at high water. S aspect. Access to road via 100 m gravel path.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted.
properties.other_comments: Soames Road off Marine Drive. Parking for 10 vehicles, no posted restrictions. Sunshine Coast Regional District official beach access.

properties.title: Alder Park
properties.landing_comments:
All-tide, all weather sheltered 3 m wide ramp at end of 2m wide gravel path at N of small park. Low gradient gravel, small cobble substrate. Easily avoided boulders near ramp. Vessel traffic in harbour.

4. Coordinates
48.93859, -125.53810
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. Grassed day use area. Bench, 2 picnic tables. Waste bin.
properties.other_comments: Attractive. View. Located at Alder St and Eber Road. Adjacent day parking for 5-6 vehicles. No overnight parking. Closest town hand launch to open ocean. District of Ucluelet municipal park.

properties.title: Starboat Cove
properties.landing_comments: Easy at low or mid water on beach of sand, gravel, cobble. Moderate at high water because beach mostly floods, numerous drift logs float about. SE aspect. Protected.
properties.camp_comments: No camping permitted. No fires.
properties.other_comments: In Lighthouse Park, District of West Vancouver. Toilet nearby. Extensive hiking trails. Cove approx 500 m by trail from park gate, parking.

properties.title: Caulfeild Cove
properties.landing_comments: Gravel beach with bedrock outcrops in very protected cove. S aspect. Public dock, low float on SE shore. Beach mostly floods at high water.
properties.camp_comments: No camping.
properties.other_comments: Limited street parking in residential area with unusually narrow lanes.. Public wharf, float also gives access but obstacles make for awkward access if carrying boats, gear. Easier to move boats to beach down grassy bank by lowest point of Pilot House Road.. Aka Tiddly Cove. Historic pilotage location.

properties.title: Terease Point
properties.landing_comments: No comments.
properties.camp_comments: No known camping.
properties.other_comments: Shower at shore. Water warms a little passing over rocks.

properties.title: Holden Creek
properties.landing_comments: Exposed beach. S aspect. Easy at high water on grass otherwise difficult on boulders. High flows in creek could be hazardous.
properties.camp_comments: Upland cleared forest tent sites on W bank of creek. Camp furniture, some debris. Fire pit. Short trails.
properties.other_comments: Attractive, views. Water at year-round creek. Waterfall. Staging for Kingcome Inlet. Piled lumber suggests future cabin to be built here.
